reviews.review: Great park and hike!. My wife and I climbed the hill with our infant from the south side to the north randomly. It wasn't a planned thing, we were wandering from the bridge to the Buda castle and just decided to give it a whirl. It was beautiful and fun!There are tons of little park spots to break that seem like old battlements or are very picturesque. Some have slides and playgrounds type things for kids. Particularly pretty in September. The trails that face the river are the busiest and you can avoid most of that by taking the paths up that are most to the middle or other side. There are tons of paths. On the north side you can make your way down to the roads and cross to get to Buda as well. Statues at the top were cool as well. Bring water, although there are some stands on the north side of the top that sell ice cream and drinks. There's a toilet behind them as well but you'll need to pay. This is a place that I'd love to hike all the time if I lived in the area. We didn't enter the cave church since you can get the idea from the front entrance and you have to pay.

Beautiful views, good exercise and cultural overload. This place is absolutely stunning from the bottom to the top. We started down at the Erzsebét Bridge and got some lunch at the Hummus Bar. Then walked slowly up the hill taking in all of the beautiful autumn trees and stopping at each lookout. If you have good ankles and knees then you must do this!!! The views of Pest are insanely gorgeous at some points you almost get a 280 degree view. Once at the citadel we read some of the history had then had a mulled wine and sat and soaked in the cool sun.

Great Walk. If you can walk up to the top. Walk up past the Church Cave (which is worth viewing) and follow the path. The paths criss cross each other but the views are amazing. The top is another great view over the River down towards the Parliament.
Budapest. Great view of the city. Nice place to start with. I enjoyed a lot travelling up and down by foot. The entire pest part of the city can be viewed wonderfully.

Nice view, but come for the walk. The real draw is the journey of walking up here, not necessarily getting to the top, although the statue of the woman holding the leaf and the inexpensive souvenirs are lovely too. The citadel itself is nothing spectacular, but we had a good time walking up the many steps to get here and climbing down, and the whole time seeing a lot of Buda from different angles.

A monument to freedom. In the top of the hill, right beside where used to be a prison, this monument was erected to thank the soviet soldiers that liberated Hungary from the Nazis occupation during world war II.

The best views of the City and great Sculptures. The Gellert Hill and Statue offer the best views of the city and bridges. The statues are huge and offer great photo opportunities as do the sweeping views of the City.
Great panoramic view on Pest. Just up the hill over the hotel and thermal bath with same name in Buda gives me to have a real nice panoramic view on the Danube and the city of Pest .

Beautiful once at the top. A lot of steps but beautiful view when you get to the top. Be ready to walk! There are a lot of walking up so if you have problems walking for a long time just take your time

Go at night!. Beautiful views at any time of day, but magical after dark. It's only about a 15 minute walk up paved walkways for an incredible, incredible view of most of Budapest. The sculpture itself is nice, but go for the vistas.

Excellent views of budapest. The citadel is another place to visit during the day and also at night. The ares overlooks Budapest and gives good views of the Danube. Access is up a hill on foot but do not let this deter you

Beautiful view over the city.. We went up the hill at night. There weren't any lights on our way up, so it was quiet creepy to walk there and it felt like we were the only ones. But eventually we made it to the top and it was amazing. Lots of people sitting on the edges, enjoying the view over Buda and Pest.

A lovely walk for a sunny day. A nice walk up the hill, culminating with beautiful views of Budapest and the Danube. If you're in good shape you can do this, the castle and the Fisherman's Bastion all in one day - and then have a relaxing evening in the Gellert spa just around the corner.
Great view. Walked up from our hotel below, took it easy and we're delighted with the exceptional views of the city.

Amazing views!. My friend and I visited here twice during our trip and we were just as amazed the second time as we were the first. If you want amazing views of the city, this is the place. There are a few stalls selling souvenirs and a couple that sell food and drink (we had a really good hot chocolate from the little hut near the car park!) The statue itself is worth a look whilst you're up there.
climb to the Statue. This was a bit of a walk to ascend the hill, but the view overlooking the Danube and city at night was breathtaking. Well worth the climb.
Best View of the City. Took my girlfriend here for the views as I had read they were brilliant.We weren't disappointed, quite busy with tourists but found a spot to pop the question and she said yes!
A View from the Top. If you want a view of Budapest and surrounds - head up to Gellert Hill!! Part of our tour included a visit to this monument. The statues are brilliant and the view outstanding!!

Just for the view . This is where they make most of the shoots for postcards. There is a reason: it provides the best views of the city with the Danube intersecting. Especially, during. Night time or sunset, you can sit in awe admiring the Beaty of the city, the buzz and at the same time the calm of the slowly hampering of the Danube. The walk up brings it own joy of achievement (or take the bus if you are really that lazy). Not much in terms of food or anything else to recommend but go to soak in the view!
Wonderful views. We took the hop on and off bus here and had an easy walk back down the hill. Stunning views of the city.

A must see while in Budapest. We had tickets on the "hop on/off bus" and it took us to the Gellert statue. Beautiful view of the city from the statue area which are on a hill. Interesting story told about the statue by our guide. Expensive restaurants in the statue area, so bring your water!
Beautiful statues with stunning views of the city. Beautiful statues with stunning views of the city, exceptional at night, the best views in Budapest.

The Perfect Panoramic view!. This is a superb place to view the panorama of the twin cities of Budepest. An absolute photographer's delight by day or night - and we went there at both times. The sweep of the two cities, the undulating Danube by day and the sparkling lights by night - all just quite lovely! The Freedom Statute is poetic and has a certain sense of drama. Captivating to see both at close range and from a far.

Lovely walk to the top. This looked like it would be such a grueling walk to see the statue, but the paths and stairs up the hill were quite manageable, and the views along the way were worth the trip.
Nice walk. Beautiful location of the statue with lovely panoramic view of the whole city. Wouldn't recommend going up if you don't feel fit but the view definitely compensates the effort.

Breathtaking sights. The views were spectatcular, being the highest point within the city. If you are fit you can climb the stairs like I did, and you can take as long as you want, all this for free. The liberty statue was a highlight but this historic grounds offers 350-degree views around the historic Citadella.

Worth the visit. Great location, great view, great statues. It is definitely worth a trek up to this location and part of your Budapest visit. Dress warmly as you are out there in the elements, unprotected for weather changes.
Great views. This offers the best views to see Budapest. Also, walking trails going down into Buda. Great photo op.

Incredible views!. We were there on a cool and windy day but it just added to the drama of this place! The statue is huge and emotionally intense, and the view from the top provides an incredible panorama of the city and the Danube.
Second tallest point in budapest. beautiful view - has information about the hill and the statuebeware of the crooks playing gambling in the lower view

Good stretch of the legs. The walk up the hill is quite steep, however there are plenty of winding paths that allow travelers to catch their breath whilst enjoying spectacular views of the city. We walked up on a particularly sunny and warm afternoon, and the paths thankfully also offer plenty of shade. There were quite a few crowds and tour groups at the top, but with a little patience, we were able to enjoy the views of Budapest.

Must Visit for the View. A great place to oversee the Pest side of the city. What a great view! The statue is also very interesting. Try to go during the week when it is less busy or very early in the morning. On the weekend, the wait to get up the hill can be up to 3 hours as traffic snails it way up the one lane roadway and there is limited parking at the top.
A long hike. The weather was v dry hot the day we climbed to the statue of freedom but worth it for the views. There is an ice cream stall up there but no loos and as I said it's a steep incline
Worth a visit. This statue is visible from both the Buda and Pest sides of the city and looks quite dramatic against the skyline. The Big B Bus will take you right up to it.

Must See Sight in Budapest. It's a steep walk or a taxi ride to the top of the hill but worth it. There are views of the whole city and winding Danube from on top. The statue is beautiful and a great photo op.

Amazing Views. Without a doubt the best place in the city to take breathtaking photos of the city! Accessible by public transportation (tram or M2 to Zsill Kalman Ter, then the 27 bus up the hill) but you will need to walk more than 1 km uphill. The tour buses take you as close to the top as permitted.
Great views. Loved this place, got great views of the city! Would recommend a visit here to anyone. Coaches go nearly to the top of the hill too so not much walking to do.

Statue on top of Gellert Hill. We crossed the bridge and walked up Gellert Hill via a footpath after crossing the Cave Church. The statue, erected by the Russians, was located nearly on the top where you could have good views to see Budapest on Buda side.

Read up before you go. Our guide explained the statue and importance to us when we visited. Then he mentioned the Soviet soldier statue that was on the pedestal in front. When you see something like that, you begin to understand the history of the area and the people a bit better. The views are great and this becomes an easy landmark to spot wherever you are in Buda or Pest. But take the trip up and see the statue and area.

Let freedom ring. I loved the statue. I was told that it was erected by the Russians during the time that Hungary was under their dominance. When the Russians were voted out the people of Hungary removed all the statues that were representative of Russian rule with the exception of this one as it was too large. Instead they removed the hammer and sickle and replaced it with a palm leaf. That is the story I was told and for some reason it appealed to me.
nice picture point. take a look on the whole city, coming with the hop on hop off bus is great - they give you 20 minutes to go up and take a picture, and that's enough

Good views. The Citadella is located near here on top of gelert hill. Although not much to see in terms of it. There will be some information about its use in the past. Its a bit of a walk upwards but Ive done worse. There's some great views from the top here and for photographers Id recommend who are looking for panoramic views of the city. Its also free but the toilet is not!!

Great views of Budapest. Its a bit of a climb but well worth it for the various view points you will come across over the Danube and City. We started from the path leading from the Gellert Hotel and also had a look at the "Cave" Church on the way up.
Fantastic views. You can see the statue from most places along the river. Its quite a steep walk to the top but there are great views of the city the river and the bridges.

Nice views and walks around!. Breath taking panoramic views of the whole city from the top! You can have walks around and see panoramic views from the different sides. Also please stop by a small church in the hill. Entrance fee for the church for adult was 600 HUF, which included an audio guide. This Cave Church was a pleasant surprise.
Visually stunning. Visually stunning and visible from many angles and for miles. Very beautiful......should be on any site seeing agenda

Fantastic Views of Budapest. This statue is viewable from all of the city and is even more lovely to look at up close. We took a bus ride up, and where the bus drops you off you still have to climb up a hill to the top. Plan to take your time if traveling with folks with disabilities. Lots of people stop to take pictures as soon as they get off the bus- but really the best spot for pics is right at the top. There are a couple small restaurants that line the paved walk up the hill, even sell champagne and wine. Beautiful spot.

Very nice view of Budapest. A hill on Buda side of the city. Uncrowded, with many paths toward the top of the hill. The way to the statue goes through a nice garden, with some view points that you can sit and relax.The way uphill have many stairs, but it is not that difficult.We walked down from a different way and the view was great all the way down.

See a similar view from the Buda Castle. Carry some water for sure.. I'd say if you are going for the view, you'll get a similar one from the Buda Castle(where you don't need to climb up). The real fun of this place is the hike up. And the gardens you can picnic at.So if you're going up for the view and have limited time, I suggest you don't as they have no signage and a million ways to go up. Go to the Buda Castle instead.But if you have time, it's fun to get lost around there, maybe picnic somewhere on the way up.

Be on top of Budapest. It needs a little effort to get to the top Gellert Hill but it surely gives you the feeling that you can see the city from totally different angle. so help yourself and hit the trails leading to the top, I am sure you won't regret.

Worth a visit. If you get the hop on hop off bus it will take up here were you will get 35 minutes, this is really all you need. The views of the city are amazing up here, excellent photo opportunities.
Great spot for best views of Budapest. If you are looking for the best views of Buda, Pest and the Danube, this is it! A great outdoor activity with the most beautiful photo opps.

Get fit and climb up, it's worth it.. There is an easy way using transport by road but why not climb up through the trees, pausing to view the city of Budapest. There are a lot of paths but they all ultimately lead to the summit.
Don't forget to also walk around the Citadel located behind the monument, look at all those bullet holes in the walls.

It's worth a small effort for big views of this beautiful city. We crossed Elisabeth Bridge and walked up the left side steps. There are just over 300 steps to the top plus a few moderate inclines. BUT, and here's the good part, there are as many resting points as anyone needs. You can stop without embarrassment because you're not part of a group and you just want to admire the changing view. There was a crowd at the top admiring the buildings, statues and views before they walked backed down. I wonder how many missed the peaceful parkland [and even more sculpture] sprawling on the other side of the summit? We'd packed a picnic and a bottle of red to enjoy a leisurely lunch before we strolled down the Gellert Baths side of the hill.

Best view over Budapest. The statue itself isn't really a big deal, but the view is incredible. It isn't so high and far away as it seems when you look at it form the city centre. It's only about 20 minutes away on foot. Totally worth it!

Amazing views . Peaceful gardens and great escape from the city centre when you want somewhere quiet. Walked up the side closest to Castle Hill and descended towards the Gellert Baths. Great thing to do early morning to start the day.

Freedom symbol. Gellert Hill is named after St. Gerard who was thrown to death from the hill. You can approach the hill by crossing the Liberty bridge. Then you will reach the bottom of the hill and standing on Gellert Square. Hotel Gellert and the Gellert Baths are located at the square. Go up the sloping route to reach the citadel and liberty monument at the peak. Along the way there are chairs to sit and rest, photo takng corners. Beautiful view of Budapest along the way. The Liberty Monument is that of a lovely lady with a palm frond ,signifying freedom throughout the city. It was erected in 1947 as a tribute to the Soviet soldiers who died freeing Budapest in 1945. Many people go up and down the hill, especially n the evening. If you stay until the dark grows darker, the place will be lighted up and the view Budapest at night. Is awesome.

Not worth the climb. Yes, the view is beautiful from top; but it's quite a climb to get there along a path that is dirty from graffiti and litter with some parts smelling like urine. I was quite disappointed...

Required Visit. This high point provides a nearly panoramic view of the whole city. It was very crowded the day we were there because a large number of tours arrived at about the same time. The place has historical significance and there were some interesting pictures on the wall heading to the viewing areas. Certainly should be on your list of things to visit although Castle Hill was much more impressive.

Worth it for the view. t is a bit hard to get there if you are not part of a tour group. We were in a bus group so no problems. If you go by car you have to walk a bit further. It would be a long walk with no transport. There is a local bus to the residential area which would get you in the right general area and walk from there.
Panoramic views!. It's a bit of a climb but the views alone are worth it! Breath taking panoramic views of almost the whole city!

Best view of the city!. We took the Big Red Hop-On-Hop-Off Bus to the stop at the foot of Gellért Hill. It is a short gentle walk up the hill past the stalls past the remains of the Bastion & around to the front to see the Hungarian Stature of Liberty...a woman holding a feather. Many people stop at a viewing area before getting to the top. Go the rest of the way! There are some large photos of the area showing the devastation during WWII. The view from the top is the best. The bus comes by every 30 minutes at the he bottom of the hill.
Climb to see panoramic view of Budapest. Park itself is not something I will remember to the end of my days, but view is definitely worth a climb.
City Sites. Worth the walk through the Park to catch the views and the History. Take your own bottles of water as bit more expensive up there.
a long walk up the hill but worth it. The views were amazing from the top and there were some refreshment stalls and toilet facilities. quite a steep hill.

Best view of Budapest!. It's a long climb to the top but it is absolutely worth it! Up the hill you can have an outstanding view of the city, the bridges and the river. If it's sunny then you'll have really good photos up there. It's also a good place to sit down and enjoy some ice cream in the summer :)
very nice view. well there is nothing much to say except the view on the top is lovely , you should go up there and take a look at the city
Worth a Wander.. Nice vantage points for Photo stops and to have a breather.Fantastic all round views from the top giving views of the city from many directions.
Historically interesting. Wonderful views over the city of Budapest. Great photograph opportunity. Hop on and Hop off bus makes this very achievable.

Stunning Landmark!. This a must see landmark when visiting Budapest. You may need to take multiple pics just the capture yourself with the tall statue but as a bonus, you also experience exceptional panoramic views of Budapest. Local vendors are around too selling souvenirs etc and you'll enjoy getting lost on the many trails from the statue down to ground level. This was a happy sightseeing! =)
Beautiful. If you are going to Hungary you must see this place, because this is the most beautifull view I have ever seen.

Well worth the climb. I really enjoyed Gellert Hill. Be prepared for a bit of a climb but it really isn't that bad at all. There are other statues and views to see en route so you can easily break the walking up. There are plenty of benches to sit on as well if you need a stop. We decided to do it in the morning as we thought it would be cooler and quieter. This worked really well and I would recommend doing it earlier on in the day or later in the afternoon. The views from the top of Gellert Hill are fantastic. You get a great view of Pest and the Danube with all the various bridges.
Amaying View. The view from the top is mesmerizing its a quite a long walk though but totally worth it one should definitely go there

Beautiful views of Budapest!. Though it is quite a tiring up hill walk it is worth a visit! There are view points were one can admire a great view of the Pest side of the city. It will be of a great attraction to everyone especially to those keen on photography.

Top of the hill. It is well worth the trip up the hill to get up close to the statue that can be seen from all over the city. We had 48hr hop on off bus ticket which took us up the hill. We had a beer at the top after taking in the panoramic views of the city from the many viewpoints.
City break. We did the hop on hop off bus tour visited gallery hill and statue it's very impressive and beautiful veiws

Christian and historical must see. It amazes me to think of the Christian historical heritage in Europe, and of the brave men and women who helped establish it. This is a gorgeous hill, great views of Pest...but it's a hike from the street, so tourist beware! The Chapel was amazing, and so sad to think it was filled with cement to try destroy the church. It's the most unique church you will probably ever find.

Very crowded. We walked from the Hilton Budapest. It was a reasonable hike up to the top. Lots of steps, so not a rugged hike. Seeing the statue from the top was not too exciting and the whole place was packed, even though we got to the top early in the morning. Views are great.
Lovely walk up the hill. There is a path up the hill from the Cave church, not well marked to the Statue but follow your instinct and enjoy the lovely walk. Great views from the top.

Worth a visit to get great views. This is definitely one of the places you have to go when you are in Budapest. You see the whole city from the top. We went early morning when it wasn't too busy or too hot.

Set aside time to shop for Souvenirs. While the views are fantastic and make for good photo stops, don't forget to stop at the stalls on the way up. The souvenirs are reasonably priced - plenty of fridge magnets for Euro 1-2. And there is this one shop which sells Hungarian shawls - beautiful hand embroidery. They were priced for Euro 30 each.
The views from here are stunning. Take s trip up to the citadel and look down over the city. It's breathtaking. Make sure it's not a cloudy day though.

Beautiful view of Budapest at night. The best views of all Budapest at night and a pleasant walking trail to head back down to the city after you visit the statue. I think it's best at night when it's less crowded.

Great views to the city!. This is quite a hike to the top from the east side. You can get a ride around to the west side and then hike back to town. The statue is great, but the views to the city are awesome.

Výhľad / View. S výnimkou vynikajúceho výhľadu na Budapešť ma táto atrakcia nijako zvlášť neoslovila.
With the exception of a superb view of Budapest is such an attraction not particularly fail to reach.

Easy way up and long way down. For fantastiv views across the city you must visit the Citadella atop Gellert Hill. To stand at the foot of the Liberty Statue and look down on the Danube and Budapest is one of lifes luxuries. We used the hop on hop off bus to get to the Citadella and the ealjed back down to the Danube through the woodland, much the easier option.

Big climb. The climb to this attraction is rather steep but well worth the effort if you can make it. Stop off at the Cave Church on the way. We ended up being there late afternoon and took advantage of somewhere to sit while waiting for nightfall. Wow! Very spectacular!
Spectacular views of Budapest. Getting there requires a short uphill walk, which some might find a bit demanding, but the breathtaking views of Budapest make it all worth the effort.

Liberty!. Beautiful expression of freedom. The statues are amazing and the views of the city and river are unparalleled. Try going at night, too, for night time views - though we never managed to find the time. It the hill is open to public at night it will be awesome! But the day time was already great. It is very crowded with tourists as its very popular.
Beautiful. Beautiful view on Budapest. It's very nice place for walking. Not hard to get the hill. A lot of tourists.
Tough hike for old folks. Walk ways are well maintained, but the walk can be rather strenuous. Well worth it once at the top. Views are great.

Trip to Gellert Hill. This hill holds an amazing view over Budapest. In comparison to the well-known Castle Hill, the Gellert Hill is less populated and gives you the view over Castle Hill. I would recommend to make this trip around sunrise or sunset since the temperature is lower and the walk up will be easier.

Must see! Panoramic view of the city. Definitely head up to Gellert Hill for an amazing panoramic view of the city!
There are different paths you can choose which will all lead up to the top. The walk is about 20 minutes, and there are several viewing spots along the way.

Amazing views. As others have said it is worth a walk up, for the terrific views. You can take a bus if you are unable to walk.
The day we visited was a very warm day with clear blue skies, so the view was excellent.

Incredible View of the City - Well Worth the Walk Up!. Saw this from by the river on our first day and decided to get to the top. We chose to walk up which took about 15 minutes, but you can get a bus up also. The views when you reach the top are absolutely incredible and definitely worth the walk up! There are stalls to eat, drink and to buy souvenirs as well as a toilet (which definitely came in use after walking up although you have to pay 300 FT for the privilege)
Best panorama. The view and panorama over town was amazingprobably one of the best you can get, but the place was very crowded.
Amazing. I adore the status and the park where the statue is being erected.You can take amazing pictures of budapest and the river. It is a must see place.
Great view, not so great for eating . Great view, not so great for eating. Very pricy and not very good food. Service OK. Spectacular views!

Beautiful landmar. We walked up the hill to this landmark, which half way up there are other statues. It's a long walk especially when it's nearly 30 degrees! Well worth the visit, but you can get a bus to the top, which I found out when I got there. Quaint little stalls are at the top selling local goods

For the view. It is a stroll from the old town and offers commanding views over most of the city's sights. There is no clear 'best way' to go up - just a multitude of paths and if you keep following ramps or steps up (or down if you are descending) you'll get to the monument at the top, the bastion, the traders stalls, the expensive refreshments and toilets at 300fl admission. But the view is worth it.

Long uphill walk. Long walk in soaring heat to see Liberty statue and two smaller statues. Wait a minute, what about the fabulous views of the city. Worth the walk for the views alone. On the hill there are various gardens and walks however I was too tired to venture further. Could have done with a bar at the top of the hill. There's bars everywhere else in the city!

FOR THE VIEWS AND THE STATUE. It’s quite a climb to get to the top of the hill but the views are spectacular. The statue was erected by the Russians to commemorate the liberation of Hungary from the Germans in 1945: for many, it also symbolised the Soviet domination of the Hungary. Following the collapse of the Soviet Union and Hungary’s new freedom, rather than demolish it, it was covered up for 4 days and then unveiled afresh as a celebration of Hungary’s liberation from Soviet dominance.
Liberty. Such a sign of Liberty. When you cross the bridge going to Castle Hill and Fishermans .Bastion and see her I got chills.
Take the long walk. We took the walk up the hill from the Gellert Spa side, the amazing views along the way are well worth the trek.
Great view. Budapest has its liberty statue. This one has meaning, in the sense that it represents the liberation oh Hungary from the Mongol invasion. Nice settings, watch out for pickpockets!
only for the view. It's worth to visit only for the view from the top. The parc itself is in very bad condition and there is a lot of trash around

Good view. You can get a good overview of the city from this spot, good for photo shot. If you are climbing up, it takes about 15-20 minutes, else you can catch the hop on/off buses. Some souvenir shops along a small stretch of the road.
Fantastic views of the city. Citadella is a must when in budapest. Superb views of the city and good history to it. Local stalls selling gifts and things plus food and drink stalls near by.
Best lookout spot. From this point you have the best views all over the city. Hopp On Hopp Off busses drive here. On a sunny day the outlook is great.

Wish I could give it 10/5 stars!. The view here is breath taking, especially during the night.The statue itself is illuminated and is easy to see at night.Don;t just visit the statue tho, all of the surrounding area is simply amazing!

Beautiful scenic view. Our tour guide recommended a visit at sunset. The views of the city were amazing. I wish we had budgeted more time so that we could see both the sunset and the city being illuminated at night.

Make sure this place is there in your trip chart. If you are in Budapest, make sure this place is added to your trip chart. You can walk , hip hop buses or get there by your tour operators transportation . Magnificent panoramic view of both visa and pest side along with the beauty of dunbey river. We went there in late after noon so the sun was perfect for our walks. Was little bit crowded but it will never stop you to admire the panoramic view of budapest

Beautiful site. Tourist trap. Con artist working grounds.. Not sure it's very good but better than average. The site is beautiful. Spent an afternoon strolling, reading the plaques, admiring the view and learning. Beautiful views. Grounds need work due to funding difficulties but doesn't detract from the experience.It is also tourist trap. Expected to pay more but the mark-up on prices is ridiculous and seems designed to obtain as many tourist dollars as possible. For example, water at a supermarket was 0.65 florin. On site, it was just shy of 5 florin. Similar with everything else regardless of where it was purchased. Bring your own food if no prepared to pay the prices.Be aware of a con artist working on the grounds. The con is the shell game also known as three shells and a pea. He has two accomplishes who pretend they are tourists. The "tourists" play the game, sometimes losing, sometimes winning. Once he/they realize a person is he interested he deliberately shows the 'pea'; not at first but after several more wins/loses by his accomplices. The hook. While the mark is distracted with getting out money (100 Euros) he moves the pea.
Best View !. Panoramic view of Budapest. Must see for all visitors. Very beautiful by day, elegant by night. The bridges are spectacular from the hill
Liberty!. At the top of Gellert Hill there are food stands, make sure to get a sausage with bread on your way up to see the Lady Liberty statue.

Great view form the top. A long walk to the top. Slopes and steps so you can take the easier option if the steps are too difficult. Paths in some places need attention as they were a bit crumbly. View points all the way up so even if you don't make it to the top there are still places you can take pictures cross the river and city. Took a while and was out of breath by the time I reached the top but the view was worth the effort.

Phew! what a view. After visiting Paris a couple of years back I thought the view from the Eiffel tower was unbeatable, well this matches if not surpasses it in my opinion wonderful view of this truly unique city !!
Should visit. Great panoramic view especially during night. It is a must visit to see the city and the bridges from up

Great panorama pics. Don't miss visiting it whilst in Budapest. Entry is free and you can take really nice pictures of the city lights. I'd recommend going at 7 in summer, so you see the sunset too and the city lights straight after.

Ok for pictures. It's ok to visit for the lanscape. You don't have to pay for the statue and landscape. I visited it twice. It's good to be visited during winter - better landscape because of the lack of threes.
Great panorama . Great view to the all city. You can see the Buda castle, parliment and the others main atraction. You can go by foot, the entrance is free of charge.

Breathtaking fro Below. She stands proud and beautiful on the hill above the city and the Danube. This statue is easily viewed from many points in the city, and particularly easy to see from a boat on the Danube.
Leisure. Another great location to capture great views of the city. Quite a steep climb but recommend taking a tour bus or taxi
Another fantastic view of Buda & Pest. A trip up Gellert Hill is worth the effort for the view alone. The old Communist monument has not gone through an exorcism and is the Statute of Liberty.
What a view!. You have to take a trip, but it is definitely worth it. During a sunny day you can see the whole Budapest from the hill. Great view!

Great view and not a long climb. we climbed it during afternoon time, the view is well worth it, so is the walk. The walk is in the nature, not too long.
Beautiful view - a must do when in Budapest.
Must visit.. Great view over the city. Very interesting monument. Great paths for walking. Great sport opportunity to climb the hill. Very relaxing way down.

Juist for the view and walk over the Liberty Bridge is worth it.. The statue of Liberty as it is often called, a monument to all those who laid down their lives for the liberation of Budapest. Wonderful views of the Danube and both the Pest and Buda sides of Budapest, a bit of a climb but a great walk down to the foot of the Liberty Bridge and the symbolic statues along the way.

Great views. A bit of a slog to walk up but our hop on/off bus dropped us near the top and we walked back down which was much easier! Once at the top the views of Budapest were fantastic (best to go on a nice sunny day) and we got some great photos.

Tough walk up but worth it.. We walked up to the top and it is a difficult climb with steps but hard work.You can get a taxi and suggest yoh do. Cost about 1400 florints from centre of Pest.Worth the view and there are a few souvenir stalls and a couple of stalls selling drinks round the back of citadel.

Best view of the city. We climbed the gellert hill on our last day in Budapest and having already been up the basilica on the pest side we definitely thought this was a better view of the whole city and definitely worth the climb. The walk up wasn't particularly interesting but the top is quite nice with the fortress and several statues as well as some food stalls, although we brought a picnic to eat on one of the many benches.

Best Spot in Budapest to Watch the Sunrise/Sunset. The citadel is the best spot to watch the sunset over Budapest. Take some beers and good company, get through the 20 minute trek up, and then sit back and take in the views. I would advise going for either the sunrise or sunset as it gets particularly busy during the day and it's less special.

Long walk but worth it. This took a while to get up to - but a really amazing view of the city once you make it. And great to look at when you can see it from the river side and can say "we made it all the way up there!!". Once up there there a few market stalls and drink vendors to make it worth the while.

Amazing views of Budapest, Must see. Long climb/walk from the bottom to the top that seems to keep going and going but once you get to the top it is all made worth while. There is a nice little parade of shops at the top for souvenirs and also a food stall. The only down side is the graffiti but you do get that no matter where you are and broken glass on the way up the hill.
worth the hike. yes you can get there on the tour bus but the hike it lovely and well worth it plus not too many people can be bother to walk to it's a relatively peaceful hike,...
Very popular tourist attraction and panoramic view. This is popular vantage point for tourists and locals and offers massive statutes and panoramic view

Stiff Walk, But Great Views From The Top. The photos are misleading - they are off the Citadella, not the Gellert statue, which is near the bottom of the hill near Erzsebet bridge. It is worth starting the climb from the Erzsebet Bridge, so you can see the Gellert statue as you climb to the Citadella. This is a steep walk, but worth it for the views.
Fantastic views of Budapest. It's a long way up so better early morning or late in the day during the hot summer days but the views of Budapest are spectacular. Well worth the effort.

The amazing views are worth the climb. We walked across the Liberty Bridge, passed the Gellert baths and up by the Cave Church and started our ascent. Sorry, sounds a bit dramatic but be warned it’s quite a steep climb with lots of steps and strenuous on a hot day but we finally reached the summit. Wear comfortable shoes and bring water, you can also take breaks in the shade along the way.There are stunning views of both Buda and Pest, the Danube and its bridges once you reach the top. Well worth the effort.

A great free activity. I've been up the hill many times as the view is wonderful. Its a fair walk but not too strenuous, and its easy to get to the base of the hill, either by walking or going to Gelert metro station.Combine the walk back down with a trip to Gellert baths at the bottom ;)

Great Views. It's a pleasant (if steep) walk up through parkland to get up to the citadel, but once you're there the views down across the city and the Danube are well worth it. Great place for panoramas.
Stunning views. The views from here are stunning. If you get the opportunity and are a photography fan then this is a must do when I'm Budapest.

Hard trek but worth it.. Decided to take a look. Wanted too see the statue but it's a very hard climb up these stairs. Worth it when you get to the top. The views are amazing. Nice relaxing walk back down the hill through the park land as well.
long walk. You have to be prepared for long walk ad bit hiking on it.GPS helps because not many signs where to go
The best views of the city . The birds eye view of Budapest can be enjoyed from gellert Hill, there are too many stairs to climb but worth the climb
Fantastic. It was very hot when we went there but was a fantastic view and well worth the walk up the hill from. Don't miss if you visit Budapest.
monument on the hill. bit of a hike up the hill but well worth it . great views of buda and pest . Lots of little eating places on the hill and on the way down .

Run up the hill. One of my favorite pastimes in Bp. is to run up Gellert hill. Start around Kosztolanyi ter/Feneketlen to area and run towards the church by the lake. Behind the church are steps which lead to more steps and crooked streets. Lots to see during the run: the Gardening University has an arboretum (free) with lots of plants/trees, cozy little crooked streets, great views, historical landmarks (Eotvos dormitory) and just a great area for relaxing, there is even a house with turrets. There are many other runners/joggers. Once up to the Citadel, to towards the Castle, another fine area to run. There are several paths down the hill towards the castle and there is a statue park with statues of Gandhi and other philosophers. If running at night, be prepared for fantastic lighting of the castle.

Lovely location, Stunning view. We took the bus up to the hill and then there was a short walk uphill to the statue. Many viewpoints along the way overlooking Budapest. Also lots of hawkers selling souvenirs that were actually cheaper than the centre of town. The statue itself is quite impressive offering an almost 360 degree view of the city. The walk down from the statue brings you directly to the Gellert Spa. Not a bad way to finish off the day.

Rewarding hike up. The view from the top is just outstanding! Be prepared as it is a long tiring hike up. There were stalls selling food, drinks and souvenirs near buy, some more expensive than usual as it is a touristy area. Fun fact the Liberating Soviet Soldier in Memento Park used to stand here.

Great Views. Lovely views from here. Used the hop on hop off bus which saved a big hike up, still got a walk to reach the top, but it was pleasant, past nice gardens and nice cold beer on the return to the bus stop.

Bit of a climb. We walked all the way up and it is quite exhausting, even if you use the bus there is still quite a climb up to the statue. Well worth it though as there are some fantastic views on the way.
Budapest's most amazing view. It was quite hard to climp up the hill but the view was definately rewarding as it was the most beautiful view of Budapest at night we saw!

The locals call it the Bottle Opener.. High above the Danube is this statue to liberty. freedom is precious to a people, occupied by the Nazis, and the Soviets. Many people remember the dark days of Communist rule. They treasure the return to a sense of freedom and liberty. And they enjoy a good joke. This statue does look like a bottle opener from the distant reaches of Pest.

Memorable. One of the most memorable statues I have seen. It is installed on the top of the hill so it stands above the city. The statue has such a long history. Funny and sad at the same time. Looks even more beautiful at night.
Buda and Pest viewpoint of both ¡¡. The hill is crowned by the Citadel and is a privileged viewpoint, with its privileged view from the top of the town

Sweaty hike. Totally worth it. This was one hell of a workout but was 100% worth it for the views you get on the way up and when you finally reach the top!... We took some lunch up with us but there are small food venders when you reach the statue. Take lots of water! There are lots of different paths on the way up, which got a little confusing, but we just picked a way and stuck with it - I imagine all paths lead to the statue in the end!

Good HIking adventure!. Get ready to see the best views of Buda! And also get ready to hike A LOT! don't worry , it is definitely worth it!! Make sure to check the park with beautiful flowers that is next to it , it's my favorite spot in Budapest
Nice walk with a view. The Gellert Hill is very nice to walk up and down. Beautiful views and not too steep climbs make it a must-visit for Budapest.

Well worth a trip up. We got the train up, and walked dos to Gellert Baths. A great view of the city, and excellent to see see the statue close up and its size. It's a step walk up so definitely one for the bus!

Breathtaking. It is worth the drive or walk up to the Gellért Hill as the view from there is breathtaking.
Below you lies the entire city in its glory. Clear day is the best but stunning in any weather.
Must visit. This place is up on the hill but it is definitely worth climbing approx 1000 steps :P, view from the top is awesome

Must do if you like views and history. Stunning city views. I walked over from the Buda side, and up the hill past the little grotto. On the way up, you'll get some absolutely stunning views of the city. Do stop, catch your breath, take a sip of water, and snap a photo of the view.When you get to the top, there isn't much shade. If it's a warm day, keep moving. As you walk around the statue and nearby Citadel, you'll get some great views of Buda.If you do like I did, and walk over from Pest, do wear comfy shoes, bring a hat/sunscreen if it's sunny, and a water bottle. Expect the walk up to take 30-45 minutes depending on one's speed.
Climb or ride an air-conditioned bus.. Lots of people, nice views. Must-see night spot for all photographers. Some souvenirs stalls next to the citadel.

Great views of Budapest for FREE!. Great views once you get all the way to the top. The whole park area around it is just great for an afternoon stroll all for free. Sit at the top and take it all that is Budapest. We went at sunset and had some great pictures!

Pretty view and a nice climb. It take a little bit of climbing to see this, but it isn't too hard. You can take tour buses, drive, or take a city bus and end up fairly close to this. There are plenty of souvenir shops, ice cream shops, and places to snack on the way to the statue also.When we went it was chilly and windy, so you might want a jacket if it's later in the year. (We had a freak cold spell that saw temps in the mid 60's and lows in the 40's in August.) All in all my wife and kids made the walk without problems. But be aware that it is a major tourist attraction and will probably be packed with tourists. We also saw plenty of hustlers trying to get folks to bet money on shell games. AVOID these guys unless you want to go broke or get pick pocketed!But the statue is pretty hard to see from the base. The best photos of this one have been taken from drones that you can see some tourists flying around. You will get a wonderful view of the city from this area. You also have what looks like an old fort or bastion up there. It used to be open for tours, offering almost 360 degree view of the city, but it is now close to the public.

Stunning views, but quite the climb. The climb is pretty steep and long. Not recommended for (very) little kids or elderly people. There are many stops on the way to the top with a couple of benches which we used gladly. We climbed the Gellert Hill on a cooler day and were really thankful we did. Not recommended on a very hot day unless you are in pretty good shape. The views on the way are already pretty nice, but when you reach the top it is really stunning. The monument itself is nice, but not that special. It's cool because it is such a landmark in Budapest and now you can see it up close. Despite the climb a must visit. Just take it step by step and maybe take some water with you.

Not as impressive as Castle Hill?. We reached here from central Budapest by 46 or 47 bus then the 27 bus up the hill (walking up isn't recommended unless you are either a masochist or extremely fit). Other than the monument there really isn't much up there other than a smattering of tourist stalls. Given our time again we would probably use it in a different way and stick to Castle Hill for the views.

Beautiful views of Budapest. Had a quick visit on a very warm day. Beautiful views of Budapest but very busy with tour buses. Traffic was bad getting there and pretty nerve wrecking with some of the Hungarian driving

Hell before Heaven . It's been mentioned before and it's worth noting that the climb to this hill consists of steep climbs and steps (albeit can be avoided if needed but they do save time). There are many benches along the route with some great views however some are broke or taken up by other hikers. We took this route on a humid day and didn't prepare for the climb as we didn't bring any water. There are a couple of stalls once you reach the top that offer souvenirs, water, beer or a good bite to eat. Prices for a bottle of water and a can of beer came to about 1400huf.Once you're at the top it's a great view of both Buda and Pest with plenty of photograph opportunities. It's definitely worth the tough climb so do preserver!

Long way to go. There is a church in the beginning which small but good with some really interesting history but they charge you 1200ft per person for entrance and also provide audio guide which i don't is worth it till the time you're a crazy history lover. To reach the summit you really gotta sweat a lot, its 771ft high it was named after saint gerrad who was thrown to death from the hill. There is a hot water pool in gelert bath .This hill is worth a visit because of the view from top.

Worth the walk. We walked all the way from the castle here and boy was it a long walk! We decided to be explorers that day and although I pretty much complained all the way to the top (as some steps were quite steep)...the view at the top was absolutely breathtaking. Definitely worth walking up as you feel accomplished.

Must Visit!. A must to visit for what i would reckon a best view of the city. Situated high above ground (as the name suggests), one gets to overlook the city and Danube river. A small 'food street' is available as well to enjoy a lovely afternoon away with beautiful scenery

Well worth the walk for the view at the top!. The view from the top of this hill is outstanding. I have a huge fear of heights but I thoroughly enjoyed the view. The walk up is tiresome but completely worth it. We saw lots of families at the top too. Apparently there is a mini museum at the top but we didn't wonder all the way around the statue

Worth the pain. This place is totally worth the climb, not going to lie but the climb is so hard but once you are at the top the views are totally worth it amazing breath taking views and at least there are stalls at the top to get a drink.
Good to see . Another nice place on the map to go and visit is gellert hill and statue. It has a lovely park next to it and you can go and have a nice sit in the sun with some lunch.

Be prepared for uphill walking . Nice to be in the trees and greenery walking! Hot walking up! Lovely view from up there but literally just the statue and lots of touristy shops with food and water which is super expensive! You will need to buy water for sure! Walk back down past gellert statue and waterfall at bottom by elizabeth bridge. Also cave church on other side and gellert baths!
Vantage point . Wandering in Budapest we went up the hill to see the view, amazing! The Donau, the Pest side of town, small boats, it's simply beautiful.

Bring your fittest self!. The climb was HARD, especially as it was already a fairly hot day. I recommend you come early in the morning to avoid getting heat stroke. My 50 year old mother had to stop a few times to catch her breath. I could've kept going, but welcomed the break. Once you get up to the top, the statue is beautiful and the views of Budapest are amazing. If you keep walking behind the statue, you'll find the citadel and many little touristic spots. There's also food stalls, one of which sells flavoured slushies (which I lapped up immediately to cool down).Overall a worthy experience, but I don't recommend to older people who have trouble with moderate to hard physical activity. Some coaches take you up there if you go in a tour so that may be a better option to still see this attraction without exerting yourself.

LIBERTY LIAISON. We walked up to the Statue of Liberty from the Gellert Spa, calling in at the Church in the Rock. It is not the hardest walk, even in the midday sun, so well worth the effort. The views are extraordinary and it's all free
Budapest view from the hill.. To go up to see the statue u must walk up in about 10 minutes. When u reach the top a part from the statue, u can see Budapest clearly from the hill.

Great view. It is better if you visit this place with a guide or at least read about it before going as without the real story of a statue it wont impact you with all its strenghts.
If you there take an advantage of your camera as the views are fantastic from up there.

The most beautiful view in the city. Most people could complain because of the climbing but we are used to it so for us it wasn't big deal to climb. Nice place for casual walk, nice view on Danube and bridges. There isn't a lot to see - few statues, some walls and that's about it. Also, there are no boards with explenations of what is there and which show directions. You can't enter in the citadel because it's closed for public (at least it was on a sunday when I was visiting). There are a few merchant stands with souvenirs and that's pretty much it. Conclusion: visit if you have some free time.

A hikers retreat. This place is awesome and to reach here you will have to hike uphill for around one hour. At the top you can find there statues and also you can enjoy the amazing view of Budapest with river danube. It is really panoramic

Even Better Views Than Buda Castle!. If you want to reach the best vantage point from which to view Budapest, going to the summit of Gellert Hill is an absolute must. Although there are a number of routes which you can take, we found that the path leading up from Elisabeth bridge to offer the most spectacular views. Really really fantastic stuff to see from there. Be warned however, the ascent is long, steep and tough so be sure to be prepared for a hard slog. Upon reaching the summit however, you quickly forget the walk as you marvel at the views. Some great opportunities for photographs of both Pest and Buda. There is a large monument to heroes of Hungarian freedom at the top of the hill as well as a large citadel fort, both of which have much history attached to them. You can also descend from the hill on the Southern side which brings you down to Gellert Spa for much-needed rest and relaxation after the walk. A great amenity overall and one which is a must for visitors to Budapest.

Best view of the city!. I would definitely recommend taking a visit to the top of this hill, on a clear day the views are spectacular you can see many bridges and have a good panoramic view of the city. We visited this by using the hop on/off bus, as it is a bit a trek to the top!

Amazing views. Can be reached by hop on hop off tour bus or by walkingIf you walk climb the hill on the side of the Gellert Hotel as it has the better views (it will take about 30-40 minutes to ascend the hill) The views of the city and Castle hill are spectacular

Worth to see the view. If you go to Buda hill and see the Buda castle, it is worth to go and see the view from the hill by night.I take the hop on hop off buses during all my vacation to Budapest (i have only 2 days there)., with a valid ticket for 2 days (extra discount for students)The hill is free to see it outside and i see it when i went to Buda castle. it is the next stop i think with hop on hop off buses.
Not for the fainthearted. The monument is something not to be missed. Ascending to the monument may be a challenge to the handicapped and those not able to climb stairs
best viewpoint of budapest. if one wants to get to the best free viewpoint of budapest then choose this one. if one says that is to hard of a hike then they are wrong, the view is more then worth it.

Amazing view. Be sure to climb the hill on the side of the Gellert Hotel. It has the better views and is alot less commercial (no stands selling stuff). The climb itself is not that bad, it will take the average person 30-45 minutes to ascend the hill. The first part is paved slope and the second half are stairs. The views are amazing. We made the mistake of going around 13:00. (1:00 PM). it was hot (not alot of shade) and busy. Nevertheless, the view spectacular and we understood why the Pest skyline is part of the UNESCO world heratage.

Great views of the river and city. The hop on hop off bus stops here however they underplayed the view from here and i dint get off the bus. as the bus departed the auto commentary talked about the view and not to miss it. I was walking near the chain bridge the next day and decided to jump on the bus and go have a look. Great idea. Dont miss it.

Very good. Gellert Hill provides an excellent panaromic view of both Buda and Pest sides. It is a historic and beautiful place to visit. Trip to Budapest is incomplete without visit to Gellert Hill and Statue of Liberty.

Worth the Steep Climb. The view is amazing, a beautiful panaroma view of Budapest. The climb is pretty steep, but luckily relatively short. Bring enough water during a hot day. Beverages and food can be bought at the top.

Well worth the trek up. While you can get to top on the hop on and hop off buses or by public transport/taxis, we decided to tackle the hill by foot and found it surprisingly manageable - plus the views are the top feel so much more worth it. Not just at the top, but on the way up as well, you get some incredible views across the whole city and further afield. The beauty of it takes your breath away and you can't miss the opportunity to see them for yourself.
Stunning. Gellert Hill provides superb Panasonic view of Budapest city. It is also a historic place with a nice Statue of Liberty. Highly recommended.

Go up in the morning and beat the crowds. Ran up the hill at 0500. Saw the sunrise with just a few teenagers who probably spent the night up there. Much nicer to see the memorials prior to all the tour busses.

Great exercise!. It doesn't look say high when you're at the ground level but it is a typical situaties of looks can be deceiving. In the hot Hungarian sun it was quite the walk so make sure to bring some bottled water with your when 'walking' to the top. The sight is well worth the hassle and, in my opinion, it is a must do when you're in Budapest

Stunning views. The various hop on hop off busses visit here so it's easy to get to. Spend a bit of time here, enjoy the citadel but particularly enjoy the splendid views of the city from up here. There are toilets and restaurants here too, it's a nice place to spend time and relax.

just an ordinary statue. This statue can be seen from a distance whether you are near the Danube river or on the other side of town.We went up to see it and as a matter of fact it wasn't somwthing that special.If you are stuck between doing 2 things,this is not worth it but if you have time go check it out!

Take it easy.. This is a must achievement for any family wanting to take a slow walk, up the side of cliff, that not only has spectacular views on the way up and down, but also once you get to the top. You see this statue from afar and when on the Danube but you only realise the size of it and the surrounding when up and close. If you walk up from the bridge, there are lots of stop off points to rest and enjoy the scenery.

A perfect day trip with nice view. I really liked the day trip to this spectacular place. The view, the walk up to the hill and all the people around were just fabulous. Best pictures taken from this place from my Budapest trip.

The Climb Rewarded By Stunning Vista. The area around Gellert Hill is beautiful. Whether you reach it by walking,tram or bus there is no escaping the climb. An impressive, tranquil waterfall is flanked by the steps that will take you to the statue. It is worth the effort as you are treated to a beautiful view of the Danube and the Pest side. I find the experience to be contemplative each time I go. I think you will too Replacement buses in the summer from Geller Square will get you to the nearby Rudas Gyoryfurdo (Health baths) from where you can access the stairs and the hill.
Hilly beauty. Nice to go there at all times. evening and midday. The statue is huge and it is pleasant to walk around the hill.
Sightseeing. This was part of the hop on hop off bus tour. You certainly couldn't walk up here, so taking the bus is recommended. Once at the top views of the city are tremendous.

A wonderful green labyrinth. I live in Budapest, and climb every year at least once up to the Gellért Hill. I have probably never gone on the same way. There are so many ways, so many opportunities, so many views that it is absolutely worth walking instead of the bus. Don't fear of get lost: if you walk up, you will arrive the top anyway; if you go down, you will arrive a place in the city anyway, where are trams and busses.One of my favorite parts of the city.

Dramatic Statue. This statue is high up on the hill and is well-lit at night so it was very cool to see it up close during the day as part of our Budapest City Tour. The views are wonderful from this vantage point - we were not disappointed not to see the views from Fisherman's Bastion or Castle Hill.

The most beautiful view of the city. We Came to the Mount by bus number 27.After about 15 min. walking we arrived to the statue.The statue is not very impressive But the view from the hilltop to the city is Amazing!

Worth a trip to get up close. It's impossible not to see Gellert Hill from anywhere in Budapest. Its a lovely and short excursion to go up close. We explored it during a Hop on Hop off bus trip and actually walked down to see the statue of St. Gellert statue as well as more prominent Liberty statue.

Better from a Distance. You can see this statue from many places on either side of the city and, while the views from there are nice, you can get similar views from more interesting locales. I wouldn't take the time unless you are in Budapest for a week.

Great View & Free - but do you have the time?. Can't complain about the view from here and certainly A+ - but there are so many panorama spots to pick from - this one just loses out in the competition. If you have the time a worthy stop, but if you need to prioritize your time - skip this one. It is out of the way and really how many pictures do you need. Fisherman's Bastion of the Castle are better choices.
Beautiful view!!. Worth the climb or take the hop on hop off bus! Be sure to walk all the way out to the statue. Just beautiful!
Great view of Budapest. Probably the best view of Budapest. We went to the Hill right after the Gellert Spa.From the hill we moved on to the Castle area.

Should go in the evening. It is not high but under the afternoon sun, it's hard climb. Refreshment available on top but not in the middle. This is by far the best vantage point of the city. Sitting on the top in the shadow, it's kind of peaceful.

Gellert Hill, a must-visit place in Budapest. The Gellert Hill can be seen from the city, with it's location high obove and practical in the middle of Budapest.You are rewarded with the most beautiful view over the whole city, and the place oozes history. Really recommendable.

Worth for long walk. This place is take a long walk before you reach the hill but worth enough to walk because once you get to the hill you will forget how tired you walked up here. you can see Budapest view especially during night time is the most Beautiful place to see. but quite dark to walk during night time better to take a bus but if you don't scare so it's okay and quite safe.

Wow, the views are amazing!. We walked up one sunny afternoon. It was a slow and steady climb to the top but we did make it after many stops to take the odd photos. There are plenty of seats to sit and rest on the way up if you need to rest for a bit. it was lovely to make it to the top and the views were amazing. You can see the statue for miles around.

A long walk. Take the bus!. We took hop on hop off the bus to the end of the line and walked the rest of the way. It's about 10/15 mins up hill and hard when it's hot! But there are traders on the hills that you can stop off at and the cafe at the bus stop is good

Nice view. It is a small hill overlooking Danube. It was named after a saint. At the top of the hill is a citadel from where one can get nice view of the river & the surrounding. It is in unesco heritage list.
Overlooking Budapest. One of the highest points of the city and its surrounding. Nice statue on top of it with interesting history about it.
amazing views. amazing views from up there. you will see all Budapest under you and the Danube from up is wow. souvenirs are available as well

Beautiful Walk Through The Park . Lovely walk through the park, with many stunning view points along the way. The hike to the top is pretty easy...slow and steady. The views over the Danube and city are stunning. The monument at the top is impressive.
this is the place. the views of the city and the danube are breathtaking,take the tourist bus to this must visit view point

A look worth it. We were there in the evening, and it is beautiful.
The view goes all the way over Budapest city, you se everything every building lighten up, it is so worth to take a trip up there in the evening.
Worth the walk . There is a fair walk up the hill however once reaches the top some really nice viewpoint of the entire city, also a citadela and some other historic monuments to see
Views to die for. The best views of Budapest and the surrounding areas - great to get your bearings and wonderful to watch the sun go down!
Great place and great view. As for me it's the first place you definitely need to visit in Budapest. When you'll get to the top you will be able to see overall city and most interesting places
Nice morning walk. If you are planning trip to Budapest you shouldnt forget to visit this place. Nice view and really great tourist trail leading further to the city.

Super Views over Pest. Gelert Hil lstands 230 mts above the River Danube. You can walk up, use the hop on hop off buses or public transport. The views you get are great.You also get to walk around the Citadel (still showing it's battle scars from the various conflicts there have been in Hungary). The independence monument also sits on top of the hill. Erected by the Russians to mark the liberation of the city from the Germans, it was once surrounded by Russian soldiers but these were taken down in 1992.

Nice walk from the bus stop. The walk to this from the bus stop is very pleasant and not too strenuous. The monument itself is a mark in the history of the country and is worth seeing. You can walk down from here all the way to Gellert Baths, although you have to make a few guesses as to the right path to follow at times .. Lots of steps as well.

One of my favourite places in Budpest. If you cross the Liberty bridge (Szabadsag hid) from the Pest to the Buda side you'll see the Gellert hotel. Right next to it is a green area and at the top you can see the statue looking out over the city. A short but steep walk takes you to the top of the hill were you can enjoy the view and sit down for a drink and a snack offered at the booths operating a short walk from the statue itself.Be sure to walk up here since it's all free and offers a great view of parts of the castle and the Pest side of town.

A Great view from the top.. A High hill over looking the Danube river,named after Saint Gerard who was thrown from the hill to die.At the top of the hill is the citadel,a good view of all the Districts and the Danube river, which separates Buda and Pest.There are a few shops on the top that sell souvenirs.

Amazing View. You will have to work for it as it is a bit of a walk up but I will recommend it. Of course you can always take a bus there but it won't be as fun :-) Work for it and you wont regret it. Every step up you will be able to see the city from a different angle. At the top, an amazing view, a great monument and a nice small market

Amazing view. Great walk. 360 view of the city....but look out...... Great walk up if you can manage it. Amazing 360 degree view of the city and the river. Nice little shops for souvenirs. There is a traditional dish which is like fried dough with garlic butter, cream cheese and more cheese on top.....definitely get it! It's amazing!!!But......and there is always a but....be careful of the cup and ball players (shell game). This is a complete and utter scam! I saw one lady lose 300 euros right in front of my eyes. You live and you learn. Don't take part! The crowd around them are all in on it. Apart from that, enjoy the views, grab a selfie and an ice cream.https://www.tripadvisor.co.uk/ShowUserReviews-g274887-d276867-r397211846-Citadel-Budapest_Central_Hungary.html#

Comunist style statue. Gellert hill is nice to walk if you are in good shape and have enough time to spent in Budapest. The statue is an old communist relicvs. I do not recomment a trip there, better to visist St Gellert cave at bottom.

This monument was not relegated to Mememto Park. Although originally erected in honour of the valiant Soviet Soldiers who liberated Hungary, this monument was not relegated to the Memento Park, for two reasons I understand: its actual design predated the arrival of the Soviet army and following the collapse of the Socialist System the inscription was changed to be more inclusive: to all who fought for freedom etc. etc.We took the hop on, hop off bus to Gellert Hill walked up to the statue, the took the bus gain. The view is great, but so are many from the Buda side.

The walk up may finish you off!. We walked up on a very hot day and wanted to give up on several occasions. Keep going, it's worth it. However you could get the 27 bus from metro stop Moricz Zsigmond Korter. There is an extensive souvenir market at the back of the Citadel if that is of interest to you. We went up for the view and our interest in Comunist statues.

Beautiful refuge in the heart of the city. Beautiful refuge in the heart of the city. Check out the Citadel but then leave quickly for a stroll in the park located at the back of hill. A beloved park by locals, couples, people with children and dogs. You get a nice view over the city and can enjoy the shades of trees. Don't miss if you visit Budapest.

Stunning views. A must visit if you are into city views! I would recommend going before the sunset so you can find a place to sit (as it does get crowded) and enjoy the sunset along with the night view of the beautiful city of budapest. The sculpture itself is good too but the city views take over. Be warned there are quite a few stairs to the top, although there are sections in between where you can stop and catch a breath before moving on.

fantastic view of the city.. This was a fantastic view and well worth the walk up the hill from where the hopon hop off bus dropped us.. There was a little craft market and stalls selling snacks and drinks which we did not use. There were also public lavatories up there.Under the actual statue there were quite a lot of people but a short easy walk down steps led to other viewpoints that were empty.It was very hot when we went there and we drank almost all our water, but we could have bought some more from the snack stalls. Some people were walking up which seemed madness to me since it was mid-day, the hill is very steep and it was 36C. They mostly looked shattered. It seems you can catch an ordinary bus up and end up where the coaches drop people off; I would certainly say that seems better.
A must to visit. Amazing the area surrounding is worth the visit . The artwork is superb . Easy accessible location. Towering statues breathtaking by their stature.
Great view and not much else. We stopped here on our bus tour. The views of the city were amazing but other than a few touristy shops there is nothing else here.

SPECTACULAR VIEWING POINT. This is the tallest point in Budapest and offers stunning views of both Buda and Pest, the Danube and the surrounding area. Point is visible from most parts of town and is located at the Erzsebet hid (Elizabeth) bridge. The Liberty Statue on top of the hill commemorates those who died in the fight for Hungarian independence
Best view of the city. The citadel is on the Buda side and there are stunning views of the entire city and Danube river. This is your photo stop.

Mesmerising view. The view from Liberty Statue is unbelievable, offering a unique panorama over Budapest. The statues themselves are also magnificent, and amazing to see up close the history of Communist Hungary. The only downfall of the walk was that there were no signposts, and we had to rely mostly on intuition and following others to reach the top, which took about 30 mins. We went at sunset which was amazing, so would definitely recommend early evening when the heat is less intense.
Iconic viewpoint on the Danube. A substantial walk from the city centre this has to be one of the most iconic view points across the city and the Danube. Well worth the effort.

Highlight of the week. I took two German teacher collegues to the top after a heavy rain, late at night at about 12. No tourists, just the giant figures of bronze statues, emerging from the swirling mist - a bit grotesque, if you like, as if in a concert with the beams of light. It was not easy to find our way to the top by car in the zig-zag streets. And the toilet was also closed - would have been useful after a pub evening. But the view: stunning!
excelent view to Budapest. The place offers one one the best views to Budapest. With the parks the place is nice to walk through and rest.

Killer City and River Views from this Area. Unforgettable views of Budapest and the Danube from this hill. Lots of trails for hiking and viewing. A walk around the citadel really allows you to imagine the area way back when. This is a Budapest, must-do!

Hungary’s Statue of Liberty. Imagine you’re in New York City. In the bay a green-patina statue holds high a lighted beacon. For someone unaware of America’s history—and France’s gift—it means little, just a tall statue. I acknowledge my ignorance of Hungary’s history and culture, though Budapest has now become my favorite European city.Atop Gellért Hill, indeed, the prominent 14-meter (46 feet) tall statue on a 26-meter (85 feet) pedestal erected in 1947 is called Liberty Statue, named for the (translation) “Memory of the liberating Soviet heroes in 1945 by the grateful Hungarian people.” Hungarians could not have known that though Soviet occupation did end the Nazi reign of terror, but a decade later led to a failed revolution. Gellért Hill stands hundreds of feet above Danube River making this statue appear as tall as her New York sister. The sculptor had intended the statue to hold a child, but the controlling Soviets insisted that be changed to a palm frond (which I originally thought was a feather).Gellért Hill and Liberty Statue are identified as one attraction—adjacent to Citadel—from which views of Budapest and the river are phenomenal. I recommend visiting here shortly before sunset, to experience growing shadows and exquisite colors of the landscape and many statues surrounding the area. There are places to enjoy a late picnic lunch, and I suggest a good Hungarian wine with exquisite local cheeses. There is no cost for visiting the half dozen attractions lining this hill, all of which are accessible for about a 75-cent bus ride.

Short Steep Walk worth it!!. Easily accessible via bus from the Pest side. The start is right across the white bridge at a gorgeous waterfall. The hill and climb look daunting but it only took us about 20 minutes (with bad knees) to get to the top. The view is amazing and there are shops and food at the top that are relatively cheap. Its a great outdoor activity on a day that isn't too hot!!

Panoramic point. Interesting panoramic point to get a comprehensive overlook on Budapest. The place is reachable through a nice walk in the greenery and once you get there you can relax and breathe good fresh air (especially in summer). Don't forget to take pictures of the statues, which are among symbols of the city. Rich choice in typical food and souvenirs just around the corner

Good hike up, fantastic views.. There are many routes to the top, some include steps. I began at the Erzebet bridge and missed most of the steps, but obviously the incline was steep. The citadel has its pretty detailed history written on the side on one of the walls in English and I found that very helpful. Views of both sides of the Danube were spectacular. I came down a different route and found the cross on a mound with nearby seating. Similar view but from lower incline. You can drive up to the top but it's not as much fun.

Great views. Quite a walk, especially if it is a hot day but you get wonderful views from here and a nice spot to rest before you head back. Not a lot here other than the same statue and some stalls selling souvenirs.
View from the very top. Suggest you use the hop on and off bus. Walk to straight to the top. The view is breathtaking. Best going in the morning.
Good view, little information. There isn't a whole lot of information up there (none in fact) and it is very busy with tourists. But there is a lovely view from the Liberty statue.

night time visit with spectactular views. amazing views over the city but be prepared for it to be crowded as it is very popular. if going on your own you might have a long walk from where you park, Coaches fill the car park

worth a visit but not a lot beyond the views. good view from the top of the Citadel, but not a lot more. the citadel itself is not open to visitors, a real pity. we visited during the red bull air race weekend, and the view from there was fantastic!
What a statue!. The climb was worth it! I remember we walked for so long, there were so many steep steps but we made it. The city is seen so nicely from the hill.
Stunning Views!. This is a place where you can see all the city and relax while you enjoy the views!If you have time don't miss it!
The best views in Budapest!. Walk here takes a little time and isn't the most easiest but once you get up here the scenery is worth every step! Up in the hill there are some shops.
Great view of the city. It's on the Hop on Hop off bus tour itinerary so no need to plan a visit. Just jump off when you get the opportunity.
Amazing view. Great view. A workout to get to the top but totally worth it. Gorgeous views along the way and a cool monument and fort at the top.
Well worth the hike!. The views from the top of this mountain not far from the centre of town are not to be missed and the wooded park is large and has plenty of attractions to explore.
Wonderful . It was our first stop in Budapest! Breathtaking view! We were excited! You can see all of Budapest! Almost :-) wonderful!

Beautiful statue - beautifully lit at night. The history of this statue is interesting. According to our guide, the Soviets called it a statue of liberation, and the Hungarians now view it the same way, only to them it is a memorial to their liberation FROM Soviet dominance.Her place on the hill acts as a 'welcome' to the area when viewed from a river boat, and at night she is lit up and can be viewed from the river (or from Pest) and admired.
Wonderful. It is a long walk up the hill. Definitely worth the effort to get to the top! The view is breathtaking. Highly recommended photographers, perfect pictures.
Worth the climb. Worth the climb to the top for the amazing views over the City. Metro station at the bottom of the hill and ferry stop.
