A long way up for not much. It was a good climb to the top of this hill and the view was great, but there is unfortunately not much else up there. You can get a similar view from the Castle Hill. It was a nice walk though, definitely a tourist spot.

Great climbing up and down with kids. Started climbing from Dobrentei ter near the bridge with 3 kids and found that the way was easier then what we thought, true that we stop at every view point at the shadow.... It was a hot day and it is steep but not difficult at all, The top and view is very nice and walking around all this little shops and flower garden is nice too there is a great signs and pictures explaining the history of the place as well. We thought that taking the time walking was worth it and that it was good taking snacks and water with us looking at the prices...We went down from the other side towards the other bridge finding 2 shedowed playgrounds one of them has many cool slides that even all "not kids" passed there enjoyed :)

Spectacular views. This walk is well worth the exertion. At the hot of the hill you will see spectacular views of both the Buda and Pest side of Budapest. There are also some little shops at the top selling touristy items and drinks.

Great views after a bit of a climb.. This is situated on the Buda side just by the Liberty - Green - Bridge and opposite the Gellert Hotel and Baths. A robust climb awaits you,zig zagging upwards, however there are a lot of viewing pit stops to catch your breath and enjoy the amazing views before you reach the Statues. Up at the top there are again even better views and little stalls selling souvenirs and well deserved drinks and snacks. Well worth the effort as the views are some of the best in the city. Go see!!!

Nice Views of Budapest. We took public transportation (train and bus) as far as it would bring us and walked the rest of the way. It's free and you get spectacular views of the city below. If you can get up there, it's worth a visit, just for the views alone.
The best view over the city. It's a must see in Budapest. Beside the statue there's a great view over the Danube and the city. I recommend hiking up there. The path is very nice.
Very beautiful. Very beautiful place from where you can see a very beautiful view of Budapest. With a beautiful waterfall.

Famous place. You will find a lot of tourists there , it is a famous , you can catch a nice picture for Duna and historical buildings on it , there are a lot of traditional things with local seller there .

Amazing view. Once again, this hill of the Buda side offers an incredible view on the Pest side of the city.Don't be afraid to get their by walking on the well marked path on the hill either from the danube or from the Gellert bath. The walk is not that hard and you will enjoy many view points.
The best view over BP. Going there was easy alone, but with a baby carrier I am not so sure. Already the walk there was enjoyable and fun, sad I did it alone though. Anyhow, the view is splendid! :-)
Hopped off - view!. As part of the Hop On Hop Off bus route we hopped off for the photo op with lovely views of Budapest. Worth the time to hop off and walk about.

Budapest anniversary visit. We did this visit by using one of 'city bus tours' and were not disappointed. The views over the city are superb and well worth the time taken, there is a short up hill walk after getting off the bus!
Great view, shame about the rubbish. We walked up here on a sunny, hot afternoon. There is quite a bit of welcome shade but the discarded rubbish really is not acceptable.
Worth the effort. The walk up the hill to the top was well worth it for the amazing views over the city and then a walk back down through the park was a great mornings outing.

Definitely make yhe effort. This is on most of the hop on hop off bus routes but very easy to get to on public transport ( if you go public you have bit of a walk up to statue). This gets very busy but the view is definitely worth the effort, you get to see the whole of beautiful Budapest. The statues are true works of art.There are the usual tat stalls on the way up and are very expensive so you would be advised to buy your souvenirs elsewhere.There are public toilets at a small fee.
Great views. beautiful lookout onto buda and pest parts of the city. The monument is impressive. Catch a bus up, and then walk down the shaded forest back to city level.

Walk to the top and don't forget to look down as you get higher!. Worth it for the view at the top, although the statue is not really the best Budapest has to offer. There are some other good vantage points across the chain bridge where Parliament House can be viewed (castle hill for example) - and you'd likely be visiting those anyway.

A must visit place, the highest place around, for a panoramic view of Budapest. We went on Gellert hill by bus and reached the statues in 10 minutes. The panoramic view of the city was expected. The only thing to recommend is that you have to visit Buda Castle also, with much more interesting kind of view, and all the historic buildings around.

Incredible View. You should visit this place for sure to see the nice view. Frome this part you can enjoy both Buda and Pest and Margaret's island in the middle. Do not miss it. Take wonderful photos from there.

AMAZING VIEWS OF THE CITY!. The best views over the city! Took a while to get to the top, but was a nice walk on a warm day, wasn't extremely well sign- posted but was lovely. Once at the top theres not a huge amount to do. There was a few pop- up shops and cafe's which were good to stop in at and you could walk around the citadel.

Worth visiting. We saw the statue from the city and decided we had to visit. We walked over the bridge in the evening, and walked the stone stairs up to the top. It was lovely to walk there in the evening, just a few lights along the stairs gave it a mystic feeling. There were few people in the evening too, and the view from the top at night was worth the walk.

Beautiful panoramic views of Budapest. If you are up for the walk to the top of Gellert Hill you will be rewarded with some of the best views of Budapest. The walk up is a combination of inclined paths and steps and will be an energetic 20-30 minute walk, depending on your pace. But well worth it!

Great view. Going up the hill isnt easy , you must do it when its not to hot. The view is great . We came late and couldnt go inside, unfurtenutaly, but enjoyed sitting and viewing the bridges on the river.

A very tall statue and hard to see from the base. It was a long walk on a hot day. Better seen from a distance. There were street games at the base with shills drawing folks in. Guide warned against them.
Wonderful view. You have from the top a wonderful view oin a big part of the city, the Danube, the bridges. The statue is to remember that the soviets was libarating the country from the nazis.

Go for the Scenic View and Less for the Statue. Gellert Hill and Statue provide the best view point of Budapest. We went up for the photo of the statue which can be seen from everywhere on the lower level. However when we reached the top the priority was diverted. The scene of the city and the Danube River could not be better. We ended up with our best photos of the lower level including the important sites and few photos of the tall statue on the top of the hill. Any case,the trip was better than we thought.
Nice view. It's quite a climb up, but the view is marvelous! The statue itself isn't quite that special, but it's a must-see and the waterfall is pretty too.
Nice view. We enjoyed climbing the hill and appreciating the view from the top. There were only a handful of people up there which was nice.

Hike in the park. Good hike in the park to have a great view of the Danube and Pest. On a hot day park water as they charge way too much at the top. The statue is ok but take tome to read the timeline on the wall.
That view ! . A must do! Incredible views ! Go for the sunset and then stay there and wait for the whole city to turn the lights on ! Amazing !

beautiful view - but could be improved. I've made this trip multiple times over the years and was glad to take my family for the marvelous views. We started at the Gellert ter metro station and made our way up to the top. Some signage would be helpful, although you realize soon enough that all roads lead to the top. The view from the top is spectacular. Even if you are going to the Castle as well, Gellert has a slightly different view of Pest, the Bridges, etc. What disappointed me was the state of maintenance. The walks were broken down in places and there was a lot of trash along the way. Compared to so many other sites we saw in Hungary, this was a disappointment. Regardless, it's still a marvelous view of the city and well worth it.

Good hike to the top. I like to hike and walk, so this is a great destination. There is not much at the top other than the monument and the old fortress. We took the bus up and walked down, which is highly recommended. The trip down offers so many great views through a wooded setting and is quite well maintained. It is a good hike and drops you off at the Cave Church and Gellert Spa at the bottom.
Very interesting. A good climb up the hill but well worth the effort. The views over Budapest are spectacular. I tried Chimney cake for the first time. Delicious.
Great views. Amazing views but not much to do at the top. Castle hill is much better. Skip if you don't have time.

Worth the long hike!. Budapest demands walking and lots of it!
The long walk to this attraction was well worth it!
The views are amazing and the statue is regal and imposing.
Very crowded when we went, so obviously popular!

Budapest Statue of Liberty . You can see it from anywhere. You won't be excited till you find it. You'll have the climb the hill... Not that easy for old people and handicapped. The Pest side and the Danube looks fantastic from this place in Buda. At the end of the hill you'll find it!

Beautiful panorama. The panorama from the citadel is really fantastic but I regret that the citadel itself can not be visited. You only can walk around but not inside. I recommend this visit if you have time but for short stay you can pass it without missing anything important.

Accidentally came across this Stunning View. We were actually climbing up the hill to get to the Citadella. As we crossed the bridge, this beautiful set of stairs rose before us, eventually leading us through a set of staircases to an incredible statue and a far more amazing view. Honestly the staircases reminded me of the stairs to the castle in "Slipper and the Rose". We spent several minutes enjoying the view and the statue, wondering about its history, and enjoying the facial expressions on the statues before continuing on with our climb. P.S. Neither of us is in any kind of shape, but we were still able to climb up to the statue in about 10-15 minutes, the rest of the climb to the Citadella was a different story
Hiking heaven. We hiked to the top of Gellert Hill in temperatures upwards of 30 degrees celcius so it was a very difficult climb but the views from the top were absolutely worth it.

Awesome view on the city!. This was the first stop as part of our city tour and we came by here for a short photo stop. The weather was sunny but yet cooling as it was windy.Wow! The views here on the city were awesome, would say was the best panoramic views of the entire city, we saw the bridge that links Buda (Old Town) with Pest (New Town). Photos taken here resemble to those we saw in postcards, gorgeous and awesome!We really felt we were on top of the world having a great bird eye's view on the lovely city which later on, we actually went for a walking tour to explore in greater depths.Recommended!

Poorly sign-posted, but beautiful views at the top!. We climbed Gellert Hill after having lunch sat on the suspension of Liberty Bridge. Fortunately we had a map of the City between us, and we followed a highlighted path to the top of the hill. In honesty I am not sure where we went wrong, but we strayed from the main path and took another one that seemed intact but ended up physically climbing the hill! Thankfully we're young and somewhat athletic, but I dread to think what someone whom requires wheelchair access would do. All in all, the climb was tough, and the summer sun did not aid us! But the views at the top were well worth the trek.

Best city view i've ever seen. I went here 4 years ago and enjoyed it so much I went back last week. Go up after the sun has set for a stunning view of the Danube lit up by the main buildings in Budapest. The walk can be a little scary at night so I recommend not going alone.
Incredible Views!. Really easy to access by foot or public transport. A really peaceful place with incredible views of the entire city!

Bus tour. We came here on a hop on-hop off bus tour and glad we did. The views across the city and river were fantastic. I'm not sure if the citadel itself was open, if it was, we missed it. The only downside was having to pay for the toilets to a woman who had a face on her like the back of the bus we'd just got off of.

Toilets at gellert hill. I don't mind paying to use public toilets but I do expect them to be clean. The floor was wet and there was wee on the toilet seat.. The attendant was busy eating her lunch inside the building instead of attending to the cleaning.
Good place. Not too steep walk. But U need more time here. Very peaceful place. Lot of history to understand and see. Good viewing points and pics and selfie places!

Worth the climb. I definitely don't recommend going there in a hot sunny day. Do it in an early morning or at sunset. The view of the city is spectacular from the top. There are a few terraces on the way which also have fantastic view. Get water if the weather is hot. It took me 40 minutes to get there (with the breaks for photos and rest) - I've climbed it from Hotel Gellert side. There is overpriced icecream truck on the top. Don't miss the Rock Church.
They call it the statue of liberty. You see this standing out all over the city, you must go and see it you get impressive views of the city. We went by hop on hop off bus.

Hungary's Statue of Liberty. At the end of our days touring we called by Gellert Hill. The view from here is one of the best in Budapest with the whole of the Pest side laid out before you. You can see the parliament and various bridges, the Danube and a lot further afield. The fortress was closed for renovations but the whole thing is quite majestic.
if you don't like to walk, take the hop on/hop off or a cab. This is a long walk up a very steep hill. It was crowded and it really entailed looking at the views more than anything else.
Great surprise. We didn't know this was here and sort of stumbled upon it on our walk down the hill - great surprise and views.
Get up early to do this!. This is a great hike with actually lots of statues and such on the way! There is more than only the liberty statue to see! Cannot beat this view of Budapest!

A very pretty statue!. I liked this statue very much. I loved what it signified and what it stood for. I took a picture of it every chance I got. When Hungary won against Austria in the EM (football), the statue changed to all different colours that night. Even the colour of the flag. Beautiful!

Stunning views, hard walk!. The views especially in the summer are mesmerising from the hills. So worth the difficult walk.
I have troubled knees so found the walk up challenging but the benches and shade helped and my supportive friends. Yet once getting up there, the traditional food, the unexpected market with souvenirs, the views and sights are spectacular. Beyond worth it!

for a photographer, its unavoidable for the panoramas. its a it of a trek - easy but plan 30 minutes to get on top with couple of breaks if needed. Go around sunset - enjoy the crimson skies if weather is good; but more importantly enjoy the lights coming up at buda castle, parliament, chain bridge. its amazing

Quite a climb!. Take water if you are going to climb the hill and also make sure that you don't need the loo when you get to the top as they charge quite a lot for use of the toilets in the citadella. However, it is definitely worth a visit to the top if only for the wonderful views of the city below.

View. We went here on a private tour and loved the views. I thought there could be a few things to make this area better. There were guys hustling people up at the statue doing card games. The area parking was bad because of all the buses. Very crowded. Lots of vendors at top

A long climb up but well worth it!. After a late night, this was the perfect start to the day, with a long, steep climb to get the body working again! Well worth it though, with fantastic views from the summit across the whole city and beyond. The river Danube looked beautiful as it glistened in the sunlight and overall, it was one of the highlights of our visit to Budapest

Great views at night. We went up here one evening and got a great view of Budapest. The way up is a little bit of a maze and isn't very well lit but we managed it in the end and the views didn't disappoint
worth the hike. great views, both day and night. a bit of a walk but it is totally worth it. felt safe even at night.

She is special! . The day we went up the hill was unfortunately wet and cloudy...but seeing this statue and the surrounding views were still very attractive. In a city filled with male statues she was for us a strong and endearing statue reflecting hope and new beginnings. The Citadel and the view over the lawns and across the city are breathtaking...even on a cloudy day. The Danube is clearly visible flowing in both directions as it divides the city....Buda and Pest! Take the time to see it all.

Go to Gellert Hill for spectacular views of Budapest!!. We visited Gellert Hill during the day and at night! The views were spectacular! We saw the hill as part of the Castle Hill and Parliament Tour and the Budapest at Night/Folk Tour.

Even if you skip it you don't miss anything. . I've lived in Hungary for many years and never had been there, only went there because my dad wanted to. Anyway, we walked up on foot and the top didn't really have much to see, I mean like just some souvenir shops and the statue and the citadel itself. Would've skipped it if someone else wanted to go.

Worth it. Getting there means dying just a little, but the view at the top is worth it! There are different little winding paths up the hill and every now and then there are viewpoints, making the climb just a little easier to bear.

Great views with a bit of nature. The hike to the top of the hill is well worth it. It offers great views of the city and a peaceful break from the city. Walking through the wooded areas in spring was a treat.
Worth the climb!. Stunning views from the top, although the climb is tiring, it's well worth it. Great place to just explore.
Best veiws of the city, great history and markets!. Amazing panoramic views of the city, great history of the area and beautiful picture opportunities. Take change for toilets and markets!

Fantastic views, well worth the walk. You can walk up a series of paths and steps starting opposite the Gellert Hotel. You don't need to be super fit and kids could do this but no buggies. There are beautiful views all the way up but the view from the top is spectacular. The monument itself is impressive and welll worth seeing. I think the bus tours come here so if you can't do the walk get the bus it's well worth the trip.

Breathtaking views. My very athletic friend and me (professional lazy person) decided to take a walk up to the"lady & the leaf) and it was absolutely worth the effort!!! The view of the city up there took both of our breaths away! The photo just doesn't do it justice. It was great to have a guy up there selling ice cold drinks too - these were needed after the climb and the price wasn't extortionate which was a bonus as I'd have paid anything at that point for a bottle of water Would highly recommend.

Pleasure walk which ends with stunning view. Long story short – nice walk, stunning view all over the city, for free. It´s also easy to combine with visit of Fisherman's Bastion, Caste Hill. If you use metro, you can start at Széll Kálmán tér and then enjoy the walk.
Good View. Stopped here on the hop on hop off bus. Amazing views, spent about 30 minutes here which I think is enough. Statue is impressive and good to see close up
nice. we only walk to the statue of liberty. can make goog photos from there. but rain came and we 've been obliged to get the first bus.

Spectacular Views ...... Walking up to the Statue we have a birds eye view of the city, with no charge to enter this attraction you can enjoy the surroundings. It did become quite busy so maybe an idea to go early.

Mr.. Nice walk, breath taking views, I think night views are best, but day views have it's own magic, there for be there 15 minutes before sun set. 1 to 1,5 hour needed to enjoy day/night views with bridges, castle, parlament and city illumination.

Mesmerizing Views from the hill. Tallest area in Budapest, with magnificent views of the river below plus the city. The stature and castle is also impressive and on the walls it has every 10 years of Budapest by photo's

Good view of the town. It's totally worth it to climb the hill because the view from here is just stunning. Best place for pictures.
impressive. While on a short cruise down the Danube this statue was an amazing site, perched high up on a hill, seen at sunset.
The views are incredible.. If you're going to Budapest, a visit to the top of Gellert hill is mandatory! the views from the top are amazing. On a clear day you can see across the whole of Budapest.
worth the walk up to see the view. A nice Sunday stroll up this hill to look at the view over both sides of the town. It's well worth it. There is also beer sold at the top, if you need motivation!
Hungary jewel. beautiful, very beautiful place and always like to visit with the children, with friends and family.
nice!!!. Its a nice place to stop by for the view of Budapest city from the hill... pretty impressive i would say.
Iconic viewpoint. You need to visit here to get the best possible sweeping views of the Danube passing through Budapest: includes Castle Hill and all the Budapest highlights

Good workout with a reward at the end. . We decided to climb up the hill which was a good workout for us but the climb is beautiful with various view points. The liberty statue is great and the view of the city is spectacular. Of course u have a choice to take other transport mode but hiking up and down the hill is fun.

Superb views of the cities and the Danube . Went up on the hop on hop off bus tour and spent quite a while wondered around reading the history of the place and looking at the superb views taking photos. Worth spending a little time here early in your visit to Budapest then you can see the two cities laid out like a map and get your bearings. Looks splendid at night too as does the whole city of Buda.

Cool Soviet era monument. I'm glad they didn't tear it down like many countries do for places like this. It was very interesting to see. It's basically a "build this statue of freedom... or else" gesture from the Soviets.
Amazing view. From the top of Gellert hill you can get a great view of Budapest,definate must do especially at night!
Peace Monument. Our guide informed us that this is a Peace Monument errected on this hill very near to Citadel. We could see Budapest City view from this Hill

Great place, but why historical monument plaques have been removed? Wrong to forget the history!. Best view of the city opens from this spot,it`s just breath taking - visit it by all means! Great view. Walked around here after using the gellert spa which is nearby. The view is amazing, would love to go up here after dark the view would have been spectacular
Nice view. I went for a morning walk/run/sightseeing and chose this place as my target for the day. The climb up here is nice, and the view from the top was beatyfull.
Amazing views of the city. Went up the Gellert hill at night, and the views were phenomenal! There is a great view across the whole city, and isn't too steep to climb.

Worth the climb.. You can climb the hill to Gellert but it is also possible to take the public bus or - if you want- the hop-on-hop-off bus.

Great angle to view Budapest. On top of Gellért Hill there are probably the best possible views over the entire city on both sides of the Danube meaning Pest as well as Buda. Also good hiking venue.

Great place to visit!. Definitely worth a stop if you can find someone to drive you there (or take a hop on- hop off bus) or if you are in a good shape just walk. However You should go there. View of the city and a Danube are amazing.
nice bottleopener!. It is located on the top of the gellért hill. Wich is not a real hill, so it is really easy to climb it. The Libety Statue from afar it is like a huge bottle opener

Great views of the city. It is a steep walk up to the statue but well worth it as the views from that height is well worth it. f it is warm take something to drink. The memorial itself is quite touching.
A Less Often Seen View. According to our guide, this is a less often seen vista, and historic. Definitely worth a stop if you can get someone to drive you here.
Worth The Walk. It is kind of a long walk up the trail to get to the top, but it is definitely worth the effort. Great history to see and amazing views of the city.
Fantastic sunset view. Don't go there for the statute; go there for the view; go there when the light is beautiful. Probably one of the best places to watch sunset and to fall in love with Budapest

Incredible views. Situated just behind the Citadel, it backs up the monument like a little bonus for climbing the tall hill above the city. The most expansive view of the city allows long panorama shots of the Danube.

Best view of Buda and Pest. If feeling reasonably fit, try climbing the hill from the Elizabeth bridge and drop down to the Gellert Spa, the views are pretty incredible and well worth the effort. Usual touristy effort at the back of the bastion with clearly bored staff, but if getting a fridge magnet or filling your face with overcooked street food is high on your agenda, this is for you. Interesting history of the bastion itself if thats your thing.
Best views in Budapest!. This is a must when you visit Budapest. It is not easy to access without transport, but it is worth it every bit of it. You can get the best views of Budapest from up there!

Nice walk, but what is it?. It is slightly confusing locating the entrance to the walk, as the slope begins down at the foot of the Liberty Bridge; whereas the Gellert Hill is the next hill over. The entrance is not signposted, though hopefully most should be able to figure it out for themselves when they see the crowds gathering at the waterfall migrating up and down the hill towards the smaller statue on your walk up.The walk up the hill is exhausting; particularly on a hot sunny day as it was when I attempted it. Once one reaches so far as the halfway point, however, they will be rewarded with magnificent views of Budapest - which is nothing to say for the views one witnesses at the summit. Unfortunately, once at the top after the pleasant walk, one will find... Not much. Huge crowds of tourists, an ice cream van selling drinks for more expensive than they are even in the UK, and the statue complex. The statues are nice to behold, even with the hilarious symbolism of a Russian worker punching a German eagle in the face. However, there is absolutely no indication of the statue's purpose, what it's there for, and its history. There is the odd sign in Hungarian, but given the huge crowds of American and West European tourists, I imagine they are typically unhelpful. As a result, I would like to rate the walk higher; but the negligence of the statue as a historical site means I can only rate three stars despite the lovely views and pleasant forest atmosphere of the rural hill. Disappointing.
Lovely Place. Great place to visit. The statues are amazing, so big! The structure of the statues are unbelievable. Make sure you come here. Great photo's!
Marvelous view !!!. Last night when we arrived our first thing was go to the top of the Gellert Hill and check it the marvelous panoramic view! Today we would like to go back in twilight time!

Wonderful views of the city. A long walk up the hill via steps and steep paths but definitely worth it for the views of the city and the Danube which are amazing. Incredible Budapest!. One of the primary attractions in Budapest, Gellert Hill In Buda is one of the highest points of the city which is an excruciating yet rewarding climb to the top mounted monuments crowning the city hill. Personally, walking up the snow covered hill was a hilarious experience, as we slowly (but not quite steadily) made our way up battling the slippery terrain and back breaking climb. While cruising along the river one gets to see several night spots, the most brilliant of all being Dream island- a junction of 6 to 7 dynamic clubs. There are several types of clubs catering to different types of people and from different age groups, but the best club in the area was Studio which is also the largest club in Europe. While at glamourous spots like these one gets to witness a generation which has successfully moved on from the horrors of war, along yet other party streets of Budapest one comes across several multi-cultural joints, pubs and ghettos which show the melting hot pot of cultures that Hungary actually is! As compared to Buda, Pest is livelier and more dynamic, but the real treasure is what lies in the middle of the two cities. The river cruise is a must do and one of the best things that Budapest has to offer. The river cruise gave us an opportunity to enjoy the city views by night, and the most spectacular highlight was the chain bridge, one of the 6 bridges built over the Danube but most definitely the most beautiful of them all. The amazing thing about Budapest is that it genuinely has a lot to offer in terms of places to see and experience. The Gellert hill Cave is one such example, deep seated under the geller hill, this cave church holds way too many secrets and stories than can be touched on the surface. The hidden church tells the tales over time of peace and prayers in a time of war, historical milestones of Budapest and and the dark history of Gellert Hill itself, which was named thus after Saint Gellert who was thrown down from the top of the hill hundreds of years ago.

Nice hike and view of Budapest along with a significant landmark. My husband and I hiked up to see Liberty Statue on the top of Gellert Hill. It was quite a distance, but not difficult. I thought it would be a pretty landmark and wonderful view, but it was more than that. I was touched by the inscriptions. One read "To the memory of all those who sacrificed their lives for the independence, freedom and prosperity of Hungary. I recommend reading up on how the memorial has changed over the years since the time of the Russian occupation. It's a good history lesson.

Magnificent view with a monumental statue!. The Gellert height with its Statue of Liberty is a must when visiting Budapest. Gellert Hill. This is a nice place to visit on a sunny day . There is a statue at the of a woman holding an olive branch which can be seen from many areas in Budapest. There are also very good views across the city

Highly recommend this attraction, wonderful nature and sublime view over the city.
Best pictures from Budapest. I think it is the best view on entire Budapest. Historical Fortress shows interesting history of Budpest from 1850 till 1980.

Lovely Views. I climbed to the top of the hill with a friend while we were in Budapest. I was a little winded when we got to the top, but the views made it all worth it! You can see all of Budapest from the top and it was simply stunning! Definitely worth checking out if you have the time.

Great views the city below. This provides great vies of the city below. One gets a real perspective of the geography of Budapest. Interesting to see the damage that was inflicted by the attacks on the fortress by the Russians as they attacked the Germans.
Beautiful view. Statue is not interesting and the place is crowded. But view on Budapest is beautiful and view is the only reason to get there if you want.

Every time you turn a corner there is another great view. Although most people should have no problems with the walk it would not be suitable for the elderly or infirm.

Long walk, big (sightseeing) reward. Be prepared for a steep uphill walk, but completely doable for all fitness types at your own leisurely pace? Once at the top, you are rewarded with panoramic views of the city.

A long walk uphill but worth it for the views. We walked this at night and the views over the city were breathtaking. We felt safe and there were others walking up there too. We went up by the Gellert Hotel side.

Quite a climb....... .........and not for the "unfit". There is a lift at the other side of this hill (funicular) but if you are able and have the time walk to the top. You will be rewarded with a good view across the Danube and into Budapest
Worth the Visit. Beautiful view of the Danube and Budapest. Tour buses park just below the outlook and you walk up. Not strenuous. Photographs do not do it justice. The view is breathtaking.
Good views of Budapest. A good hearty walk up the hill or you can drive up, nice views but avoid the food from the stalls, expensive and unpleasant.

Worth the Walk. We took the On and Off bus to Gellert Hill to see the Liberty monument. Gellert Hill was named after a Christian martyr. It was a little hike to the top but the view in itself is panoramic!! You first walk past some pop up shops. Then there is a 19thC citadel built by the famous Hapsburg's to better control the city. The Liberty monument, from 1947, originally paid homage to the Soviet soldiers who liberated the city from the Nazis. She/Liberty rises majestically over the Danube, holding a palm leaf, I believe. Two other figures are below her but don't remember who they are.
Beautiful view.. Perfect place to see the panorama of the Budapest. Worth visitng after sunrise. Great place for taking photos :)

Well worth the hike to the top.. We walked up from the Gellert tram stop. It's easy to follow the several zig zag paths to the top, which took us around 15 to 20 minutes, and it's not really that hard of a walk.Once at the top the views are spectacular, and the statues are very communist era !!Not much else to say, except pick a clear day and just do it. It's a must !!
Statue of Liberty and Gellert Hill. A lovely walk up through the park with amazing views of the river Danube, bridges and across to Pest.

Worth the climb!. After a bottle of sparkling wine on the last day of our trip, we decided that despite the 25 degree heat, we'd climb the 'mountain' we'd been looking at for the previous few days! At the top there's an ice cream/drinks cart, or around the corner of the Citadel there are a few food and souvenir stalls. Definitely worth the effort to get to the top!
A MUST. The view you see on a clear day is worth a visit and even without entering the Citandella its goods including for photo lovers .Go in a briet day

One of the best places in Budapest. Very nice little walk up the hill, in april everything is flowering around you. Superb views on the city.. It was fun to enjoy the great wheather "climbing" up the hill, very nice walk, suitable to do with kids, but not with strollers. Beautiful scenery, nice views.
Great exercise and great views. It is a long walk up the hill but worth it for the views and to get some great exercise. Remember to bring some water.

Good things come to those who walk. Yeah, it was a long walk uphill. I personally enjoyed it, there seems to be a lot of different routes up and exploring them was great fun! If you're not interested in walking, I guess you can get up there with a bus. The view over Danube and the Pest side of city is breathtaking.If you have visited there only during daytime, I recommend coming back after the dark. It's not as easy to find there as I felt there wasn't enough lights covering the road, but after some adventuring in the dark, seeing all the city lights from the top.. truly amazing.During my two week stay in Budapest, I had to climb up there 4 times. The view is something that makes you want to come back again and again.
Top point. Top point for view must go by car or bus ... Walking is difficult... View is good , nothing near there , nice weather , clean air . Both sides of the hill has different views must see both
A real nice hike if your healthy!. Nice views and pleasant scenery will reward the effort needed to tackle this wonderful park in memory of the first martyr of Christianity.
Great views towards the river. Highly recommended photographers who want to shoot the bridges and the river at night.And of course romantic couples...

Perfect view for perfect pictures. It's true that we had to climb the hill to get there, but we had fun while doing it and the view was amazing! I totally recommend it! It's probably the most beautiful view in Budapest.

Lovely early morning walk.. Very quite peaceful walk up this steep hill taking in the views. It was quite overcast when we went, but brightened up later. The statue once at the top is nice, but the views are better walking up and down the hill. The views on a clear day would be amazing. It's a free walk and a lovely way to explore some of Budapest on foot.

Amazin view over the city. Gellert hill is a great photo opertunity, if you get one of the bus tour tickets it will take you up here on rout. Jump of and walk to the top, you will get the most beautiful view over the city, (one of my favorit city's for a weekend break)
Nice view. Nice place but not worth the long way if u can't take it. Nice view , you can enjoy it , but it is not a must

Beautiful walk. We had a lovely morning walking up this quite steep hill. The views grow increasingly beautiful as you climb. There was no litter anywhere and we were lucky enough to spot a gorgeous red squirrel. The statues at the top are impressive and the little shops selling souvenirs were nice with pleasant vendors who did not make a nuisance of themselves but were friendly without pushing their wears on you. Recommend for some stunning photos over the city,

Worth the visit - twice. Worth a visit twice - many people do it during the day but I have to say, the best time to go is at night. Take a great night camera with you. The view is amazing. Warning though, it *is* a hike to get there. Taxi is a great option.

Best view of Budapest 😎. Definitely worth a visit. The statue itself is not so interesting but the view is breathtaking. If you have time you should definitely climb by foot, it takes 20 minutes from the Elisabeth bridge to the top. You can get there from the Gellert hotel as well. It is really nice and relaxing walk in the green hills of Buda ☺️

Fun climb and stunning views. The hill is quite steep at points but has some really nice views of the city. Definitely worth going. The fortress is nice to see but not really special. Beware though that there was a group of older men trying to trick people into playing an illegal shell game.
Gellert Hill and Stature. This was a great walk and worth every step of it. There are many statues along the way and the Homes along the walk are an interesting mix of modern and historical.

Great Views & Good Trek Up!. Few vantage points to look at the City from a top angle.. We tried to see the sunset from there; but it was a cloudy day and we could not see it as well. But with whatever we saw; the sunset was still pretty! Worth visiting just to take breath taking panoramic photos.

It is definitely worth the walk up.. Good trip to take. Plenty of good views from the top, and surprisingly, given the location and the numbers of tourists, Try to catch the sunset. It was really romantic. It is definitely worth the walk up.
Be here at night. yes, you have to watch the city lights from here at night. it is breathtaking. you can spend hours just enjoying the view

Scam everywhere. You will find some locals try to cheap tourists. Ranging from taxi driver, restaurant operator, money changer to sellers on the streets.Some will even get you into playing some simple games at tourist spots & asked for payment after that.This place is not very much different from Prague where you don't find many honest people. These cities have no match to Munich when come to security.

Be certain to go back at night. The night time view from this vantage point is spectacular. I highly recommend this stop on any tour. The buses can't go up all of the way, but take your time, there are rest places along the way. The view is breathtaking.
View from the Citadel. A great view from of Budapest from this vantage point. Some nice art work and chocolates to be found by vendors.
Breathtaking Views. If you want to get the best views of the city you must go to Gellert hill and the Citadel to look at the entire city from the best viewpoint possible.

Fun and energetic walk to the top of this park with amazing views. There are a couple of ways Tao get up this steep stairway path. It's worth it because there are beautiful views of the Danube as well as of the city. Greta place to people watch.
Great views . Great views over Danube river to Pest, especially at night! Steep hill, but worth of walking. Watch your steps, it's quite dark on paths.

Great afternoon walk. Took a stroll up the hill while the kids were at the Gellert Spa. It's a nice workout, with stairs at various points but also sloped paths if you want a longer route. Lots of switchbacks to get to the top. The statue itself is so-so, but most likely you're not going there because your a fan of Soviet-style ornamentation...it's the view that you'll want to check out.

Magnificent historic site that watches over the city. This was yet another site in Budapest that was worth the visit and that also captured your eye whenever you looked in its direction from the river banks of the Danube. Worth a visit

Great view of city - interesting history. Well worth the hike up to see the monument and the view of the city. Depending on how busy it is will depend if you will be able to get a solid photo of the monument if trying to capture the whole thing. This would be a great place to be at sunrise or sunset. One can access the monument simply by walking - no fee to simply see the monument.I was told the lady monument used to hold a helicopter blade instead of a palm leaf. The helicopter blade represented economy and resiliency. Once the city was under different rule, the helicopter blade was replaced with a palm leaf to represent peace and prosperity (not sure how true all of that is).

Hungary's statue of liberty.... ... is not only impressive, but also beautifully located. We stopped there as part of the hop-on hop-off bus tour, so we didn't have to deal with the "climb" to the top of the hill. It's part of the citadel and was built by the Soviets, which, if you've been in Moscow, is pretty easy to detect. There's a definite soviet feel to the things. There's no admission, it's located in a beautiful park and it offers the best opportunities to take panoramic pictures of Budapest. If you're visiting the city, definitely stop by!
Great view over Pest. This hill besides having some great properties obviously belonging to some very rich people has also a great view over most of Budapest and especially the river Duna.

Great view all over the city. Looooong walk up. After a very long way up . we saw an amazing panoramic view from the hill . there are no signs that says where to go (when you go up or go down) . but after a while we found the way .

A steep climb, but worth it.. Visible from every part of the river front, this is a must for visitors to the city. The climb is hard up the flights of stairs, but much easier by walking through the pleasant parkland.Not only are the views from here incredible, but the monument shows the spirit of this city and country to an amazing degree.The monument was originally raised by the Russians following WWI, and originally carried a statues of a Russian soldier at the base (now in Memento Park). After liberation from USSR, it was rededicated to Hungary and the Hungarian people.

Past glory. The hill itself gives a panoramic view of Budapest, it is worthwhile to visit only for this. If you manage to vaoid the tourist season you may enjoy it too. The statue was made by Kisfaludy Strobl Zsigmond. Originally created in the memory of governor Horthy's son, killed by the Nazis, it was expropriated by the communists to serve as a statue of freedom. A Soviet soldier's statue stood at the foot of the lady. Removed during the popular uprising in 1956, it was put in place for another three decades until the late 1980s. The hill wasd called after a Roman catholic bishop of Italian origin who tried to persuade the pagan Hungarians about the advantages of Christendom. Unconvinced, the barbarians rolled down the bishop in a barrel (packed with nails) from the hill. The Austrians, who stayed in Hungary for a couple of centuries, built a rather ugly fortress called Citadella on the hill. Here you may find a restaurant, and on Aug 20, every year you may enjoy fireworks from the Gellert Hill, but stay on the Pest side in this case.

Amazing view. The walk is long, but you get an amazing view of Buda and Pest.
Take a beer or wine with you and enjoy the view with friends on top of Gellert Hill.
The view . We went up on a chilly dull day and it's a steep walk up . But once there the view made it worthwhile . Not that much else to do .

Worth the walk. It's a fair walk up to the top of the hill but it's very much worth it for the spectacular views from the top and a pleasant walk down through some woods. I would recommend that you bring plenty of water with you though if it's a hot day.
Visit the church in rocks. Walk down in the road and stairs, you explore all the beautiful view and the charm of the peacful place.
Do not forget for this!. This place offers a great view of the city. Go from Chain Bridge up to the hill and enjoy exclusive views of Buda and Pest at once.
view of the city is wonderful. whether we are lucky and the day was not much cold, so we could fully enjoy the walks, this place is very nice, view of the city is wonderful

spectacular in the evening. We were with a group and were bussed to the area. We then proceeded to walk up to the top where the statue is. It is not a difficult walk...just take your time and enjoy it. This is a popular thing to do, so you will have a lot of company and it is very safe.The view is so spectacular, you will want to spend much time taking it all in. On the way up or down take a look at the huge pictures and descriptions on the wall...lots of historical information.

Bird's Eye View of Budapest !. The view is well worth the climb (140mtrs high) which is perfectly fine for those who are used to a regular jaunt, but even if only used to 2-3klm walks, still go and ensure you take your time and plenty advantage of the many opportunities to sit on the way up. We had a 9 yr old and as usal, no problem for him. Went in April, however, would be much hotter in Summer so take account of that and ensure you take liquids (and something sweet for youngsters) as nothing until you reach the top (there is no cafe up there either).Stunning on way up and beautiful at the top - suggest leaving until towards the end of your stay so you can get a perspective of all the places you visited .... excellent hike for clearing the conscience for the hearty evening meal and drink(s) !

Hungarian Statue of Libery. Gellert Hegy (the Statue of Liberty) is one of the symbol of Budapest. Reachable after a 20 min walking, is located close to Citadel. it is recommended to take wonderful pictures as the view from there is absolutely amazing!
Statue of Liberty - Hungarian style. You can see this statue from just about anywhere in Budapest. It is best to see it up close. The views of the City from Gellert Hill are breathtaking!

Magnificent views. Super views to the other side of the river, we walked up and around and had a glorious time. The statue itself is quite eerie and oddly moving, definitely worth going if you have the time.

Take a taxi up for an amazing nighttime panorama. This is a good sight saved for an evening after dinner, when you can enjoy the amazing view without feeling you're "taking time away" from other sights/activities you might be seeing or doing otherwise. (There are also lots of beautiful views of the city from the castle hill, with much more to do besides, whereas at the Citadel, it's mostly the view.)The monument was originally built to commemorate the liberation of the city by the Soviets, and there used to be statues of Red Army soldiers at the base. After 1989, the Hungarians were happy to get rid of Soviet remnants, but no one was ready to give up the statue here. The soldiers were removed and the inscription was changed, so now the statue stands more generally as a monument to liberty. Fun fact: It's said that children, when asked what the "lady on the hill" is holding in her arms (it's a palm leaf), often respond that she is holding a "kifli" -- a traditional Hungarian crescent-shaped roll that the little ones are very familiar with. :)It's possible to walk up to the citadel from the Buda side of the Szabadsag hid (Liberty Bridge) -- in fact, there are many paths to it -- but those who are older or out of shape (guilty on both counts!) may find it a serious challenge. If you're young and/or fit, go for it! Others may find it easier to get there by public transport (doable, but not so obvious to figure out) or by taxi (easiest, and probably most appealing if you decide to do this for a nighttime view after a good Hungarian dinner!

Best View of Pest!. Tough climb, but clearly the best views of Budapest. There is a way to get there by car/taxi if you are not up to climbing the stairs and pathways. Fantastic view of Pest from the top and many places along the way up. If you are going, this should be early in your day on your feet. It was my last stop and the hike was a bit much.

more excellent views. As with my review of Castle Hill walked over the Elizabeth Bridge and then up the hill on the zig zag paths and steps to the top for some brilliant views, the monument is again impressive, couldn't see any way to get into the citadel itself though part is now a restaurant that wasn't open on our visit. few kiosks for souvenirs and refreshments at slightly inflated prices due to the out of the way location. Good to visit though not a wet weather venue. There were a lot who arrived by coach but the walk was quite pleasant.

extensive views. Extensive views over the city and the Danube, a must for a selfie or two and easily accessible on the hopper buses or a really good leg stretcher for those who feel the need to walk off last nights goulash. There are a couple of small cafes with terraces serving Hungarian platters and stews we ate at Palinka Terasz and had simple salad with dips and bread, and of course a beer, at a fair price. there are some souvenir stalls and well cleaned toilets.Worth a visit if just for the photo opprtunity.

The best view of the river and the city!. It's worth visiting. Amazing view of the city. You can go there on foot (about 15 minutes from the Liberty bridge) or by car. It's a bit tiring if you choose foot but the view makes you forget every tiredness!
Worth the walk up the hill to explore. Great views and if you walk up the hill from the base of the bridge you get in a nice little hill climb and there are other interesting spots along the way up.

A hill fills with histories. We took the hop-on hop-off bus there to explore; the top of the hill was a Citadel and with few monuments, one is the Liberty Monument. You can see it from the Danube. We had a wonderful walk there. We also enjoyed the panoramic view of the city on the Pest side and the Liberty Bridge and the Elisabeth Bridge. The St. Gellert (Gerard) monument is another historic statue that can be seen from the foothill. The legend said the bishop St.Gellert was killed by a spiked barrel in 1046. The monument marks the spots where his brutal death occurred. On the way to the top of the Citadel are many vendors selling souvenirs.Happy Travelling!
Enjoy the view and the walk down . Beautiful view of the city! We took a taxi up, nice ride. Enjoyed the stunning view and walked down in 10-15 minutes. Beautiful and worth a visit!

A tiring climb up for a good view over Budapest.. Climbed up endless paths and steps before finally arriving at the top to see a statue and admire the views over Budapest, the Citadel is next door but you cannot get access to it and just view it from the outside.There is the usual collection of stalls selling tourist souvenirs and a couple of places selling snacks and drinks and that is it.If you do not fancy an energetic climb the busses do come up the road and stop at the top as do the sightseeing coaches but it is not a trip to a sight worth paying for unless it is included on your city transport ticket.

Great views at night. We walked up the hill at dusk from the tram stop (tram 19) next to Szabadsag Bridge but I am pretty sure you could walk up from any direction. There were beautiful views at the top - well worth the climb.

Saw from afar. We could see this from our hotel, Pest side. Beautiful at night.
Access thru the "green" bridge. High on hill. Did not have time
to go up and see it, but could see figures of people enjoying the view from above.

My favourite spot in Budapest. The view from here is amazing! You can see the Danube, most of the bridges, the Margit spigot, Buda castle etc.
Plus your cardio for the day is done. :)
The climb is about 15 mins for sporty people and 25 for not so sporty ones..
Amazing views!!!!. If you have extra time in Budapest, the climb to the top is great exercise and you are rewarded by the fantastic views. Fun slide for older kids on the hill half way up.

The View. Sit and gather yourself after the leisurely climb uphill. The view is incredible. Its the picture perfect place to record your time here. The Citadel is directly behind it and the hill leading back down will bring you towards the Chain Bridge.
Amazing views - MUST DO in Budapest. Although the hill is quite a trek, the views from the top are definitely worth it. The statue is an interesting reminder of Hungary's history.

Only if you stay several days in Budapest. You need to be healthy to climb up there. That's true that you have a nice view on the city but you have a nice view at other sites. It was interesting to see Some status from the Russian dominantion. It takes Some time for Some statues which l recommand but only on the third day.

Worth the Hike!. This was my sixth visit to Budapest, but my first time up to the top of Gellert Hill. My husband (50s) and I (40s) decided to hike up the hill from the Gellert hotel rather than take the bus.While we had to stop a few time to catch our breath (clearly not as in as good shape as we thought we were LOL), it was totally wonderful to enjoy the scenery and view as we worked our way up on the lovely Easter Sunday morning.I definitely recommend doing this - and there is refreshment stand once you get to the top in case you need water or a beer perhaps to celebrate.This costs absolutely nothing and you will have wonderful photos and memories!
A fair walk but worth it. We did this on a sunny morning and when we got to the top (its a fair walk up hill), it was well worth it. Probably the best view of Budapest.
The views . The views are amazing you see the whole of pest and the river the statue is good also. This is not your normal walk its steep and loads of steps but well worth it
Great Views and Snacks. Take the 'Hop On Bus' up and enjoy the views with mulled wine and Hungarian food. Lots of snack shops and history.

Highest Point in Budapest. Try to reach the Hill as early as possible to enjoy the fresh air. Do note that there are multiple trails to reach the statue. It was peaceful while trekking up the hill. The place will be one of the best spot to capture the entire view of Budapest.

Best view budapest. There are two way to go gellert hill. First; get tram no2 and than bus no 27. Second way which I tried climb the steps. Not so easy but worth it. The view of almost all the town is under your foot.

A great view as well. It is quite a steep walk up to the top so you need to be reasonable fit.... I wouldn't try pushing a pram up to the top. Again, this is a statue with an interesting history. Glad I made the effort as the views from the top looking out over the river are very good.
Excellent views. A bit of a hike, but well worth it for the fantastic views from the top. Would be perfect for a dry day, afternoon activity.

A nice walk to the top.. We chose a sunny day to walk up to the top, the gardens around it are really peaceful and protect you from the wind! Because once where the monument it can get very windy so be careful if you are wearing a hat. It can get very crowded so watch for your bags and stuff. Amazing views of the city from there.
Nice view over the city. Very nice view! Good way to start your trip. Just prepare for a walk and a big climb. But in the end it's definitely worth it!

Worth climbing up the hill. This place is made for hundreds of photos. You can take the best shots of the whole city, there are always people around and little shops selling food, hungarian products etc. Take a deep breath, take all your courage and start climbing...the views will simply pay you back to the maximum!It is cold up there though, so be prepared!The wood as you climb up the hill is simply outstanding!
Crazy hike. I recommend starting at the base (by the hidden cave church) and walking up to the Citadel and statue. What a great hike, with amazing views along the way.

came across the statue during a walk. I went there with my girlfriend. Not especially for the statue but during a little walk around the city. Close to a little park on the hillside you have a good view over the city. Nice, but not special.

What a view!. We took the hop on bus up to the hill which has spectacular panoramic views across Budapest. The statues are pleasing and there are lots of photo opportunities. We walked down the wooded hill, carpeted with wild flowers back to the riverside. While the paths may not be in the best repair this is a lovely walk taking you past various viewing points and statuary.
View fro the hill. Amazing area ! Note that Buda is the most interesting part of the town . The Statue of Liberty can be seen from the biggest part of the river shores ! You can take pictures !

Well worth a visit!. Love stunning vistas and picture perfect scenes. Gellert hill is where it is at. No doubt most of you planning your trip will visit the gellert baths or the rudas baths. Well this is located between the 2. Walk it in the early morning, relax in a thermal spa in the afternoon. its a win win! Metro M4 is what you need! The walk takes no more than 20 minutes to the top and You would only have to put aside an hour of your day! Enjoy!

Good view. Good hike to top of the town. Depending on which routing you take, it could either be pleasant staircases up the hill or very steep upward slope. The walk is 15mins only from the bridge to the top.Very crowded site but it has a good view of the city but personally, will prefer the sight from Buda castleThere are many scammers at the top playing those 3 boxes guess games. Be careful and you can never win.

Stunning. Offers a stunning bird's eye view of Buda and Pest. Loved the climb from Gellert hotel up to the Citadel, especially on a sunny weather. Not to be missed for travellers looking for the perfect place to view Budapest from the top. Skip if you are scared of heights though.
Amazing view!. Long way up but its worth it. With impressive statue on the top you will be able to enjoy a awesome panorama of Budapest.

Fabulous Views of the City. We climbed Gellert Hill in time to see the sunset, and see Budapest transform itself to one of the most magical cities in Europe. The view is simply breathtaking, and the city is a sight to behold at night once the lights come on.

The view is worth the ascent!. Going up Gellert Hill was one of our last activities in Budapest and the view was worth it! Is the view better than the one from Fisherman's Bastion? I would not compare it. It's a bit of a different view and very beautiful, too. I would go up there again!

Excellent VIew.. It is dedicated to a Venetian missionary who introduced Christianity to Hungary. The area is a nice place to have a photoshoot with excellent views along the Danube. It is close to the Gellert Ter metro station.
Great view of the city. Highly recommended for a beautiful view of the city. You do not need much time since there is only a statue to see but still well worth a visit.

Nice overview over the city. Like indicated in the title, from here you can get a pretty nice and clear overview of the city (depending on the weather obviously). Highly advised for panorama photography.
A Must Stop. If you want a commanding view of Budapest, there are really only two places, Castle Hill or Gellert Hill. I recommend both!
What a view and enjoyable walk down afterward.. We took the bus up to the top for the views of the Danube River and Budapest looking east. Then there are pathways down to the river.

The most romantic view in Budapest.. We (a couple) believe that Gellert Hill opens the best view to Budapest in contrast to many other hills in the city. The main reason of it is that it captures most of the iconic sights of Budapest like Buda Castle, Chain Bridge, Liberty Bridge and even partially Parliament and Basilica. You will see only half of these sights if you are standing on the Buda Hill. Also, this place is usually quite peaceful in contrast to Buda Hill.When you are on the Gellert Hill, there are also other things to do besides having a good time observing the city. For instance, you might visit Citadel and its military museum.The only negative part of this place is that it is quite challenging to reach its top. If you will try to walk to it from the bank of Danube, you might get exhausted. However, the walking way is much prettier than the one that tourist buses and taxis use, so little tiredness will be compensated by benches with the most romantic view to the city. We (a couple) recommend you to put Gellert Hill in the priority list of things to do when you are in Budapest.

Your best view point. Freedom StatueIf you have the time I would recommend that you walk up to the Freedom statute. Howeever, be careful because there are lot of footpaths that lead you to the statue or away from it. There are plenty of view points along the way where you can take some really great pictures of the river and the city below. There are some great lawn and pictnic paces at the statute and you should hang around if possible. The actually statute is quite ordinary and rather disappointing but the place is definitely a vantage view point.
Top view of Budapest. From here you're able to look over the city from old castle view. Panorama sights are the best. Easy to get there either by walking or with sighteeing buses.

Nice place to have a great view and chill out. I guess this place is the best to get a good picture of Budapest...;)Great Statues, so you can have some nice selfies as well...;)I personally recommend to take a walk trip from the Freedom Bridge( the green one;) and just walk up to the mountain. If you would get tired, there are some benches on the way so you can have some rest also.
Amazing view. If you want to enjoy the magnificient view of Budapest, then come here!You can get a city view from a very steep angle! :-)The Statue is also fine. A must!
Intersting history. Close to a park so there are some other options to pad out your visit. Very busy with traffic all around. Felt a little left out in the open.
Monument. The Citadel is at the top off Gellert hill you can reach it by taking the Hop on off bus, the views over Buda and Pest side are excellent from there

Impressive view on Budapest. We went there with a Hop-on-Hop-off bus which was a good investment (20€/pp/48hours) to view Budapest in a 2,5 day visit. It takes you at least 7 minutes to walk/run around the citadel (and view this statue) so your run and take the same bus back down or you stay (and walk) and take the next bus down. The bus drivers aren't that friendly so you better be on time ...

Worth the Walk to the Top. I recommend stopping first at the Saint Gellért statue before walking up to the Citadella and taking the path down the backside of the hill. The Liberty Statue was built in 1947 to honor the "Soviet liberation" of Hungary during World War II. Nevertheless, the woman raising a palm leaf above her head is incredible to see from many places in the city. The hill offers some amazing views of the Danube, Buda and Pest.

Wonderful views of the city. Well worth the climb up the hill ( watch out for the man out the top playing the ball under the cup trick- saw him winning a lot of money off folk!!!). Super views from the top and well worth going up the steps and paths rather than following the road

well worth the trek.. GELLERT HILL & THE LIBERTY STATUE can be viewed from most points of the city and is a nice tourist attraction. Aiming from the Gellert Hotel the walk up is not for the faint hearted and the rewards are superb with some of the best views of the city and River Danube .We were here in March and the weather was fantastic so we had unbroken views of the city and beyond and took some fabulous photos. We only stayed for about half an hour or so then we moved on, the walk down is a lot easier on the leg's.A great tourist attraction and well worth checking out. Don't forget to take your camera.

Beautiful views and great walk. Take your time to walk up the hill and enjoy the view. It's worth your while! Explore the cathedral at the foot of Gellert hill and amble up the park, stopping occasionally to admire the changing view of Pest, Liberty bridge, the Danube and eventually Buda castle too!

Beautiful up close and far away. Gallert Hill is a beautiful walk, as long as you realize you are going to go up up up! But the view is well worth the walk. You can also take a cab or bus ride if you are less adventurous. Some of the best views of the city are from here and at night, it becomes one of the best view from the city. Highly recommend both for the scenery and the history!

Quick trip to Gallert Hill. We took a quick trip to the top of Gallert Hill, to take in the view of the surrounding Budapest and of course the River Danube. Also guide explained the significance of their own version of the Statue of Liberty - a legacy of the Soviet Era . The weather was great for this time of year. Clear sunny a bit windy . Nevertheless a good place to absorb the landscape of Budapest
Gellert hill. Quite a trek,but worth it, beautiful views, near the famous gellert hotel. Not for unfit people, dark at night so make sure you go in daylight.

Stunning sunset views. A friend recommended that we watch the sunset from Gellert hill and boy am I glad we did. We went up along the road next to the Gellert baths and ended up taking a very non direct and steep way up there so I would recommend making your way up from one of the sets of steps along the main road running next to the river. You can see out across the whole city and watching the sun set and the city light up was just magical.
Nice view at the top. Perfect Place for a drink and a view. A lot of stairs, but worth it. Nice view of the city and the surroundings.

Can be seen from most of the city. Beautiful statue on top of Gellert hill well worth the climb ( you can see other monuments and cave church in same area ) . Interestingly the statue was built as something else , covered up and then reclaimed as part of the new Buda heritage
Lovely sightseeing and landskapes. Just nice one to walk to see as it you can enjoy the great view along the way, although little bit rough to walk up if not in decent shape :)

Great hike.. This is one of the best easy hikes I've ever taken. I enjoyed great views along the way. The statue is very impressive at a close up. There was also a statue of the Russian soldier next to it at the base which was removed after the fall of communism. I suggest to veer right when hiking up the hill from Elizabeth bridge, this way you can approach the complex from the back, see the Citadel and vista points of Buda.

Interesting statute that looks like a can opener. Bust viewed from afar, not necessary to go to visit unless you have 1 week in Buda. Erected after the soviet invasion but not realized until the soviets left in 1990.

The most amazing views!!. The Citadel and the Statues are incredible at the top, but every few feet on the walk up the view makes it worth your while. Many different paths meander their way up and you really MUST get a pretzel and some mulled wine from the vendor opposite the Gellert Spa! Nom Nom!
Great view. A long trip up, but worth it! The view is amazing, and we brought a couple of beers to drink after we climbed the hill, which were well deserved in that hot summer!

The best view at night (ever). During the day this place may be busy, with some cheap (yet expensive) attractions, but at night time this is the best view of the city (if not the world). Do not leave Budapest without seeing (and breathing) it from here at night.
STUNNING view. Absolutely breathtaking. So much so, I sat there for an hour just to enjoy it. I did it at night and by day. Better view than Castle Hill!

Fitness walk up here, then superb views. Ok, wear good trainers of comfortable walking shoes and enjoy the challenging for some walk up here! Once you're at the top, you'll be glad you came, so enjoy the magnificent views all round and take your camera
The place for a perfect view over Pest. We climbed the hill from the Freedom bridge side. The views over Pest where breathtaking. Of course we also vistited the church and the memorial location.

Nice vies of Budapest. Incredible church in a cave at the bottom of this hill. There is also the Gellert baths at the bottom too on the opposite side of the street. Nice walk up the hill with a few stairs.

Worth the very long climb. Amazing views!!!
It's worth the climb although not for the less able.
If you do make it you have Panoramic views of the city

Worth the climb for the views. We like to walk when we are on holiday and the climb to the top here is worth it for the views and there are things to see on the way up. The citadel was closed when we were there, but that did not detract from the experience.

Panoramic views!!. once me and my friend have climbed up the hill and reached the top where there is the Citadel and most of all the statue of liberty, we were astonished with the panoramic views of Budapest. In fact from here, one can practically see the entire city of Budapest. furthermore, the statue is really amazing and it dominates not only the hill but even the city itself.
The place for the best sceen of Budapest. Come here to enjoy an undisturbed panoramic view of the capital. Try your knowledge in spotting the various attractions over the city.

Don't be lazy and climb up there!. Despite the weather conditions (snow and ice) we were eager to climb here. I think people should experience the walk as its a nice view from every part as you walk up. Obviously the top has the best view, you will be amazed.
Beautiful views!. Beautiful views over Budapest and oll other directions. Historical interesting. I'm not into communist monuments though.

Quite a hike to the top, excellent view. There were a bunch of little seating areas and offshoots on the way to the top if you need a break. Even though the weather was terrible on the day we visited, I liked getting pictures that were a little foggy and rainy. Different than everyone else's sunny ones!
Must climb. It is an easy climb to the top of the hill, and the views from up there are completely worthy. Recommend going up when the city is lit up.
Amazing view of the city. Well worth the steep walk up the hill to the top. There is an amazing view from the top and plenty of photo opps!

Great viewpoint, for moderately fit. We had a view of this from many parts of the city, so decided to walk up to it. Approaching the hill, we lose sight of the statue, and walk through a wooded pathway. As That got steeper, my wife decided to wait on a seat while I went on. Fairly busy with tourists taking photos of the statue and the whole city.

easy climb (or bus ride) for a superb view. There are several ways to climb up to Gellert Hill, for example from Elisabeth bridge, by the artificial waterfall, passing by the statue of Gellert or from Gellert square, after visiting the church inside the rock (which is interesting because if its location, but nothing special), or by bus 27 from Moricz Zsigmond square. Head to the Citadell (closed now) or the viewing terrace facing Buda castle. There is a path which leading you along the hillside from the waterfall to Gellert square, the view is also nice from there.

Best views of the city. This has to be the best place to enjoy views of the city.. Don't be put off by other reviewers, it's an easy uphill walk. (Took under 15 mins from independence bridge, including photo stops. Maybe longer from Elizabeth bridge - I came down that way and thought it seemed longer). Citadella was closed, statue takes a moment to look at, but it was totally worthwhile - nice walk and stunning views.
Gellert Hill. Beautiful wiew to Budapest, good restaurant, and if the sun is shining and it's spring, summer or autumn you will feel very well there.

A nice view of the city.. Budapest have many nice sights which get`s you a little up over the city and offers a nice view. This is one of the better. I prefer to walk up, but it`s also possible to take a taxi or even a bus, I also think some of the tour busses goes here. The area is nice and offers several nice statues and an excellent view. Go here during the day if the statues etc is your think, or by the evening if the view over the city is your main goal.
Worth the walk. Nice atmosphere and a splendid view from the top with a great panoramaview on the cityhighlights, the river and the bridges

Great views across Buda and Pest. It is quite a hike to walk up Gellert Hill, unless you are really fit. We took a taxi from just across the Elizabeth Bridge for 2,000 Huf, however, we did walk back down (easier walking down than up). The views are spectacular across both side of The Danube and of the bridges across the Danube. Well worth the effort. The monument is also well worth a look.
Best place to see Budapest from.. It is a must in your Budapest tour. The views are amazing both in day linght and in the night. Highly recomended to go there.

Excellent Panoramic Views. Gellert Hill sits on the Buda side of Budapest across from the Central Market Hall and right next to the famous Gellert Hotel and baths. It's easy to find and is easily accessible by public transportation or on foot.The Buda side of Budapest is filled with hills to see great panoramic views of Budapest, and Gellert Hill is a prime example of this. You can take a tour bus up to the top, or you can walk up the hill several different ways. I strongly recommend walking if you can because the nature aspect of the hill is quite beautiful, and there are many little places to stop and get views of the city you aren't going to get otherwise.When you get to the top, you can check out the incredible statue and see the huge Citadel building. You can also take in incredible views of Budapest, the Danube and Hungary that you aren't going to get many other places in the city.Take special care to pay attention to the way you go back down the hill. We went down a different way than we came up and ended up wondering through a neighborhood where the Saudi embassy was, but then got kind of lost and walked through a park with some questionable people in it. We were glad it wasn't dark, but just pay close attention to this as you make your way back down from the incredible top.

Steep ? How Soft are you Lot ??. We walked from Buda Castle down then 'Due Up' to the top of Gellert Hill and we are high end 50's + !! The walk is a doddle and the payoff is the fantastic view back over the City from this viewpoint ! Saw it from afar under lights at night but you must visit during daylight ! Plus the walk back down past St.Gellerts's statue and across Liberty Hid is well worth it !
Beautiful Views. This place has a wonderful view of the city. So beautiful and peaceful. A definite must to visit and take pictures. Beautiful and tranquil.
View from the top of Budapest. Very easily accessed by private or public transport. It gives nice picture of the whole city and it is a nice location to spent few hours

Panoramic views over one of the most romantic cities in Europe... For those of you who enjoy a bracing walk through woodland with some of the most stunning views..this could be for you...There are brightly painted red benches to take a rest and view the panorama of the river,the city and the bridges...The Citadella was built in 1851 after the Hungarian Revolution of 1848 . The Soviets occupied it during the Hungarian Revolution as a perfect vantage point to stem the uprising..The Liberty Statue at the very top was built by the occupying Soviets to commemorate their 'liberation' of the city but later commemorated all those who sacrificed their lives for independance and freedom from the same Russian regime.It is just one of the many locations that one will be reminded of the dreadful events...However people visit mostly for the exhilarating walk and the stunning views .The Gellert Hotel can be a perfect coffee stop with its Art Nouvea interiors..but there are many small coffee houses on the street level..The new Metro 4 will carry you beneath the river to the great Market Hall..
Amazing views. Well worth the effort of the climb. View over the city and River Danube are superb. A very steep climb!!

HAughty!. A haughty statue on the Gellert hill. There is a public bus going up there, You can go on foot but it is a little bit tiring. If you manage to go up there you will forget all your tiring when you see the stuning view.
What a View!. Well worth the walk up the hill. Try to choose a clear day as the views are exceptional. Lots of steps along the way, but take your time plenty of photo opportunities.

Great views and a gorgeous park. First things first - this must be a pretty steep climb up from the riverside and I am glad we wimped out by taking the No 27 bus up to the top (making the most of our Budacards!) but the walk back down was glorious. The views are amazing and ether are so many nooks and crannies to take pictures from. The citadel itself is a marvel of engineering and - like most places I. Budapest - the art work is stunning.
