We took a slow wander down the hill through the park to the Baths and thorough enjoyed ourselves doing it. Well worth a trip

Citadelle was not open for public. There is a 20 minutes uphill hike to the citadelle. When we were there, the citadelle (fort) couldn't be accessed by tourists which was a disappointment. The view from the hill is still stunning and the statue is impressive.

Nice Hike from Liberty Bridge. It's easy to reach the base of Gellert Hill from Liberty Bridge. Start from the Fővám tér (M4) and walk across the bridge, or theSzent Gellért tér (M4) metro right down the street. (Trams also stop at the Gellert metro.) The hike up the hill is strenuous but doable for average tourists. Not recommended for anyone with health problems or mobility issues. There are places you can stop for a quick break or to take pictures. From the statue you can walk around the side of it past the outer edges of the Citadel, and down the opposite side of the hill to the Saint Gellert monument, all the way to the bottom to catch a tram or bus to the Buda Castle area.

On the Mountaintop. We had a family member who lived in Budapest drive us to see this statue. At first we did not realize that you could see it close up as we always viewed it from the street level. The view from the statue was outstanding
Soviet "art". The monument is typical for the socialist realism trend. Rigid, bulky, cold. Still worth going to see it because from there you can admire a panoramic view of Budapest.
Great view. I like the contact with nature and nice views, walk around the hill gives you both. I would recommend especially on Sunday, warm days :)
Great. The most beautiful view of Budapest really worth to walk there... It's amazing at night, you see all city lights.. It needs 20 min walk from Green bridge to go there
Liberty liberty..where are you. Our guide explained a lot about Hungary. Changing the system, the current political situation. I dont want to underrate this (worth to go)...but where are you liberty?

Best view in the world. Though quite a hike the view from the top is absolutely worth it!!! From the top you have a 360 view of budapest where you can take great pictures to show off where youve been! this is a must do while you're here
Amazing view. Friends told us to go and visit but when we arrived it was late in the afternoon so dark and foggy was not the best view but the drive was fun.

Great place to view the City. Had a bright, warm day for this which helped. It does get very busy but there's a big park and lots of space to chill if you want to. We went by public transport - in fact we used a four day Budapest card, which was excellent value for money, enabling us to travel by bus, tram and subway. All efficient and clean. Also includes free entrance to several museums/attractions, one of the best City cards we have had. Views of the city are great from the top of the hill and the statue itself is quite spectacular.

A Great View Presented To You. Gellert Hill is easy to hike as i take a slow walk up because i was so busy clicking here and there. I started by walking across the green Liberty Bridge in Pest and then walked up to this lovely hill. It has many lookup points that offer the visitors a panoramic view of the flat plains of Pest. Up there, the River Danube look so blue and gentle connected by many bridges linking Buda and Pest. When i was there, there are frosts leftover by the previous day 30 minutes light snow shower. It was very windy and cold up there but view made me forget about the chill. After reaching the summit, i can see some statutes and men betting on games. Then i walked downhill towards the White Elizabeth Bridge that brought me to Pest. I went to Gellert Hill twice because i stayed 8 nights in Budapest. So much idle time to kill!
Great view over the city. you will have to climb a bit but i say it is totally worth it. The view over the city is absolutely wonderful both during the day and in the evenings.

Worth the walk for the view . I had to pretend I wanted to take pictures at every opportunity as i didn't want my boyfriend thinking i was struggling up the hill. How did everyone else look so energetic?! It nearly killed me. Not sure I would like to do it in the heat, we had a perfect sunny,crisp,cold afternoon.Great views of the city so worth the walk. I couldnt face the walk up to Buda castle afterwards though but spotted the cable car...result!

Worth the hike. My husband and I climbed the hill to get to be top. It was great for us because we love hiking, but older ones would probably hate the climb. It looked like there were tour buses at the top and many people came up that way. However there are many pretty photo ops on the way up if you go up on the side by the Gellert Spa.

great view. firstly do not attempt this if you are not good with steps, that being said the view is well worth the effort, just gald we did not need refreshments as they were closed when we got to the top , i counted over 300 steps , without including the steep inclines in between , size of buildings very impressive

Amazing views!. I've visited Gellert Hill and Statue in late January and definitely recommend it in dry sunny days.The walk up to Citadella is quite steep but through the park there are places to have a rest in nature and enjoy with fresh environment.

walking uphill is great. Well, looking at the freedom-statue while you are somewhere in the city is great, walking up the hill, taking your time for having photo-stops is highly recommended but the area next to the sculpture is very touristy....in a nasty way....beware of pickpockets!

Best point of view. For me it was the best point of view in the whole city. Come in the afternoon in a weekday, not a lot of people at all. Good place to take pics and shooting videos using an aircraft.
terrific hike for a beautiful day. Lovely walk up the hill with beautiful views from the summit. Excellent activity for a nice day. Not too strenuous.

Great views. We walked up on the winding little steps behind the Gellert spa - quite a climb with some steps but fantastic views of the Danube and bridges as you go up and some interesting structures along the way, including the cave church. Came back down the other side and out of the ornate entrance - waterfall wasn't flowing but all very grand and impressive. All in all enjoyable walk with great views.

spectacular view. We started the climb from the Gellert Hotel so we had a very good view of the Danube and its bridges while hiking up (it's not really a hike, it's more like a stroll...).The monument itself isn't spectacular, you'll main goal will be the rewarding views on a clear day...

Fantastic views of Budapest. It's a slightly steep walk to the top- but definitely worth it on a sunny day! From the base of the statue are some of the best views of the city, especially of the Danube. The walk up to the Citadella/Statue is pretty steep, but it is through a park and there are lots of opportunities to stop and enjoy the plants/flowers. Definitely recommended!
Worth climbing. Excellent view over the city. The climbing to the hill top can be heavy especially on a hot summer day but still worth every sweat drop.

Cannot be missed. The great Statue of Liberty on top of the hill can be seen from many places in Budapest. The walk up the hill to this statue is worth your while because the massive statues are impressive. Besides there is a lovely view from up there, weather permitting. Recommended.
Long walk, but worth it. The views at the top are breathtaking so if you can do the walk, do it. Best way to see a panorama of the city,
Amazing view. The walk up there takes a while but it is definitely worth it! I don't know about the statue but the view from the hill is great. This is a must-do if you go to Budapest.
Stunning views. A definite place to go when visiting Budapest, the best views of the city, all of the tour bus go there...

Impressive statue, Best views, Very long way to walk.. Myself and my partner walked up to the Citadel on a not so glamorous day! It was miserable and it was an extremely challenging walk just after lunch (felt more like a hiker than a tourist). However, we did appreciate the view when we made it to the top.There are hop-on hop-off buses that go up there on a regular basis so do not panic. The statue itself is very impressive and is actually visable from the town at night as all is lit up (great picture oppurtunity.
Impressive views.. I bit of a hike for those who might not be used to exercise, but the views of the two sides of the Danube are well worth it.
Worth the Hike. It is a pretty good hike up the hill, but the views over the city are great and the monument itself is impressive.
A treat to behold. The statue and the views were well worth the 20 minute hike up from the foot of Elizabeth Bridge, a great trip.
What a view !. If one wants to see the city, this is the place. The view is spectacular and one has to get here to see it.

The best view in Budapest!?. Even with the bad camera in your mobile, you cannot fail. The scenario gives you the panorama over the Pest side from this hill on the Buda side. You can still see the bullet holes from earlier conflicts and you can see a wonderful and informative exhibition with photos on the north wall of the citadell. The visitors are a mix of people from all over the world. Just listen to the different languages!

Well worth a walk up!. The view is stunning. That needs to be put out there first. Better than the Bastion or Castle views. Despite having nothing really at the top other than the view, the walk up somehow adds to the satisfaction upon reaching the peak. Almost 360 degree views of the city, and with the walk uphill through woods, this can offer a lovely counterpoint to the urban environment and walking elsewhere in the city. For simply views, the best place in the city to go.

IN BUDAPEST? MUST GO PLACE.. It requires some walking uphill however considering the view you can see in this place, you should definitely go. The statue looks cool but most importantly, the city view with the fisherman bastion and buda castle and the bridge are simply fantastic. Great place to chill whoever you are going with!

Really Interesting Place to Be. We have tried a different way, so we took a public transportation bus and had a nice ride with many locals through narrow streets full of large interesting villas (a quarter I can imagine to live in). Than it took some walk and here we are in the middle of countless crowd. So many people were here. This place has some genius loci, that’s for sure. Take your time and read the big sign about history of this place, it is pretty interesting. The statue area must be crowded all day long I guess, but still it makes you to stay for some time. When it’s sunny, when it’s hot… you will like it. After all we have decided to descent down towards the castle hill and take a break in that adorable cake shop next to the church and that was great idea  I was surprised how many people were on top and during our way down just few were passing by. So take your time and walk up or down the slope, it is nice walk with some great views.

Stunning view. Amazing view on the Danube and Pest, definetly worth the effort of climbing up Gellert Hill!! You can climb it for free and in a few minutes you are on top of the hill, and then you can have an enjoyable walk down the hill!

Beutiful walk rewarded by Spectacular views. We took this walk to the Statue after brunch at the Gellert Hotel. We thought is would be a good idea to walk off our brunch. Wow, its a steep hill, criss crossed by paths. We went up in the snow which made it quite treacherous, but beautiful. There were fine views over the Danube from various view points on the way up and down, but most paths were unsalted and so tricky in places to negotiate.

Worth the climb!. A couple of friends and I visited Budpaest and our last day we decided to climb Gellert Hill. You have got to be prepared to walk up steep hills and steps, especially in the winter months as it got quite icy and slippery (especially on the way down). Breathtaking view points on the way up, and plenty of benches for a break! Beautiful when the weather is clear, not sure if it'd be the same if it was foggy. A must do if you have the energy for it!!
Huge hill - no signposts. And not that exciting when you get to the top. Don't go on a foggy day as we couldn't see the statue.
Beautiful view! . It was a very pleasant walk uphill and the views of both sides of the city were stunning - not to miss!

Stunning views . We decided early on that we were going to climb this hill. You can get on any of a number of the hop on hop off services that run through the city if you're feeling less adventurous. We climbed it in the evening and the path way was well lit for about 75% of the climb the final 25% wasn't lit but you could still see you're way fine. My only warning is that the paths are not gritted and we went when it was well below freezing so you have to be careful in places. The view from the top did not disappoint. We went at night as we thought the city would look more beautiful all lit up. My pictures don't really do it justice. In terms of what there is to do on the hill, pretty much admire the view there is nothing else up there but don't let that put you off!

Great Panorama of the city.. Gellért Hill is around 200 meters hihg and it overlooks the Danube river in Budapest. It offers one of the best panoramic views of Budapest. Besides the vista, there are many other attractions to see. Great for excursions in the city. Enjoyed. '10
Steep. Quite a climb and nothing to gain at the top on arrival. Yes there are views but as good better at the castle. Bit of a let down.
High spot.. Quite good panorama. Nothing special, but probably the highest stop that you can climb in Budapest. So, yeah, it wont take much time, so visit it.
Gellert Hill. an amazing view and defiantly worth the trip to the top , which we fortunately did on a Segway. you can see for miles all around .

Worth it for the View. It's a long steep hike up the hill to see the Soviet "Statue of Liberty" and the Bishop Gellert statue, but it's worth the walk for the absolutely breathtaking view of Budapest. It'll take about 30 minutes to get up there depending on how quickly you walk. My advice is to take the metro to the stop in front of Hotel Gellert, walk up to the Statue of Liberty and then head down to the Bishop Gellert statue for a great view of the Elizabeth Bridge. These are truly the best views that you can get of Budapest

Amazing views. We walked over the Liberty Bridge and up through the gardens to reach the top of Gellert Hill. We are not super fit so we took it at a fairly easy pace, some parts of the gardens are much steeper than others and we passed several people paused and panting. We reached the top after maybe 30 or 40 minutes but it was definitely worth the walk. The view was amazing and despite it being the middle of January it was a glorious sunny day with not a cloud in the sky. We could see the whole of Budapest. Unfortunately the citadel was not open to the public so we could only walk around it, which we did and then walked down the gardens on the opposite side into Taban. If you feel lazy you can get the bus but you see lots of wildlife if you walk which is much more interesting.

Come at night!. We walked up to the hill in the evening and although it was quite dark (some lanterns along the paths) and slippery (ice on the paths!), the view from the top of Gellért Hill was spectacular. The sights and streets of Budapest are illuminated, so you can see the size of Budapest in the distance and take pretty pictures :)

Spectacular Views!. We followed the more gentle gradient up to Gellert Hill by crossing the bridge keeping the Citadel and statue on our right hand side.It is a pleasant walk to the summit through parkland with plenty of seating if you need a rest during your ascent. Again, lots of lookout points for photographic opportunities.Once you reach the summit the views are stunning! Only damper of the day was that there were a group of men doing the 'hide an object under one of three cups routine' and then strongly urging people to bet. They seemed to be targeting Asian people and showing them d denominations of notes they should bet with. A nice British lad called out that these were nice people they were fleecing who worked hard for their money. This was met with aggression and stone throwing. Kind of spoilt the mood.However, although there was nothing open here being cold January, the Citadella was impressive from the outside with a brilliant history of the building. We walked down the other side of the hill. There are toilets open and a car park, making it accessible for disabled people by taxis, car, bus etc.A very worthwhile walk on a sunny if bitterly cold day.
Nice view. The last rememberance of the communist era, but most of all an impressive landmark. If you manage to get up there, you get some amazing views over Budapest
a view from the top. the Gellert Hill is great for the spectacular views over whole Budapest, spent there the New Year Eve and it was really something

Beautiful view of Budapest. It is one of the places that is for sure worth visiting! It is very easy to get there (there is a bus going almost all the way up) or you can have a lovely walk! The view from the hill is breath taking and just perfect for panoramic pictures of the city!

Superb statue and view. What a dramatic statue and the view and pictures we took were just incredible this is a must see...we were lucky as we stayed in Hotel Gellert which is very close in Buda district right next to the bridge across the Danube,Liberty bridge. We went at night but I'm sure if you go in the day it's just as dramatic.

A View of Budapest. There is really nothing of real note up here, since the Citadel is closed. The views of Budapest from up here are stunning, but other than that, it is a long way to come for a few photos, especially when it was cold. The only thing for sale up here was a trip to the toilet.

Went on a really foggy and cold day. I think if it was a clear day you would get amazing views of Budapest city. While it was still nice to go and have a look, you don't need to spend too much time up there. We caught a taxi up from Gellert Spa and then walked back down.
The view. This statue is near the Citadel. I really only went up there for the view of the city. Very nice statue though to represent liberty,
Worth the climb. You can see the statue from miles away so it is good to get up close to see the detail, and the view across the city is very good.

Fort was closed?!. We got there and fort was closed, no sign and nobody to tell us when will be reopen!
Nice to walk around hill, amazing nature and attractions on all Hill.
Excellent Panorama View of Budapest. This citadel gives you an excellent panorama view of Budapest and the Danube River. Also, the locals call this as their Statue of Liberty.

A beautiful walk to the top!. Walking up the stairs was a nice way to exercise before going to relax in the Gellert Spa. We really enjoyed the sight, especially at sunset! We met some kind people on our way up and the top was not too crowded. It was simply perfect!
excellent view. Must go place if you're in Budapest,breathtaking view on Pest and Buda castle,also the statue is very nice

Amazing view.... Do not walk here if you struggle with hills/steps/walking! I am amazed I got to the top. The view was certainly worth it however bring water with you! There was no where to get a drink at the top when we visited.

Top of the hill. I climbed the hill on a peacefull evening from the Gellert spa side. I stopped at the chapel in the rock, then went to the Citadelle. In January there is a Christmas market so it's quite busy.It was the best place and the best moment ( no clouds, no fog, not too cold) to enjoy the view of this wonderful city. It was amazing, the city lit up and the majesty of the monuments and buildings all around. It's the best souvenir from Budapest.

very nice view. I have been there twice - once in September and one in December. I would definitely prefer the visit in September - much nicer weather (o; But the view is always amazing. So if you are not lazy, have a time and it's not freezing, just go there. It's a MUST.

Great view, that's all. Great view from here but, there's nothing else to do ! I suppose the view is enough and worth the journey. We got a rickety bus up the hill from the tram terminus below and walked back down. I thought we'd get a good view of the lower statue on the way down but you can't get near it other than under it and the area is a graffiti users paradise.

Breathtaking !!!!!!!!. Do yourselfs a favor !!!!!! Visit this spot just what i personally consider the best vew of a city in the world !!!It makes yoy want to move to this city and retire for ever !!The view has literarry been printed in my head for ever !!!SUPERB !
Disappointing. Walked to the top, but honestly not much to see. A big statue and an old building. (And I normally like seeing palaces etc)

Nice!. A steep climb after the bridge or after exitog the metro station. Around 15 minutes and then you can enjoy a nice view of Budapest and the Danube. On your way down is the hotel Gellert with the steam baths
Great views!. The best view over Buda and Pest, as it is the highest mountain on the Danube shore. Day and night is worth the view.
AMAZING VIEWS. This is a steep climb up to the top of the hill. Once you are up there the views are amazing and you can see the whole of Budapest. A must see.
Reachable by foot but great. This location is reachable by foot and you need to climb on the hill for 15 minutes but the view is great so it is worth it.
Beautiful views of Pest and the Danube. Went up to this HIll Anita Barta our tour guide and got to see a lovely panoramic view of the Danube, some of Buda and much of Pest

Nature is speaking. . This place is so beautiful. When you walk through Budapest's streets especially during Christmas you only meet elegance, luxury, lights everywhere, and marvellous buildings. When you cross the Chain bridge, you automatically change environment. You walk up to the hill through the park, which is really beautiful, you breath fresh air and you have an amphitheatrical view to the city. It surely needs two hours, up there.
Nice walk. Nice walk up the hill with nice views during the walk and on top. Quite touristy but nevertheless a must see.
Spectacular. Worth every step from the bottom of the hill to the top.healthy walk that includes spots for great views.

Good climb with great view. There is footpath and stairs all the way up to the top. There are few stops for breather and rest if you need it. The stops offer views from different layers of the mountain (if you know what i mean), so if you are up to a bit of exercising, the climb might be worth it. The sun will be behind the statues in the morning, so those without good camera flash and techniques might want to do it in the afternoon. View from the top is breath taking. History of the place are depicted on the walls surrounding the 'display / showcase building' where you will need a ticket to get in. Apart from that, there is nothing much.

Great View Point and a Healthy Walk. The walk up the hill is pleasant and the views magnificent. The chequered history of the statue amused me. It morphed from being a symbol of communist oppression to currently that of freedom. Go figure!
Statue of Liberty. Interesting place with Statue of Liberty and citadel. The highest place in Buda side with great view.

Amazing views - go up just before sunset . We got up here just as the sun was setting which really was a sight to see (see our photos if you want a preview). It only took about 20 minutes to walk up from the bottom. Allow time to spend up the top as you get such a lovely view of Budapest.It's worth noting that some people have started putting padlocks/love locks on the railings at this beautiful spot. If you get here at sunset or just before like we did it's worth waiting for it to get dark as you get to see Budapest in the dark all lit up then too.

Fantastic view from the statue!. We climbed to the statue via the stairs that start right netxt to the Geller spa. The view from the stairs is fantastic. And from the statue - you can see both Buda and Pest! Its fantastic.

What a view. Well worth the walk from the drop off to get to the top of the hill.The views of all aspects of the city are wonderful and we took some spectacular photographs.It was misty and cold the day we visited but that did not take away our enjoyment or spoil the photography.

Good for a hike. It is a 3 tiered monument with an artificial waterfall capped by Bishop Gellért holding a cross. Hiking further to the top of Gellért Hill are 3 statues. A good place for an aerial view of Budapest.

Jewel in The Crown of Buda. Strenuous walk for elderly or not too fit !!! But bus available most the way up. Amazing views of the City and breathtaking when we visited as sun was shining high in the sky, we learnt so much about the History of Hungary it was very interesting
Great views. Great views over Danube & both sides of the city &being winter trees were bare & probably gave better views than when in full bloom .
Fantastic views. The views from the hill are amazing you can what feels like the entire city. The history of the buildings and statuary are something to see. A must visit.
This can be seen from the city. Wonderful views over the city, again not busy. We were on our way elsewhere but I think you can see different things there.

A must in Budapest. I am really sorry that bad politicians removed the statue of the Russian soldier. Anyway it is the best overall view of the city from the walk around the Citadella. If you are healthy just take the walk up from the Gellért Hotel and down on the other side along the Gellért sculpture to the Erzsébet bridge.

Good Place to Visit and walk around. Nice to see and good area to walk in. History, as in all of the world, at your feet. You could walk here if you are a hiker. It is on the Buda side so hilly. But worth whichever way you decide to visit. The views of the City are great. Wait for the sun to come out if you can during the winter.

A must see! . This was great when we finally made it to the top and found our way.Unfortunately it was a foggy day and didn't see the sights as good as we'd like to. Make sure you find this when you are near! Park isn't sign posted and we nearly gave up....look up and you'll find where the view point is.
stunning views. Worth the hike up the hill. Views panoramic and breathtaking. Bonnie clear day and can see for miles.

Great Views. This is part of the Citadel Tour, absolutely stunning views of the City. Come up here if only to take Postcard Quality photosVery Steep climb to the top catch No27 Bus if your are not going by Tour Bus
part of seeing Budapest. Take the funicular up. Check out the Citadel. Then scoot off to the eponymous spa and get a great massage.

Rocky hill in the middle of the capital. On a sunny day, it is a beautiful trip to walk up from the south part of the hill to the top. The path is leading you through a lovely park, and your reward will be the breathtaking view from the top. We were there on the first Saturday of the month, and, as we learnt, there is a peaceful motor biker meeting here on these days. It was lovely to see all those bike ridden down on the hillside road! Hundreds of them!

Another Beautiful View of the City. The citadel at the top of Gellert Hill is an interesting site to visit, and the views from the hill are really beautiful. My husband and I rode to the top of the hill on a hop-on/hop-off bus and then walked down. There are some truly amazing views of the city as you can see across the Danube to the Pest side as well as some of the beautiful iconic sites on the Buda side (like the castle and the fisherman's bastion). Going at night was really spectacular with everything lit up--make sure you bring your camera!

It's a hill and a statue !. Ok, so this is a hill next to the Gellert baths with a statue on top. Not too great a walk up and the view is ok when it is clear so nice enough to visit but not to much to see when you are up there

Great place for a night-time bottle of wine with views!. Although it's a bit of a climb (not too hard), you'll definitely be rewarded when you get to the top. Take a bottle of wine up in the evening and enjoy amazing night-time views of the Pest side, all lit up.
Would be a nice view if not for Fog. So we came here for the view and saw nothing, because of the Fog. However, in different weather conditions it's a must see, if you're in Budapest.
The best views from the city!. Best views from the city! You can go at night as far as I know and you will find great views from the city, it takes around 20-40 minutes to go up by walking

Not so impressive view from here. You don't need to buy a guide tour to see this Place. You can walk from the end of the bridge Close by. If you don't have much time this is one view Point you can miss!

Well worth the pleasant walk up the hill for a great view over the city. I had a great autumn walk up the hill. The leaves were just starting to fall and I managed to catch the last summer sunshine. The view is great, but try to go early morning or late night to avoid tourist sheep.

Gellert Hill. The view from the top is very nice, especially by night. But should be visited by daytime also. We tried both versions to visit by car and on foot on the stairs. The best one is by food it's the best way to see the landscapes. It's a must visit if in Budapest.

Topmost point in Budapest !. This place gives you the best view of the city. A must must visit for all tourists. By the way, please don't forget to keep a water bottle as the climb to hill is long and slightly tiring.
Great views of the city. This is definitely worth a visit as it provides great views of the River Danube and both sides of the city.

Views over Buda and Pest. The best views over the city. A must for all any photographer r budding photographer. Not forgetting the statue of liberty at the top. You get a history story on the open top bus of the area.

Worth the climb. Worth it for the view but once you've sat and rested (it is a bit of a climb) there's nothing really to do.
Pick a clear day and be aware it is busy up there.

Worth Walking. Was quite a bit of walk cos I walked from the Matthias Church to here the same afternoon. I think it worthed especially the Citadella, was the only thing I saw in the city with actual historical trace (which the other so called famous attractions without for me).

Impressive. We visited the Citadelle via metro 4 then a bus almost to the top of the hill. An easy way to get there if walking uphill is difficult. Great views even on a foogy day. The statues are impressive.

Magnificent Views and Symbolic Importance. When you get up here from your long walk up the hills, you are instantly hit with this never ending view of the Danube, glancing down to the Parliament and Budapest's many wonderful bridges. The towering lady is the 'safeguard' of Budapest and has a significant importance in history and present day as the 'safe keeper', Her official name Liberty Statue, it is here for the memory of those all who sacrificed their lives for the independence, freedom, and prosperity of Hungary. You can all see it from many corners of Budapest and it is one of the best places to go to for a great panorama, make sure to visit it at night as well when everything is all lit up nicely, and might be less crowded during the night. Enjoy your stay in Budapest !
Breathtaking Vistas. Unreal spot. Despite the little hike up the hill which was a handy workout.. the views up on this landmark were incredible
Views. It's worth making the journey to this lofty outcrop for the views across Budapest alone. Absolutely stunning views of the Danube and the Buda Hills also.

stunning views and emotional place - you can feel the history. Beautiful views of the city - just watch out for dodgy characters doing find the lady and such to con the tourists - I suspect a few pickpockets operate here too...

Stunning views!. It is worth to go up if you would like to see the spread-out city. It is really exceptional. The top of the hill itself a bit too much concrete for me, but the unspoiled view is great!

Good walk to the top great views. Great views over Budapest from here, lovely and clean, we walked up the hill after crossing over the bridge, lovely walk, clean and safe we thought. There was nothing open at the top btw, we hoped to stop for a snack or lunch but the cafe/restaurant is being refurbed so pop down to Gellert for a great and bargain priced lunch in the bistro instead.
Worth the walk. Walked up the steps of Gellert Hill to get the the statue. Long walk but well worth it for the views of the city.
good to see!. the view form there is amazing!!! we went there by night. the statue was really big!!! i would prefer to go in the morning too but we had no time....

a Postcard view. No trip to Budapest would be complete without a trip to Gellert Hill (including the Citadella). One of the signature views of the city can be had here. Then enjoy a leisurely coffee or food nearby. The statue dominates the skyline from across the river from several vantage points around the city. Most bus tours stop at this point. Especially beautiful when the foliage is changing in autumn.

STUNNING views of Budapest and the Danube. We were on a tour bus and got off here. It was still quite a walk from where you are dropped to the statue but WELL WORTH IT!It is not huge but you get some amazing views of bothBuda and Pest and of the River Danube. If you only had 1 stop on the tour bus,I would suggest here
The best view of Budapest. A slightly taxing climb but well worth it for the views of Castle Hill and the parliament building and Pest across the river.
Attending a conference with time to spare.. It is a rewarding experience to visit the many historical places in Budapest . You need at least 5 days to see most of Buda and pest.
Very Bright!. The stairs are quite well but not in very good condition but the view really worth it!Not good recommendation for old people and good bench system around.

Fantastic view!. We avoided the steep hike up the hill by visiting as party of our Rent a Trabant tour. Well worth a visit, and it was wonderful to have our guide explain much of the history of the two cities while looking over the spectacular view. Don't miss the Hungarian Statue of Liberty at the very top - the history of the monument is fascinating.
Best view of Budapest. On a sunny day almost every part of Pest's downtown can be seen from this hill. I find it better than Fisherman's Bastion.

Excellent views.. Gellert hill (named after Saint Gerard as he was thrown to his death from the hill) Houses many monuments and buildings, the hill is worth the climb. At the top of the hill is the Citadella (Citadel), from which a view is available down both directions of the Danube.

A good climb on a a pleasant day for the fit.. I climbed all the way up. IT took longer that I thought as it was a winding climb. I enjoyed it as the weather was good. I recommend it for people who are fit and like a good climb. the view is worth it.

SPECTACULAR VIEWS. We reached this Hill via our Hop on Hop off bus! Worth the walk up the hill to reach here. The views were fantastic from up here so this is a great photo opportunity and well worth it!

An excellent view. This place has the best view of the city. The statue itself is magnificent already, but the view that the hill provides you with is just breathtaking. The only bad thing is that it is a little bit tiring to get up there by foot.
nice view of the city. i took awalk up Gellert hill..it was well worth the effort asthe views from the top are wonderfull.The statue is huge once you reach it .

had a great hike up. We walked/hiked up from the side of Gellert hotel/spa. We took some steeper route but is was sprinkled with some playgrounds and parks but it was a pretty hike well worth getting to the top and the view.
Amazing panoramic views. At the top of the hill you can see the whole of Budapest panoramically, amazing to see and you can get some fantastic pictures and see all the sights

Nice trekking if you have time. Going up the hill was a nice trekking, you could do pauses to catch your breath while enjoying the good view. Please bring some water with you and wear proper shoes. If you don't have much time in Budapest, you can skip this one. As I think the view you get is not that much different from that of Fisherman's Bastion.

Worth the climb. This gives you fantastic views over Budapest, although if it is sunny the view does become very hazy. It is a steep climb up the hill through the park. Follow the arrows painted on to the path for the quickest route up.

Visit on the Vespa tour. In order to avoid the steep hike up, we visited the Citadel on our Vespa tour. It offers views of the side of the city that are hard to catch from Castle hill. It is definitely worth a visit for the photo op.

Great views, invigorating walk, great at dusk. We walked up from the Church in the Rocks...it's an invigorating steep walk uphill through the trees (good paths and plenty of people around). The views over Pest at dusk were fantastic...everything lit up was really romantic. The Liberation monument at the top is pretty impressive and it's a good vantage point to catch your breath and get some photos. Walk on towards the citadel and then back down to the river via the Gellert monument. In all it takes about an hour and is a good activity when other places have closed and you're working up an appetite for dinner! Free, safe, good views.

Worth a trip. Fortunately I didn't have to climb up the steep hill to reach this magnificent place. To take picture I suggest going during the morning because there won't be as many people, but during the afternoon, with the sun going down, it just has a different feeling. It is a nice place to have something to drink and eat as well.

Worth the hike up for the views. We hiked up the hill from the Gillbert spa side and back down towards the chain bridge and it was worth it. Actually it isn't that bad, depending on your health of course, but it is a nice walk in the woods.
Good vantage point. The very good vantage point to see the city and Danube river even in the middle of the winter.Just hike there and enjoy the view.

Fabulous views but an uncomfotable journey to get there.. We approached the Gellert statue from the Gellert Hotel entrance for the Gellert Hill and found there were lots of steps to climb and it took a long time to climb up there. The site was very popular with coach trips and there was a large car park with a couple of basic cafes. The views across the Danube were spectacular but there seemed to be a few dodgy characters lurking in the trees! Watch out for magic trick scams and people selling stuff on stairs.
nice. great view from up here where the statue is. very beautiful! the statue is also impressive. its worth a look

Get hiking, Take a picnic and watch the sun go down!. It's a bit of a steep track up the hill but well worth the view! We got some Hungarian cheese, wine and crackers and watched the sun go down there were much fewer people in winter and so we had an amazing spot. In summer its a great spot for a local hangout!
Great walk/hike. We walked from the Danube up the hill. It was rather steep and we worked up a sweat. Great view once you reached the top, with many photo opportunities.

Budapest has its own Statue of Liberty. The Szabadság Szobor or Statue of Liberty in Budapest was erected in 1947 to remember the Soviet liberation of Hungary from Nazi forces during World War II. While we did not go to Gellért Hill to see the statue close up, our local guide told us the bronze statue is 45+ feet high. The female figure holds a large palm leaf to symbolize peace. The guide also said the inscription on the statue was changed after the 1956 Revolution to read the monument is dedicated to all who sacrifice their lives for Hungarian freedom. I’m sure this would be worth a visit if you have the time to do so.

Best view of the city. To get there you can take the public transport, or the route I took, by foot, about 30 minutes starting at the Gellert Hotel. It's a good work out. The view at the top is amazing, all of Budapest at your feet. There is also a good walk down through the woods which takes you past some monuments and brings you directly to a bridge which leads back to Pest.

Worth the Climb Up for the Breathtaking Views. One lovely fall afternoon we hiked up to the top of Gellert Hill. The walk was exhilarating (we definitely broke a sweat) and well worth the reward when we made it to the top. The Citadel statue is lovely to look at briefly, but it's the views that make it worth your while.
Pride of the City. Take your time here, there is lost of history to enjoy and the view of Budapest is really great, a little walk but worth it.

Amazing views and a nice walk through the park. It might seem burdensome because one has to climb a bit, but the view on the top is just stunning, and worth even more in comparison to Castle hill. Furthermore, I just loved the park that you pass while climbing and lots of different nice places great for sitting and chilling.

Great view!. Loved hiking from the bridge through the park till arriving at the top. The yellow autumn leaves! :) Loved the statues and the view of Buda and Peste.
There are several love lockers locked near the monument.

The highlight of my trip.. It was tiring to go all the way up but totally worth it. The views from above is magical. Definitely the highlight of my trip and should be on anybody's must-do list in Budapest.
It's free and fun!

Great views, bit of a trek!. Defiantly worth a visit but the journey to the top is quite a trek!
There were options available to get a bus, but be warned if you walk it is a 15-20 up hill climb!
long climb but great veiws. no denying it is a bit of a climb/trek up to see this attraction, however well worth the visit for the views if you are fit and able.
GREAT VIEW of whole city! . Free to walk up! Totally worth the little walk! Best to go at sunset so you can see the whole city during the day and at night!
Beautiful view of Budapest !. Do not miss going up this hill (using one of the bus tours or by yourself); the view is spectacular and it will instantly transport you to another calmer place :)

Climb to the top of Buda. This statue is seen right from the every corner of the Pest of river Danube. Just aim this place first thing in the morning and climb the stairs slowly while enjoying the park and breath taking scenery of the Pest area. After the statue take a walk down again through the park and head to the castle area.

Gellert Hill and Statue. Budapest Citadella(Hungarian for Fortress) situated on Gellert hill is at a altitude of 235 meters.The Citadella was built during the Habsburg rule in 1854.Amazingly i found the trek akin to a walk although with a few intermittent rest stops in between.Finally reached the summit at approximately 1215 hrs .As usual there was a tourist crowd and the panoramic view of the Danube river with its bridges and shipping traffic was amazing, the best viewpoint in Budapest.There is a Statue of Liberty on the Citadel which is 40 meter tall with its pedestal and has the statue of a woman holding aloft a palm branch.The Citadel played a historic role during World War II in the 50 days "Siege of Budapest" by Russian forces and over a decade later in the Hungarian revolution of 1956. Soviet troops put down the Hungarian revolution by occupying the citadel and firing from that height on the Hungarian rebels.Today its a tourist attraction in Hungary and a broadcasting point for many radio stations..The descent was smooth as there was a bus service from another end of the Citadel's Gellert hill and hence returned by motorized transport back to sea level in Buda.
Best view of Budapest. If you aren't to fit??...it's a bit of a walk up hill on a mixture of pathways and stairs...I love it up there, and the views are majestic . Not to be missed

Fantastic view - go at sunset!. One of the best views in Budapest is from Gellert Hill; you'll see impressive views at sunset in particular, as it overlooks Pest from the hills of Buda. I'll be posting some of my favorite photos of it from Visit50.com

Worth a Visit.. Take a bus up to the top of the hill where the Citadel is located. We used the Big Bus Tour. It is on the Buda side of the river and is home of the Gellert Statue that has historical significance . There is not much to see re the citadel but the views from above are impressive. The main statue and the smaller side sculptures are worth the visit.

amazing views. we started from Gellert statue with fountain,go all way up and in about an hour walk,including visiting Liberty statue and citadel u end down at gellert baths and freedom bridge.u can buy some food and local art on the way,great views of parlament,bridges.lots of fresh air:)) a must

Budapest View . Gellert Hill is where you get to see the city from the top. it is nearby the Gellert Thermal spa, So I went there 6 in the morning and after the bath went up the gellert hill and found it amazing.

Beautiful View from the Top. We first saw the Gellert Statue and learned the story on our Danube River cruse so we had to climb to the top and see more. You can get a closer look by climbing the steps that lead from Elizabeth Bridge.The Gellért Monument is a Budapest landmark, but most impressive at night when it is all lite up. It is located near the top of Gellért Hill, overlooking the Elizabeth Bridge. This monument was erected in 1904, in honor of the 11th century bishop St Gellért who converted the Magyars to Christianity. Below the memorial is a nice waterfall. Legends says that Gellért was put to death by pagans at this spot by putting him in a barrel and rolling it down the steep Gellért Hill and then throwing it into the Danube.

Amazing View. Our private guide took us up here. There really isn't all that much up here save the amazing view over all of Budapest. Even on a drizzling day the view was beautiful. Great spot for a few pictures.

TOP TOP TOP!. Excellent view to the whole city! Best place to see Budapest. You can go up here with bus 27 from 'Móricz Zsigmond körtér'. IF the weather is good, there are also stairs all the way to the top from the Erzsébet híd.

Great place for views and pix. This is a place you should visit. Beautiful vistas of the Pest side of the of the city. Before you go, do the research so you know what the statues mean, the markers are all in Hungarian. Always consider the time of day - where the sun will be - for any outdoor site you will want to take pictures. You will want to time to have the sun behind you.
Symbolizing Budapest. Was a part of my city tour. Beautiful architecture representing principles of Budapest. The place also gives good views of the entire city. Visit as a part of a group tour.

This monument is really beautiful. we were there at night and the classical structure in marble with a bronze statue combined with an amazing light design give u a magic sensation to go back on time to the emperors days, very recommended

SYMBOL OF LIBERTY AND GREAT VIEWS. Another significant icon of Budapest and of Hungarian history. Great views. It helps to know some of the history of Hungary, especially recent liberation from the communist era.

Lovely view of the city. Lovely view of the city from the top of the hill. The rise took 20 minutes on foot. At the top is former Austrian fort in it a museum, where we, unfortunately, were not included. But apparently a fort in good condition and quite an interesting structure. Around a lot of lawns.
Best views of Budapest. We walked to the top, so glad we did, fab views, it was breathtaking. There are a few stops you can make and view points on the way up. If you have time its well worth a visit

Great for a morning walk with magnificent view over Budapest.. The Budapest Citadella is built on top of a steep hill in a park very close to the river. There are many different paths and stair ways leading up from the river side to the monument. A long the way there are many resting places and small outcrops in the hill for watching the view. Be sure to walk around to the back side of the monument for additional views in the opposite direction from the river.

Tough walk up. The walk was a bit steep and being in my 60,s made it tough but still very achievable Views absolutely fabulous and we'll worth the effort. The Liberty Statue used to have a 7 metre high Russian bronze statue in front but this was removed to Memento Park, another good place to visit ☺
Nice climb. We went up on a misty morning, but the sun came and it was wonderfull. On the top we had a very good coffe and we went down through the parc on the other side of the hill.

Great views. It's a steep climb to the top and hard work at times i suggest you take a drink and make sure your camera is packed because you will do well to find a better place to take pictures of the whole city than this one !!!! Glad we made the effort.
Take the 27 bus. This is well worth the effort. We went on a beautiful October day and the views are stunning. Great views of the city. We took the 27 bus, which drops right at the top.
Great view. You have to climb a steep hill, so take your time. The view from above is beautifull, an overview over Pest, Buda and the Danu.

Nice place to stroll with great views of Budapest. This is a fun place to stroll and easily accessible by public transport (tram and bus). You can walk around the park on top of the hill and then take in the statues and the Citadel. Go on a clear day, bring a picnic lunch, and bring your camera. There are some tourists but it is not as crowded as Buda Castle. If you're adventurous you can also walk up and down. We had bought a 24-hour metro pass so we were hopping on and off trams and buses all day.

Amazing views on a sunny day. The statues and views are amazing when viewed on a sunny day. Avoid when wet and foggy as there is no where to shelter and everything disappears into the grey. Take one of the many buses up the hill; we walked and its steep! Explore Buda and Pest before you visit the hill so you can pick out locations you have been. Beware the men trying to scam you with the guess which shell the nut is under!!
Best place to relax . One hour of walking on this beautiful place is like you are in the heaven. The air is fresh, people are nice. There is a beautiful park too. I'm really enjoying the walking.
Hiking. we went on a rainy day though you should walk this attraction, but it wasn't a problem, but don't eat a lot before cause you have stairs and a good walking distance to be done.

Favourite Views. Budapest is blessed with a number of great places to see the city, including Fisherman's Bastion, the panorama of St. Stephen's Basilica or from the Danube on a night river cruise. But my favourite came at the top of Gellert Hill.Started the climb from the South side, after visiting the Cave Church. Basically would just pick whichever fork struck me as the most interesting, as a result I got different types of terrain from stairs to crumbling stairs to paths of various types. In general, it is a good climb, though nothing along the route I took was overly steep. You just know you are climbing. And it is worth it when you reach the top.Maybe wish it was more interesting up top, particularly with the Citadella, but looking outwards its great. If you forgot or run out of water, you can buy some of the most expensive non-restaurant water you'll find in Budapest. So be more organized than me.Going down, I seemed to find steeper paths, but again manageable. Enough that at the bottom, near Elisabeth Bridge, I enjoyed the cool down offered by standing next to the waterfall.
One hell of a climb up to this point, but worth it. After a long and steep climb it was a splendid view, and worth the effort. Much easier coming down afterwards.

Steep Climb but fantastic view!. This is certainly not very everybody as it involves a rather steep climb up from the Gellert Hotel at the foot of the hill to the top of Gellert Hill where the Liberty Statue is located. But what a gorgeous view of the city of Budapest and the Danube river from up there!
Great views. Great views and accessible by bus. This is a great place to go see and well worth the trip up. Brilliant place to take pictures

Beautiful !!. I was there on my school trip and i must say that it's hard to climb on the top with no breaks like we did. Although it's definitely worth it and a view is breathtaking *.* i recomend to visit this place at night, it looks much better and romantic too ;) Before you will go there, read some historical facts, it's good to know why this woman is standing of the top of the hill.
One of the highest points. I was up here on a rainy evening, this place offers a beautiful view of Pest, best to visit during sunset, the city views while lit up looks gorgeous.

Great Panoramic Views. Probably one of the best locations for panoramic views across Budapest. Great angles for taking pictures of the Danube and bridges. Budapest's Statue of Liberty stands tall and faces across the vista towards Russia.

BUDAPEST'S MUST-SEE. As I've visited the Gellert Hill and Statue this month, I would highly recommend going there. Climbing up the steep hillside will be definitely worth the effort because of the stunning views of Budha and Pest from the top. Not only can you admire the whole city, but it can also be a good opportunity to escape from the daily routine and a moment of relax. You can either choose the healthy option and walk or jump into the bus which will take you there quickly and effortlessly. All in all, if you're looking for a place to get some breath-taking panoramic photos of Budapest you should give it a go as soon as possible.
Great View of the Danube and Pest. We had a fabulous view of the Danube and Pest side of the city from Gellert Hill. We are glad our tour bus stopped at this location.
Great Views. Great views from the top of the hill. Not much else to see here as the Citadel is not accessible, but the views alone make this worth while.
Great view!. I thought this was the best view of all the various hills in and around Budapest. Not a bad hike up and there are some shortcuts to be found. Very exhilarating at the top!
best view over budapest. in my opinion this is the best place to get a view all over budapest. here you can take a lot of pictures and relax.
Touching Picturesque. Great view of Buda and pest. The bridge that connects them. Panoramic view and great cheap souvenirs from the locals rather than the tourist traps.
Great views. Not intense, more pleasant. Lots of great little viewing spots on the walk up to see all areas of Budapest. Good to bring a little picnic or snack to sit and take it all in.

NICE VIEW. It is located at Buda site, on a hill.We went there by bus till the parking area, and from there by walking about 10 minutes.On the top of the hill there is the main statu. From there you can enjoy the panoramic view of the Dunabe and the Pest (If you are lucky and the weather permits).You can take amazing photos.

Great view from the hilltop with good paths for running. One of the best places in Budapest for a morning run if you are ready to climb the hillside while doing it. The hill has a beautiful view of Budapest from the statue platform after climbing up the steep hillside.

Highest point in Budapest. Requires some walking distance climbing up the Gellert Hill, accessible using different routes if you don't hire a cab or purchase the tourist Big Bus services. Worth to pay a visit if time allows.

Lovely views! . If you're looking for a place to get some lovely panoramic photos of Budapest, then this is the place to go. The Citadell itself I also beautiful to look at. Although the easiest way to access this is by bus, we opted to walk back down again, and would highly recommend this to anyone, as it also provides the opportunity to access the waterfall half way down.
Run up the staira. Take the opportunity to mix culture, beautiful views together with workout, by jogging up all the stairs to the top. And do it twice at least
The statue alias The bottle opener. Great view from this place in a nice area! Possible to go by bus, and also buy refreshment in the area, close to the parking area. OBS, just a small parking area!

Peaceful and relaxing. Loved the area and getting away from the hubbub of Pest. great views. We enjoyed a nice lunch at the Gellert Hotel. The area has a quiet gentility a more. relaxed pace and was less touristy than other parts of the city of Budapest.

Interesting, but not worth a trip. We drove to Gellert Hill and drove by the statue, but were not impressed enough to stop. The view is lovely, but better from Castle Hill. If you have a lot of time, do stop and take photos here. But if you have only a few hours, go to Castle Hill.

Symbol of the city. From here you get a better feel for the odd history of this area and a fortress that never saw action. The Liberty Monument is an amazing statue. Once again a place that offers fantastic views of the city. Not a lot of food or bathroom opportunities. We caught this off the HO-HO, so didn't need to climb the hill.

Good for a short visit. It has beautiful views of the Danube and the city, 30 min visit is plenty and worth it. There are interesting plaques with the history of this place and a nice forest hill around it

Unrivalled 360 views. We went to see the cave church and then followed the little trail up the mountainside (at least we think it was a trail? there were little hearts on the path and they led us on a meandering route to the top), and it took us past so many beautiful hidden viewing areas! When we eventually got to the top, the view was stunning. If you can make the climb, this isn't to be missed.
Nice view of Budapest. It is a 20 minutes climb and a very nice landscape in the end. except the statue, there is no many other things there to see.
Place to see view of Danube. Short distance walking from the parking lot this top we will arrive to this place. View of Danube with Chain bridge and the castle hill is beautiful
Good exercise. It was quite a trek getting up there. while it does feel a bit maze like, the clue is to only go up. All roads lead to the summit. Worth it for the view.

Great views of Pest. This was not on our list of things to do but we were wandering around the market and the statue caught my husband's eye so we decided to cross the bridge and walk up the hill to it. This is something you will want to do on a clear day. There is a lot of walking and steps but it is worth it for the view. There is not a lot to do but wander around the Citadel at the top and the couple of statues.

Awesome views. We walked across the Danube on the Green bridge and walked up Gellert Hill. It was a definite hike. The views back down to the Danube and the chain bridge and city were beautiful. The statues were nice as well. We walked around the Citadella and back down. Very nice walk. Only tip would be to try and do it on a clear day and you will be able to see more of the city below.

We walked to the top!. We walked from our hotel to Gellert Hill and Statue. We had planned to visit the church built into the side of the hill but we were exhausted when we finished walking back down.Most people take some sort of transportation to the top but we aren't most people. My FitBit said that I walked up 38 flights of stairs on the day we walked up Gellert Hill. Most of them were on that walk. Take your time and enjoy the scenery.A word of warning:There was a guy challenging folks, for money of course, to see which of 3 nuts hid a coin. You have probably seen this. We thought, "Oh my! People are falling for this scam!" We walked around the top and returned to where the guy was. Sure enough, he was working with 2 cohorts to scam folks into thinking that they were really playing the game. Don't be fooled!
nice views. A short walk up the hill provides a nice city view. There is a bus o. The non river side. Recommended MeuterMedia

Last night glory. Visited as part of an Imperial City tour organised by Rail Discoveries of York. This was a last night of our stay in Budapest and a chance to see the panorama of the City illuminated. We weren’t disappointed. It is a great view. The ‘Statue of Liberty’ is absolutely colossal.

Garden of Philosophy. This "park" is a wonderful place to wander around in and you get picturesque views of Budapest. I especially loved the "Garden of Philosophy" located at the back of Gellert Hill. The eight life size statues were created by Hungarian sculptor Nandor Wagner to promote "mutual understanding".
Funny feeling. This statue reminds me of the comi era, but when I am taking my friends to the Halászbástya, it is a must to go there and see.
Wow!. What a wonderful way to view Budapest. We had a great view of the Danube and each side of the river.

I could have stood there for hours. The view is fantastic, especially since you are on a hill and can walk around the zenith to get different angles on the city view. Easily accessible with bus 27 which takes you up the hill, leaving you with just a short walk to the statue. A few people have locked padlocks to the fence, but the links are really too thick to allow any more of these.

Great views over the "lower" end of the Danube.. Took the hop on, hop off bus here. You get 20 mins at the top and to be honest that about sums it up. You walk to the statue and do have great views but that is it.Don't worry if you miss it. The great fort was closed when we were there. 20 mins does it.

Don't go, everyone else does!. Hard to get around in this complex and having experienced some other baths, I would skip this one. Not user friendly place and really large with hundreds of people and they are mostly tourists.

Best view in Budapest. There is a road up to the citadel, which is great for anyone who can't walk up steep slopes with steps, but if you can walk on difficult surfaces, I recommend going up on one of the many paths around the hill, as they are a sight in themselves, with hidden treasures around some corners. Whichever way you go up, the view from the top is stunning. There can't be a better spot to view the city from. Since Budapest is really well lit at night, including the bridges, it is worth going up at night as well just to look out. Not all paths have lights but some do. Most cities don't even have a place like this.

Great View, Difficult to Access. Gellert Hill offers great views of the city... besides Fisherman's Bastion, it is the best place to get a shot of the whole downtown area. However, it is also hard to access without a car. Certain busses do travel to the top, but you might be better off walking instead of waiting and paying for the bus.
Great view at the city. We went on foot and enjoyed the climb up. You can also take the bus if you want... The night view is amazing

Amazing views, huge statue!. Walk up the numerous paths from the river side or take a tour bus up there, we did both. The statue was a gift from Russia after the war but it is now renamed the liberty statue as most Hungarians seem to regard the Russian occupation afterwards with a great deal of anger. Never the less the views over the river are worth getting off the bus for, the statue itself is huge and the fortress has a lot of interesting information on the walls as you pass.

Worth the hike: Beautiful scenery to take in, especially at night. We went at night so the hike was a bit difficult without much lighting to clearly point out the pathway. However, beyond this slight challenge, getting up the hill to the statues and the view of the city below was fantastic. The Budapest skyline at night is well worth the effort and we pretty much had free roam of the place to enjoy multiple perspectives from. While we're not sure what the views look like from the daytime, it's certainly one of the nicer untouched tourist sites the city has to offer.Quick note: This site is definitely not wheelchair-friendly

Highest Point in Budapest, Great Views and Offers Recent History. As part of our Hop on - Hop off bus day, Gellert Hill was one of its stops. It is a relatively short walk up to the Citadel and Freedom Statue. It has a tragic history, as the Citadel was built by the Russians after WWII, and they then used that hill (being the highest in Budapest) to bombard the city with tanks and field guns to suppress the Hungarian uprising in 1956. A significant part of the Pest side was destroyed during this time. The Freedom Statue was erected after Hungary was no longer a Russian satellite. It offers excellent views as well as several others on the Buda side of the Danube.

Great hoke to the top. We hiked to the top and enjoyed the view. We also went to the bath and got a massage.
The Gelert bath is nice but very confusing. We met many people who had difficulty to find their way in the bath house.
I had a 40 minutes massage and it is recommended.

Worth the walk up.. Great place to take a break from your usual city activities. We had a 'slow' wander up and around the citadella and then came back down to the hustle bustle of the city. Well worth a look.
Citadel. Astonishing view of the Danúbio and all city Very good place for pictures and selfies. Place to park car.

A walk with a view.. There is a public bus (nr 27) you can take up the hill, you will need to check which nr and the closest spot to get it. From there, take the short walk to the Citadella. Huge, impressive, strong fort. The views are stunning from there, a short walk further is the Freedom statue, the large statue of the lady holding the palm leaf.. Watch out for conmen there, using cards, dice or other bits and pieces to con tourists out of Euros or any other currency. From there, take a walk down the Gellert Hill. Near the hotel, you will find the Metro nr 4.

Tough climb but worth it. Hope you are in decent shape, this is a tough amount of stairs to walk up but after numerous breaks to catch my breath I finally reached the top. WOW, the views are stunning.....and worth the effort!

Nice views but can be seen elsewhere (without the effort). Long hike up (although we did enjoy it). Views very similar to those from Buda Castle so no need to visit if you have been there (on route to Gellert Baths!).
Best view of the city.. We were lazy and got the 27 bus up and walked back down. This is a must with amazing panoramic views.

It worth every single stairs to get there. If you ask me…It worth every single stairs to get there. There are multiple way to reach the top, me and my friend did it in the hard way and took the stairs in the middle of summer. You can imagine. We climed all the way to the top int he heat, of course we took little stops to catch our breath so we had really good opportunities to take some picture of the city with the Danube and the beautiful bridges. Then finally we made it to the top and the view was just awesome. We didn’t even want to leave the spectacular landscape.

Nice afternoon walk. There are multiple ways to reach the top, so just keep going up and you'll get there. Personally I recommend getting there from the South because this side is more like a park, there are hardly any steps and it's very pleasant. The walk can be a bit tiring though. Also the view from the top, i.e. from below the statue is beautiful. And once you're up there, please, take a minute or two to admire it, don't just look through the lens of your camera.

You need to be fit!. We took the steps and steep paths route up from the waterfall at the roadside. It seemed never ending!! We are not completely unfit, but we certainly felt we had done some exercise!! Views on the way up are gorgeous and from the top breathtaking as one has at least a 300 degree view around, looking both over the Danube and the Pest side as well as over Buda and districts. Quite stupendous.There are two cafes at the top, not near the statues but on the roadway past the Citadella (which unfortunately wasn't open).It's easy to walk back down to the waterfall - down a fairly steep road - takes about 20 minutes.

OUT OF BREATH. The pathway to the top is beside the Gellert Hotel and is not well signposted to the top. Also the pathway is quite uneven in places so watch where you're walking. It is steep in places and I made it to halfway and called it a day. I believe it can be reached by transport so perhaps next time.

Worth the journey for the view. The residential areas lining the hillside are quite lovely and when yu reach the viewpoint you are rewarded with another ideal viewpoint for panoramic views over the city.

Its a long climb but worth it (there is a road too). Its a long climb to the top of the hill, but the statue and the views across the Danube in both directions are well worth it. The statue is magnificent and a real landmark to the castle area. From here go down to the Gellert Hotel and look at the interiors and those of the baths, or relax after your long climb and descent. Near the hotel is the new metro line with deep stations, the engineering of which is quite stunning.There is a car and coach park round the back of the castle with cafes for refreshments.
Breathtaking View!. Walking up the hill is really nice! The view from Gellert Hill across the Danube river and Pest side is simply breathtaking

u need t climb up to see it...LOL.... its a huge communist era monument. nice one above the hill. u need to climb up to see it. must carry water if u r trying it in summer. the view from the top is also good.
Something to do. A pleasant walk across Elizabeth Bridge and up to the statute. OK for views but really there is not a lot there.
Worth the steep climb!. Climb the hill if you dare! it's a steep climb but well worth the sweat! magnificent views of Pest from all resting stops.

Tranquil walks nearby and fab views. I spent an afternoon walking up to the statue, taking the views in and then meandering back down a different way through the leafy park - which is a real treat as you are still in the city. I even saw a red squirrel on my way down!There are lots of tourists milling around, but most of them get on and off the buses from by the citadel, so it's much more enjoyable to walk up from the bridge. And there are a variety of paths to choose from, and resting spots. The views are amazing, as you can see the main part of Pest, but also much more of the suburbs of Buda, as the Danube flows around the corner.

Endless walk, but so worth it!. As this was one of our last stops during out four day trip, we were kind of tired of walking (didn't use public transport once), but yet we decided to climp up this place. The walk up seemed endless, the stairs seemed to be laughing at our faces, but once we made it, we felt incredibly proud. The view is stunning, you get to see the city yet from another angle - this time with all the bridges in front of you. Loved it. Too bad there was no café or anything.
A must see place. Gellert Hill gives you a breathtaking view over Budapest and its bridges. I spent over there about an hour in the evening watching the sunset - this was a great experience!

The best view point of the city. From gellert hegy you will see The best view point of the city, buda, pest, danube.
You can get there by walking up the park from gellert hotel or by a bus and then a little walk

Stunning, especially at night. This place has a wonderful view of the "Pest" side of Budapest. It's high above the city on the Buda side. We were able to go there at night to look out over the city. It's an incredible view. It also helps to know that this originally was put up by the Russians/Soviet occupiers. The name of the statue has changed several times to reflect first, Soviet occupation and now a free, independent Hungary. You might enjoy the monument a bit more if you read a little about it ahead of time. Whether you do or don't read about it, this is a stunning moment, especially at night.
beautiful view. We took the route from south, from Hotel Gellert. It's kinda steep, but fun, with lot of views on Dunaj. Statue is monumental and its worth to get there!
Top of Budapest. Important for Budapest occupants, cheering tourists and young couples. Citadel on top of hill with excellent outlook around Budapest.

Great view but not much else. If you want a great view of Pest and surrounding area then this is worth a trip. The statues are nice but there really isn't much else to do up here than admire the view. Fishermans Bastion has a just as beautiful a view and more to do if you need to choose one!

Visit just before sunset to get snaps in day light and later in night time. Nice view of city before and after sun set. In case you go there by public transport bus number 27 , you need to walk to a km to reach to top.
Great view!. Went by foot all the way to the hill, the view was worth it! Even better than Budapest eye :)It's not easy going all the way up, but if you can, it's a must!

great views of Budapest and the Danube. accessible 90% of the way by public transport, some walking required, well worth the trip up the hill. Would recommend getting PT up then walking down toward the river.
Budapest trip.. Easy to access by public transport. Probably best to go up on a nice day. Wonderful view of the city as well.
Iconic Statue and Amazing Views. Gellert Hill offers stunning panoramic views of Budapest across the Danube and includes The Chain Bridge and Buda Castle. The Statue is beautiful and very large too.

Perfect for views and photography. We climbed the hill from the south side. This way up is only for pedestrians and shows some great spots with views over Pest. On the top of the hill you will find the Statue.
Reminiscent. Previous trip memories were well rewarded. The statuary in the Gellert Spa was magnificent. It's a busy place as so many locals frequent it too.

Not to be missed!. Our guide strongly recommended that we go to the Hill and see the Statue. So glad we did!! The views of Budapest were spectacular. Had it been closer to the beginning of our stay in Budapest, it would have been fun to attempt the hike up the hill, but we were "walked" out!
Impressive. really close to the centre of the city - interesting to walk around & admire the views from all sides.
Dont miss the view. A short walk from the bus stop this is a view that should not be missed as the whole city is spread out before you
Great views. A great morning walk to the top of the hill, at the top it gives you an amazing view across the city. Would recommend a visit
Amazing Views!. This was really amazing the views were astounding and much better than those from the Fisherman's bastion
Best views. Worth the trip as the views are spectacular. There is not much else up there but you can see the whole city. Best time to go is in the afternoon, as you will have westerly sun.

What a view. If you want to challenge yourself you can walk but it could be a bit tiring. But when you're on top of the hill the view is worth every effort - particularly at night. Perfect spot to take many panoramic photos of Budapest and enjoy the moment.

Marvellous views. To reach it, it needs a hike from the castle, with a rewarding set of views. Also the statue of a historic value. For those who cannot hike it or are pressed in time, the whole hill and the statue can also bee seen from any bridge crossing the Danube.

Wonderful Views. Fabulous views!! A very distinct landmark and well work a visit. Busses go most of the way up the hill and it's quite pleasant to walk the last it. It's also a lovely place to walk to first thing in the morning before the tours start and just soak up the atmosphere.
Stunning views at sunset. Excellent views, would recommend going at sunset to experience the best sights lit up at dark. Took 30minutes to walk up but highly worth it
Great views. It's a bit of a hike up but once you are up at the top it is well worth the reward to see the city views.

Vertigo point. Overlooking the city of Budapest, this hill on the Buda side is very nice to relax and take a brake from the busy city. Mind that it's a bit of a walk from the metro or tram and can be steep if not trained to walk uphill.

Stunning Views. Totally worth going to see! You can get the bus number 27 up the hill then follow the road up if you don't want to walk or take a tour bus. It's so beautiful, went on a clear day and it was stunning. Every photo I took looks beautiful!
This citadel played a lot of roles in Budapest history. Great view of BUDAPEST and some interesting history too. Easy access from hop on hop off tour buses.

Cittadella. I walked up here at the evening, when it got darker. It was not easy to get up, but it didn't matter. Its an unbelievable view and magical atmosphere at the top with the local hungarian youth. If you are a good walker and have good sight, I would recommend this at sunset. But it is not easy at night.
Tough walk but worth the views!. This is right at the top of a steep hill, so be prepared! The views are amazing though, see Budapest from this high point and it is stunning.

A workout. I took the 49 yellow trolly across the bridge from the Market place. First stop was at the base of Gellert Hill. I knew that I wanted to hike up to the top and the trail began just on the other side of the big Hotel there. One can go up through the woods or take the trail and MANY steps up to the top. There are several place to rest along the way. I know there are easier ways to acces the top as there is a road up there and I noticed a lot of people coming from the other direction. I wanted a bit of a challenge. It wasn't difficult but it IS a long way uphill.

A lovely walk around the buidlings and statutes.. Took the hop on hop off bus to get there. A great way to get around and see the main tourist areas of Budapest. Interesting walks around the top of the Gellert Hill. We took the quieter route down on the opposite side to where the bus comes up. Its a very nice walk through tree lined gardens right down to the riverside again. Not many people take this route.
Best view of Budapest. Great (steep) walk up to the top but once there on a sunny day you have postcard views of the Danube and Budapest

Breathtaking views. We walked up Gellert Hill then across to the Fishermans Bastion. Admittedly it did take a couple hours mainly because we stopped frequently to take in the sights and walk around the Citadel. There a multiple walks you can take and the are relatively easy if you enjoy walking. Most paths are shaded and toilets are at the top near the Citadel. If you can walk then I highly recommend you do.

A must!!! . My partner and I walked up to the top of galert hill on the 19th September. I was hot but there are plenty of benches and lovely views to stop at along the way. When we got to the top the view is AMAZING! While we where there my boyfriend proposed to me! It was the perfect setting and an wonderful memory of Budapest.
Amazing views over the city. This is well worth the climb, views are spectacular. If you're on a bus tour jump off for a look around.
