Adventure Budapest . This location has fabulous views of Budapest and the beautiful Danube River. Very steep walk but just amazing when you get there. Highly worth visiting. There is just so much to see you can make no mistakes visiting budapest.
Bird's view of Budapest. More than the architecture or beauty or grandness of this monument, this place will fascinate you for the bird's view of this beautiful city.

Struggle but worth it. Me and my partner climbed up here one evening last week, it was an extremely tough climb (clearly my fitness levels aren't as good as I thought!) but worth it when we reached the top, fantastic views - photos don't do it justice. It was dark when we climbed up and there was barely any lights so it was quite spooky and difficult to see, I wouldn't have wanted to be on my own. We walked back down via the main road which took a little longer.

Fantastic Views of Budapest. I heard it's also known as the Citadel. While some might like to hike up the hill or take public transport, we took electric bikes up (booked through "I like EBike" in Budapest) and it was almost effortless to cycle up all the way. Buses have to stop a distance away and visitors have to walk the rest, they allowed bicycles to travel all the way to the top. That's a real advantage because it can be tiring otherwise. The breeze was equally enjoyable.

Stunning views of the city. It may well be a hike to the top, but the views of the city are stunning. For those who cannot make it, the tour buses run up regularly. The citadel was closed so cannot comment on what is in there. We took the route up from Szabadsag hid bridge and came across Gellert Hill caves with a grotto chapel inside...worth checking out when in the area.

Nice views from here,to climb only if you have time. For people who live here, this is a nice stroll up, multiple ways are possible going up, walking or climbing stairs. For tourists this would be only worth if you have at least 3 days, other monuments and places go first in Budapest. So this is good for the photos/viewsand the exercise, there is not much else to do once on top.
OK. This place is worth a visit for a stunning view of the city. (Make sure to bring your camera) and a great hike.

Long walk. Did this walk today and it was so hot but there was a sense of achievement getting to the top. The views are excellent and the walk up is very pleasant, though not suitable for anyone with health conditions. There is a bus route that you can use. The citadel at the top was shut for no apparent reason so that was disappointing. If you're going just to see that make sure that it's open before you leave.
Well worth the steep walk. It's a steep walk but the view is fantastic. If you use the big red bus tour you can get on and off at the top, so for the less mobile this may be the best way to see it
Climbing to a great view. What a view! What a walk up to the top. A bit scary and steep. But so worth it. You have a wide view over the beautiful Budapest

Great commemorative statue. This statue, located on Gellert Hill is in honor of those who sacrificed their lives for freedom in Hungary. It was erected in 1947 in remembrance of Hungary's liberation from Nazi forces of Germany.
The Best Photo taking spot. If you don't mind walking, go up to the hill and feel the view. You will not regret it. But sometimes it can be closed for private function.

Best view!. This is where you will find the best view in Budapest cause it's actually the highest point (higher than the Castle district). It's I think the best place to look down on both the Buda and Pest sides. A must see!

Wonderful view of city along Danube . Interesting photos of city on wall, incremented by decade, as you climb the hill. Sad to see the 1945 one showed the Chain Bridge collapsed. Great views for miles along the Danube of both sides of the city are unmissable.Thoroughly recommended.
Worth The Effort. A long trek to the top if you don't take the bus, but well worth it once you get there and see the views over the Danube and Budapest.

A Peaceful Walk. After the splendour of the Castle, this is very peaceful. You can walk up from the Gellert Hotel, or along from Buda Castle and enjoy the Soviet-era Statue of Liberty. The views are stunning and there are plenty of photo opportunities on the way up and at the top.It can be quite quiet and secluded as you go round the hill, which adds to its attraction.

Great views, but .... We were pretty underwhelmed by Gellert Hill and Statue. Yes, the views over Budapest are fantastic. Yes, the Statue is an excellent example of post war triumphalism. But, there's not much else to do up there. The food offerings are pretty ordinary. The parking lot is full of buses idling and belching diesel fumes.If you want some good pictures of Budapest from above, go up there. But, that's about it.
Wonderful Views. Wonderful views of the city even from the lower level but worth walking up to the highest point where the statue is.
Best viewpoint in Budapest. If you want to see the Budapest town as on loof. Definitely visit this place. There is many stops during the walk up to take a rest, photo of Budapest.

Nice for a walk and the view. Gellert Hill gives you the best view over Budapest. At the same time it gives you an opportunity for a peacefull walk away from the city noice. Take a path on the Danub side, and you will have several opportunities to view the Pest side, the river and the handsome bridges. On the very top you can see The Statue of Independence. A lovely lady with a palm over her head. Originaly erected in 1947 in tribute to the Soviet troops liberating Hungary from facism. Today the dedication is a bit changed. You can see that the text has been changed. In fact the statue was originally made for the hungarian facist ruler Horty to comemorate his pilot son, who was shot down over Soviet during the war, but it was not erected before 1947.

Spectacular views. Gellert Hill is a must-see on any visit to Budapest simply because of the unparalleled views from the top of the hill. We took the Hop on Hop off bus but it can also be reached via city transit, taxi, or simply walking the well-marked and maintained walkway that begins behind the Gellert thermal baths.
Sunny skies and classic art. On a lovely sunny day we visited this beautiful monument, though we couldn't understand what it stood for - no English translation sadly.

Amazing view of the city. For people who are in shape take the hike in the woods by stairs starting near the gellert hotel and up to the statue. The air is so clean to vreath and the top when you get to the libert statue ,the views are beautiful.
scenic view. we took the bus as far as it would take you and walked up the rest, there isn't really much to see at the top but you do get a great view over the city
Great walk. It surely worth the walk to the top. The view of the city is stunning. Also really romantic, and for free!

Worth the climb. Absolutely worth the climb, fantastic views from the top, best time to go (in summer) is just before sunset to get good photos from the top, there are plenty of benches to rest on the way up.

great morning exercise. We walked up Gelllert Hill and it was a great morning exercise! The view is beautiful both from climbing and from upstairs.
When arriving to the statue the wind was very strong and nothing much left to do there but to check the view... We've continued walking directly to the Buda castle.
Best view of Budapest. We visited here in a sunny day. On top of the hill, we saw the stunningly beautiful view of Buda and Pest. It's worth visiting!
Beautiful Views. This is a must see if you want beautiful views. The statues themselve are nice but you go for the views.

A liitle bit of history and great views. As part of a shore excursion from the Emerald Sun Danube Delights cruise we had a Sunday walking tour of Gellert Hill.The bullet and shrapnel damage to the bastion walls reminds one of how fierce the battle was in WW11 and it is so tragic that the meaning of the statue took nearly 40 years to be realised.

Hard climb for those who can comfortable ride by bus. Climb to see the views and enjoy the chalenge for whoever can
Don't miss the Citadel garden the walk is pleasant and much easier

Fantastic views. Took the number 5 bus and got off a the citadel, walked for 300 years to the entrance. Perfect for taking photos looking over the Danube and the city. If you want you can walk back down via the paths. A must.
Sightseeing. Excellent sightseeing venue. Very historic setting. More sign age in English could be helpful to allow one appreciate area better.

Nice little walk. Walked up to the statue with my three year old son and he walked all the way to the top, amazing views of Budapest when you reach the top. If you have difficulties walking then better to catch a tour bus or some transport, when you get to the top there is places to buy food and drinks, both soft and alcoholic. There is also parks on the way up to the statue for younger ones

Fun walk up to the top!. We walked over the Elisabeth Bridge, and checked out the outside of the old Turkish Baths and some of the old fences along he Gellert Hill side of the street before going up. The walk up is a combination of stairs and ramps, with several good lookout points at well as the St. Istvan monument to stop and look at. Walked around the edge of the citadel to the statues at the top. The views of the city are great up there and the price is right (free!). There is interesting information posted on the outside of the Citadel explaining some of it's history.On you way up, you constantly have to decide whether to go left or right, we just kept picking a way and eventually got there, I don't think any of the ways really get you off track. Definitely worth the walk up though (or take a bus if needed). Doesn't burn up much time if you are in a hurry, or you can take more time if you desire.
Great view. Pretty steep hill. The fort was closed when we got there. Dont know if it is always like that. Theres a bar 100 m from the top/fort. We walked all the way, but you can also take the bus
Worthy of a vist. Worth a visit with great views at the top. A couple of bars and eating places on the top. The statue itself is one of Budapest's landmarks.

Beautiful View!. For a beautiful view of the city, Gellert Hill is the best. We walked up using the stairs and ramps. The path is wide, and relatively straight forward, taking about 30 minutes at an easy pace (including in-between photo stops). Recommended! Tip: If walking at night, the path isn't lit with lighting all the way, so it will be dark, thus a torch app on a phone is useful.

Not for the unfit. We had a walk up the hill just for the views which were very good. If you aren't fit or active maybe go to Castle hill which you can access by the funicular. Either one will give you a nice view of Pest.

What a view of the city!. Even thought we were walking by at least seven hours every day... Walking to the top of the hill was a real sacrifice hahahaha... But all worth indeed. The city view from there is unique!!!!

The best view!. You simply cannot visit Budapest without seeing the views from the top of this hill. You can hike up as we did, or I am sure you can get a lift up too. It was one of the highlights of our weekend and its well worth seeing.

A Must. It is a must if you are visiting Budapest, Great reason to visit Buda and see Peste from a high point. I was a very hot day when i visited so make sure you have plenty of water and suitable clothes and your camera for great view.

Best view of the city . The hike up the hill will take anywhere from 20-40 minutes depending on physical ability and weather. It's an amazing view of the city. I only wish I had gone at night to get pictures with lights all around the city

Fantastic views day and night. We went here twice as the views are great day and night. The statue is worth seeing and walk up and around so you can see all sides. There is toilets there, chargeable, but aSo there is cafe if you have time to stop for refreshments. The evening view is fantastic and if you can only go once then make it at night.
Amazing views. We decided to track up the steps for this view and I'm so glad we did the views are breathtaking. You can get a bus though.

A s fabulous sight. Bara hotel is near to the Gellert hill. If you can walk it would be a nice experience. If you have the city tour by HO/HO you can stop here,. The hill and church and the statue are feast to the eyes. if you have time you can have a walk. from the hill the Danube river and the panoramic view of the city is great

Cool views of the city. You can have a full panoramic view from Gellert hill and it's a short hike from where the Hop on hop of bus leaves you, so it's worth checking it out if you're into city views from 235 meters above sea level. I suppose it must be more exciting at night though.
Worth a visit. If you're already have a HO/HO bus ticket, you might as well stop at this spot. Lovely statue and interesting history to the fortress. Excellent view of Budapest for photo shoots.

Nice attraction. Not a lot happening around it. the whole place was shut down for some reason, but getting to this monument is a short walk from the bus drop off point.
One of the attraction that mus be seen while there. views of the city from there and simply beautiful day or night

A taste of Budapest with some fabulous panoramic views. The history of this part of Budapest is fascinating, and the views alone are worth the climb or bus ride up. You get practically panoramic views of the Danube, the Pest side and some great views of the Buda hills as well. This was the view that really gave me a handle on how big Budapest actually is! I had a four-year-old with me, and it is a pretty safe place to let them have some space to move and climb, but to also get some great pictures with them.

Panoramic views of the great city.. The place is situated on a hill with steep slopes so unless you are very fit or stay nearby it's advisable to use some means of transportation or reach by Hop on - Hop Off bus. The bus will drop you very near to the landmark that you will reach after around 10 mins walk up the hill with a gentle slope.The statue and other sculptures are great by themselves but they are overshadowed by magnificent panoramic views of river Danube and the city. Along the way up there are a few benches where you can sit, relax, catch up your breath and enjoy the views.Just spectacular and worth a visit.

Spectacular Views. We climbed up the rather steep incline for the Gellert Hotel side. Was worth the hard work to see the views though. It's a good walk but well worth it. Suggestion would be to use the hop on hop off bus rather than test your self in 30 degrees of heat
Walk it. The walk was well worth it for the views from the high ground over the city. Give your legs, lungs and eyes a treat.
Must visit. Nice area. Take the Hop on Hop off bus tour and you will end up at this location. Just walk up the Hill from bus stop.It worth the walk. Lots of History about the Hungarians.

A look over Budapest from Buda1. IOf you visit this and you are in any way infirm do not climb the hill straight up past the Gellert Statue. It is a steep climb we are both in our 60's and we were stopping a few times and out of puff at the top. Buses do go to the top on a gentle climb from further into Buda! The views from the top are stunning and there is a small cafe!
Nice little hike. This is a nice hike up the hill. Quiet a few stairs up, but once you up you will have nice view on the city from each side. Another must see if you are in Budapest.

Worth the hike!. It's kind of a hike up but you'll be glad you did it. Amazing view of Budapest and lovely statue. Not to mention, puts you in a good location to hit some of the sights on that side of town such as the local market
Week in Budapest. Nice hike up the mountain (but you can drive it too). FREE to see. Lots of people so go early if you want few people in the pics. Good view of the Pest side of Budapest.
Breath-taking. It's a long, steep walk but certainly worth the sweating! The views of the Danube and city are breath-taking (pardon the pun!)

Magnificent. To on stand on Gellert Hill under the magnificent statue is one of the highlights of my visit to Budapest, and the view over the Danube to the city is magnificent, if you have time on your visit take a taxi to the hill, you will not be disappointed.

Really good panoramic view of vudapest. We took a bus up to Gellert hill and caught the sunset. It was really beautiful when you see the last rays of the sun cast upon the city. We even brought food up and the sun sets really late and by then we were already hungry. Be careful not to stay too late as the way down is quite dark. We used iPhone torch to navigate our way out of the park.
Nice to see and learn about.. This is a really intresteing area to see, we done the red bus hop on hop off. nice area for picnic if weather is nice.
A nice view. After a simple walk(different trails) you arrive there and there is a wonderful view over Budapest. It's worth.

Best view of Budapest . I imagine if you take a walk up this hill you are going to feel it. But there are a lot of bus services as well as the hop on hop off ones that go up here. & it is definitely worth the trip the view from the top is like no other one you will see in Budapest

worth the hike!. Spectacular view of the city from this location. Very scenic hike up to this point. Shaded trees along the pathway make it pleasant. Avoid very hot days for the hike as there is no water or food available along the path.

A bit of a walk. Walk up the hill through a wonderful old garden. Must have water bottle. Peak at views all around Budapest until you get to the top for a 360degree look out. Steeped in history which is well recorded at the site

Best views of Buda and Best. They were preparing for an event or something, so some areas was closed off incl. around the statue, which was a disappointment. However, the hike but the hill was full of great views of both Buda and Pest.

Brilliant views of the city. The Gellert hill is more than just a great viewpoint with sweeping vistas of Budapest. It houses some important statues such as the Liberty Statue which was erected by the soviet army as a symbol of their victory in World War. It shows a girl holding an olive branch which is a symbol of freedom from the oppression.On either side are another couple of important statues, one of a powerful young man overpowering and slaying a dragon and the other is of a man facing the city with a burning torch in his hand, another symbol of freedom struggle. Almost the entire city is also visible from various points atop the hill and there are plenty of vistas for the shutterbugs to spend half an hour here.
Great photo stops. Super views from the top of Buda side. Can be a bit if a walk depending on how far up the hill the traffic police will let your driver go.
Scenic. There is a local bus to the Citadel & a shortish uphill trek. Visitors are not permitted to the front area of the statue....hoardings obstruct. Views across the city are rewarding.
Nice walk up and down, good view!. This is on the Buda side. Nice walk, not too far, but quite steep. Great view on the river and the Pest side of Budapest.

The best place for night view of Budapest!!!. Visited the hill in the night for night view of the city, and this is the very right choice after I went to the hill!! This is basically the highest place for you to enjoy the while view of the city and it is not difficult to approach by taking bus 27 in the Buda area. Don't miss this place if you are addicted to night view when you are traveling.

Amazing vistas of the city. A must see if you visit Budapest. The views from here are stunning, as are the statues and buildings, you really do get a full view of Budapest. Make sure your camera is charged up. Fantastic

Don't give up and go there on foot. It's quite cool to see Budapest from the hills, but it's certainly cooler if you get there on foot. The statue is not that nice if you look at it on the photos, but it's kind of emotionally involving when you reach for it.Lots of tourist though (due to the buses coming up from the other side of the hill), but you can still take pretty good pics from up there.
Amazing view. We walked up this hill on a very hot day but it was totally worth the effort. The view of Budapest was superb.

Best Views of the City. We went up with s private tour guide who shared the history of the hill with us and explained how the statue became their "statue of liberty" after the Soviets left. The history of the various statues and the Citadel are interesting, but the best reason to make the trip to the hilltop is the fabulous views. We were there during a fairly hot, cloudless day and could see for miles. We hope to go back to Budapest and would go back during the day and at night. The views are stunning!

Spectacular view. A must see in Budapest. From here you get a full view of Budapest. Breathtaking view and breathtaking climb to the hill. It was 35 Celsius when we went here, so the climb was a bit of too much. But you can get to the top with a bus and a cab.

Go during day, then during night for a beautiful view. The hill itself has a lot of history, but you will appreciate, after a 5-10 min climb, the fantastic view it provides over Buda and Pest. Climb it before sunrise for an amazing shot of the city's iconic architectural masterpieces, or at night for a view that rivals that of Paris. Bring alcohol and good company for the perfect outing event!

Statues & Views. We climbed up the Buda Castle hill to the Gilbert Hill which was strategic point for the Hapsburg rulers, being the highest point in Budapet from where they could keep a look out for both Buda & Pest towns then.Accordingly, they built a Citadell fortifications with a 60 cannons which was kept only as a threat without being made of use.Later after the Hungarians recaptured the place, they used it only to attract the tourists like us to visit! You got lovely views from here during dusk & stunning ones later at night.There is also a rather non descript & ugly statue of a child but the statue of Liberty with a woman figure holding an olive branch,the symbol of peace; has a more symbolic value with the victory of the child over the dragon symbolising the victory over facsism.It commemorates those who laid down their lives for independence,freedom & prosperity of Hungary.
Lovely Statue. Great view from the boat and also from the hop-on hop- off bus. the week we stayed was extremely hot otherwise we would have walked closer to see it.

Excellent view. We walked across the Liberty bridge to Gellert hotel and with the temp at 39 degrees made the long climb to this delightful view across budapest, the statue is cool as well. Do it when not as hot.
great view. we visited the hill at night and the view was amazing. we took the bus so we didn't have to walk that much.

Stunning view. One of my favorite places in the city. I really like walking up to the hill from the Liberty bridge side, after eating some delicious fruit at the Market Hall. As you rise to the top of the mountain you experience better and better views to the Southern part of the city (Technical University, Corvinus -business- university, the Whale, Liberty bridge, Market Hall, and overall the city).

Great exercise and even greater view. We took the stairs from across Liberty Bridge. On a hot day (+34C) it's very good for cardio exercise, but one get fully rewarded reaching the top. A beautiful view to all the bridges, landmarks and towers. Probably even greater at night. The decent is just as challenging as going up :-)

The View is Awesome - But Understand the Statue is about Ugly.. To be honest I have lived here for 13 years. The view at night is absolutely worth it and you must do it. You can see most of the best bridges, the Castle and the river. My problem with the Statue is that it is a Soviet "Liberation" monument and I believe in truth. Variations of these statues were located in every major city in the Soviet Union and captured lands, loosely based on the Mother Russia model. It was not a Liberation, it was an occupation with a brutal Communist regime. The monument should be removed and put in the Statue Graveyard which is another tourist attraction (Statue Park). The Soviet War Memorial at Freedom Square can remain because it honors the lives of brave men who fought for what they believed, but this should go. The Soviets erected this after the defeat of Hungary in World War II. Sorry, the truth.
Great landmark. Well worth seeing, great views, and the hop on hop off buses take you up there, so you don't have to walk.

view from the hill. Away from the downtown area of the city you have gellert Hill the monument is situated at the top of the hill and like most of the statues in Budapest it's a monumental piece of work, The hungarians love there heritage and the views of the danube and the city are fantastic take the time to see more of this beautiful city and it's history,

Stunning view at sunset. The view from Gellert Hill to the Church of St. Stephen, Chain Bridge, the Parliament, the Danube River and other attractions is fantastic, especially during sunset. The climb walk drains your stamina a bit, but is worth every step. For those who prefer, another option is to take the tram to the top of the hill. It is also interesting to visit the Citadel and read a little about the history of this building.
Unrivaled views. Views from this location unbelievable and unobstructed. Walk or use the funicular railway or bus of course.

Walking Tour of Citadel & The Castle. Sadly the Citadel was closed but views from the top were very good but need a clear day. Also need a good pair of walking shoes and take water if hot day as the climb is quite exhausting for the older person.

Cool story about the statue and awesome views.. The walk up has so many different trails. Make sure you have something to drink with you.The 'statue of liberty' is kind of cool. It was built in 1947 to thank the Soviet soldiers for liberating Hungary. In 1989, during the fall of communism, they put a veil over the statue and then later proclaimed it the statue of liberty, changing the inscription on the statue. Its meaning has since changed :)There are awesome views of the city from here. I would also recommend the views from the castle which is not too far of a walk. It's a couple kilometres west of Gellert, on the same side.

A great walk or run if you're reasonably fit, get the bus if not, but go there for the view. We strolled up the path from the bridge, there are places to pause and take in the interim viewpoints before joining the crowds at the top.From there you have great views across the river to Pest and over the hilly and green suburbs of Buda. There are cafés should you need to recoup!

Super view over looking the city.. Hiked up here when the temperature was 43! Perhaps not the ideal climate to do it in but well worth it once you get to the top for the views alone. Stunning!There are many paths up to the top none of which are signposted but just follow the general direction and you'll end up there.

Great history, statues and view.. Wonderful view from the top! Very nice statues too. I really enjoyed the Hungarian history on the side of the Citadella. They have almost consistently been under siege since the mid 1800s. Great hike up the hill. My iPhone said 26 stories. Busses go up too.
View is amazing. Really enjoyed this, stunning building full of interesting history, plus the view of the city from here is great. def one to see.
A tough walk but worth it!. A must for truly amazing views and photos of the city! A great way to spend a lazy afternoon! Not for the unfit or lazy tourist!

Great views!. Great views of Budapest from the top of Gellert Hill. I climbed from the Elizabeth Bridge, and it took me slightly under 30 mins. Some parts of the climb can be steep - I guess it was more difficult for me because I was lugging camera gear and a tripod. Go at sunset - it's magical seeing the city light up. Note however that it gets chilly up there after sunset, and the path down isn't lighted. Bring a torch if you have to, or use your phone's. I also didn't see any stalls or toilets at the top.

Best views in Budapest. It's worth making your way up this hill for the amazing views of the Danube, Buda, and Pest. There is also the Citadel, a Communist leftover, and a closer look at the sculptures you've been seeing from far away. The views are amazing though... literally one of the best in Europe!

Great at Night. This was the best night we had in Budapest! We bought a bottle of wine and some food and went climbing up the hill to reach the top. The climb isn't that much and the paths have railings if you're struggling but it's not that far to walk up When you reach the top, the view is worth everything! That's why it's great to go at night to see the city all lit up at night, this is amazing and I recommend it to anyone! Once you're up there, you are greeted with couples and groups of people having great funGo open a bottle of wine and enjoy the night with friends at the Gellert Hill and Statue :)

Crowed but worth it. The best view of Budapest for sure. The Castle bearing the scars of an obviously intense battle in WW2 is worth it on its own.Be prepared for the crowds and the traffic is a nightmare, don't consider driving yourself here and the walk would be too much for most.

Nice overall view of both sides of the Danube. If taking the local bus, please note that it is a bit of an uphill walk to the entrance of the Citadella from the bus stop. Once you get there, though, there is a viewing area just before the entrance where you have a great view of both the Buda and Pest sides of the Danube. Opposite this viewing area there is a tap (against the wall) where one can fill and drink a bottle of fresh spring water. This was a nice bonus as it was really very hot and we were very thirsty. Lots of walking trails on this hill although some looked a bit isolated. Overall, a nice place to chill and to take in the skyline of Budapest.
Trip july 2015. A modern construction, raised during the communism era, impressive by its clean style, position and view of Budapest that offers from the hill.

Specatacular views and monument. The monument itself is fascinating, the views from here unbeatable, and the history of the citadel is amazing. Well worth it! Can go by bus, or a good hike up from Gellert Baths all the way to the top!

Fantastic view, downside you need to go there with tour bus. I loved the view from up there. It's magnificent. But we were that you need take a bus tour to go up there. Make sure you go up when the bus are going up there when busses are going up/down with short intervals. You can use 30 min. up there.

The beautiful view from top is totally worth it!. The view from the hill is amazing and it continues when we walk down towards the Gellert thermal bath. (Our plan was to hike along Buda and end the city tour with thermal bath at Gellert) FYI, there are many ways to get to the top and there aren't clear signs on the way, so just head the general direction (zigzag here and there) and you will see the Citadel soon.

The view from here will worth the trip!. The view from here will definitely worth the trip up here. Great photo opportunities, possibly the best ones in Budapest! Virtually all of the tour buses go up here.

Potentially exhausting walk, but views are totally worthwhile. I fear the potentially exhausting walk to the summit may deter many, especially as I can imagine many finding the statue somewhat anticlimactic. Regardless, I loved the walk up, the views are fantastic, the story behind the statue is a bit depressing and should you make your way to the top of Gellert Hill, I suggest you do so in anticipation of the view

Many ways lead to Gellért-hegy. The way up is quite long but as you can see in the other comments the view is worth it. When we arrived there we where really hungry and thought there would be a restaurant or at least a food stand. But everything was closed because of the season (March 2015). Would be good to check that first. But still a nice place to visit when you are in Budapest.

Lovely walk and nice sights. A lovely walk to the top of the hill which takes around 20 mins. Once at the top you get a lovely view of the city, river and castle district. We did this walk first thing in the morning and then moved on to the castle district as they are quite close to each other.

Lovely View. We went to Gellert hill by tram and bus combination. Walked up the hill slightly after getting off at the bus stop. The hill consists of a citadel and the Liberty monument. From all angles, the views from the hill are spectacular. A very nice spot to stroll abound and take some classy pictures. A good tourist spot to visit.

View!. This is a 235m high dolomite hill. It has a spectacular view from the top. It has had different names through history. During the middle ages it was called Kelen-hegy, Pesti-hegy and Blocksberg. Then during the Turk period it was called Gürz Elyas bayiri because of a holy man whose shrine was at the top of the hill. A bishop, called St. Gerard, played a significant role in the spread of Christianity in Hungary. Legend goes that in 1046 this saintly person was killed by the pagans in the great pagan rebellion. The pagans locked St. Gerard into a barrel and rolled it down the hill down towards the Danube. The hill was named Gellert Hill in the 15th century. This hill has the Liberty Monument on top. This monument was designed by Zsigmond Kisfaludyi Stróbl. It is a symbol of liberation from the Nazi rule. It was built in 1947 and placed on the Gellert Hill. It shows a woman holding a palm branch in her upraised arms. The statue is 14 meters high and is affixed on a 26 m high base. There is an inscription on the base which says, " To those who gave up their lives for Hungary’s independence, freedom and prosperity."

made it to the top. we walked up because we didn't join a tour, so no bus nor car. beautiful along the trail, stopped and took pictures, at the top, even better, the statues are so grand. you can see the panorama view of budapest.

Great view. It's worth it! The view of the city is the best from here. Even though you will have to walk uphill for a while, I believe that you won't regret it. It is best to visit on a nice but not too hot day because you will probably sweat a lot until you reach the top, but when you do you will have time to enjoy the view and be proud of yourself.
Good. We make the climn by night, a bit difficult because all the paths aren't lightned... But great view of the city !
Great historical value. Our guide included this stop while touring the city. He shared the history of each statue. Very interesting and well maintained.

Nice views. We only walked about half way up the hill as it was a very hot day and we were becoming very tired. We reached the cross and took some nice pictures from up high of the buildings across the river and it was very lovely. Just wished there had been a small cafe as we were heading up so we could re-hydrate and continue on!
Now I have seen it..... Nice park around the statue but else there is not much to see. You have to walk up a bit to get there. The finist look is from Donau.
A great view of the city. A long walk but worth the pain considering the view you can have on the city. Some small cafe to take a drink.
Great!. Much easier walk to the statue that expected after reading the reviews on here. I think one side is much better than the other. Great walk, great view - just wished the Citadella was open!

Best views over the city. Totally worth taking the walk up the mountain. The views from up there are just breathtaking.
A must go :)

Walkers paradise. Don't take a bus! This is worth the walk from the bottom of the hill. The views change as you walk up and after the fabulous cakes we'd been eating we really needed a bit of exercise. The views extend 360 around Budapest. Make sure you use the toilet stop (and the coffee shop) then walk down the other side and either to the caves or Castle Hill. AND -don't forget the camera.

Very hilly. Worth the walk up a steep hill. You may need to take it slowly at present due to the heatwave we are experiencing at present.also talk a bottle of water as you may need rehydrating after your climb

Amazing views of Budapest - best vantage point. This statue has a very interesting history for the Hungarians. They originally wanted an angel. During Soviet occupation, the statue was changed to a woman carrying a palm ( former wing). The Soviet soldier statues were moved to another park and the statues of people now represent all who served for the good of Hungary.
a fabulous view over the city. We walked to the top of the Citadella as had heard the view was worth the fairly long climb. We were not disappointed, it was spectacular. Well worth the achy limbs.

42•C degrees but the view is worth the sweat! . We visited yesterday and it was hot work up the hill - if you are going in summer being at least two litres of water with you! It was worth it though, we enjoyed it and the view was great. Round trip is only around an hour taking it pretty slowly.
Guided tour. Didn't get chance to go up close. Saw fro below on guided tour of city. Looks lovely lit up at night.
good place for walk and photo. palce to walk and relax, Very quiet. There you can have dinner in a restaurant with great view. Big bus route stops there.

The best spot to enjoy the sight of the city. Since it was originally designed to honor the brave soldiers of the Great Soviet Army, there were soldiers by the footstool of the statue, but after the fall of the socialist area, it was decided to remain a statue of liberty, because liberty is good - if we can separate it from the Soviets.Nevertheless it really is a great spectacle, which deserves to honor liberty - the universal liberty, which all of us need. But that is not why it is an obligatory visit if you are in Budapest.There is no other place in the city where you get such a splendid view! If you would like to take panorama pictures of Budapest, come here. If you are planning to take night photos, come here. Thinking about a time-lapse video? The best spot is here. If you want to capture the true beauty of Budapest, or just enjoy the view, there is no better place to visit!

Amazing views. It is a long walk up to the top, but the view is spectacular. It's a great place to take the kids if they need to burn off some energy. It was very hot when we visited (August) but I bet it is even more enjoyable in the fall.
Impressive. I found that the most impressive view of this statue was actually from the river. However it's always a good photo op for the family when you are at the foot of it.
Great view from there. Great view over the whole city from up there. Not to tidy though but absolutely a place to see after checking out the Citadella

Take the bus to go there. The Citadel and the area around is also a must to visit place, but if you would like to go there on foot be prepared to climb couple of hundred steps, I highly recommend to take the local bus!

The fountain under the Saint was beautiful.. We did not go all the way to the top, but only to the statue of the Saint. It is walkable. There is a beautiful fountain below the statue, not far from the street level. Be careful of the broken glass that you may find on the stairs.

Wonderful view. Took a bus tour,hop on hop off, which took us through most of Budapest and to Gellert hill. The bus is very frequently coming there, so we took a tour on foot of the hill, nice view of Pesta,good photo oportunity. There are a couple of places for food and drinks on the hill, also clean bathroom facilities.

Challenging Walk, View is the Payoff. Yes, do bring water for your hike up the hill. There are plenty of places to stop along the way and take great photos. At the top it does get crowded, but relax and you will find a way to get to the views across the river or turn around and look up at the Liberty Statue.

Great views. Walked up at night. Gradient not too bad but temperature can be a challenge (hence night walk). No public transport goes to the top. Advise taking water with you. The scale of the statue is hard to take in and photos don't do it justice. Views across the city are amazing. There are some cafe's on the approach road. Unless you are on a bus tour or get a taxi, be prepared for a walk.

Outstanding View. From the top of Gellert Hill, by the Citadel, on a clear day you get an extraordinary view of Budapest and the Danube. One of the most spectacular panoramic views of my now 4 month trip in Europe. The Freedom Monument and the Citadel are also great to see and find out about.

Hike it and you will appreciate it more!. When I first saw the statute off in the distance lit up a night... I knew that I had to see it.We walked from our hotel and then up we went. There are benches and small smaller lookouts that give you good views of the city. When finally reaching the top we had amazing views of the city. And we got to look at some 'great' Soviet Style architecture.

Great views over Budapest. The statue is at the top of a hill but well worth the climb, it is in a nice park, and the views over Budapest are super. At the bottom of the hill is the rock church which is also worth a visit, it is actually in the rock.

Big hill! But definitely worth it!. We made the mistake of going here in the heat of the day so the walk up was very hot! This being said, it only took us like 20 mins including a brief water stop. We walked up from the Gellert Hotel side. If doing the same be sure to refill your water bottle at the fountain outside the hotel as nowhere to do so en route. The walk up is very shaded by trees. The area walking up did smell a bit of wee and there was quite lot of litter around, which did spoil some of the views. However all of this was forgotten when we reached the top. The statue itself is massive! It's a shame to see that some people have put chewing gum on it and some graffiti. The views from the top of the hill were spectacular.

Find the right way to the top.... Otherwise it will be a pretty exhausting trip. Coming from the gellert Hotel it felt much more challenging than the road which is also taken by the Busses. At least it felt so for US. On the top you have a great Panorama and at Night an absolutley lovely romantic athmossphere even though there can be a ton of tourists - but there is enougj space for all ppl

steep walk well worth it. a steep walk up to the top but worth it when you get there fantastic views of the city from here the building was closed when we were there but there was information boards on the outside we walked around the building and there are bullet holes in the walls from when Hitler was there in the second world war !!

Best view in Budapest. Great views of the city and winding river with its bridges and the parliament building from up here, especially at sunset. If you use the Hop on busses, becareful the don't leave you behind! They don't wait!

The view. After you spend half a day walking up the hill getting to this old bunker you will be very surprised at the amazing view. From this hill you were able to see the entire city. There's a really cool restaurant at the top that serves really good food if your hungry but I recommend waiting into you get back down if you're hiking back.

See it at night!. The hike to the top of the hill to see this amazing Statue is well worth it, especially at night when it is all lit up and for the views it gives of the Danube River and the city. Allow plenty of time to read the timeline of the city on the walk to the statue, and make sure you descend the steps from the statue to the river. The stairs are built into the hillside and they are near the Gellert Hotel and convenient to the subway and bus lines.

Great view over the city. In the summer it's a very warm walk so please remember some water. I prefer to walk from the small roads next to the Geller hotel. On that way there's a playground on the way that children can play on, if you are traveling with children

Amazing!. Me and my brother (aged 19 and 14) went up this mountain together. It took us appr. 15 minutes to get on top, but we went quite fast, though enjoying the amazing view. I suggest you take the left side when you are at the first steps. The view is AMAZING and it's really fun to do. Also, we did this when it was 37°C so it was quite warm but do-able because of the shadows we could walk through. Make sure you have some anti-mosquito stuff on you, you never know ;) . Would definitely recommend! :)

Highest point. It's so high up here the view is brilliant on a clear day. It's also great to reach the statue of the woman as you can see it from the whole of Budapest. The park is nice too so the walk is pleasant.

Amazing Views. The hill gives you a great panoramic view of the city and the weather up there is perfect.. The statues is really nice too.. However there is nothing else up there, no facilities during winter times.. Not sure in the summer.
Great views. The statue is an impressive structure and good to look at close up as well as from a distance. Nice to walk around the area and admire the views.

What a walk but so worth it!. The statue was beautiful once you climb the steep steps and hills to the highest point in Buda. I don't believe there is any other way to get to the top and back down again besides walking. Once you catch your breath, it is taken away again. The view was so breathtaking of the Danube, the bridges, and the Pest side. The statue was first erected in 1947 in remembrance of what was then referred to as the Soviet liberation of Hungary during World War II, which ended the occupation by Nazi Germany. The statue had an inscription that was translated to me by a local.."To the memory of those all who sacrificed their lives for the independence, freedom, and prosperity of Hungary."
Views. great views from up there - a 'decent' walk. We couldn't find a way in to visit the Citadel but the sign giving the history was detailed.

Awesome!. This is also a must for the traveller to Budapest. This statue stands high and proud and a visit to the top is definitely worthwhile. There tends to be a lot of walking in Budapest so wear comfy shoes so you can enjoy the many wonders that await you either visually, structurally and architecturally.
Amazing view of Budapest! . Highest point of Budapest! After climbing up the stairs, you will see the amazing view of Budapest. Definitely it worths to climb!
Worth the Climb. It's a spectacular statue and the views of the Danube and the city on the way up are stunning. Free and good for your health!!

A good workout walking up. I did my walk up first thing in the morning to avoid the crowds and heat. I believe it took around thirty minutes. The paths were well looked after and a lot of flowers and green space. There is an option to take a road up to the top, but if you are active at all you shouldn't have any issues with the hike. Great views from the top and a history of the area and statue are your reward.
Amazing view and must visit. The beautiful site of Budapest, you could see the beauty of Danube and the whole city. We would say go in Sunday
Busy place. A lot of people are taking pictures of themselved in fron of this statue. If you want to photgraph it witout people you might need some time during the summer months

Challenging climb. Didn't make it all the way to the top, so we've been working out so we complete the climb next time. Beautiful views even half way up. There are food stands at the bottom for a quick snack.

Not Worth the Climb. I love the story of St. Gellert but the view, much obstructed by overgrown trees, is not great compared to St Stephens or Fisherman's Bastion. The park could be fantastic if they ever cared enough to take care of it.
WORTH THE CLIMB. It was an extremely hot and sweaty day the day we decided to climb up the steps but we were so glad we did it. The views are magnificent, it was well worth the effort.

Explore Gellért hegy - go down the path less trodden!. I used to live on this hill, believe it or not. Right underneath the Citadella. Many people take a bus up the hill, walk around the citadella and take a bus back to Pest, but that would be a shame. You'll miss out on two beatifull walks downhill.There are two ways to walk down Gellért hill and both are lovely. One is to take a path down from the citadella on the side of Elizabeth bridge and walk down that way. You'll come down beautiful steps at the end but more importantly, you'll walk trough a park that is the stuff of Hungarian legend.The other path I recommend is the one leading to the famous Gellért hotel. You'll pass by two playgrounds (great with kids although the big slides seem a little dangerous, if you have very small kids, walk further down to find the kiddie's playground almost at the end of the hill). This is where you'll find the Hungarian themselves out for a stroll and not many tourists. Go for a fancy tea in the Gellért (with Dobosz cake, of course) and you'll have spent a wonderful morning or afternoon. You can walk back to Pest and the Vaci ut by the 'freedom bridge'. Both paths can be done with a stroller (I did it all the time) but it is an obstacle course...so beware.

Amazing place. This is where St. Gellert was martyred in the 11th century by being thrown off the hill in a nail studded barrel. AS gruesome as that was the hill is today so lovely and fashionable that it houses the most expensive real estate in Budapest. The area is very nice and splendid for a walk and viewing the statues.
Stunning views. Well worth the walk up for the gorgeous views of such a beautiful city. Avoid the wooded area at night and take the road up instead, just using common sense.

Magnificent monuments, breathtaking views. The monuments are breathtaking. They truly represent both the struggles for communism and joys of liberation. The views are some of the most incredible anywhere - seeing Buda and Pest with the Danube river and bridges across the two cities.
Worth the climb. We had a baby cart with us, so it was a long and sweaty climb up the hill. I'm still glad we did it, because the view over the city was amazing!

Great views!. We visited Gellert spa (an absolute must when in the city) and afterwards, feeling refreshed and relaxed took a stroll up Gellert hill. We were not disappointed. The views over the city from here are lovely..
Great views from up here!. If you start at the bottom of the hill it takes about 20 minutes to hike to the top. But the hike is well worth the views of the Danube and Budapest.

Best view I have ever seen! Highlight of my trip!. First of all I definitely recommend going up around an hour before sunset. This way you can get your pics during the day light and also after the city lights have come on. Originally I was going to walk up but due to the 37 degree heat, I decided to get the bus instead. After coming out of the Móricz Zsigmond körtér metro station into a big square, it was quite difficult to find the number 27 bus which more or less takes you to the top of the hill. After finding the bus (which is at the side of a big Spar shop), the ride took roughly 10 minutes to get to the top, and then it's a further 10 minute walk up to the viewpoint and statue. There are also a couple of places to get food and drink at the top.

An Eagle's View of Budapest.. A great vantage point to behold the sight and lights of Budapest. Many tourist buses should attest to the popularity of this site where it gives the visitor an amazing and awesome view of the City. This is one of the few highlights of our holidays.

View from Gellert Hill. Although this mightn't be a must-see for a lot of people, and there mightn't be loads to do, the views over the city from up high are so amazing that I just had to give this a five star review. Not to mention that the place is so easy to get to- you can go by tour bus, regular bus or tram, and of course if you're in the city centre anyway, it's only a short walk over, if you use the likes of Chain Bridge! But the funicular is a huge attraction as well- it's just such a quick, fun way to get to the top of the hill, not to mention that it saves you a long walk on a hot day! And the views from the top of the hill are definitely worth getting five stars!!
Great History. Beautiful views to be had from here and we loved the murals filled with history. Our daughter loved running in the garden area and having her photo made by the beautiful flowers.

Use bus 27. What a view! They removed the statue in the middle due to politics, and the citadel is closed, but the view... amazing.There are a lot of tourist busses but simply use any tram from Deák Ferenc (end station of 47, 48, 49), change at Móricz Zsigmond körter, and take the half-sized blue bus 27.You will find bus 27 to the left of tram 61 and pointing towards the square - it will then start the tour by making a u-turn.Leave at the "Citadella" stop and follow the signs or do like the locals and stroll through the park, and past the playground. Both tram and bus leave every 7-8 min so it will be much faster and more fun than using a hop on/off bus.
Very Beautiful - Must visit. Beautifel place! One of our favourite attractions on Budapest... The view from the hill is absolutly outstanding!

a Must SEE in Budapest. This place is a MUST if you are in Budapest, it is hard to conquer if your coming from the Gellert Bath side, but what you see from the top, its amazing, you can see the whole city.
Beautiful Views. If you are going up to Castle Hill it is worth carrying on to see the Statue. Fantastic views again of the City from Gellert Hill. Well worth a visit.

Memorial site with a wiev. Even it requires some physical excersice this place is worth seeing- Fantastic view over the whole Budapest. Citadelle nearby might interesting but it was in renovation during our visit.

Gently hike with nice views. These statues reward you after a very nice and gentle hike.
The view of Budapest is incredible from here, you can see for miles and miles. Lovely
beautiful view. the place itself is nothing interesting, everything is closed. but after sunset it is a place to visit, with an amazing view. you can see the lights of Budapest. it is an amazing city

Must visit!. walking up the hill was brutal in the heat. But it was very worth it. The view is amazing, the monument is beautiful. Bring enough water because we couldn't discover a restaurant or even a little shop that sells water.

Nice walk, beautiful view. The walk up the mountain was a bit harsh in the heat, but very nice and lush. Once we reached the top, we could gaze over the entire city.
Not a must see but worth the climb!
Best views of Budapest. Get the open top bus to here as it is very high up and very hot, there are couple of cafes here for refreshment thankfully. Great views and picture taking of a beautiful city

Worth seeing. This was just accross from our hotel so easy to wander over and visit. Also easy to get to since the underground has a station close by or a walk over the bridge after wandering the market in Pest
Fantastic walk. It was so great to finally get to the top of that hill and see the statue. You have fabulous views of the Danube and the city from there.
Great Hike and View. It is a short hike up with a lot of spots in between for viewing the city. The statue itself was not special but you can get 360 degree view of the city from here.
Must visit viewpoint. We visited Gellert hill and statue with our hop-on-hop-off bus tour and found it very nice and relaxing place to be.

Citadella & City Views. Walked up here within the first few hours of being in Budapest. Beautiful views from the top of the hill, fairly easy but steady climb up. You can see all of Pest, bridges, the Danube, just great. Worth every step!
Very nice!. Very nice to go here at night. The walk on the hill is a bit dangerous as the hill is not very well lit, but the view is magical!

Great views of Budapest. We walked up to the top in very hot weather from the Hotel Gellert. The path is easy to follow if you keep going up. It winds sideways at times. There are long flights of steps in poor condition. The Soviet-style statue is typical for its era. The views are worth lingering over.
gellert hill and citaddella. abeautiful sight to behod from the top, georgeous flowerseverywhere, meadows green, and easy access. Arduous climb, but good excercise.

Should be first stop as you arrive. We visited Budapest by car coming from Vienna.. This hill was our first stop. It gives you an overview of the city.It felt like watching the city inside a snowy glass ball and then getting a thumb small and starting to walk in the city streets inside the glass ball. Sounds more of Disney dreamy imagination but this is how it felt.
Walk Gellert Hill. Start at the bottom of Gellert Hill near the Gelllert Hotel and climb up the walking paths and steps to the top of the hill. Wonderful view and a nice experience
Great view. The soviet style statues on the top of the hill dominate the city.Floodlit at niight.Excellent views over the city.

Great views, but not a great deal else. Unless you are part of an organised tour, it is not the easiest place to get to if you don't want the very steep hike up the hill from the Danube bank. The secret is to get bus 27 from Mortez Zsigmond Korter. Once there, the views, from a different angle compared to Fisherman's Bastion, let you see the Danube far to the North of the city. Otherwise the Liberty Monument is massive, but typical Soviet era overblown and the Citadel was closed. However the street poster display of photos of different parts of Prague over the hundreds of years was very interesting, as was the information about the history of the Citadella displayed on its wall as you approach the Monument

Amazing view of budapest. Nice walk after a visit to the gallert baths , not too far up and an amazing view in the evening. Enjoy the walk down and take the chance to visit another nice statue on the way down towards the bridge
magnificent views. Magnificent views and very special feeling in the hill. A great place to take time out and just enjoy being.
stunning views!. Stunning views! and was worth the walk, i would go first thing in the morning, when it is cooler!!! it is a treak!! but beautiful!
A nice hike to the top of the Citadella. A nice hike to the top of the Citadella, you are rewarded with beautiful views of the city. Located near the Gellért Hotel and Thermal baths

Excellent views. Great place for views and a wonderful occasions to take many pictures of the Danube and the bridges. If you are not fit do not go on foot. A very simple way is the bus, it takes you all the way up to Citadella and from there it is a short walk.
The best view. Gellert hill has the best views to the Pest and castle hill. You can get there by bus or walk. We took the walk, it's a lot of stairs but definetly worth it!

The view. There are various ways to arrive there. I went there from Móricz Zsigmond körtér and it's not far. Enjoy the view during the walk and its recommended to go in the evening if want using Móricz Zsigmond körtér.

Offers a lovely view. A must do on a list of things to see and do in Budapest. Offers a fantastic view of the city, including the Danube and some of the bridges over it. Binoculars are extremely helpful and handy.
Amazing view.. Arrived on the hop on hop off bus and took the walk up to the statue to be treated to a spectacular panorama. One of the best city views I have seen.
the climb. took transit not really knowing where we were going. Approached from thehotel side and marched up the hill. Interesting sculptures on the way,

A hike, but well worth it. The hill is much higher then it seems and the hike up can be a bit of a challenge in the heat of the summer, but the stunning views of the city are well worth it. There are many criss crossing and winding paths up the hill, so it my be a bit confusing. The Citadella and the Red Army monument are not as impressive.
The walk is worth every footstep. On a hot summers day in Budapest the stroll through the trees to the top of the hill was surprisingly refreshing break.

A bit tiring. Great historic site to visit. We walked there and it was a bit too much in July heat, but then we took a boat tour later at night, and it was a totally different perspective! Don't go there if you have trouble walking, just take a boat tour on Danube and you will pass it by and see the hill and the statue very well.

Cave church (Sziklatemplom). Just next to Hotel Gellert there is this cave church with beautiful view to the bridge and the church itself is amazing.The cashier is so friendly and hospitable and the atmosphere is so special. Don't expect a baroque wow church because it is not that style, comparing to those it is quiet simple, it's beauty is coming from the art of Nature.
Gorgeous views. Gellert Hill is quite a walk on a hot day but the view is well worth it. The statue is also remarkable. At the top there is a fast food bar and also a park for children.

Beautiful momunents and views of Budapest. The place is reachable by car and when start to trek, a viewing deck after some stone monument will make for a beautiful photo of Budapest. Take an uphill hike further beside the Citadel you will find the Gellert Statues which also is an ideal place for an over-look photo of the city.

Little hike on the Buda side with a great view. Beautiful spot with a great view. I went for a run here, and depsite the tourist it was a great quick workout because of the uphills. If you are trying to burn off the last nights alcohol I recommend busing to the Buda side and hiking up this beginner mountain.

Amazing view. A little bit of a trek up the hill but once there it's great. An amazing view of the city and the statues atop the hill are brilliant. We went at night and my only complaint would be that at times the path isn't very well lit.

360 degree view over Buda and Pest. Walking up this hill is worth the view from the top. The statue is surprisingly tall and there is enough space around to sit down. Keep in mind: Take water! Also there are often many different paths intertwined leading up the face of the hill so it can sometimes become a little confusing to navigate.

Key sites in Budapest. Awesome site and must be on your to visit list when you are in Budapest. Just alongside is a really great Spa, I spent the day there and enjoyed the outdoor pool etc, very nice area.

Amazing Views- Go for the Sunset. My friends and I made the trek up this hill about an hour before the sun was supposed to set. The views from up here are incredible and the sunset we got was amazing. The walk is a little rough, but definitely worth the amazing picturesque views!
be prepared to climb. so many steps, i wanted to give up, but the view is amazing!! along the way, nice frozen lemon aid to keep you cool.

Spectacular view. The way we see it, there are two ways to get to Gellért Hill to see the Liberation Monument and the Citadel (Citadella). One way is to climb up the hill: you can, for instance, take the subway (M4) to Szt. Gellért tér station, come out right next to the Gellért Hotel and Baths Complex at the foot of Gellért Hill and start walking up the paths and steps right up to the Monument. The second way - which we chose and were really glad about it afterwards when we were walking down the hill and saw all the tired and sweaty people going up, it was a really hot day, about +34 degrees Celsius - is, firstly, to take the subway (M4) to Móricz Zs. Körtér station and, secondly, take the bus number 27 up the hill. The bus stop is easy to find from the subway station as it is very well market (exit C from the station if memory serves right) and the Citadella bus stop is the 7th stop from Móricz Zs. Körtér. Gellért Hill and the Liberation Monument themselves were a journey worth to make. The view from the hill is spectacular, so you should take your time and sit there for a while. The central figure of the Monument is even bigger than expected, but since it can be seen from all over the city, it's really no surprise.
Don't miss this. But you have to climb up and not take the bus. Its's good for your healty and you really can be satisfied for yourself.

Worth the trek up the hill.. Whilst you can take a bus up to the top of the hill, there is a path that leads from near the end of the bridge and zig zags up the hill. The walk is suitable for low to moderate levels of fitness with lots of benches and places to stop on the way to the top of the hill. It also provides a great opportunity to see the statues that dominate the skyline up close.

Best view of the city. Nice walk up to a worthy view of the city - great photo point. Great to do when the weather is warm, although seeing the city covered in snow is beautiful. Annnnd from here you get to see the Castle and Parliament light switch off at 1am
Nice view to the city. We fund all the buildings, we were last week. Danube is the most loved river for me. It was good time ther.

Great statue on historic grounds. The gallery hill and stTue are over an ancient hot spring that is one of true wonders of the old city. A fancy health spa is the result that many locals go to enjoy the heAted water. I availed myself of this place and it really was a great joy. A short cab ride from almost anywhere make it convenient

must see this view!. A short climb up the hill with a worthy reward. Panoramic views of Buda and Pest were incredible, and there are many view points on the way up. definitely worth doing at sunset or sunrise with some beers!
Go at night. The view from up on this hill was one of the highlights of our 3 week trip. Seeing all the lights down on the river and all the buildings lit up was amazing.

wowza. I thought i was lost at first because the up there ( which i used) was all in the forest and was never reaching , i think there is another way as well cause i have seen people coming but which ever way you get through do not stop even if you think you are lost keep going up cause these statues are huge i mean really HUGE so its in the top so keep hiking up you will see people in bikini's lying down , in the corner people who came for picnic, people running , people studying , but just keep going up cause when you get there you see it your self haha . i liked it very much . ITS JUST SO BEAUTIFUL . you can take some snacks with you and enjoy it with the view when you get on the top .

I thought I had seen the best views, and then we climbed Gellert Hill.... Gellert Hill is open late into the night. There were many tourists (bus tours) still visiting after 10 p.m. There is an overlook near the parking. Don't even bother to stop there. Go all the way to the top! The panoramic option on my phone made for one incredible photo of the majority of Budapest. The statues are beautiful and represent the liberation of the city.

magnificent view , easy walk. If you feel in good shape, you can even climb up from all side of the hill, or just take a bus and go for a walk arround the fortress. Not a real big hill with its 235m above see level, but it gives magnificent view to all direction. Its also a Unesco world heritage site - worth a visit. The location was a famous vinary of Buda before the XX.century - the interesting and unique thing about Citadella , it was built against the population in 1851-1854 by Julius Jacob von Haynau to controll the locals - therefore the cannons headed to the city of Pest, not to outside. Fortunatelly they never shot for real , only used for salutes. In 1867 it lost its military purpose, and the austrian soldiers left the fortress by 1899 . Funny thing about the fort - Locals wanted and began to demolish it - as it was a bad memento, but finally they couldnt finance it, so the fortification remained.The liberation monument was built in 1947 by russian order, and modified in 1992.

Worth the climb. We enjoyed walking up past the Gellert Baths on our way to the top of Gellert Hill. It was well worth the effort, at the end of a hot busy day seeing the sights of Budapest, to see the city from this viewpoint. The statue from this perspective is a little hard on the neck - better seen from the Danube

Best view of Budapest. The best view of Budapest, but unless you are a hiker take the hop on hop off bus here. It's quite a nice gentle walk down and actually if you aim it right you can end up almost opposite the Gellert Spa ready for a fab Spa day. Just beware of the guys with the boxes!!! They are con men and have a circle around them of supposedly other tourists betting. They are not other tourists they are part of the gang, and even if you win they do not pay out so definitely do not get involved , unless you want to lose lots of money.

Awesome View. We took a day trip to Budapest from Vienna and accidentally ended up climbing up Gellert Hill. We had booked our train to Budapest not realizing it would stop at Ferencvaros train station. I asked on the Budapest forum what should we do. The experts there said to get off at the Kelenföld station and take the metro from there into town. When we did this, we looked at the metro map and saw a station stop at Gellert. We had heard of the Gellert baths and decided to check them out.The baths were nice - though the building looks like it could use a renovation or two. Since we did not have bathing suits we walked around and saw a statue at the top of the hill next to the baths. We decided to climb and check it out. The path is well paved, but beware, it is a steep climb in several sections. Take your time and you will be rewarded with one of the best views of the city. There are several stops along the way that will give good views, but plow on to the top and you will get a 360 degree view that includes all of Budapest and photo opportunities that would make you the talk of Facebook!
Worth the walk. Loved the views from the top - of the city and the riverThe walk was pretty steep on a hot day, but manageable

Free! Must visit, beautiful views of Danube and picture opportunities, don't miss. Located high over the winding Danube, the views from Gellert Hill and Statue are memorable and breathtaking. From this vantage point you're able to view both Buda and Pest and see the beauty and majesty of this wonderful city. Even the trip up the hill is entertaining and enjoyable and photo opportunities are endless. You will love this spot!

Wonderful view. At school we had to write a composition about " the view of Budapest from Gellért hill" every year. It felt very boring. Now, when I climbed the hill with my sons I understood why we wrote about the view. It's simply astonishing. We can see the whole town! The climb among the trees are in contrast with the buildings on the top of the hill. Nice walk! Recommended!

Great!. This was our second climb to this monument.The first time we were there it was really hot but we climbed anyway from bankside.It was really hard but rewarding.The second time it was cooler and we went up from opposite the Gellert Baths, through the woods. Everything was in full bloom and birds were singing all around us. We peeked at the homes of people in the hills and it was really interesting to see. We approached the monument from the back, the walk turned out to be a lot easier than the last time. After reaching the top and duly admiring the momument, we began the walk down. Really beautiful views from the hill. There are two cafes just two minutes down, and we sat and had refreshments and then resumed our wonderful walk.Highly recommended. Don't forget to visit the church in the caves (just as you go up opposite the Baths). It's beautiful. We did not pay an entrance fee either times we visited, but there was an a ticket office which was closed.

Amazing view. It's quite a walk up a hill to get there but it's more than worth it when you get there! The views are spectacular, especially on a clear day like it was when we went; you can see the whole of Budapest.

Great view as the sun sets.. Went here to get a view of the citadel and Liberty statue at night and was not disappointed. We got there an hour before sunset and enjoyed the view before the lights in the city came on. We left just after sunset before it got very dark which was good timing as coach loads of tourist arrived as we were leaving and it became very crowded. Shame it spoilt the peacefulness of the views from just before. Time it right is my advice.

Nice view over the City. We took the car up the hill, as there were 30 degrees outside at 8 am. The history of the monument is written on a billboard on it's walls.You can see the whole city from up there and it is a wonderful view. You could see the discrepancy between Buda and Pest , their different architecture and maintainance level.I was disappointed that you could go inside, all we could do was walk around it a few times and then left.

Great View of the City. I took a scooter tour of Budapest and this was one of the sites we saw. The views of the city from the statue are worth the trip. It is also a good site from the river at night when the statue is lit up with lights.
Astonishing view. One of the most beautiful view points of Budapest gives a sense of the extraordinary buildings and history of the city. Worth the hike.

Not as challenging a climb as it appears.. We climbed up here at the start of the day. We prevaricated over whether to bother but we're very pleased we had once we made it to the top. There are plenty of places to pause on the way up and enjoy the view, which is worth the effort.
Gellert hill n statue. Gellert hill n statue. A major landmark of Buda. Can be see from Pest, the Statue of Liberty like lady but with a fish, hence called the Liberty statue.
Worth the walk!. One can walk around and get several amazing views from different points. Hard work to get up there, but worth it!

Really on top of the city. It is really a great place to go for the sigths (for me second time). There is not much else to do. Easy to be reached by local bus or the hop on hop off touristic services.

Great wiev. Gellert Hill is the most famous hill to see Budapest. If you visit Budapest you must see here. Especially on the evening. There is an castle , war museum and unique Budapest.. 4 bridge and Parliament built. it is the best place have a look Budapest.
A must see. Has a higher location than Castle Hill. Very nice view. If you walk up in summer heat can be exhaustive

Great views of the city. Love it, great views of the city, beautiful! The trek up the trails were quite difficult and not well marked but doable. Transport is available but we wanted to do the trails, next time will locate the available transport. Visited Dec 2011

Lovely view!. This monument comes with an interesting story which is shared on the monument information placards. You are able to see the incredible view of the city from the top. You can reach this either by walking up the public street, via the trails from the Gellert Hotel or via tour bus. The trails are not for the faint hearted as they are very step and in so-so condition. Coming down was a challenge to ensure that we kept our footing.
Best view from the hill on whole Budapest!. Great experience! When you climb the hill, you can see Budapest from the view of 360 Degrees. One of the most picturesque places!
Nice climb. Nice climb take the walking path from the Gellert Hotel and find the slides. Super fun for kids and adults. Great view of Budapest and its free.
Not old but interesting. You get great views of the river from up here. The history of the area is also interesting and reflects the history of Budapest

Fantastic views. This is a wonderful place to visit to see all of Budapest since this is the highest place in town. You can walk up to the statue and take in the views or take a bus up and walk down a love zig zag path that affords lovely views from each turn. Once up there you can see many places along the river--we spied a Greek restaurant from up there and walked down to the river, crossed it and found the restaurant easily. You can also see the other side of Buda, kind of like the Beverly Hills of Buda where the wealthier people live. Not much else to do up there, but totally worth the effort for the views.
Great vistas. Great walk to wonderful vistas across Budapest. You can see most of the city, the river and the bridges. The statue is impressive.

What a view!. The walk is longer than expected, but there are many paths, each filled with point of views and periodic benches to rest and enjoy the view.When you reach the top, you are rewarded with a breathtaking view. I recommend going there just when it shifts from day to night, as watching the many colored lights coming to life is quite a sight.
Crowning glory with oversight of Budapest. Glorious views over the entirety of the city. Sadly scarred by the vicissitudes of fate and war, but still a moving and enduring monument.

Perfect place to see all Budapest. We didn't know where it would be best to start our journey up but I like hiking so I didn't mind starting wherever. Facing the Gellert Hill and standing with the back to the river, we started from the left side and it turned out to be quite a workout on such a hot day. There are also several trails for those that want to get up the hill faster rather than taking zig-zag pavement walks. But the views climbing up were amazing so I don't regret we went this way. The higher up we got, the nicer the views and more you could see. When we walked up to the end we took a slow walk down along a big highway which wasn't too steep.So it's up to you which side you choose, depends on how strong you are!

Worth it for the views..... The statues are very run of the mill - i dont even remember what they were of, the real reason to make the arduous uphill trek (and for the average person, in full-Hungarian heat - it is a worthy of taking an extra bottle for water), the real reason to make the walk is the views. Beautiful views over the Danube, beautiful views over Pest, beautiful views over Buda. Beautiful vistas in every direction. Do it, spend 30 seconds glancing over the statue, then walk over to the sides and take in the scenery.

Magnificent view!. Despite time needed to climb the hill (and thus some strength) the view from above is very nice. We were there at New Years eve looking at Budapest and tons of fireworks here and there - and it worth that! Even the wind blowing into your face, believe me (and try by yourself ;)).

Nice view. It was a very good experience to get there. It is very recommended, to visit it!
I will come back, if I am in Budapest again.

Worth the effort. The best views of Budapest, really! Many different paths to take, and once you reach the top, simply simply amazing
Worth the climb.

Excellent views of the entire city and 4 bridges. Although its an uphill task for people who are not used to climbing up but with a little effort is worth for the majestic views that you will get once at the top.

Steep hill up to an ordinary top. A tiring walk up the hill along human made steps. Views over Danube and pest at points along the route up. Many different paths to the top.
