You can't go wrong which path you take as all lead to the top of the hill.When you get the you get amazing views over buda and pest. The citadel at the top is not worth looking at as it is derelict. Everyone appears to rest at the statue feet en go back down again. A lot of uphill walking for not a lot. Wouldn't suit anyone with bad knees etc ... as it a hard and long slog up hill.
Climbing the top. Very nice walk to do in the evening. Lots of people walking their dogs in the natural surroundings. Very safe place because of security people that watch the statues.

Spectacular view, it is must!. To get there by foot is challenging as it is very steep or by the tourist buses and by car.Well worth to make time to visit it, I think you can get the best view of the city from here, it is spectacular on a nice clear day.On site available rather pricey refreshments and we seen a toilet too (but you have to pay for it) which is normal due to location.My suggestion would be to get there by bus or car and walk down on the stairs, we did this way, such a great experience.
Worth the walk up the hill. A maze of footpaths slopes and steps lead you upwards without signposting required. Fabulous views in many directions over budapest and the Danube

Worth the walk. We walked up the hill, which is very steep, to get to the top. It was worth it though. The view up there is amazing! The citadel building is up there too, and has a board explaining it's interesting history. The hop on hop off buses take you up there if you don't fancy the walk.

Great views. We got to this statue from one of the hop on, hop off bus tours. Otherwise I imagine it would be quite a climb! The Liberty statue was built during the Communist era, but then repurposed to signify freedom after the Communists left. The statue itself is nice - good photo op, but what's best is the views of the city. You can get great views of the Buda castle area, and the city Pest area, and the Danube.
Historic site, great view. On Danube, by Hotel Gellert and Spa. Statue of Liberty at top of hill, A strenuous climb or can drive to top for grand view.
Long way up. This was quite a climb for me as it was exceptionally hot but made it and view from top is wonderful

Amazing views of BudaPest. We travelled by hop on hop off bus and walked to the Citadel at the top of the hill.
The views were amazing best vantage point to see Budapest.
There is a toilet (which you have to pay for 150 Huf) and bar/cafe.
Definitely a great place to visit.

Incredible views make the hike worthwhile. This is one steep hill, but well worth the effort as you'll be rewarded with spectacular views over the Danube, as well as the Liberty Statue and Citadel on the top, as well as the Szent Gellert monument on the way up. There's also a very well appointed small park at the top, with a food and drink stall - which was very welcome to this hiker on a hot and sunny day!

Paying our respects to one of Budapest's patron saints. Wonderful climb to the citadel at the top and then down to see the saint's statue. Szent Gellért is the Hungarian name of St. Gerard who was martyred on the hill. The view of Pest and the Danube is spectacular.
Nice view!. An emblematic spot for the Hungarians that gives you the opportunity to check out one of the best views of the Danube and Budapest! Get ready to walk a lot or take a ride up there!

The Best View of Budapest. The walk up the hill is a little hard but bus route 27 makes it much easier. The view is absolutely not something you should miss, especially if it your first visit to Budapest.
gives a break on the climb to Citadella. Stopped here on the way up to the Citadella, nothing special, but it gave chance to take a breather on the climb up to the Citadel

Lovely hike to get to the Liberty Statute. My son likes to hike to high vantage points and asked if we could go up this hill while in Budapest. It was a very warm day but we decided to give it a shot. There are numerous trails to hike up the hill. Lots of benches sprinkled up the hill both on the trail and in the woods that make for a delightful jaunt. There are vendors up the hill selling food and drink. The views of the city are unparalleled. Definitely recommend the hike.

Beautiful views. The walk up to the Citadel is a really pleasant one, zigzagging through the park and there are loads of different paths you can follow to get to the top. The views at the top are incredible. Well worth the walk up there. Quite a romantic spot, especially at sunset.
Gellert Spa. Next to Gellert hotel which has an excellent spa facilities good value for money good day spent here relaxing on sun beds by the pool with the first wave machine in the world
Best City View. The best place for the view of beautiful Budapest. Climbing between nice gardens is also very joyful.

Worth the trek for the view alone. Its up a hill, its steep and its tiring but when you finally reach the top you are rewarded with the classic view over the Danube as well as both Buda and Pest. You could drive up here but if you've got the time and the energy why not take one of the many meandering paths up the hillside?

Lovely views.. We went up the winding paths through the trees and were very happy when we reached the top! There weren't any signs to tell you that you were going the right way, but keep on going upwards, the view is worth it.

Beautiful views but you work for it!. Really fun explore up to the top of the hill, there are so many different paths that you can never go the same way twice! Great views and a great workout too. I would do this again to have more time at the top of the hill, I was in a bit of a rush.
Nice climb up Gellert Hill. It's a scenic walk up Gellert Hill and was nice to see all of Pest from the Buda side. Great places to view the parliament and take panoramic pics of Pest and the Danube!
Well worth the exercise- great views. We cheated and took the local bus up, but still plenty of walking to do around the park near the top and fine statue work at the summit
views to die for. fantastic walk to the top with breathtaking views lots of history on the way. Can't wait to return to explore more of this amazing city
Beautiful views.. Amazing views over the cities and the Danube. Definitely worth the travel up there. Its absolutely freezing up there in winter so pack your gloves and beanies.

Adds to the charm. While this adds to the charm of the city, the story behind it is mosst amusing leaving me and my Hungarian friends feeling a bit ambivenent. Russia erected the statue to celebrate Hungary's 'freedom' from Nazi Germany and promptly plunged Hungary into a new, more terrifying dictatorship.
Wedged in the forest. Wedged in the sharp forest edge of Buda side, this monument provides an excellent view to river Danube and Pest city. Very well lightened at night!
I loved it!. It's one of the best place in Budapest. Arriving to the head of the hill is very difficult but at the end, when you are arrived, the panorama is fantastic! Never give up!
Worth the climb. Climbing the hill is worth it for the view of Pest across the Danube river. Take plenty of water with you if you go during the summer as you will find a shop only on top.

Walk up the steps/path from the spa side!. Great views over Pest from the Liberty Monument. I'd walk up the steps and path instead of taking the road up. Lots of places to stop and take a photo. Once at the top spend a bit of time wandering around the citadel and the monument. Easy walk back down the road to the white bridge.

Great view. It doesn't take much time and effort to climb the top of Gellert Hill - and the reward is great: you get an amazing view at the whole city, especially beautiful Peszt side and the Parliament. Definetely do!
200 steps. If you do mind a long hike up the hill, the view from the top of Budapest is well worth it. Then there are some stunning statues to see around the Citadel

nice walk, good views, less tourist overwhelmed that castle area. do this instead of Fisherman's tower if you have a fair amount of time and enjoy city parks. Feels safe during the day despite wandering paths in vegetation. Take water.
Can be visited... While u r in castle district. It was amazing to see how tall it is... N off course the history behind it makes even more interesting. Walk to statue is not alot :)

OUTSTANDING. The statue was given to Budapest by the Russians after they freed the city from German occupation. The view of the Danube and the Pest side of the city from this area on Gellert Hill is outstanding.

Fantastic views. The statue of liberty is not only an iconic landmark of Budapest, but a visit (take bus 27) gives you some of the best views of the city. As you approach the statue suddenly you face a giant postcard - what you see cannot be real. But leave some room for more photos as you descend on the labirinth of paths of Gellért Hill to Gellért tér. There are several stops with viewpoints with the city practically under your feet.

Great view of the city.. Stunning views of the Danube and the city. I've been to quite a few places in the world and the view from the top of gellert hill is as good as any view I've seen. Bit of a hike walking up best getting the bus! X

Walk up there and enjoy the view.. The walking trip is Good, easy to find and with Nice views alpng the paved path.
At the top you cannot enter the fortress (at least we never found an entrance) but Can enjoy views, snacks, drinks and there is a toilet.
Scenic. This is the first place we stopped and saw Budapest from. The statues are impressive and so was the scenery definitely worth seeing.

Nice Walking Up. It is challenging to go up. But it worth. I would recommend it to all. U will see a very nice view for the whole town with good chance to take all lovely photos. I would recommend to Use two different ways in going up and down. Go from the front and pass by the Big Statue then go down from the back the garden side.really worth going

best way if you prefer hiking. well a good place to visit and 25 mins of hiking. while you're hike you'll see whole Budapest city. but be careful of pickpockets and other strange people. I was alone but i didn't care any of them so it wasn't any harm at all. If you're visit Budapest you must visit this. cheers

Worth the walk!. The view from up there is the best!!! Make sure you go on a clear day, but ideally not too hot or you will work a sweat! Even though most of the paths are nicely shaded by the trees.We couldn't find any entrance into the actual citadel though, so I'm assuming that's only for the guided tours.

The best view of the city. In my opinion, this gives the best view of the city. I would advise going up at dusk, so you can see the city in the day and night. It took about 20 minutes to climb to the top.

Good view from top of Budapest. Visiting the Gellert hill you will have a nice view on the Danube and mostly the Pest side of the city . When weather is clear you have a good panoramic view to the city and the city ,, lays at your feet ,,.

Visit Gellert Spa after the walk up the hill to view the statue and the views of the city along the Danube.. The spa was a lively and welcoming retreat, rest your travel weary body and feet in the thermal baths, enjoy the sauna, outdoor and indoor pool, lay in the sun! You can also dine here on the lovely patio. Hint: bring your hotel shower cap or they will charge you to buy one, you can buy slippers and towels as well!

Outstanding views of the city. Great place to take stunning pictures of the city from the hill. Got up here early before all the crowds took over. came up the hill through the residences then took the trail back down through the park.

Worth the walk. Visiting the statue is a must for everyone interested in history. And please make the effort to walk up the hill. Beautiful views from different spots on the way makes it worth the effort.

Amazing view. If you want to see the cities (buda, upper and lower pèst), from a great perspective, I would highly recommend this amazing hill. I'd recommend getting the hop on hop off tour buses, as you can stay up there as long as the buses are running. They come every half an hour, so there's plenty of time to enjoy the view.

Good exercise to walk up to hill. - There are paths that allow visitor to walk up to the hill (which takes around 30-45 mins). Continuous slopes under the trees can be a good exercise if you are tired to walk around the city center.- Able to have a overview of the city- There are not many shelters so better to bring along hats / umbrellas on sunny day- Unfortunate i don't have time to stay longer otherwise it should be a good place for night scene

Very good views of Budapest, Great Hike up from the Bridge. I rated this average, since there are so many wonderful places to see in Budapest. If you are looking for a good hike, with great views at the end. This would be a great choice. Hike from your hotel, over the bridge and up the walk. You will get good exercise and nice views at the end. Was glad I did it.

Fastastic view of the city. The Citadel, Liberty Statue and monument to the Celts (like a Stonehenge) are also within this area. There is an area behind the "Budapest Stonehedge" where you will find several people takings photos with the view of the Danube in the background. The Citadel is closed, but you can walk up the road to the Liberty Statue. On the side of the Citadel there are pictures of Budapest through the years, including a very moving one showing the Chain Bridge in ruins. The Liberty Monument comprises of 3 statues. One of a women holding a palm leaf, and 2 others at the base. We were told that during the Communist occupation there was a 4th statue of a Russian soldier. However that has been removed now.

Bigger than you think. Its a very nice walk uphill and a beautiful view when on top. We also had a lovely snack of a Magyaros tál for two. We had enough and were 4 of us. Its a pity that you can't go in behind the wall. All closed.

Worth the climb. Use tripadvisor map for scenic route.. There are a lot of bozos saying it's a hard climb. They're not smart travelers.Use the TripAdvisor map that you can download using the app, and take the scenic route up where there are like 5 different look out points as you ascend. They're like 100m apart and you take a rest at each point and enjoy the view.Incredible views. Better than fisherman's bastion.Go do it!

Hot climb, great views. Climbed the hill mid day, quite hot but totally worth it, as the views were stunning...many shady resting and sitting areas, came in quite handy...definitely a site not to be missed when visiting Budapest!
View. the best view over the town and the danube also to fishermans bastion. specially at night when so many attractions are lighted
quite a climb. We did this climb on a nice warm spring morning. Even so, it is quite a hike but has some great views all over Budapest.

on the top. the hopon hop off bus takes u there.
please buy this tkt as it gets u to all distant sites.
u will waste a lot of time if u go alone.
u can spend time there and get the next bus after 20 minutes.
very easy.
beautiful of the city.
radha aiyar.

Great views.. We decided to bus to the western side of the park as we were already on the Buda side at lunch so it was an easy walk thru the park to the statue and lookout, then walked down the many stairs to the river side just near to the Gellert Hotel and Spa.
Nice View. This is a must-do on a visit to Budapest. Great views of the city, and interesting to walk around the citadel. Easy to get to on a hop-on-hop-off.

Fantastic views from the mountain. If you like to walk it is a beautiful walk up the mountain from near Elisabeth Bridge. It is quite steep, though, so bring something to drink with you. If you don´t like walking up it is possible to take the Hop-On Hop-Off buses which goes all the way up. The view when you walk up the mountain is fantastic, though, so don´t skip it if you don´t have to. From the mountain it is possible to walk down on the other side to the Cave Cathedral which is also worth a visit. Just notice that it closes around 4 pm because of a service.
BEST VIEWS IN CITY. The views from the top of the hill are amazing. We got the open top bus to the car park then walked up. Panoramic views, great for photos.

Visiting the Gellert Spa. We were looking forward to visiting Gellert as part of our recent trip to Budapest and were rather hoping it would be possible to just relax in the extensive outdoor area behind the hotel and take in the atmosphere. It seems this is not possible however unless you pay the full price of admission - as if you were intending to use the swimming pools or spa itself. Since this would have placed a considerable surcharge on to the price of a cup of coffee, we declined and left disappointed.The buidling itself however is impressive and worth a visit although now somewhat faded spendour inside.
views. good views of Budapest from the top......we saw it by using the hop on hop off bus.......but you can walk up from liberty bridge

Worth the climb, just for the view. I walked up to the top from the Elizabeth Bridge. Its a zig zag up the side of a steep hill. Once you get to the top, the statues are impressive. There are lots of 'love locks' on the railings. The views over Budapest from up there are great. On one side you look down over the Danube towards the Parliament building. On the other side to can see the area around the National Museum and the big Market. If you don't feel like walking, you can hire a 'Segway'. Well worth the visit.

Great views again. One of three high points on the Buda side of the Danube giving great views along the river and over to the Pest side. Not as impressive as the Castle or Fisherman's Bastion but still worth a visit.
Must see. After walking to the top you'll be rewarded with a terrific view over the city. Going up is not hard and something not to be missed while in Budapest.

Nice to check out.. We walked up the hillside to see the view from the top. There are many places on the Buda side of the city for fabulous views and this is one of them. There are many places you can cut the path and walk on your own, or, the path is well maintained. There was a bit of graffiti but nothing to take away from the view atop.
Well worth the walk.. Quite an uphill walk, but lovely scenery as you go. The actual statue is ok, but don't stop here, carry on up to the citadel, the views from the top are just fantastic.
Worth every minute of the walk. Much higher than Buda castle the Gellert Hill gives you a huge panorama and an enjoyable walk through the paths to and from. The statues on the top are beautiful.

Take the Bus Up To See The Views. Unless you're REALLY keen on walking, take the bus (many choices, including the hop-on, hop-off) up to the hill.Not really much up there (couple of cafes, toilets - 200 HuF coin needed), but the Liberty statue is impressive and the views amazing.The massive fortress (Citadella) was not open to the public when we were there.Tip: bus drivers say they will wait for 10 minutes for you as they drop you off. It's at least 20 minutes up to the statue and back, so you'll be getting a different bus back down the hill!

Meandering paths. There are many meandering paths (and unofficial scrabbling short cuts) up the side of Gellert Hill. From river level it's about a 25 minute walk if you don't stop for long on the way up.. If you want to take your time you could stop at some of the many viewpoints on the way up. Perhaps share a bottle of wine with some other special person ? Great views at the top near the statue. It seemed very safe when I went up there at about 7.30 in the evening. Walking down only took around 10-15 minutes.
Best place for photography. I visited with my mom she like the monuments.The place really one of best amazing place.i like it very much and wish to visit again

Great view and quite area. We did a lot of walking and this place gives you a great view of the Pest side. We took the buss just over the bridge and then start walking uphill. A relay plesent walk in the park.

Amazing Views. This statue is the one you can see illuminated on Gellert hill at night from around the city. The walk up via the footpaths was pretty easy although not very well lit at night and there was not much in the way of signage but pretty much just keep heading up to get there. While on the top of the hill walk around the Citadella to see the panoramic views of the city.

Amazing view. Pretty long walk but absolutely worth it. There is a truly amazing view from the top. The hill is covered with trees so it is very relaxing to walk, accompanied by birds singing. It is my favourite place in Budapest.
What a view!. Definitely worth a visit. Take a lovely walk in the park and explore the beautiful and impressive skyline of Budapest when you arrive at the top of the hill.

Amazing panorama. Amazing view of Budapest. Statue is ok but the best thing is the view. Onyl few towns in Europe have this kind of great panoramic view. Amazing at night, but also in any time of day.

A big climb. Lots of steps and quite a challenge to walk. The tour buses will travel to the top also if you do not fancy the climb.
Lovely views of the city below and of the Chain Bridge
Worth the climb. One of the few remaining Communist monuments by the Citadel. Quite a climb, but what a view. Woman on top of a column flanked by 2 blokes, one fighting a dragon with multiple heads

Best views of Budapest!. Be prepared for a hike! But once you are at the top, you will quickly realize it was worth the climb! Make sure you have a camera to capture the absolutely stunning views of the Danube, it's many bridges, Parliament, Buda Castle, etc.
Best view of Istanbul. This is my favorite place in Istanbul. It should have higher ratings. If you like taking photos, you will get the best views of Budapest here.

Panoramas worth climbing to see.. Unless you arrive there by tour bus, you are going to do plenty of climbing ( stairways and inclined pathways ) to reach the summit. Once there, you`ll be rewarded with travel poster grade birds eye views of the city and the Danube, with its signature bridges .Disappointing during time of visit were signs of vadalism and overgrown parkland, especially across the western sides of the hill, which need city council and police attention.Night views of the illuminated city from here would be memorable too. However,perhaps not to be recommended for lone walkers after dark, as there are lots of poorly lit wooded areas across the hill. If able to visit in groups, taking the usual sensible precautions, then all should go well.

A steep climb to a rewarding view. The hill is about 140 meters high, do realise that before you start climbing it. The view from the top is spectacular, The church in the rock is worth a quick visit, although the audio tour is maybe a bit much for the less religiously interested. I'm not sure you can access it for free.

Best sight in Budapest. We took the hop on hop off bus up to the top. What amazing views - this was one of the best things in Budapest (the others being the Matyas church, Bastion, and Hospital under the Rocks). Stunning scenery below your feet.

Worth the effort. I thought I had a good sense of direction and that this would be an easy landmark to find (after all it's just a question of getting to the top of a hill, isn't it?!) but curiously, my orientation deserted me. Perhaps because it was dusk approaching night. Anyway, getting up the hill is a bit of a challenge. I approached it from the side with the big hotel and made my way down past the statue of St Gellert. Even though I thought it was a bit late and maybe I shouldn't be on my own out there, it felt quite safe. There were lots of people at the summit. The path is actually marked with little painted numbers if I remember correctly but at the start, just above the hotel, I wasn't sure which way was "up" because it felt like the path was zig-zagging all over the place. The views are amazing at night with all the lights across the city. I'm glad I chose that time of day to visit because I imagine in the day it would have been much busier with people. I quite like night-time panoramas even though my camera is hopeless at taking night-time photos without a tripod. Naturally, the walk down was much easier.

Very pretty. It was quite a hike up this hill/mountain, but it was well worth it, big and terrifying story behind it, but really nice surroundings and a great place to get a nice overview over the city. :)much appreciated

Hard work but worth it. It was so high, didnt think it was, i should have got the bus, but we loved it, we are both 68 and i. Descided we would walk up after visiting the castle also, every step made me cringe but im so proud and glad we did it the scenery up and down is beautifull so beautifull, well worth the visit, butmaybe get the hop on hop off bus next time
A must see. Very interesting. Good views, stunning statues. Gets a lot of coaches. So pretty busy but still worth going. I should think in the height of the season it would be extremely busy though.

Prominent. The statue can be seen from anywhere you are in the city and looks wonderful lit up at night. Due to lack of time didn't get to spend a lot of time - went up on the tour bus! A place to visit next time

world master traveller in central europe. my first really serious jolly in Budapest, on my first full days amble, after crossing that magnificent bridge over that even more magnificent Danube, what to do? what to do? go back or walk up that big *** off hill with the angle looking gal atop? yes hoof it up the hill it was to be!! It was steep up a good steady pace and don`t forget to breath plenty good people!! Theres many different paths and steps so take the one least used, also theres plenty of seats and stopping places before the summit is reached and the views, the vistas, the panoramas etc magnifique!!! with 360 degree views of the nearby hills of the city, the river bending its way hither and dither was splendid indeed, a corker of a day for it with those big, blue skies and quite warm sun, it all looked wonderful! Remember good folk, its more difficult to descend the ascend!! people never fall going uphill but many do going downhill, enjoy!!
Budapest from above. See the beautifull Danube and the surroundings,most famous buildings of the city and enjoy the views.

Stunning view of Budapest. You have to walk up there to admire the beauty of the Budapest, but it is definitely worth it! Do nto worry which path you chose, all in all you get to the top. You can start from the Cross down and visit the Cave church (600HUF adult ticket) and then go up, but you can also start from climbing up the hill (if you do so please check for the spring water to buy 70HUF 0,5l and you have 3 options avaialble also free tasting).
a nice view of Pest and parts of Buda. We took a taxi and spent about 20 minutes to walk around the area. The view of the Danube and of the city is very nice.
Amazing views. Amazing views from up here. Definitely worth a visit, I've got some great photos to take home. Bus trip can take you here.

Gellert Hill. You have to be fit to walk because it's quite a steep hill & there are stairs as well, so be prepared.On the way up there are many stops where you can take photos of the lovely view.When you get to the top there is a fantastic view of the Danube river & also Liberty Statue.

Wonderful view!. Be prepared for a long walk and many stairs! Take plenty of water and wear comfortable walking shoes and you will be fine. There are lots of benches where you can stop and rest, and believe me it is well worth it once you get to the top! The view is by far the best in Budapest and you can literally see out across the entire city. Fab photo opportunity. Highly recommended!
worth the steps for the views!. i recommend you go on a sunny day but even on a cloudy day it is a nice trip up to the top. you can see all over budapest!!
fantastic view. It is well worth the visit ,a leisurely walk up to it ,but well worth it as the view over pest in fantastic

The best Budapest view!. We visited this place just before the sunset, so we had the privilege to have a view of Budapest in the day and illuminated in the night. There is not a picture that could truly discribe this view of this beautiful city.

For a nice, sunny day out with family. We went there together with the husband. It was a bit windy that day, but the views (whole city) and atmosphere of the park are rewarding anyway. Recommendable for everyone!
more views. Our last afternoon and time to spare after a long heavy lunch, we walked off our excess with a well worth climb to the statue. Another set of fabulous views down over Pest
Great View Point & Historical Site. Great View Point & Historical Site, visited both day and night and night time was very charming, clear night then the clouds drew in (paranomic view Budapest)

definitely the best view of the city. you really need to go there after sunset and enjoy the amazing view of the city. you can use hop on hop off bus, or catching a taxi from city center is around 10€

Great Hike, Beautiful Views!. We were staying on the Buda side, so our hike was much less strenuous than others, as we were coming from the back of the Hill. Watch out for scams when you're walking down from the statue toward Gellert Hotel - I got duped pretty badly and I consider myself rather well travelled. Otherwise, there were some really beautiful views of Pest. If you go down toward the Gellert hotel, there's a museum in the side of the mountain that (I believe) houses some cats. We saw one running around, took some photos of the Chain Bridge and the hotel, and then headed back to our hotel. Overall, I'd say it was only about 2 hours, but we didn't have the strenuous hike to the top!Definitely recommended if you want to fill up your day with some physical activity!

View of views. We used the hop on and off bus which took us to places that we would never have managed to walk to and this was one of them, fantastic views well worth the time. It puts the rest of the city into view which you would never have time to visit

Best view over Budapest. Great view over Budapest. Not much more to look at on the Hill itself, however the walk to the should be nice. We took a taxi however, which is very inexpensive. Visit at night to enjoy the view of Budapest by night.

Stunning Views but WHAT A HIKE TO THE TOP!. We visited Budapest for 6 nights in March, 2015. As part of the itinerary we decided to HIKE up Gellert Hill from the base all the way up to the Liberty Statue at the top of the hill). There may have been easier ways to get up there but you are listening to 2 people who also walked up the steps to Coit Tower in San Francisco! We are both in our 60's so it was a challenge but we mastered it. The views of Budapest from the peak of the hill are awesome and provided innumerous photo opportunities. Would definitely recommend doing this to someone who is able to climb steps and also in relatively good health.
Long walk up, good view. We trekked through rain and wind up the long hill, but in the end the view was beautiful. Make sure to wear good shoes and bring a camera :)
Fantastic views. really recommend going here for the views - we walked up and then had coffee in the baths café nearby. Easy to walk to over the bridge

Great place to spend outdoor time. Like in Fishermans bastion: in sunny day this is must see place - but with the time enough to walk around the are, not with hurry. Lot of nice picnic places and panorama view to Pest.

Good climb, stunning view. Fantastic view across and up the Danube, a good climb but worth it. Named after abishop Gellert who was apparently thrown off the hill in a barrel by those unimpressed with his spreading of Christianity!
Day and Night - A Must. Experience Gellert Hill and Statue during the day and night - the difference is palpable.Great views of the city below, so make sure your camera is fully charged.

Sacred hill. Gellert, an italian monk was considered a sacred person and christian evangelist. He also discovered the healing springs above which the famous Gellert spa operates. The Hill contains statue of Gellert in a semicircle colonade and is worth a hike to the top for the world class view of Budapest UNESCO world heritage Danube landscape.

Brave Bishop. Gellert hill stands on the banks of the Danube, and when Bishop Gellert attempted to evangelise the native Hungarians, at the request of the Hungarian King and Saint Stephan,he was uncerimoniously put into a barrel full of nails and rolled down the hill to be drowned in the Danube.
It's worth the climb. You may get a little breathless going up, but the views from the top are simply magnificent. You can see for miles around. All the famous landmarks.
Worthwhile. Definitely worth the climb to the top. We had a very nice day for this climb not to warm. The views from the top are amazing. Look across the Danube to the parliament buildings.

Fantastic views, especially at night. We managed to visit Gellert Hill late evening on the night before our departure and we are so pleased that we made the effort to climb the hill. We were glad that we visited in the evening rather than the daytime, as we feel the view was probably more spectacular due to the city being lit up. The view was simply stunning and breathtaking.
Commanding view of Buda side of Danube. Great place to get scenic pictures of Buda and Danube. Highly recommended if you are into scenic photos.
A Worthwhile Walk. A bit of a trek to the top on a warm day but worth if for the exceptional views from the top. Utterly stunning. Plenty places to sit with a picnic to

Less effort to get there on foot than you think!. If you start walking up the Gellert Hill from Hotel Gellert (on your way you can visit the church carved out in the rock!) the access to the top of the hill is quite easy. Your effort will be rewarded by unforgettable view from many different perspectives.
visit. wonderful views over the city a must visit so many thing to see and do the history of the city is amazing

Amazing view of the city. We went to Gellert Hill at night. The view is breathtaking! From the hill you can see the entire city, and at night all the lights make it even more impressive. If you are in walking mode - you can easily walk there. its very romantic at night - recommended.

Quite a hike!. This monument is well-lit at night and seen from afar either by land or along a cruise on the Danube. We took the train and disembarked at Gellert Baths walking up the many stairs and winding pathways to reach the top. A great photo op for panoramic views of Budapest and the Danube, but nothing was opened at the top so we simply continued our long walk back down the hill. MANY stairs and some rough inclines so plan to take your time to avoid twisted ankles, stress on joints and general fatigue. There are a number of benches located throughout the pathways. We are in our 60's so would probably have spent our time better elsewhere.

Steep walk but worth it !. Took a slow steep walk (but fairly quick and short) from the Gellert hotel to the top, stopping at various points for photo opportunities, of which there are many. Great views all the way. not much time needed at the top, worth the walk for the views.

Awesome views. This place has one of the best views of Budapest. There is a huge and beautiful park. Also, you can find the Church in the rock.It is incredible, you should visit it. There are two ways to arrive, one option is climbing great number of stairs. Other way that is more confortable is by public transportation. All is explained in my blog: http://two-spanish-lost-around-the-world.blogspot.hu/search/label/Budapest

A highlight. We decided to take the walk up just opposite to the Gellert Hotel. It took all up 20 minutes to reach to the top, but it certainly wasn't an easy walk. Whilst its not sign posted and occasionally you see two different paths, they all essentially lead to the top. When you get there, the views are absolutely amazing. We went up after 7pm with a tripod and SLR and the pics turned out amazing!

Gellert Hill and statue. Great views over the city but you don't need a lot of time here. We bought tickets on the hop on hop off bus but negotiated the price with the guy and got him to give us 72 hours on the bus so we could use the tickets over 3 days and not rush. Brilliant way of seeing the sites and getting background history from the English language commentary over the headphones. We bought tickets on green and pink line but this allows to use the blue line as well.
Nice view. The place have a great view over Budapest. Don't expect to get a good picture of the statue from the hill, but do the walk up there, or take the bus. It is fun climbing.

Great uphill walk. I love to go in mountains so this was the nicest walk for me in Budapest. The view is great and the walk was good. The walk is good for all levels of fitness. There is paths or you can be active and take some steep short cuts.

Good walk for a good view. We walked here on a Sunday afternoon and were not alone. It seemed like many people enjoy this short uphill walk.The walk took us 25 minutes which is what the Rough Guiide estimated.Not much to see at the top beyond the statue and the view so if you are pressed for time it is not essential, in my opinion.

Amazing views!!. The views was worth the climb, would recommend getting a hop on hop off bus and getting off to explore. Would also suggest going at night, we went both day and night but everything lit up was just beautiful!!!!!
Brilliant view. We walked up to the statue through the park on a beautiful sunny day. Great view of Budapest from the top

Most disappointing part of my trip. This is a very long hard walk up hill badly signposted and you get a better view of the status from the river . The views over the city are very good but not much better the from castle hill or fisherman's bastion.

Great. Only the braviests will make it to the top (I think you can go by bus if you want to avoid the climbing) but the view from here is really nice!!Definitly one the place you have to go if you pass by Budapest!
Views. The walk to the hill itself from the bridge towards Gillert hotel was picturesque. We just went up for the views and it was well worth the trip to the statue..

Stunning views over the city. We climbed up the hill and it was well worth it!! The views were great from all sides.. Stunning views over the city. We climbed up the hill and it was well worth it!! The views were great from all sides. We climbed just before sunset which really added to how beautiful it was from the top!
Worth a quick look. We had a short time here but were very impressed with what we saw and were told by the travel guide.

Superb Panorama of the Danube River and Budapest. I had a few hours in Budapest and a friend took me up to the statue on Gellert Hill. Lots of tourists were there... with their cameras... and now I know why! What a view of the river and city! YOU MUST GO AFTER SUNSET AS WELL! The city all lit up is a beauty... probably the most beautiful I have ever seen on 5 continents. Take your camera.... extra battery and extra memory card if you even like photography a little. The bridges of the Danube are visible as is the palace and several church steeples. Gorgeous overlook. Don't miss it, especially at night. The lights are like seeing Christmas all year long!

Worth the hike...... Myself and My husband walked the whole time we were in Budapest as we found this the best way to explore, we walked across the Elizabeth bridge and up the steps which lead up to the top of Gellert Hill- the views along the way to the top are breath taking. We are both reasonably fit and took around 30 minutes to walk to the top, however this was with a photo photograph opportunity stops along the way! The statues at the top are beautiful and really something to see u close- the freedom statue can be seen from all over Budapest, only when you stand next to it do you realise its enormity! we walked back down the other side of the hill, past the Gellert hotel, over the bridge and finished up in the market hall which is just over the other side of the Danube, a good walk with views to remember.

Don't miss out. We visited this on our last morning before travelling to the airport - so didn't have much time. It is well worth visiting. The Gellert Hotel is a piece of history and worth going into the foyer to see - and then around the side to the Spa and bath area (again pop inside to take in the architecture). I wish we had brought swimming costumes with us to bathe in the mineral baths. The day was sunny when we visited - but cold - but there were many visitors in the outside pools - and you could see they were warm and comfortable. We didn't have time to climb Gellert Hill (we will on our return) but the views will be magnificent. If you cross the bridge to the Pest side, as you walk down the main road there is a large impressive "Gothic" building on the right with a brightly tiled roof housing little market stalls inside. Again, well worth popping in and feeling as if you have gone back in time! It was bustling and busy......

Wonderful Spa. Spent a lovely morning in the Spa in the many thermal pools. Massage was lovely and masseur was friendly and helpful. A great experience, would definitely go again with a better understanding of how it all works and would definitely go for a cabin to change in.

A must for visitors. What can you say, this is a must for any visiator to Budapest. The views are unbelievable. I think that it is easier to do this on the hop on hop off bus. This way you get to see most of the tourist sights in Budapest. If you don't go anywhere else go here.

Amazing view. My favorite place in Budapest. Amazing view to the Pest side, Danube, bridges. I reccomend to go up there to watch the sunset with the Buda Castle on the background. You can go on foot, by stairs from the church in the cave, close to Gellért Hotel. Or you can take a bus at Móricz Zsigmond körtér.
Best views. Walked up after a visit to the baths. Amazing views of Budapest. The statue is striking ..... Designed in the aftermath of ww2.

Worth the climb!. Take your camera and go on a clear day. It took us a couple hours to get to the top and back down, taking our time and lots of pictures, and we could have taken even longer! Windy and cold in December but as you walk you warm up. This was one of the (literal) high points of our trip, so beautiful to see the city and river all laid in front of you! We climbed up the cave-church side and down the other side past the citadel. So worth it!

Great views. Well worth walking up, especially on dry day. You can see this statue from miles and there is just over two hundred steps to reach it. Views of Budapest are great, but as one of other reviewers said- you don't go there for statue, but for views.
story. Gellert Hill has an incredible story! it's visible from everywhere in the city and is worth the walk up the hill to see the beautiful views of budapest!

What can I say... Go!. Gorgeous views above the Danube River with fantastic strolls. Take your comfortable shoes and camera to get the full effect. Great snacking opportunities from vendors along the way.

Nice walk great view. You'll need a big breaky before climbing up the steep hill to get to the top but totally worth it. The view is unrivalled and you'll have benches along the walk where you can catch your breath. Not sure if the fort is still open to the public or not but was closed when we went. Apart from the 3 statues and the great view, not much else to see there. The cave church is a good way to start your climb (HUF 600 per adult).

Great views, but clear day needed!. We made the steep walk up the Gellert Hill to reach the Citadella, which was a little tough, but well worth it to see the statues up close. We were sold the idea that being up here gave you the best views of the Pest side of Budapest, however it was very thick snow on the day we decided to go there. It was a bit of a shame not to be able to see the city from this height, but the Citadella is very impressive, so would recommend this after checking the weather forecast!

Remarkable view. Wether you walk up to the hill by foot or you choose the bus( I recommend) it's definitely worth to visit this place. You will get an amazing panoramic view so if you are a photography freak like me you will love the view. If you decide to visit this place go in the late afternoon just before sunset so you will as something extraordinary. The statute itself is not so old, it was built after the war as a symbol of liberation and it become an iconic part of the city.

Feel your liberty!. This is one of the 1st monument what you can notice when you starting to go around the city, a sepecial historical place of the capital. And you can do a healthy walking to the top of the hill, a bit long, but believe me worth it! The freedom what you can fell in that calm atmosphere, around you the nature and the capital. This symbolize the liberty of Budapest. And also romantic.

The Citadel. The bus goes up here (but not between Jan-Mar) but it is much better to get on your leather personnel carriers and walk up - its not as intimidating as it first looks. The views from the top are the best in the city and on a clear day you will get some top photographs.

Gellert Hill and Statue. Don't miss this! Make sure you're there just before the sun goes down, so you can watch the lighting of the chain bridge. It's a great way to see the city. You can get there by a sightseeing bus but we prefer to go by car there. You can see the Parliament and all the hotels by the Danube, and of course all the pleasure boats, cruises on the river.
Great views of Budapest!. Quite a steep climb up but the views are worth it! Great to see the statue that is visible throughout Budapest. Benches at the top to sit and look at the view

Huge!. When you look at the statue that is actually visible from almost every part of the city, you cannot truly imagine how big the statue is. When you stand beside it you feel so tiny. The history behind it is amazing as well. Since it's a part of the Citedella complex, don't miss out.

Overrated. The place is crowded. The outside pools were out of use. Unfriendly staff. The main pool is in a beautiful setting, with columns. But this is the only thing really astonishing. In general, I did not fiond the place very clean.

A Must When you Want to View Budapest. It is a lovely stroll up the winding paths that leads to this impossing statue that dominates part of the Buda skyline. The views from the top are quite magnificent and the area has a great deal of historical significance.

Overlook of Budapest. A good vantage point to see the city and take pictures. Lots of history but did not have the 'wow factor' for me.Lot of walking with some steep points, If you don't like to walk, this may not be to your liking.

Gorgeous at sunset. We went up at the end of the day when the sun was setting behind Gellert Hill and it was gorgeous. The last of the sun was catching the waterfront of the Pest side and made the statues at the monument on Gellert hill look amazing - definitely the best time of day to visit.

What a view. Got of the bus tour at Gellert Hill and walked for 2 mins to find a very picturesque view of the Danube and the city of Budapest. This is a must for anyone who wants a fantastic view of the city.

Communist monument transformed in a patriotic one. Great panoramic views. This monument can be seen from the city but it worth to go on Gellert Hill to look at it closely. We took a hop-on hop-off tour of Budapest and the bus stopped near the statue so we didn't have to walk that much to the top.It is a great work of art, sober and imposing. Initially it was dedicated to the soviet troops after World War Two. After the fall of communist regime in 1989, the significance of the ensemble was changed. Now is no longer a soviet monument, but a patriotic one, dedicated to all of those who died for the independence and freedom of Hungary. A lot of great monuments from eastern and central Europe had a similar fate in the last 25-26 years.Here you will find also excellent spots to take pictures of the city seen from above. Great panoramic views!Also at the base of the walls of the nearby fortress it was a nice place where you could practice with bow and arrows. I am proud that a I could hit the target several times :)

Best view in Budapest. Absolutely beautiful! The Statue is incredible in itself, as is the historical importance of the Citadel. The main selling point of this area, however, is the incredible views that you get across the whole city. An absolute must-see.

Well worth the climb to the top.... Walked to the statue on a beautiful sunny day in February and it was great. Lovely views and fresh air. The climb to the top of the hill is worth it. Lots of steps though!

Takes effort. This is a statue situated atop Gellert hill. There is a long walk up to this statue. The views are nice but you shouldn't go there for this statue but the views. The parliament building is cool and we even took some pictures with the guards. Though you should be aware that if you are not taking the funicular train, it will take around 10-15 minutes to reach the top and then another 5 minute walk to the statue. Good place for photographers though.
From where Budapest photos are taken. No matter how often one visits, Gellért Hill remains one of the best places to admire Pest from. The hill is also perfect for a short refreshing forest walk.

Worth the climb. The statue atop the Gellert Hill overlooking the city of Budapest is more awesome close up than from a distance so it is well worth the climb.It was erected by the Soviet Union after it took control of Hungary after the Second World War. But following the fall of the Iron Curtain, all reference to the Soviets has been scrubbed out and it now celebrates the efforts of the brave Hungarian soldiers.The view across Buda and Pest from the citadel is truly spectacular. All in all, a must see.

Worth the walk. We were a little wary of going up Gellert HIll due to the reviews refering to the lengthy walk so to confirm.....yes its a hill and yes its quite steep but its an easy walk with a number of different routes to the top. The actual statue was a bit touristy and even out of season we struggled to get a photo where there weresnt loads of other people in it...all taking photos, but the views are fantastic and well worth the walk.

A viewpoint but nothing else. This hill was used by the soviets in the Hungarian revolution to fire their tanks towards the city centre. Besides this, the monument was erected by the Soviet Red Army to celebrate victory in World War II. Unfortunately, this does not go down well with the locals because it reminds them of difficult times. In fact they call it "Bottle opener" to mock it. Putting all this apart, the hill is a nice viewpoint and a perfect area to grab your camera and take a couple (or much more!!) of pics.
Everything closed in February. This view point was completely closed and you were only able to see the exterior of the "fortress". However, the view towards the city is probably the best.
Nice view over Budapest. Nice view over Budapest and then some surprise when walking around the Parliament building! Oldtown around the corner with a beautiful church

Favorite Budapest activity. Climbing Gellert Hill is one of my favorite Budapest activities (frequent visitor here). If you are in fair shape it will take about 15-20 to make the climb without stopping. However, there are lots of spots along the way to stop and take in some of the most spectacular and panoramic views of Pest the city offers. Start your climb next to the Gellert Hotel and stop at the Cave Church on the way up. It is worth the fee to get in the church and explore. Continue your climb, stopping along the way at several vistas to take in the view. Once atop take in the view, snap some photos of the Liberty Monument and get some water for your treck down the other side. I like to climb up early in the morning when few others are out. I always feel safe even though there seem to be a few folks hanging out that seem to waking from a long night of partying. There are a number of paths going up, it doesn't matter which trail you take just keep going up. Same story going down. I've climbed Gellert at least 10 times and never seem to take the same route.
Best viewpoint in Budapest. It will take some efforts to climb there but it's really worth it. Go there at daytime and after dark both. In the evening the view isvery especial.

Outstanding view!. If some of you would be wondering whether it's worth it to climb all the way up that hill my answer is - ABSOLUTELY!!! The photos, which can be taken from there are gorgeous. You have the entire Budapest like on your hand. Must visit!
Good exercise & great view. We had great weather and going up the steps everything just kept getting better and better! Great photo vistas! Statue was huge when you got up there!

Not the best view of Budapest but a must see!. While I think the views from Buda Castle and Castle Hill are better than this place, the history of the restoration of the Citadel and the details of the Nazis desperate last stand in the hills make this a great historical location.

It's quite a walk, but well worth the effort. The walk up the hill is well sign posted with regular viewing spots along the way. Such a special way to see Buda and Pest from a vantage point. Walk up past the cave church, and down toward Buda Castle. Make a day of the trip.

Great view!!...... It was a nice, leisurely climb through the paths, shared with people walking their dogs. In January, the trees are all bare, but this must be a great place to go to in spring and summer, for picnics or a stroll uphill to enjoy the beautiful view ... Along the way you can see the Citadella (closed when we were there), and learn some important historical facts about the city and the country, as a whole.
the view!. Gellert hill, the statue, the citadella -- both during the day and at night this is worth the short climb, to enjoy the wonderful view over Budapest, and its lights.

A little walk. Just a paid a quick visit on our last morning the snow was horizontal as we crossed river but the views when we got to the top were fantastic but the viability was poor with the weather but worth the hike to the top

Disappointing. Was it because of the grey winter days? It all seemed so lonely and detached. The site was not very well kept, in contrast with many other sites in the city, the bare trees only added to the uneasiness.

Great way to start a tour with city layed out in front of you.. Anita from travelguidehungary.com provided a great half day tour that was laid out perfectly and started with a visit to Gellert Hill and the Liberty Statue. The overview of the Danube and the Pest side of the city from this elevated location was a great way to start with an understanding of the city layout and topography. It's about a 5-10 minute walk uphill to the statue since they now have the street closed off. But's it's an important part of the history and worth the walk.

Wonderful Exploration. 100% recommend this. The hike isn't that bad of a walk, I mean the stairs are a bit of a hike but I'm not in shape and had no problem. Once you get to the top there are outlooks all over and different trails. The views are just absolutely gorgeous. We didn't have a great map but it made it that much more adventurous. It was raining and starting to snow but we still had a great time. Just dress warmly-Budapest gets cold but it's still completely worth it.

Great vista and history lesson. The walk up the hill to the statue provides you with pictures that detail the history of Budapest. These were very interesting and well worth the time. There are several wonderful vistas on the way up to provide you with a wonderful view of the full city.

Best view of the city !!. We climbed the hill from the bridge below which I found an exhilarating experience as it's a long way up, a few others did this also. Great photo opportunities when at the top. Interesting story to the citadel but it wasn't open which was a let down. Still worth a look though.

Amazing. A good place to hike up to. First visit the caves and the church in the cave by the Gellert Hotel and spa and then go up the hill to the statue . It will be much better to understand the history then. Small fee for the church in the cave but worth it to see the history. rent a headset

Wonderful view and quite a workout. With an afternoon to kill we decided to walk up to see the statue. We were four able bodied adults (at least when we set off) and we found the uphill walk quite strenuous. There was much whinging from a couple of members of our party which was exacerbated when we finally reached the top and realised there is a car park and we could have jumped in a taxi. The next day when we had reflected on the view we concluded that the sense of achievement outweighed the leaden legs. We were all very thirsty by the time we had reached the top and were glad to find we could buy water and there are also toilet facilities.The statues are very interesting and the view is spectacular but if you are short of time or maybe not that mobile then take a taxi, it's definitely worth it.

Under my expectations... The truth is that the view is unique, but, comparing Gellert Hill to the Castle District, I would definetely choose the Castle District because there, one can sightsee and discover Hungarian history at the same time. Though a must-visit if you have 5 days in the city..

Great view. It's quite a hike but well worth it. On a sunny weather you get amazing views of the city. The statue of liberty itself is a curious example of Soviet-Hungarian relations evolution over the years.
Must See!. Do not leave without checking out the view, especially at night, the ONE Photo you must take is from the top of the hill, looking down on both BUda and Pest.

Best views of the city. The views are wonderful (esp. from the highest point) and definitely worth making the climb for - even better than the view from Fisherman's Bastion in my opinion. As you walk to the top of the hill you will see pictures of Budapest throughout the 19th and 20th century right up to World War 2 - so you will see how the city came to be the wonderful, artistic Hungarian capital that it is today. There is also a statue at the top of the hill (Liberty Statue) which was erected in honour of the Soviet soldiers who liberated Hungary from Nazi Germany control.
Breath taking!. One of the most breath taking places I've ever had the pleasure of visiting. Would highly recommend taking the time to go on this tour & view the city from above.

Stunning views!. We went the hill but only up to the Liberation Monument but the views are stunning! You can see the entire Budapest up here. Really worth the climb. We did it as the sun is setting so really awesome!!

Fantastic. We walked to the Gellert hill and it was amazing. Every time we walked higher we saw the city more and more. From the highest point we saw all Budapest, the city, Danube, bridges, every thing .The sightseeing was beautiful. I can't describe our feelings when we saw all these beauty.

Lovely. We decided to climb up to the top of Citadella on Christmas Day, getting a bit of a Christmas workout! It was definitely a bit of a workout, it gets quite steep at time but the view from the top is well worth it. The statues are amazing and you can truly see in all directions out across Budapest. It's a great way to get perspective out across the city too, to get a greater understanding as to where things are around the city. A great way to spend a few hours.

Superb!. Amazing view when the sky is clear, you can see all budapest from up there, the climbing is not too easy, but if you are in a good shape is possible.We enjoyed the climbing and the view so much. A nice 1 -2 hour to spent. Go up just if the sky clear.

For great views. If you have limited time, I would suggest just visiting Castle Hill for city views. However for those with spare time, a hike up this hill plus a visit to the central market across Szabadsag Hid will be a nice treat.

Incredible views. The views from the top of the hill are insanely beautiful, quite a long walk to the top but definitely worth it. Unfortunately we visited on a foggy day so we couldn't see as far into the distance as we had hoped but it was definitely worth the walk

On top of the world next to a citadel. A lovely place to climb up to have a bird's eye view of the entire city of Budapest. The walk up (there are many ways that lead to the top) is a pleasant one and I recommend that those who can must walk up and down the hillock on top of which is the statue and the citadel. There are both steps and a gradual sloping road and you can choose either to reach the top.The view from there is breathtaking and you will forget that you had to climb the hill. Though there no signs, you just have to keep climbing and you will reach the top .

Beautiful view...but not the best. I think that if you want to have the best view of the city you should still go to the Castle Hill but anyway...this place is quieter and you still have a complete view of the city, Castle Hill included. We almost didn't make it because of the weather but then we decided to go anyway...the rain stopped and it was awesome.I reccomend it for a relaxing evening...take a bottle of wine and relax there, you won't regret it

Wonderful views. This is the best place to get a view of the whole city. The statue of Liberty is of course much smaller than its American counterpart, looks more like the one on the old French coinage, from memory. Still impressive, though. The citadel is less so.

Great views. Superb. Worth going up here just for the views. Then there is the history if the place which is quite colourful due to its strategic importance for the military. About a 15 minute hike up and worth it even in winter. But try to plan a dry day to visit if possible. No charge.

Worth the hike. We almost did not made the hike due to the wet winter weather. However thankfully the wife convinced me to make the hike even though it would be tougher for her. The view is definitely better than from the Castle Hill. Yes signs to head up are almost non-existent but with the help of google maps it was pretty easy.

Citadel closed , disappointed. The good :Great , i mean great view of the city , it is worth to climb to the top only for the view . Lots of different routes that lead to the same place , clean ( garbage bins everywhere) , benches .The bad -closed when i visited , the gatekeepers did not spoke not even basic english ( could not say "yes" or "no" ) so you wont get any usefull info from them (when it will open )
Awesome view. Either take the hop on hop off buss here or climb up the hill, it's all worth wile. The views over Budapest is stunning!

Take your camera. Its a steep climb but when you stand at the top and look down into Budapest and along the Danube you realise the effort was so worthwhile and the walk down is so pleasant with lots of seats too take a break and doesn't matter where you stop the views are stunning

What a view. If you, like me, are a sucker for a great view then take the time to get up there! But at night. Very important. There's even a specific point of the view which had been preserved by UNESCO World Heritage!
It is a stunningly beautiful view at night. Well worth it.

Worth the Effort. Even though the weather was rainy and foggy at the top it is still worth taking in the view. I agree with previous posters that it is much more enjoyable to take a taxi or public transportation to the hill and walk down. Also agree with previous posters that the signage is not that great.

Excellent City View. This ofcourse is a must go place when in Budapest because of the great views of city that it offers. The day we went up was a very rainy day unfortunately but still enjoyed gazing over whole city. The only thing I disliked about this place was lack of navigation signs or directions as there were multiple tracks to reach up and it was a little confusing. Nonetheless, the place is worth all the hike.

amazing climb to the top. we took the way next to the gellert baths to the park leading u the climb itself isnt easy so if your not prepared to walk dont even attempt it but the views of the city are just amazing you get lots of nice scenic stops that overlooks the danub and the boat action the monument itself is such a bless cuz you get to finaly sit and just look at it it was bigger than expected also you have a chance to put a lock on the railing

Incredible views of the city. Easily the best views of the city up here. I recommend coming in the evening during winter as you can see the whole city lit up which looks amazing, particularly the bridges. Personally, I would recommend ordering a taxi from wherever you are staying, all the way to the top and then take the steps back down to the city, it cost the 2 of us a total of €6 to go to the top, so €3 each, there's also a city bus that goes about 3/4 the way up but we weren't bothered with the hassle of finding the right stops etc and potentially getting lost. It's also quite quiet up here, with not many tourists etc.
Great views from the top. Just further up from Citadella is the Gellert Hill and Statue from where you get the best views of both Buda and Pest sides.

Uphill walk - certainly not for those not keen on walking!. Great walk - all uphill. Especially beautiful at the time of Sunset when the whole city lies out beneath and the everything lights up - the bridges, castle, church and many numerous little sparkles! Must visit!

one of the best panoramic views of Budapest.... Gellért Hill is a high dolomite rock rising above the Danube in Buda. It is one of favourite excursion spots. Apart from the historic sights the hill also offers some of the best spots to take photos of the city.

For Those With the Energy to Make the Climb. THE best view of both Buda and Pest. Lots of paths and trails but plenty of steps to climb. The Citadel is up there but didn't look that interesting - they certainly weren't marketing it, which considering the Hapsburgs built it to control the city is missing a trick. This city is brilliant and deserves some sort of history trail, there's so much

Luckily I went!. To go to the Gellert hill was not what I intended. Honestly, I knew somethere there after crossing the bridge will be a statue but my map kept the secret that is it on a hill very well. ;) First it was hard to find out how to get up there as there are no signs, but me and my friends found our way. A path on the right side of a huge hotel leads the way up and it is totally worth to go! Halfway is a playground, which might be interesting for travellors with kids or just for people like me. And on top then, you will be rewarded with the best view over the city. Honestly, its better than the view from the fishermams bastion plus there are nearly no tourist plus you downt hve to pay for a ticket.

Great views.....once you get to the top. Situated at Gellert Hill and a good walk too, amazing views from the top and you can see this whilst walking along any part of the Danbue, I recommend you take a drink amd camera, have little atops along the way...it is steep!

Great Vantage Point, Challenging Walk. Don't know if there is public buses to top, but if there are I recommend them. The climb is alot more challenging than it looks, but the views from the path and the top are worth the trip. Be careful, there was a man doing 3-card monty tricks for tourists, I saw one in tears who must have lost some money. There is also a small play area (with slides) for children about 1/3 of the way up.

Come For The View...Stay For The Statues!. We took a bus here on the advice of Sir Steve's of Rick...It was quite the hill coming up but we did make it with little trouble. Follow this guidebook...it covers all your questions, then some.The view is unreal. An overview of Pest can be seen and on a clear day the entire Hortabogy can be seen. The crowds can be a little overbearing and you will be asked to take a picture for someone here...be warned. The statues are in remarkable shape for their age. Tough to get a proper view of them on the hill, but we did our best. Restrooms are on the top of the hill...not very pretty. Bring some water with you on a hot day! Just go.
Skyline view to the city. From here you can see most of the city. I advise you take a hike up to the top. The feel of doing it yourselves will sum up the experience.

Beautiful view of the city. If you can stand a little bit of a hike up a steep hill, you will be rewarded with a spectacular view of the city. The statues at the top of the hill have a typical Eastern bloc feel to them and are very interesting to look at.

this hill is higher than it looks. We decided to walk up this hill after visiting the Central Market Hall and viewing the statue from there. Well after crossing the bridge we started on a path upwards. And we climbed and we climbed. It took forever, but fortunately there are several places to stop and soak in the views. When we made it to the top and saw the Gellert Hill Statue I made sure to get my picture near it to prove I had made it to the top. Then we walked around a little and found that also on top of this hill is a Citadel. It was closed that day, but on the other side of that we noticed a road and some buses. So my suggestion, unless you're in great shape, is to find out how to catch a bus up there.

This is where to catch the city at night.... The climb will wear you out, but cheat a little and take the bus that goes from Moricz Zsigmond Korter. If you are looking to get some amazing night shots of The Var (Castle) this is the spot to do it from. Also worth a look during the day. The statue, Szabadsag Szobor (Freedom/Libery Statue) sits atop an old bunker. It is quite interesting. Take the tour. You won't be disapointed that you made the trek up.
Worth the walk. It is a bit of a trek up here but you can get the full appreciation of this monument after dark and the rest of the city for that matter

Stunning views!. The climb won't take very long but it may seem a tad tireing. However, the views of Budapest will take your breath away! If only you can, go there at sunrise and then at sunset. And make sure in advance the visibility is good and there's no fog.

Stunning scenery. We took a taxi up to the top as it is high up with either a long winding walk up the road, or a lot of steps, but really do recommend going up here mainly for the sights over the city - they are incredible from the very top, but also some really good ones on the walk back down the steps.

It's a hike. We chose to walk up to the Statue of Liberty from Erszebet Bridge, not knowing that there is a network of paths and that taking the wrong ones can pretty near double the distance. The view from the climb gets better and better, so the hike had an upside. The statue is magnificent, much larger than one realizes from the riverside, and in my opinion, more interesting than the French-American Statue of Liberty. What each symbolizes is what is really important.

15 minute walk uphill for wonderful views. Warning : there are lots of steps and, unless you're fit, you should take the bus, especially as a small portion of the steps is quite uneven. There are also some missing stair rails.For those who like a climb, there are several paths to the top and you can also visit the Gellert Monument, as well as the Liberation Monument, the latter of which is at the top and is the highest point. Although it appears daunting, if you don't stop but take it steady, it is only 15 minutes from the base to the top. The views of the Danube, the bridges, the Parliament House and all the other magnificent buildings are wonderful. It is probably best to approach it from the Green bridge. The number 2 tram on the Pest side takes you there, from the Chain bridge. If you walk instead of taking the tram, it is about 20 minutes apart.

Don't miss. Gellert offers the best view of Budapest by day and by night. IT was quite a hike walking up the hill and we were concerned that we might get lost since the route is not obvious. There is a bus to the top. The view is gorgeous. On your way down stop at the cave church near the bottom of the hill, take a picture or two of Gellert hotel and see if you can find the lady reading a book statue; it looked so real.
Amazing Views. Lovely views of the whole City and the various bridges over the Danube. Beautiful place to walk about. Got here by using the hop on/off bus.
Highest point in Budapest. I arrived here using the hop on hop off bus. They give you about 20 minutes to walk around. The area is quite nice and the views are very beautiful.

Perfect escape from the city. It was a nice to get away from the city and the people and walk around in this area. The climb is easy, with many any look outs. The views were fabulous. We saw many joggers on the back side. ( near the bath.). The statues were nice, but would not make it the reason to go up. The exercise, view and peacefulness is the reason.

Romantic sunset moment . There is an amazing view from the top of Gellert Hill and it is one hundred per cent worth the walk. Set off when the sky is starting to change colours and you should be able to get up to the top, enjoy the sunset, and get down again before full dark. It is a tough walk up all the steps so plan to take frequent breaks on the way up. Some of the steps are uneven and broken so watch your step. Enjoy the view!

Impressive monument, great views. Very impressive monument which towers over Budapest. It's a good old hike going up but there are loads of stopping points to take photos whilst you catch your breath. Well worth the effort to get up there as the views are brilliant.

Great view, but disappointing area. This was the first place we went in Budapest as we were staying south of the city centre. The walk up is not too hard and the view across the city are wonderful. The area it's self though was a little disappointing - there is not much to the Citadel or the statue.

Perfect view that's worth the walk. One of my favorite moments in Budapest was hiking up Gellert Hill and taking in the view of both Buda and Pest from above.I walked up Gellert hill at night and there were not many lights or people at all. This made the hike seem more daunting than it actually was, but it was worth it. Once we arrived at the top, there were people there, but it wasn't overly crowded or noisy, which is another perk of visiting at night. I would definitely recommend spending time up there if time permits as it's a nice location for a date night or hangout with a bunch of friends with a stunning view.

You can do it!. From the bottom of the hill, Gellert's hill doesn't look so high..but, there are a lot of stairs. We're in fairly good shape and took our time for picture-taking, but did get winded at times. The stairs...which alternated with both asphalt and dirt paths were uneven, but fairly shallow. That said, the views all along the walk to the top, made the effort extremely worth the effort. The view from the top was spectacular!

Best view of this beautiful city. This is definitely one for the 'To Do' list in Budapest. It's one of my favourite memories from my trip there. I believe you can either get the Hop on Hop off bus straight to the top, or climb up. I climbed up, and it was most definitely worth the seemingly endless steps! The views at the top are breathtaking. It is absolutely stunning. I recommend going later on in the day to see the city all lit up, as that when it is at its absolute prettiest.

Worth the Walk. We were spending two weeks in Budapest directly across the Danube from this monument, and every night we saw it glowing on the hilltop. Of course it quickly got added to my "To Do in Budapest" list. The climb up the hill is not that difficult and there are actually many ways up the hill. The Liberty Monument is pretty spectacular, but to be honest I preferred it viewed from across the river. The Citadella was not open when we were there, being under repair or something. This attraction is nice, but there are lots of other attractions that are a better use of your time in Budapest. if you have time walk up the hill visiting the other statues and look-offs along the way.

Best Vantage Point Of The City. As we are keen on walking, we decided to venture to the top of the hill. The vantage points & winding paths up the side of Gellert hill allow for spectacular views & numerous photo opportunities. When you do reach the top the view is by far the best of the city & well worth the climb.
Great view point on the city. To get to this point, first you need to walk a couple hundreds meters but its fun and worth it. and after all you can take some photos with the giants statues

Amazing view. I took the evening tour with grayline , my first visit on budapest was from this hill in night , you can't imagine what is the view from their on night you can see the Parliament and the bridges with lovely lighting.
Great views of the city. Fantastic views of the city! Panoramic views of both the city and the Danube river. Definitely worth a visit!

Not for the faint hearted!. The steep climb and seemingly never-ending steps are definitely worth it when you reach the summit of this imposing rock and look out over a panorama of Buda and Pest! Not a huge amount of information about the statue but round the side of the building there is a plaque explaining the various occupations of the cluster of buildings. Might leave you with aching legs after a trip to the top but it's an experience that is worth ticking off your to-do list! There are toilets and a little kiosk at the top but I would suggest bringing your own bottle of water as well as getting up there is thirsty work!
Good view over the city. It´s worthy climbing up! Only 20 minutes. I´ve done this in the early morning and it´s very refreshing. Better would be in a sonny day so you will see the city clearly.

Nice memorial and views. The gellert hill statue also called the liberty statue was erected to commemorate the liberation of Hungary from the German/Nazi occupation by the Soviets during the 2nd world war. The statue was erected in 1947 and has a main statue on the central plinth flanked by 2 on either sides. Its located on the far side of the Citadella - which itself can be reached via bus 27 from the Móricz Zsigmond körtér metro station.The statue's inscriptions were since then modified from commemorating the Soviets to just being dedicated to all the people who sacrificed their lives for the betterment of Hungarian people.Some of the most amazing views of the city can be seen from atop the citadella just next to the status itself.The statue because of its position and erection atop the plinth can be seen from a distance from the city as well - especially when you take a cruise trip on the Danube.I would definitely recommend visiting the statue and the Citadella when you are in the city - for its position in the Hungarian history as well as for the views of the city.
