Don't miss it. Excellent view from top of the hill for Budapest, don't miss it specially if you wanna take some photos
Excellent views. A steep walk up to the top but worth the climb (steps and ramps). Statue is really good up close and, on a clear day, the views are amazing.

DEFINITELY worth it. great views, I did not notice the graffiti being any worse here than anyplace else in Budapest. I took the hoho bus up so do not know how rough a walk it is. fortunately the weather was great, so it was enjoyable to sit on the stairs and just enjoy the view. I think it is a must-do while in Budapest.

The view!. It's a small up hill hike (lots of stairs and ramps) the view is totally awesome! Even better than the view from Castle Hill.If the weather allows it go when the sun is setting and take some wine with you ;)
A great view at sunset. We took the bus to the citadel and then walked down. The views of the city were amazing. We were lucky to be there at sunset and this enhanced the view.

Incredible views of the City. Catch the 'Big Bus' tour tour to Gellert Hill for the easiest way to the summit, about 250m high, between Erzsebet (Elizabeth) and Szabadsag (Liberty) bridges, for spectacular views across the whole city. The main monument, Liberty Statue, was raised by the Soviets after WW2 and is magnificent.From the main viewing point (just follow the crowds) you can take paths downwards, right, left, right etc, and you will come to the main North/South road on the Buda side of the city, and depending where you arrive, about 5 minutes walk from the Danubis Gellert Hotel and the Baths.The walk downhill will only take 10-20 minutes.

Awesome views if you can figure out how to get there!. My friend and I wanted to climb Gellert hill and walked from the castle district over. For the life of us we couldn't figure out the best path up. It's not very well marked in my opinion. We finally just decided on one path and kept going straight. We finally ended up at the top and the views were well worth it. The statue is also pretty cool to see close up. Definitely worth climbing some stairs and being a bit confused!

Super view of Budapest, really so beautiful.. We gone there by bus , after stop climbed further , beauty was further in sight , as we reach at statue point , very scenerio of whole city was vidible . Lovely place. As u go down to bus stop , see the walls with still marks of bullet , further see the pics of 150 years old upto 1945 , see the changes with the time . Overall very lovely site to visit & take photos & videos. Superb Budapest fr top.

absolutely stunning. take it to Moricz Zsigmond Korter station, and than get on bus no. 27 up to the Citadella, it's the 7th stop. get off the bus, turn right and walk up the hill. bring some food (or buy it there) and sit on the hillside to watch the sunset. then walk around to the backside to the statue and see the lights of the city. beautiful views of the city and entire danube. afterwards go past the statue and start walking down. there are many small viewpoints on the way down for different angles of the city. it'll be dark but you can make your way with a simple iphone light. follow the white numbers on the ground. or just keep heading down. it ends up at the hotel/subway. definitely worth the experience.

Great views. Standing next to this statue affords great views over the Danube and city. It was a fairly steep climb to the top - a combination of steps and flat - but worth the climb. On a bright sunny day, you can see for miles.

Great View, No Cost. A good climb to the best view over the city, the bridges, and Parliament. A bit deceptive as you don't realize the magnitude of the citadel and it's large monuments until you're at the top. One could drive (as tour buses do) but it's much better to walk up the front side (river side) - there are benches along the way, but the greenery could do with some trimming to enhance viewpoints.

Views of the city. Climbed up here in the rain and quite a climb,but made easier by the hearts painted on the paths to follow. Stop at the large cross on the way up, and take a camera for the awesome views.get here from Pest side of river by the metro (about £1.50) or the hop on hop off buses.theres also a church about halfway up you can pay to go into.

Beautiful view of Budapest. My wife and I got on one of those hop on and hop off buses that brings you to Gallery Hill and the statue. If you are young and love hiking you can walk up and down the hill At the top you will find a panoramic view of Budapest which is quite fascinating and beautiful. I would highly recoomend this site as you can definitely see the best of Budapest to capture with your camera. And the Citadel on top of the hill is spectacular and well worth the visit.
Best view in Budapest. Gellert Hill and the Citadel is a must visit in Budapest if only for the stunning views it provides across the city. Don't miss this while here.

Great place to run & dogwalk + great view. One of my favourite places in Budapest. Don't take the bus, climb the stairs from either direction up to the hill, you won't regret it! Nice mansions and gardens, quiet neighbourhood, romantic spots.
Amazing view. It's definitely worth the effort, the view from the top is amazing. Especially beautiful at night. Highly recommended.
great view!. the statue looks like a bottle opener and their are amazing views of Buda and Pest, the Danube, Chain Bridge, etc. Don't miss Gellert Hill!

Worth the climb for the views. First of all the hike up to the top is not that exhausting, you can take breaks, enjoy the scenery, the views and take pictures. We climbed in very hot weather and it was fun. When you get to the top you will see the Liberty Monument finally up close (since it can be viewed from pretty much anywhere in Budapest). That's where you can walk around, take a rest (like most people do) and enjoy the view from up high while you take amazing pictures - totally worth the sweat.

A nice day trip. To reach Gellert Hill take Tram 6 or 4 from the pest side to Moricz Szigmund square in Buda ( get off at the terminus on the Buda side ). You can also take tram 47 or 49 from Deak Ferenc ter to Moricz Szigmund square. Then,cross the street to take bus 27 to the top ( get off after 7 stops ). You'll get beautiful views of the city and the Danube. You can get nice photos. It's really enjoyable!

Great view. Great place to go and see the amazing views all around Budapest. Bit off a walk but good exercise and you can see the whole city. Plus you can get some great pictures from the top. Would defiantly recommend it if you are in Budapest.

Great view. We went up the hill to have a little pick nick at sunset. This was a great experience. The city from the top of the hill is as beautiful in the day as it is in the night. I can recommend everybody to try and see the sight at both moments.

High Spot - Best Views. This high spot has fantastic views of the Danube with great photo opportunities. We did not hike up or down, we were driven as several members of our party can't hike or walk very far. The Liberty Monument is enormous and visible from almost anywhere in Budapest. We did not stay very long, just long enough to enjoy the views and snap the picturesque views.

Worth the hike. It is quite a hike…but the views from the top are absolutely worth it! And after all of that hungarian food, it feels good to walk it off. This is where we saw the most littering…which is sad.

Pleasant walk. It is not as high as it looks...the walk up there was fine and well worth doing. On the way up we visited the Stone Church and had a good walk up the hill which is well shaded by trees. At the top there is the ugly citadel and the beautiful statue to Liberation. There are also some pleasant gardens.The views from the top are stunning.On the way down we looked at the statue of Gellert and finished at Elizabeth's statue.
Good views . Gellert Hill has great views back to the city and out towards the countryside. There's also a few statues and cannons etc to see at the top.

Climb higher. It's a must-see, or rather, what you see from here is a must-see: most of this whole lovely, sprawling city. Climbing this hill also fulfills the urge to get as high and see as far as possible - climb it; it's worth it.

Budapest on the Top. If you are going to BUDAPEST you should not miss to visit the Gellért hill in the evening (at Sunset) The view over Budapest is the best you can get - and if you look to the Chain Bridge at sunset you see switching on the lights one by one part. After some minute the whole area is iluminated - and you can wait for the darkness. NOW - the view is unbelievable. TRY IT!

A lot of climbing, but a magnificent view!. You get to admire Budapest on three sides from there. The museum is not very interesting, but the bunker is a must see. Especially for the atmosphere and the story of the children born during the war.

Exhausting but worth it!. I have to admit... it took me a lot of effort to go up to the hill. They have the asphalt road and stairs here and there. The stairs are always steeper as it cuts down the distance of the road. But still.. it's exhausting. I regret didn't buy any drink down there :D Anyway, you might get confused as there is no sign here to go to the statue. But I believe all directions lead to the same end, just make sure you go up up and up. And once you're up there, it's a really great view of Budapest. You can even rest for as long as you want since you put so much effort to reach it :DRecommended for the panoramic-hunters!

Worth the burning calves & quads!. We decided to walk up, although in all honesty we didn't know there was a bus, it took maybe 30 minutes and a gentle to reasonable pace which still allowed us to take in the scenery and try out hand at hustling the street hustlers! The views a spectacular, it's the highest thing for miles around. How ever you get to the top, how ever long it might take you, it's worth the burning calves & quads for the view(s).

Well worth the effort!. The pictures speak for themselves but probably don't do justice to the experience of getting to the top of the hill. If you don't want to experience the wooded paths and steps and great scenery you get as you traverse the slope of the hill to walk to the top then hop onto the bus to see the end result with out the effort!A superb piece of history and well worth the effort. Come down the hill and walk towards the castle and there is a welcoming cafe on Dorentier ter to rest your legs and get some refreshment and chocolate (nutella) pancakes
Photogenic and worth the effort. One piece of advice. Do not go to Budapest and not visit Gellert hill. We did this during the day. Worth the effort, good photo opportunity too.

Certainly worth it . It's a good walk, and all steeply uphill, but the views at the top justify that. It's beautiful and interesting in commemorating a piece of history and I'd certainly recommend it, however the views from the Castle are better and there's not much else there besides, which is the real thing that keeps me from giving this a five. It is, however, a nice park, with many pleasant areas to stop and rest on the way either up or down.
Visit at Dusk. If you like a wonderful photo of the city visit Gellert Hill at dusk. The view is spectacular. Pack a picnic and watch the scenery change as it becomes nightfall.

Gellert Hill and Citadel. Citadel and Gellert hill overlooks the danube in Budapest. Gellert Hill was named after Saint Gerard who was thrown to death from the hill. The Gellert square hosts the famous Hotel Gellert and the Gellert Baths at the foot of the hill, next to Liberty Bridge. At the top of the hill is the Citadel, from which a view is available down both directions of the Danube. On the drive to Citadel, is a spot where it provides a great view of Budapest in the night. The photo is on every taxi and tourist information.

Great view! (but bring a flash light at night!). We weren't well informed about where we were going, only that "the view at night was marvellous". So we started climbing, and it wasn't too easy, but the biggest problem at night is that there are no lights on!! Sometimes the paths were pitch black, so be sure to bring a (cell phone with) flash light. When you reach the summit however, you forget all about it, 'cause the view with the illuminated city is indeed wonderful.

Walk, sweat, view. We really liked Gellert Hill. There are a number of paths that get you to the top. It is not signposted, but if you just keep walking uphill, then you will reach the summit. Yes, you will probably find your path criss crossing other people you have seen, or it may take you a little longer than the next person but you will get there. You can also get there by bus/taxi, but part of the fun is the walk itself. You are rewarded on your arrival with a masive statue, much larger than we were expecting. We also found it interesting to walk around the Citadel, where there are lots of information boards about the city , hill, status, and all sorts of tidbits that we read with interest. Again, the views down upon the city and the Danube, as well as the tree line from the rear, are indeed spectacular

Should be seen but go for the bus. While the views certainly are great (it's a hill in the heart of a vibrant capital, after all), what you're going to find on the very summit isn't anything to write home about. Sure, it's one of the symbols of Budapest and, despite the negativity you may sense from the review, you should see it just to have your own opinion but for me, it wasn't quite the cathartic experience many seem to attach to it.If you don't enjoy hill climbing in general, don't fool yourself into thinking this would be any different just because it's in the city and is one of the main attractions so "it should be easy to reach". It's not and it's a painful walk with poor signage - so glad I took the bus uphill and only walked down. The bus going there (number 27) starts its route two tram stops after the stop beside Hotel Gellert so it may seem a bit of a trip on its own but it'll take you almost to the very top (the same altitude that the tour buses stop at, anyway).

Worthwhile exercise. Many of the locals will refer to this as Liberty Hill or the Citadella. There is road access but for the able bodied there are a couple of ways of getting up here on foot. One is via an initial staircase adjacent to west end of the Erzsébet bridge. The way we used was the pathway on the northside of the Gellert Hotel. Follow the green and white marks! They are painted at the side of the route generally as a roundel but occasionally as an arrow to indicate the direction to take at a junction.This walk up is through a pleasant garden with plenty of stopping points to admire the vista. Beware the scammers with their 3-card-trick/find-the-ball. Ignore them and they will not trouble you.At the top you have a great view over Budapest and you even can look down on Castle Hill. There are some impressive bronzes and plenty of information in English about the citadel. It is well worth the energy expenditure.
Statue of Liberty. Exhausting climb up the hill, especially for young travellers, but view of the city is worth that. Don't forget to take some water with you.
An amazing hill. Quite "difficult" to be reached, but definetely worth to climb. Wonderful sight, nice statues, fresh air, nothing else to ask from a hill!

FABULOUS. I would highly recommend this! We climbed from the bottom to the top with plenty of opportunities to stop and take breathtaking pictures! I would say to be careful with children or adults unsteady on their feet as there are VERY low handrails around very high drops! The photo opportunities are great as there is hardly any other objects to block photos. The views include the bridges, parliament, the Danube etc... Gorgeous!At the top there is the statue which is just beautiful. Then if you keep walking behind the statue there is quite a bit to see! The unspoiled views are Panoramic and you can see for miles! There is a WW2 bunker which was actually used by hitler himself during the war - this was fascinating history to witness. And then there is the cannons, archery, Etc... BEAUTIFUL!

Great hilly walk to the statue and great views. The walk up the hill (marked by spraypainted hearts on the floor from Hotel Gellert) is a bit tough on a hot day, but well worth the effort, some great views on the way and a spectacular view at the top. The statue is massive! Much bigger than it looks from the ground.

Fun trail with a treat in the end. Staying at the Gellert hotel we figured the most interesting way to the castle would go straight over the Gellert Hill. The route up wasn't too long for a casual stroll and the journey offered many opportunities for great views and photos. Up on the hill you get to really understand the scale of the statue. It's huge! Pro tip: you can find a small kiosk on top of the hill serving some wine and refreshments!Take some time while at there: there's a world war era fortress and a museum bunker on top of the hill, just behind the statue. The road down on the other side featured more park trails leading almost at the base of the Castle Hill.

at night and during the day. we went there by bus at night and the views were superb! lots of people walking there all the time and Budapest is amazing. During the day you can walk to the top. Just a few metres below the mountains there is a church in the rock - worth a visit and highly recommended :)
Great view of Budapest. Worth the trip up for the view and photos of Budapest. On a clear day I think you can see the next country.

Try walking up the Hill. We challenged ourselves to walk to the top of the hill. You will pass by a lovely park before you reach the top of the hill. There is no map or direction on the way up, the only tips is keep on going up until you can see the statue. On the way up, there are couples of "rest stop" where you can have a sit on the bench and enjoy the view of Budapest at the same time. It took us 15 minutes of walking (without taking a rest) to reach the top of the hill. At the top, you will be welcome by the Statue of Liberty of Budapest and you can enjoy the view of Budapest from the top of the hill. The view is amazing.

for good walkers and climbers. if you have Energy to climb for 1-2 hours in spectacular view you won't regret it, the statue is nice, but there is much more to it, all the area is beautiful, the walk up there is amazing, (it's not worth it just to go by bus and see the statue), when you walk there you feel Rewarded by the view and the statue

Feeling energetic? Take a walk to the top.. This is a lovely park with many paths that twist and turn their way to the top of the hill. The top is not signposted, but it's fun working out which path to take.....as long as you keep going up, you will eventually get where. It is quite steep in places and makes for a decent work out!The view from the top is very impressive, looking out over the city and across the Dabube. We were there on a sunny day in November and the views were stunning! The Liberty statue and the citadel are imposing structures on top of the hill, visible from the opposite side of the river. They are well worth a visit and have a very interesting history.For a free attraction and a decent way to spend a few hours, this is a great location.

It's hundreds of steps up to the statue. The Gellert Hill is an extensive park opposite the Gellert Baths and the Cave Church. One of the sights is the Liberty Statue which is up hundreds of steps and around many twists and turns which are not signposted. You have to keep asking people. When I finally got near the top I saw that it was roped off with police guards and i could barely glimpse the top of it through the trees. A sign at the bottom before you start to climb would have been helpful. I don't know if this is a permanent or temporary closure and I am not sure how you would find out.

Statue says a thousand words. You can see it from everywhere, but to see it close up is beautiful. It has a story, which is sad and ends in happiness. Our room at Gellert Hotel looked out at this beautiful statue. Beautiful site when lit up at night time

Great view from the top! Take the segway tour!. We went up the hill with the segway so it was lots of fun. The veiw is wonderful from the top of the hill. You can see all of the pest side and the river under with the bridges. I think taking the segway up there made the whole thing just wonderful.

Great History and Impressive Monument. If you visited the Castle Hill; it’s unnecessary to climb the Gellert Hill to enjoy the Budapest view; especially, or appreciate the History of the impressive Gellert Statue full of glory and pride; you will see it from wherever you go at the top of the beautiful green Pest Hills.

Good view to Donau and town. Gave church was worth of visit ( entrance fee) and outside it we ate hot deliciuous street kitchen food. I don´t remember what it was called, but it containend spicy hot green paprika and onions. On the top of the hill, there is a good place to photograph the town.I was a little bit disappointed of the size of the Gellert mountain, because it wasn´t bigger than our small hill Laajavuori in Jyväskylä.

Nice green hill, good walking and cool views. The area around the hill is very green and has several trails for walking up that hill. during the walk you will pass several spots for some nice views! Go down the other side again.

Best view. Best viewYou gone have best view of the city from here. Next to the statue there is a Citadel. In the place there is a restaurant with the best view of Budapest but I didn’t dine there so I can’t say anything about the kitchen but the prices are very tourist orientated

Tiring and hot, but worth it!. I would recommend crossing the green bridge to Buda from Pest and then walking past the Gellert Baths and going up the hill from there. There was one water fountain that we found more or less at the start and filled up our bottles, which was essential as it was a hot day. We were wearing trainers which helped with the climb. There were benches more or less the whole way up which is useful if you are struggling! There were various view points until you get to the top where the Liberty Statue is. There was a great view of the Pest side and the Danube from all sides, I got good Panorama shots on my phone! Best free view of Budapest.

Tiring climb to the top but wow!. You must do this, what an amazing view of Budapest once you reach the top. Also you can take the steps or the path or a bit of both. There are benches and children's slides to have a break on the way up. The top is amazing, plus the statue, you can have a walk round all sides and sit and gaze at the view. Also going down is so much easier. Stop at the Thermal baths on the way down.

Amazing views but plan the walk. Definitely go here to experience the view. !!! Enough said there. We walked the length and breadth of Budapest and hiked up to the top of here ( in flip flops and sandals) worth wearing proper shoes but who needs to be reminded of that ( other than us that went for fashion over function). we really struggled to get back though ( when it started raining) ended up taking a loopy long route back as all the buses up there are hop on and hop off. It's worth planning buses and routes before you head up, we just went off the cuff and made it up as we went along which was absolutely fine as we walked through some nice suburbs- but not ideal if you are short of time of unfit as we did do a lot of walking! Another tip is to get the trolley bus while there, great experience ( buy tickets before you get on as they are cheaper) Please let me know if this is helpful information and I will write some more.

Fairly steep.... Quite a steep hike but the views are good. I imagine it would be a real slog in the summer heat.There is a bus that takes you almost to the top, but we didn't realize this until we walked down the other side! Never the less, a great way to see the awesome Danube winding its merry way.

Bus then walk down. The 'easiest' way to view this attraction is to take the 27 bus UP the hill and walk the last 100 metres. Then, after seeing probably the best views from the Buda side, walk DOWN towards the Gellert Hotel. Steep, but worth it and then time for a coffee/beer outside on the Gellert terrace.

Great walk up the hill for a wonderful view over the city. If you're staying a few days in Budapest, the walk up this hill is worth it if you're interested in the history of the place.No toilets as far as I'm aware, but the walk up and down won't take that long anyway. Wonderful view of the city at the top so make sure to take your camera along and a bottle of water too.This will probably be the only place you'll be able to take a good shot of the central market hall in its entirety.

Yup...it's a hill alright!. Gellert hill is only for those that enjoy a good hike. The views aren't any better than from other vistas on the Buda side, so unless getting your heart rate up is on your list of things to do in Budapest, don't feel bad if you skip this one.

Great view of Budapest. I love Gellert Hill, from here i can see the Danube with many beautiful sightseeing. You should come there two times, morning and evening. The morning is a peaceful Budapest, and the night is a amazing brightly Budapest.

Phew. This is a good mornings walk, and climb to the statue, its not ideal in the heat of the day, but we still enjoyed it. Take water with you and slowly walk through the paths instead of climbing all the steps, and the view from the top is worth while. A must do.

Worth the hike! View, peaceful, and great starting point. The view is worth the hike! My wife and I huffed it up the trails to the top. On the way up you get the opportunity to pass the statue of Bishop Gellert. Bishop Gellert is whom the hill is named after and he was the Bishop that was put in a barrel filled with snakes and tossed off the top of the hill by the locals. Once you get to the top, it is just an amazing view of Budapest! Setting underneath the Liberty Statue and taking in the views was a great way start our stay in Budapest (not to mention it was pretty quiet too). It was a beautiful day with a slight breeze, we sat up there for a good hour looking over the sights. The elevation allows you to see all of the sights and map out your plans for the days to come. Highly recommend Gellert Hill! You will not be disappointed with the view.
very pretty. this is seen from everywhere and looking at it from the boat ride was fab i didnt get to go up the hill as Buda castle had taken the wind out of me! but all around it was beautiful.
Excellent view. If you have the energy, walk up the hill. It is not that hard and the view is worth it. But the best is of course, when you reach the top: great view of Pest.

Can be a trek but worth it for the visit.. Gellert hill can be accessed via road if preferred, but we opted to walk up from the Liberty Bridge. Quite a trip, but ok for all of those who are reasonably fit and healthy.The path continues to wind around in a number of hairpin turns, with a number of viewpoints across the city from which you can easily empty your camera from memory.

Get your walk on... up this hill and you won't be disappointed. One note - BUY WATER in the shops for 69HUF, don't pay 500HUF at the top of the hill. Views are great and the path is tarmac so easy to get up for most, steepish in places but plenty of rest stops/spots. View is lovely and there is the Citadel and the statue at the top to see. Would be nice to do in the evening and look at the city over sunset.

view of the city - nice at night. this is at the top of the hill at Buda's side. i recommend going up with the bus (unless you dont mind the climb), and then going down by foot, checking the various view points of the city at night.
the statue is huge and lit so its very nice.
A nice walk. We walked all the way up and the view was amazing. The top is full of turists but the view makes it worth it.

Worth the climb. In order to get there we were climbing up the hill which wasn't so easy but it was totally worth it! Views were stunning, you can see large part of the city from many viewing points, sit for a while and rest. I recommend you to go there in the evening, so you can see beautiful night illumination. Unfortunately the path to the hill is not illuminated!

Spectacular!. You can walk up via a relatively easy series of steps and paths - just take it easy, and pull over at the large number of lookouts and seated places, and you'll be amazed how far up you've climbed, when you get to the top. (Walk via the cave church, that's en route). The views are, in my opinion, at least as good as those from castle hill (the one with the furnicular), probably better...This is an essential trip, and worth a whole day to stroll up, be impressed with the views, and that amazing statue at the top (she's HUGE!). And then of course the stroll back down. There are icecreams, drinks and of course souvenirs at the top - a tip: everything up there is something like 50% cheaper if you pay in the local currency- you'll pay way, way more if all you have is Euros. This is a hugely worthwhile trip.
Nice place. One of the best view to the Danube river, and a wonderful place for a walking. You also can take amazing pictures from the bridges and the Parliament. Recommend.

That's the place for a panormaic view of Budapest. If you would like to watch intire Budapest from above, and especially if you love to shoot panormic photos - You just can't miss this one. Totally free and totally amazing.Since the Metro 4 is open, it's very easy to get there - Just take it to Moricz Zsigmond Korter station, and than get on bus no. 27 up to the Citadella. Then you have a 3 minutes walking for this amazing view.I recommend to go there twice - once in day light, and the other after dark, when you get to see the whole city of lights. Just remember that the bus frequency is lower at night, and you just might wait for 0-25 minutes for the next one.
The best view. Take the green trail that starts close to the Gellert hotel. Go ahead and you will have the best Budapest panorama :)

Lovely views. Walked up Gellert hill, it was steep but worth it. You can take a bus but that's cheating lol. There is a lovely restaurant at the top which served tasty food. The view from the restaurant terrace was lovely. There are craft stalls and a museum also.

Quite a hike, but worth it.. Nearing the end of our six days in Budapest, we decided to walk up Gellert Hill. Reviews had said it was a gentle hike- not true.Yes, there are many stopping places, and boy do you need them. Only an athlete could manage the top in one go !!!Having said that, the views on the ascent are amazing and when you reach the top, there you are in front of the statue which you clearly see from the Pest side of the city. Worth the effort, but only if you are relatively fit. Otherwise take the bus which approaches from the other side.

Great view but not much else, and a pain to get to!. We headed here on our first day in Budapest, thinking it would use up a few hours until evening time. None of the guide books really helped explain how you get to the top of the hill so we took the tram to the bottom of the hill and walked up. Well, it's a loooooong walk. When you get to the top there are great views over the city, there's quite an impressive looking statue and unfortunately we couldn't work out how to get into the citadella, if you even can, I still don't know.And then you have to walk all the way back down again. Apparently there's a bus that goes to the top of the hill from somewhere and probably comes back down again from somewhere but of course, no guidance anywhere of how this might happen.If I have one complaint about Budapest, it's that they're just not well geared for tourists who might not know which bus/tram you need to get to go somewhere. Compare with somewhere like Prague which has it nailed.I probably sound grumpy, but I did see a lot of other things in Budapest that were so much better than this, and I really don't think it's worth the effort unless you fancy a bit of hill-walking or you work out how to get there some other way.
a must. a must! Great experience. If travelling by car, dont forget to pay for parking, even on Saturday or Sunday evening!

Worth a look. The statue itself isn't great. The area surrounding it is full of graffiti and a few dodgy looking types but we stopped by on the way up to the Statue of Liberty which is much more impressive.

Worth going to for the view. My partner and I walked up to it taking around 25 minutes to reach the top there are a few sections that are quite steep. The views are beautiful to stand and back and look over the city. You can't see Parliament as well as from fisherman's bastion. There are cafes and a few little gift shops up there also. We then walked around to see Liberty Statue which is bigger then we thought it would be. Overall it's worth doing and would recommended it to anyone visiting Budapest.

Great view!. We actually walked up to this hill from the Elizabeth bridge, not knowing if you could take the bus or not. It took some time and we were quite tired afterwards, but it was quite worth it and no problem to find water to buy after either. You will be granted a great view over both sides of the city!

More than you'd expect. I hadn't planned on visiting this attraction. At first, I looked up at Gellert Hill and thought it might be something to pass by (lots of effort), but curiousity got the better of us when we saw there was another large statue half-way up/down. So, we hiked up the more direct path on the north-eastern end... it didn't take too before we were enjoying the lovely views and found motivation to hike the rest of the way up. At the top, there was much more than incredible views over the Danube and city. The Liberty statue, and two other statues were lovely, but there was also a collection of market stalls, a restaurant, a museum, and specialty shops, so we wandered around (and secretly thought those who took the sightseeing buses up were cheating a bit!). We returned down leisurely, enjoying the lovely gardens (and even playground areas) built along the southern end. It helped that it was a beautiful sunny day. Especially as a free attraction, it is well worth the effort - the views are unsurpassed, and the gardens are relaxing. There are also plenty of benches around to sit on if you don't fancy sitting on grass.
Worth the walking. Walking up the hill to see the Statue of Liberty ain't that easy but it worth it as you can see all Budapest from up there. View is not amazing but it worths the effort!
A Tough Climb after a bowl of Goulash Soup!. It was quite a climb up from Gellert Spa to the statue, but well worth the views at the top. Took the bus back down to save the knees!

Wow. Pleasant surprise.. Lovely, completely unexpected surprise -not only is the view good, but the atmosphere when I was here in spring (lovely, sunny weather, +- 20C) was paradise-y. Calming, soothing. Echte aanrader!

What a view. This is the best viewpoint in Budapest. From here you look down onto the Danube and out over the city which spreads right to the horizon. On Gellert hill you have the Liberty Monument which can be seen from many miles away. There is also the Citadel and half way down the hill is a beautiful church set inside a cave.

Good view, but Castle is as good and probably more worth the hike. Decent hike to get up there, but not too bad. Once up, the view is good, especially as the lights are coming on over the city, but the statue itself isn't that exciting and there the views are better from the castle. It does give a good sight down the Danube though and could be fairly romantic. Recommended if you have time to do both the castle and this hill.

Very nice views of the city. We spent a bit of time during our recent trip to Budapest climbing the trails up Gellert Hill and enjoying the views of the city. This is a nice place to spend a bit of time outside, in the fresh air, and taking in the sights of this beautiful city. On the southern side of Gellert Hill, you can visit the Cave Church before making a comfortable ascent up paved walkways towards the top of Gellert Hill. There are numerous stopping points with park benches and lovely views of the Danube River and the Buda side of the city. At the top of the hill, you can visit the Citadel and see the large statue know as Liberty Statue, which commemorates all Hungarians who have lost their lives in the pursuit of national independence and prosperity for the nation. On the northern side of the hill, not far from Elisabeth Bridge, you can see the Gellert Monument, a large bronze statue dedicated to former Bishop Gellert, for whom the hill is named. It is believed that Bishop Gellert was killed at this spot in the 11th century. Overall, we very much enjoyed the light hike conditions and comfortability of climbing Gellert Hill. We also found the views of the river and city to be very nice from this throughout our climb. In the end, we’d suggest targeting Castle Hill first because of the higher number of important attractions found there. However, if you are wanting a more rural hill top and climb, a climb up Gellert Hill is a nice activity and way to spend a few hours in Budapest.

Amazing views! . We walked to the top from Elizabeth bridge side and it's long and steep walk up but so worth it for the amazing views of the city! I loved every second of it there are other ways to get up around the other side which are much less steep but also much less picturesque! It's amazing to see and the pictures you get are amazing

Magnificent views!. Again with the gorgeous views of the city. Lots of tour buses here, it's a good idea to park and then walk a bit to avoid the congestion. If you've had a full morning of walking, there are places to sit and have a bite or a drink and refresh yourself. Some nice historical postings, as you walk along, also. We decided not to pay to enter the fort, what we really came for were the stunning views. It's a "don't miss" while in Budpest.

A long way up. After we looked around the Gellert Hotel we decided to walk up the hill to the statue. There is a bus but not going from that location.I found the walk to be very tiring and there is nothing at the top except some souvenir stalls and the statue that you can see from every angle on the ground.

Fantastic views. A must see attraction when Budapest. You must be able to walk up hills as it me about 10-15 mins to get to top and I'm not particularly fit. It's all worth it when you get to the top. The views across the Danube to the Pest side of the city are fantastic. The first time I went up was a cloudy day do I did it all over again on a clear sunny day and it was worth the huffing and puffing!

Impressive. The statue is impressive atop a tree strewn and bushy hill with lots of lookout points and paths that lead down to the bottom of the hill,so you could access it that way,but we caught the bus which takes you almost to the top of the hill.The views are incredible .
Hard climb rewarded by fantastic views. walking to the top was probably not the easiest way, but nonetheless very rewarding by the views both on the ascent and from the top of the hill.

A nice walk and view as a rewards. Walk from Gellert hotel, no view until top, unless you count view of spa bath behind Gellert. Fort is on top of hill, and has nice restaurat. (Actually there is now a hotel inside the fort )Coffee and cake then walk down opposite side with view of Chain bridge, Elizabeth bridge and Danube.
Great view. I went in a sunny day and I'm so happy. I could appreciate all the city from the top of the mountain. I walked up. There us no fees. The statue of liberty is a great monument.I liked it.

View!. Went on a cloudy day unfortunately but was still a fairly good view. would imagine its pretty good on a very clear day. 1 thing to bear in mind, unless you go on the tour bus (hop on hop off etc) its a very steep walk up the side of the hill. you will need to be fairly fit. We were blowing a bit! walk over the bridge, under the pass and back up again straight up the steps right there.
pretty. we walked as wasnt a part of our tour - very pretty and amazing statues on the top. worth the view of budapest if you have time.

Bus 27 from moricz szigmund square for cheap public transport!. It's a must -see in Budapest. There you have a huge park, the citadella, a bunker, the freedom statue, great panoramic view, restaurants, WW2 cannons to take pictures on (for free) and much more. It's a bit hard- but not impossible to climb up to the top. Instead of taking an expensive tourist bus, just take a bus or tram to moricz szigmund square- in Buda, soewhwere behind Gellert hotel, and from there bus 27 almost all the way up to the top. Going doun is easier- either om the right hand side when you're facing the danube and you can see the cave church, or the statue of st. gellert on the left side. But beware of tourist traps!

Atmospheric January visit - cold at the top. We went the fast route up, and the slow meandering route down.It was a cold day in January, with ice all over the place. The park team had scattered salt to make it safe ... and we felt safe.If you fear high areas, then maybe you should walk up and down using the meandering slower route.On the way up people were selling pretzels and mulled wine. At the top there were some tourist shops, including one which old some badges/pins, which were lovely. A variety of things - soviet, sports, historical. A nice small gift or momento from the trip costs just a few dollars.This is a perfect sunday morning after breakfast walk. Allow 1 to 1.5 hours. Decide how cold it is outside, then put one more garment on!I suggest doing this at the end of the trip rather than the start, because you will then get to recognise some of the building and places you have already seen (but that's my general advice for tall buildings, high places).Be sure to read the history of the area in your guide book.We did not pay to go into any of the buildings/museums, so I can't comment on that.

One of my favourite places in Budapest. The views from here are absolutely amazing of the river. Touristy stalls at the top. Great little place for hot chocolate which was definitely needed!!Quite a long walk up so take a water bottle. We visited in November and it was very chilly at the top so remember to pack an extra layer too! would definitely recommend.

Beautiful sightseeing for free. Gellert Hill is in the center of Budapest and one of my favourite places in the whole city. With a little bit of exercise, half an hour walk or so, you'll be rewarded with a beautiful view over the city. This is the place to take beautiful pictures, especially when it's clear weather and sunset. When it's a chilly weather, there's usually somebody selling some hot wine next to Gellert-hotel, which warms up nicely. But warmed up you'll be anyway, since there's enough steps to achieve the top! :)

Great views. We caught the number six tram and got off at the terminus on the buda side. We then caught the 27 bus to citadella which basically brings you round the back of gellert hill. Worth the bus ride if you don't like walking up hill. Great views from the top.

A first-rate view after a good, steep climb. This is hands-down worth the climb to get the incredible view of the Danube as well as the Pest side of Budapest. You have no idea how *flat* the Pest side is until you get to the top of Gellert Hill. The climb to the top (with stops to breathe and to take photos) should take no more than 30 minutes. Photography is at best in the late afternoon (a clear day is best, or at least a clear moment) when the sun is starting to head behind the hill.There are numerous ways up and the same heading down.I crossed the river over one bridge, and just started walking up the hill until I reached the top. Going down, I followed one of many paths through the park on the SW side of Gellert Hill and took a different bridge back to the Pest side. It's quite simple, really, and worth going, especially if you are in the city on a clear day and love a good view! Best of all, the walk and the view are 100% free.

The best views of Pest!. A good activity if you're looking for a little exercise and a great view, while you're at it. We crossed the Danube from pest on the Liberty Bridge and climbed up on the marked path -- it probably took about 20 minutes to climb before reaching the statue on top. Take a few minutes to take some pictures on top and walk down towards Castle Hill or back towards the river to return to Pest.

Such a worthwhile bit of hard work. We chose to cross the river at Elisabeth Bridge and climb from that point. Its a lot of steps and steep paths so prepare for that but once you get to the top you will enjoy an outstanding view of this beautiful city.There are other, easier ways up. You can also take a tour bus if you don't fancy the climb - but for us that was all part of the achievement.Absolutely wonderful experience, and completely free. Not often you get to see such a fantastic city-scape in the open air by investing only time and legwork. Thoroughly recommended.

Fantastic views of the city. This is the tallest thing in Budapest for miles it seems. you can see everything, the government building, the fisherman bastion, all the gorgeous bridges. The walk up is steep, and if you're afraid of heights then some parts might be frightening, but push on and you'll be rewarded with stunning views and a warm drink! you can explore the old fortress which lies at the top but the real star is the statue. It is fabulous. I went with 8 other friends but this attraction is suitable for anyone, well anyone who is prepared for a steep walk!

Best view of budapest. I advice anyone who come to Budapest to start out by going up the Gellert hill. You really don`t have to be an athlete to get to the top, it`s not that high. The views of Budapest are thoroughly enjoyable, and yo get the added benefit of a bit of exercise. If you are really lazy there are also some buses going to the top. At the top there are some cool communist-inspired statues, and of course "the citadel". If you have time,money and a desire for knowledge you should visit the citadel and learn about the past of Budapest.Tip; A good time to be on the top of the hill is around sunset. The colors can be spectacular.
Take it slow!. We did this on our first day in Budapest! The climb is rather steep! But once you get up there totally worth it! The view is amazing and the old fort is defiantly worth a visit!
Sobering climb. We did this on New Year's Day... And well it was an effort. But worth it. Give yourself a few hours and head up in a clear day
sights. Worth the climb up the hill and the view was fantastic the people very friendly,their are lots of little store s and they love a good barter

Awesome view!. Great view from the top. Went up there on foot from the bottom of the hill and it didn't actually take that long. Worth the walk for the amazing view. We went there early in the morning and it was bit chilly.

Great views, especially at night. A lot of history in one hill. Walking up the east side from Gellert Hotel is steep but quick and the views from the top are good. There are snack bars and a restaurant. There is also a museum detailing the history of the fort over various conflicts. You can take a bus to the top.

Great views. Arrived here by taxi after looking at the Palace and Fisherman's Bastion, so glad as the entrance from top to bottom was an extremely long way up hill.The views were amazing, but unfortunately it was a very cold day, with an icey wind, so our walk round the hill was quite short. The statue at the top is great, and also the views over Buda and Pest, but so cold we were looking for a warm place to be.
Moving . The views are really stunning over old and new Budapest. And you were able to see and touch some parts of the history of Budapest. Best attraction so far.
It's a long way up. But well worth it, for both the statues and the overall view of the city. Recommended especially during twilight, at which the statues shine in the foreground.

Work of art. Its a long way up on foot but worth it when you get there. Better to take one of the bus tours as they take you right to it. Great views of the city from on the hill and the statue itself looms large and majestic on the top of a high plinth.

Must see while in Budapest. As we were nearing our final day we decided to check off all the sightseeing we still had to do. Gellert hill was one of the last things, getting here when it was getting dark it was quite a steep climb to get to the statue. But once we were there, the view was breathtaking, seeing all the lights of the city from atop was one a romantic and beautfull thing to see. Go here for the view defintly, its worth the climb.
Worth a wander. Great view, bit of a walk but plenty of benches & you can always get buses up too. Interesting museum at the top along with stalls & wine refreshments

Go there for a view. Nice (long) walk from the very bottom of the hill, we made several stops on many viewpoints along the way. At the very top of the hill is great monument and a Citadele, but there is not much to see from outside (well a couple of howitzers), just go there for the view.

it's the view again!. No doubt the views that gellert hill offers are beautiful and breathtaking in the evening!No meter when you visit the place as long as you do it in the evening time you should expect a magnificent view of the Danube with beautifully lighted buildings all along the river side.

Not the hill, but the CAVE. So you've walked over the Danube and had a look inside the Gellert Hotel at the stained glass panel on the staircase; then wandered through the great hall of the baths, and perhaps taken a dip. Now just over the road and on the side of Gellert Hill is something...but what is it. Go up and take a look. This is no ordinary church, but one built into the back of a cave by the Pauline order of monks. Pay your 500huf (400 if your a student or over 62), pick up your guided talk and let the atmosphere and history flow over you. This place is quite emotive. It is a gem but not publicised by the tourism board. Much more moving than the posh gilt and gold churches around Buda and Pest. Don't miss it - we may have been church and castled out by our travels but this place will stick in our memories.There is wheelchair access to the main cave and church but one small area that cannot be accessed - however the commentary covers that bit very well.

Nice walk up and great views. A statue on a hill, and a hike to get to it. Plenty of tour buses headed up and dropped people off but it was nice walking through a park and taking a winding pathway to the top. The statue is stark against the open sky and provides lots of interesting angles for photographers. You can do it in an hour and a half if you are pressed for time.

worth a quick visit, esp. by night. do not plan too much for this place, but it worth a short visit. just a few meters walk from the parking there is a spot, from where the view is excellent! I am strongly suggesting to visit by night, as the lights of Budapest and the city view is superior! do not worry about safety at all, as there are always someone walking around. finally I would not suggest the statue and the upper part, there is nothing special there....

Amazing view. So good we did it twice!Once in day time when the view was good but a bit hazy and again next day late afternoon when it was clearer and you could see the mountains in the distance, lovely and autumn colours too.We had dinner in the restaurant up there and watched the lights come on over the city, sitting outside, not bad for October. Lovely

Great photos at night. Great location for photos across the city taken from many places along the walk up to the statue. Some old reminders of the military influence around the citadel as well.Amazing photos in the evening of Budapest lit up, it is an amazing sight.

Quieter than the Castle area, but worth seeing. Lovely walk up from Gellert hotel, though quite steep so you may prefer to take the tourist bus. Stunning views from the top. Interesting to walk around the ramparts of the Citadel, and a nice cafe overlooking the river and over to Pest.
Unusual with large lettering. One is intrigued by the large lettering near the top of this building and one wonders what it really is, interestingly on our tour we were told

Make the hike, don't skip the slides. The context here is that I visited in high fall. So the view from the top of the hill was prettier than I could possibly have imagined from the bottom and doing the climb on foot was great exercise but also very manageable. Even if your visit is a short one (mine was, too), this is worthwhile.

Walking Gellert Hill. We walked up Gellert Hill on a national hungarian holiday, the day of the republic. With great weather it was really nice to climb up the hill and we were awarded with nice views of Budapest. Ideal to shoot pictures or enjoy the nice weather, we walked up hill on the Gellert Spa side and descended on the statue and waterfall side. Paths can be steep but don't let this be a showstopper.
Great place for a picture. This is probably the highest point to take a picture of Budapest from. Other than that there is not much more at the top of the hill.

The best view of Budapest. Everybody visiting Budapest must stop here! I can guarantee it is the best view of the city. I went there during the day and it was very safe, don't know about night time.You can reach the top from two different ways: 1 - from the cave church, up the hill, trough the trees and 2 - from the road on the opposite side. The first one has the prettiest view until reach the top but loads of steps. You will have to follow a sign which is an green triangle inside a white mark. Good lucky!Highly recommended!
Amazing place with an amazing view. I went there several times and every time I was enjoying this place.Open to the Danube, nice architecture - like the time has stopped.
Amazing Views. A stop on the Hop On Hop Off Bus, well worth wandering round. The bunker is amazing and very moving/sad on people do to each other during war.Couple on nice restaurants there as well.

Superb views, worth the climb.. Having read other reviews so realised it was quite an energetic walk to the top. Very true but worth it for the views. So much easier coming back down. Walking up you think "why am I doing this" coming down you should be glad you did.

GELLERT a great sight and feeling. The Gellert area of Budapest is one of those places where we enjoyed the baths, the coffee houses, and the winding streets. The Gellert Hill is a historical sight, but it's best feature is looking down across the entire city and also the vast Danube River. This is a great picture taking location and we have dozens of great photographs of ourselves and the city.

Best place for photo op.. Many of the great pics you see of Budapest are from Gellert Hill. The view of the Danube and Chain Bridge and Parliament in the distance makes this the perfect spot for a great photo. Even on a misty fall day, we got a great picture.

Best place for photo op.. Many of the great pics you see of Budapest are from Gellert Hill. The view of the Danube and Chain Bridge and Parliament in the distance makes this the perfect spot for a great photo. Even on a misty fall day, we got a great picture.

Right Before Sunset. I'm not in the best shape and I found the hike wasn't that bad. There are a couple of viewpoints with benches along the way so you stop to take pictures and continue up after some rest. Definitely the best view to see the sunset! Then all the city lights come on, wow! I would recommend taking a flashlight for going down when it's dark.

Wear sensible footwear!. Visited this on the weekend, and it was a lovely addition to our tour of Budapest. The fountain at the bottom provides a lovely photo opportunity and the walk up the hill has many stop points to rest. I would highly recommend wearing suitable shoes (I resorted to carrying my heels up the hill). The views from the top are amazing and it was not to busy, there is a few shops and cafes at the top and a bus is available if you dot fancy the walk back down!

Nice view. I walked up the hill. There are nice panoromas all the way up. On the summit, the view is amazing. The tiredness of walking up is completely paid off by the beautiful scenery! It is a must do in budapest. You wont regret of going here.
Closer to heaven. The Citadel at the top of Gellert hill is a wonderful monument to Budapest history but the best sight of Budapest is the view at a night with the city lights on, breath taking

Great views but quite a hike. Views are great, you can hike up to Bishop Gellert's statue then onwards to the fort and a further few statues and some big guns. Lots of trees on the hill going up so some shade if it is hot. Not a hike for unfit people, be warned, it is steep!

Quite a hike. We came at about 3pm. The sky was cloudy but you will get a good view of Pesh skyline.. Nothing much here, More of the view. On the hike up, we came across a playground full of kids playing slides.. There's 4 or 5 fun slides.. I was so tempted to join in too!
Great hike. A view like nothing in Budapest. It can be fun if it's not too warm,it's a good hike up. There are tour buses to drive upas well.

Quite a hike to get up here, but the view is worth it!. I had to see the Hungarian version of the Statue of Liberty :) So we took the hike up here to watch the sun set over Budapest. Very nice view of the city, but be prepared to hike a bit. Bring water, towards the dusk, the vendor up top is closed.

Best views. Gellert hill is the highest point in Budapest area. Be prepared for 30 min of steep walking up the hill, but well worth it. The panoramic views are amazing. I recommend going there at the dusk, when is less crowded.

Great Views. Wonderful views of Budapest, including the remarkable Parliament House. We stayed 3 extra days in Budaest after a river cruise from Amsterdam, so had time to really explore Gellert Hill and its attractions.

Nice view. I climbed up this hill along with my brother. It's a nice trip, since you don't get to climb a hill in any big city and watch the entire town from somewhere up high. When you get to the top, the view is very beautiful. I recommend going here if you have some spare time or if you enjoy panoramic views and some physical activity. :)
Climb and enjoy the view. A slow and steady climb is rewarded with great views down to the river and across to the town. Well worth the effort

Great night views. We visited Budapest as part of a river tour and one of the included activities was a night visit to Gellert Hill. I have a good camera, so was able to get remarkable night pictures of the city, the river, and the bridges. The view really adds to the story of a remarkable city well worth visiting.
Best view in Budapest with daily exercise included in the climb. Beautiful views worth the trek up!! Try out the slides on the the way up, in the park! Always enjoy reliving my childhood.

The Highest point in Budapest. Gellert hill may be the highest point in Budapest. It needs 30 min hiking but the view from the top is spectacular. There are many souvenir shops which you can enjoy shopping from them. And there are also a restaurant and cafe. It is nice to go up there but not a must.

The best overall view of the area surrounding the Danube River. This is the perfect place to stop either at the beginning or the end of your day trip. Just be aware that this is a meeting place for tour buses, as well as tourists coming in from other cities to meet their local tour guides. The traffic is horrendous during the lunch time hours. Do yourself a favor and take the hop on hop off bus if you're not already part of a tour. That being said, you do not want to miss this photo opportunity. This is the place to go if you want the best views of both the Buda and Pest side. You don't need to walk up to the statue to see it. I'm sure it's a better view from the tippy top, but we only had a day in Budapest. It would have taken too much time out of our day trip to do it. The view at the citadel level was all that we needed to get an idea of where everything is situated along the Danube. You can see Buda Castle, Fisherman's Bastion, Matthias Church, Parliament, and the bridges from this level. Amazing views!This is also a great place to get souvenirs. They have many kiosks as well as novelty shops near the entrance to the citadel. We found some unique gifts at one of these shops. There are many places to sit and relax while feeling the cool breeze. I kind of wish we would have ended our tour here as well. It would have been nice to view the river as the sun is setting. That's something we'll definitely need to make time for on our next trip to Budapest.

Depends on your time. If you are in Budapest for a week it is worth a look, but only if you are not rushed. Frankly, Budapest is a beautiful city to stroll around and this just isn't worth passing up other places.
up to the hills. we went there by our hop on hop off bus,,its the best place to have the best pictures...you can see all danube and enjoy the view..

Great View, Pain to Ascend. The view once you reach the top is nothing short of amazing, but walking up the steps from the eastern front it gets pretty steep and grueling. I would say don't miss this spot

Lovely spot, best viewpoint in the city. We thought the top of Gellert Hill was the best spot in the city to look out over the beautiful skyline and Danube. It is a bit of a trek in the heat, but we had a hop-on-hop-off bus ticket which took us most the way up the hill. It was also breezy, and had plenty of places to sit and catch your breath - which was much appreciated in the 40 degree heat we had while in the city.
Excellent place to view. Nice view, nice place to have a walk and enjoy fresh area, romatic corners to sit down and calm down. The liberty statue is also here , on the top of the hill.
Outstanding views of Budapest. A must see for getting great photos and a wonderful overview of the city of Budapest, the Danube River, and all of it surroundings

Great view over Budapest. This is one of the best views over Budapest. The walk is killing but we took the car up as much as we could. It is very touristy. Get a nice ice coffee after hiking the area.

Fantastic views. We visited this using one of the tourist buses (we a 2 day tickets so we could hop on and off where we liked and get to places some distance from our hotel A bit touristy (souvenir stalls) but breathtaking views and we had lunch in the cafe before continuing on our bus trip.

beautiful view of Budapest. You have to wal for a lot of time on a slope trail (but you can get there with public transport too) but when you get on the top of the hill and you see the landscape it is worth. From the top of the hill you will have the best view of Budapest. Here you can have a meal or have a drink in one of the few bar and restaurant.Reccommended to everyone in vist to Budapest.

Outstanding view. We took hop on hop off that took us staright to the Citadel. Amazing view! Would be even better visiting at night but you'll have to do the climb. We climbed up to Gellert Hegy at night and actually climbed up the statue for best views!

Big statue and what else. After visiting the Citadella, me and my girlfriend went to see the be Statue. But it turns out is no big deal. It is just a big statue in the top of a hill. Sure the view from the city is nice, but there is nothing much a part from that.

Good Hike to be Had. We hiked up the hill after having lunch at the market on the pest side. It was a little confusing finding our way on to a particular path but once we simply adopted the ethos of taking the path that went up the straightess then we were alright. It was a slightly challenging hike, however, this may have been the result of just having lunch and having hiked extensively in the morning as well. The statute at the top was good, so was the citadel but not overly amazing. There was also a bit of a garden on one side of the hill. All in all it was good to go up but I would not put it on a list of must sees for Budapest.

A dying walk up!. The walk up is really killing! There is a bus (bus 27) that leaves downhill. On top the view on the city is really magnificent and you can buy souvenirs and ice cream (if you want to cool down from the walk up).
A nice hike on a hot day. We climbed on the hill on a very hot day. It was exhausting but the view was worth it. Remember to take water with you.

Great view over the city. You'll have some stairs to cover but it is worth it. The Gellert Hill is one of the things that makes Budapest special. It offers spectacular views over the city and the monument on top is impressive.

Take water with you.... The hike up and around on Gellert Hill was really neat, but hot! The water for sale at the top by the Citadel is easily 6x what you would pay in a Spar or CBA in town. The trails are pretty easy to navigate up or down the hill, unless you're looking for a specific spot. This is a great way to get out and walk, just take water!

Nice green area. We booked a hotel and an apartment at the Gellert hill and we could not choose better. I could run every morning in a green area with beautiful view. You can also find the Citadel and the Liberty statue here.
Beautiful view. Worth 'climbing' to, the view is great!Also visit the Cave church below the hill, the fee is not high (1,3€ for students).

The most romantic spot in Budapest!. Go in the evening, it's beautiful to watch the sun set over the city and all the lights come on! It nearly turned me into a romantic!Getting there by public transport is interesting - you need to get to Moritz Zigismond ter (which is currently being re-constructed!) from the centre, or by 4/6 tram round the ring road, then catch the 27 bus from the road running from the north-western corner of the 'square' - if in doubt, ask. This takes you up the hill most of the way - get off when you get to a big restaurant on your right (after 7 stops). Then follow the signs up to the Citadella - about 5-10 mins' walk.There a several viewpoints and you can get into the Citadella for free after 7pm. Watch out for marauding tour grous who seem to come up at all hours of the day! There's a decent pizza/pasta/Hungarian restauruant (The Lounge) as well as the main 'posh' restaurant, where you can eat looking out over the city.

Internet says parking is free on Sunday, but.... I thoroughly enjoyed this view. It ranks withthe view from Piazza Michaelangelo in Florence and a similar point in Astoria, Or and Lookout Mtn TN....but I checked on parking on yhe net before driving to Budapest and they said it was free on Sunday, but somehow i ended up with a $65 parking ticket -stayed bout 25 min...too long? Ignorance is my excuse, but I hoped by checking the net I overcame that...o walk or tke the bus. A Magnificent panoramic view!
Beautiful view. It is worthwhile to go to see Gellert Hill. They also have a "Bunker" there with history and photo's from WWII. Was very interesting.

Incredible. This is a wonderful city best seen from up on this hill. Amazing history. So much history. We got to this via the Red bus Hop On Hop Off tour which was brilliant. Do note the time it finishes and don't just sit on it. Plan and get off to really see the sights.Do walk to both ends of the Citadel.. You need at least four days to see the city.
Worth the climb. The hop on hop off bus goes here but we didn't use this during our time in Budapest.We climbed to the top and the view was worth it.

Definitely worth a visit. We took a walk from the city center and up to the hill and visited the Cave Church on the way. It took a little bit longer than taking the bus, but we got to see the city in panorama and we could take breaks along the beautiful park-like paved path (and we got some exercise). The monument is beautiful and if you have the time, get someone to tell you more about the history behind it, it is very interesting! Definitely worth a visit!

views of the city. It's a long way to trudge in the heat, but well worth it. The paths up are a bit misleading as there are no sign posts and you can end up back where you started, but stick with it and the views are amazing

Worth even climbing on foot!. The view was so amazing that I didn't mind the climb on a hot day after public bus. The prices up there in kiosks are naturally higher than in the town but still cheaper than in my home country. Despite being a little small, the bunker museum in the Citadelle was interesting and worth the 3 € price as a very tidy toilet is included in the price. A few Soviet WW2 cannons are also situated on the top which was interesting for me at least.

A steep walk - but the views outstanding. We walked up from the Gellert Hotel end of the hill, do take water in summer as it is steep.The views from the Monument are amazing, our downward path was to the Elizabeth bridge
If you like hiking. It's a nice walk to the top, the view form up there is excellent. Would not recommend the Citadel museum at the top unless you're a war-holocaust-bunkers fan

Perfect Spot. This is the best point to see Buda and Pest. Two bridges , Chain Bridge and Margaret Bridge are visible from here. We came here with a group which is the most convenient way. It is not too crowded with tourists. With a good camera and on a clear day , one can take fantastic photos.
dirty. i have to say that the view from the hill is beutiful, but on our way down to the city we found this hill very dirty.

Worth the Climb. We waited until the evening to attempt the climb as the average day temperature when we were there was over 30 degrees! It was about a 20 min walk and the view was breathtaking and worth all the effort. There are several stone benches where you can sit and enjoy the wonderful view. It is within walking distance from Citadella and try to make sure you see the statue of St Gellert halfway up the hill as well as the soviet monument at the top.

Worth the hike. My friends and I hiked all the way till we reached the top on the hottest day in Budapest,but the view was breathtaking and worth all the effort. There are several stone benches where you can sit and enjoy the wonderful view. The photos taken are panoramic of Danube and the whole city. It is within walking distance from Citadella. There are stalls which sell Hungarian souvenirs around.
View from this location is wonderful. During a city tour the bus stopped at this location. The view of Budapest was great. You do have to pay for the toilets here.
Nice point with a view. Bricks, statues, ww2 artilery . Come with a bus, and walk down in the garden, to see Gallert statue.
Gellert Hill. Took the Big Bus tour there, which I highly recommend. The view is spectacular and well worth the time to see.

Small climb, great views. Just walk up there from city centre and save an expensive ticket on the hop-on-hop-off buses. It's s small climb with both steps and sloping pathways but even with a moderate condition it is not difficult. The views over the city on top are the best you get in Budapest.

Nice area in Budapest with romantic path. I like this place in Budapest. u can walk top of gellert mountain. U don't need special shoes. The ways is weri nice and romantic with trees and sunshine. From the top u can see river Danube and parlament and other nice things. At night i think it is weri good trip withouth car, "just with legs". on the top is a machine and can zooming to ewerithing what u want to see.

Amazing statues, large area!. We stopped here for 15 minutes during our city tour and really enjoyed the statues and the buildings surrounding. It's a little out of the way if you're staying in buda but there's so much to see on the way!

Away from the buzz. A lovely walk/climb up the path to the top within the trees. Hard work in the heat of the day (32 degrees), but worth it. Nice to escape the hustle and bustle for a while. View is spectacular - nice to sit back for a while at the top and enjoy it.

The best view. Go there around 8pm (summertime) and stay until 9:30... This way you will see the city light up at around 9pm and make pictures... What else do you need to hear? All the city is visible and amazing when on this hill. Also climbing the hill is a very good work out, which is totally worth your while.

Great views. A great view of the city and a great place to relax. do not buy anything in the stores here- overpriced. Wonderful place to get pictures of the city. May want to visit in the evening when the sun setting on the city would be simply outstanding.

Better from afar. When standing at the foot of the Elizabeth Bridge, the Gellert Hegy statue is beautiful. The statue and waterfall memorialize the Bishop after Christians put him in a barrel and threw him to his death over the hill. Take your pictures from the bridge. When you start climbing towards the statue, nothing is marked and several steps and even the barriers to protect you from falling down the hill are in disrepair. There's a lot of graffiti and trash that you can't see from the bridge, but distracts from the real beauty of the site. Too bad it's not being taken care of better.

Amazing views. We went up the hill by the bus and came down walking! The views are amazing throughout and its like walking through a forest !The Gellert statue is located just ahead of the Eresbet Bridge and can be approached by climbing a lot of steps too.The city looks amazing from there, especially in the evening when all lights come on.On top of the hill is the Liberation statue (Lady holding the Olive branch), a WW-II Memorial Russian Bunker and several open air museums there.

Tough hike but fantastic views. My 21 year old daughter seemed to ascend the hill with ease, but I found it tough (I'm not fit) after a day of walking around the Buda side of the river. Additionally, temperatures were in the high 30s (celsius) the day we visited. However, once at the top I forgave everything as the views were magnificent, and there were plenty of drinks and icecreams to revive us. The walk is quite shady, which was an added blessing!
Amazing. Incredible views, definitely worth the climb up steps. Amazing views with plenty of bars and restaurants at the top to allow you to fully enjoy the surroundings. Dont forget your camera

Definetly going there once agai. Hungary does have an exceptional architectural monuments besides Nature. Going up the Gellert Hill is such an extraordinary experience, specially when you reach the top of the Hill. The view from the top can't be described. The Danube, the nature, the parliament. Simply wow, definitely going there sometime soon.Has been there is Summer 2009

i like the hill. i like the hill but the story is very weird and horrible , but the hill is lovely you can buy things from the boutique up there , very lovely views sobhan Allah , lovely you should visit it
Beautiful View. The climb to the top was worth it for the view, but be sure to eat beforehand. The restaurants on the hill have a great view and you pay for it.

Great view. We climbed the hill right before the sunset. The view is very scenic indeed and and perhaps the best one in Budapest! Perfect for the evening excercise combined with spectecular observations.

a nice walk up the hill. A nice walk up the hill where you get to the see the sunset. Not much to do on the hill to be honest, but then you get to take pictuers of Budapest city next to the quirky statues.

Climbing up on a hot day. From Kálvin tér it is a great walk to reach Gellért hill through the Szabadság híd (Liberty bridge). The view is grandiose from the Liberty Bridge towards the Erzsébet híd (Elisabeth Bridge). The temperature was quite high and the hill is high however it is called just a hill so comfortable shoes are welcome. We stopped at least 3 times to check the view from different level of height and take a rest. You can see different part of the city. The view is the most wonderful on the top towards the Castle of Buda and you see the whole curve of the Danube. It is always crowded so you should be on guard if you want to take a photo with that beautiful background behind you. For taking rest the Divino wine bar's department is a really good choice.
The most beautiful place in the city!!!. It's the most beautyful place. And the view from the statue OMG!its just perfect. We walked up to the statue from the Chain Bridge.

splendid view and statue. The view over the Danube and the city is magnificent, and the statue is very fine. It is a great pity that the current rulers have seen fit to remove the statue of a Soviet soldier (a liberator of the city from Nazism). Why deny History? Also, the current statues on the lower level are poor. The site is approached via a very large number of tacky souvenir stalls, and is overwhelmed by coaches.
Beautiful. Gellert hill is beautiful during the day, but even more spectacular at night when the lights of budapest are all shining bright. Great pictures.

big walk on a hot day. we walked across the Elizabeth Bridge on a hot day - 35 degrees + , and walked up the zig zagging paths up to top of Gelert Hill and the views made it well worthwhile - the statue at the top looked Soviet to me - I do not know how long it has been there - there is a welcome small stall at the top selling much needed water and ice cream.
Perfect viewpoint. Can't go to Budapest and not take in the city from this viewpoint - fabulous panoramic vistas over the city.

Best views in Budapest. The walk up the hill didn't take too long, but was tough so not for those with mobility issues. There are plenty of places to rest. The monument is great and the views are incredible. The walk up was worth it just for this. A large bottle of cold water up the top was cheap too. Better views than from Castle Hill.

Nice walk and view. We walked up to this hill at dark night time. It was an experience. After a long walk up the hill (nice green surroundings and warm summer night) these statues were a huge surprise because they were so tall and simply came out of the blue when we reached the top. View from this location was marvelous, you can see the river and get a good look at how far this side of the city actually goes.
nice view. climb the hill to get a nice view over the city and visit the statue erected by the sovjets to commemorate their victory over the nazis
Sunset at Gellert Hill!. Bring your own drinks, sit down and enjoy - you will love it!only the way up may be hard, but afterwards you will be very happy that you did it ;)

Must do if you have the energy. Fabulous views across the whole of Pest and Buda. Take your time to climb. You lose the noise of the traffic very quickly and can appreciate the city. Nice views of the Castle and all the major landmarks.

Awesome view on Budapest. If you wanna make perfect and beautiful photos on Budapest than the best place is to go is the Gellért hegy (hill). You can park close there if you come by car although it is not the cheapest area.
