Anyhow you will have a nice view on the castle area, the Danube river, you can see the Pest-side with all the beautiful buildings.

Great views. Great climb and beautiful views. The climb can be hard and quite steep but it's well maintained. Give stout quite a perspective on the Danube and give s great photo of all the major bridges spanning he river. I'd avoid it late at night as its quite secluded and parts of the path are very quiet and shaded.

Amazing outstanding view. The best panoramic view all over Budapest! you feel like you are on a higher mountain top due to the high view exposure and clarity. We really enjoyed the world war tank display also and the quiteness in that Citadelle and the Statue of Liberty is really cool and its like it is guarding the city... It is a must see when visiting Budapest.

the best panoramic view for kms/miles. on a good day you can see the length of obuda,pest,buda and even futher into the mountains...well worth the money too visit here...includes the prehistory open air museum of the celtic times, romans up into the 19th century...and within the complex of walls is the second world war bunker...damp and surreal, well worth the visit...ss flags and soviet photos...this museum almost seems claustrophobic or waterlogged ....vivid details of the period 1942-1945...the statue of liberities, commemerating the 1956 revolution is a the very best...prob no better views over the city, than here,,,the very greatest of panoramic photos/videos on a good day...even better than tourist guide photos, can be obtained from here...

Budapest Lights at Night. The Buda side of the river is dominated by the palace and the Gellert Hill- both are must do’s in Budapest but more for the walk and view than to see the statues (which are better seen from a distance). Stairs and paved paths go up from the river to the top of Gellert Hill. While most tourists take a bus to the top, the best way to experience Gellert Hill is to walk it. It’s a brisk, very pleasant 20-30 minute walk to the top of the hill through thick forest and singing birds- a welcome break from the city. The views from the top are spectacular- a panorama of the Buda hills, the full length of the river and bridges, and across to Pest and the Parliament building. We ended up doing once during the day and then once after dinner. The evening walk was particularly special- the path is dimly lit in parts but safe, with many walkers in the evening going up and down the hill. At the top, the views of the city at sunset and then with everything lit up was memorable. The scene at the top had both tourists and locals- the locals had brought up drinks and pizza in many cases and enjoyed the view and peace from the city with friends- seemed like a perfect way to spend a warm spring evening.

Gellert...statue of St Stephen is not worth the hike!. If you want pictures of this take them from Elizabeth Bridge becausw the site is filthy and covered in graffitti! I would not walk up this if it's hot or if you are less than super fit...we took a taxi up to the Citadella to see the Hungarian statue of Libertyand it cost about nine pounds for 4 of us worth every penny when you see how many steps there are and the guide books gloss over this!! At the top there are loads of touristy stalls.We didn't bother with the museum,my kids can only cope with one on any trip,and this sounded naff! We would normally walk but slipped this in before heading back to the airport,When we walked down and saw the steps the number and how steep some of the paths were I was so glad we had!
Best Viewed From a Distance!. It is certainly not worth the walk up the hill to see up close. It is best seen from a distance as up close as it is grubby and covered with graffiti.
beautifull!!. Beautiful view. Amazing!but do not waste any tie/money on the museum -it is simply neglected and disgusting.

Beautiful view and lovely walk. We were lucky and made it up to Gellert Hill while the lilacs were in bloom - seriously beautiful setting. It is a good activity after taking a dip in the Gellert Baths. You can walk up to the Cave Church then see the Citadella. From there, you can head down to see the statute on Gellert Hill. Not the most difficult climb, but I would not advise it for people who are not up for some steep stairs. My only disappointments were the overflowing garbage bins throughout the walk and the graffiti all over the statute area. There are good views of Pest side and some nice photo opps along wthe way.

Nice views. Very nice views from the hill. By the way you do not have to climb all the way up, if you are not up to it. Bus 27 goes from Moricz Zsigmond Korter to Citadella, and then it is just a 5 minutes walk from there. You can catch trams 47 and 49 from Deak Ference Ter to Moricz Zsigmond Korter.
steep climb. go by taxi up, walk down easier. then go into the spa at the bottom of the hill. It was winter but the paths were very clear and not slippy at all.

Amazing views. After quite a steep climb we were rewarded with some stunning views over Pest in particular. We also went on to visit the Citadel and, in particular, what they called the waxworks in the Bunker. This showed some of the history of the German occupation during WWII and was fascinating. Well worth a visit.

a great walk, with interest!. You can travel up here on one of the hop on hop offs but we chose to walk, it really is well worth the effort as from each point you go up you get a different perspective of Buda and Pest.Once at the top you have plenty of seating areas to sit and take in the beautiful vistas, we then walked down the other side and again it is quite spectacular.

Breathtaking. We were staying at the foot of the hill and looking up at the huge statue everyday was spectacular enough but up close even more impressive. The views of the city are lovely there are old buildings to look round too, food and drinks available too. It's not as bleak as it appears from the ground you feel very tiny next to such huge monuments.

Great views, quite a trek to climb up. It was good fun climbing Gellert Hill to the top, though the hike was more difficult than our guidebook made out to be (it was said that the walk's "bark was worse than its bite", though as a group in our twenties we still found the climb quite tiring). About halfway up you find the Gellert Statue, which is one of the reasons the attraction doesn't get an excellent rating - the monument has seen better days, with lots of graffiti on it and not very well-kept in general. The view from this point is pretty good, but it is worth continuing on to the top where you reach the Liberty monument (the woman holding the olive branch). The views from this point are truly excellent, and you can have some great shots standing on the mounds around the monument, with the entire of Pest as your backdrop. There's also a nice route back down so you can visit the Gellert cave church and hotel+baths, though be prepared to get a bit lost - there are many possible paths to get up/down the hill but no signposts at all. Overall, I think Gellert Hill is a fantastic place to visit but needs to be better looked after by the authorities (cleaning up the graffiti on the main landmarks, putting up some simple signposts).

Amazing views. We purchased tickets for the Big Bus tour which is a great hop on hop off tour of Budapest. This service takes you almost to the statue which is a short walk away. Amazing views and great photo opportunities.

epic views, lots to see. great views up here of Budapest.Up there is multiple picture points!Also there is the citadel which houses a WW2 air raid bunker which is only £4 each to get in, which includes wax works.Worth walking up but if not you can get a taxi or bus.
great for photos. A rather braising walk up the hill from the gellert hotel but worth it and the panoramic view is fantastic frequented by young lovers who enjoy a drink and a picnic.

a good hike. I started at the Gellert hotel and walked up the hill to the citadel. There is a bunker used by the Nazis, complete with pictures and reconstructions, which is worth the trip. Also the artillery and the views make it a good visit. I went up and over and came down the far side, through lovely parks and pathways to Elizabeth bridge.

Excellent also for the Gellert Hotel. Worth going up to check out the statue, but don't miss the very famous Gellert Hotel whilst in the area! Don your costumes and swim amongst statues, columns and gargoyle fountains and go right back in time. Lots of swimming pools in this hotel and also lots of really warm thermal baths both inside and on the rooftop where lunch can be bought from the restaurant. Expect to pay £15 to enter inside the baths and you will have to pay for a bathing cap too. Best to go in your cossies as a "cabin" is extra if you need to change your clothes. Beware too the locking systems of the lockers. Do make sure you hear the click of the back of the watch they give you otherwise you could walk off thinking you've locked everything up safely and the locker could still be open!
Panaramic views. Once again able to take amazing photos of both Buda and Pest from the top of Gellert Hill, both during the day and at night

A hillside monument. Gellert, a medieval monk, attempted to baptise the unruly heathens that Hungarians were and ended up being rolled down the hill straight into the Danube. Smart? Probably not. Brave? Insanely. Meriting a huge monument? Well...If you are taking the castle-Citadel route, this bit of art-meets-history is on your way and should be checked out. The problem is, the monument cannot be fully admired from vicinity and it is perhaps best seen from a certain distance.

Liked it. I knew I wanted to stand under the statue from the first day in Budapest, but getting there is a challenge if you don't have hop-on-off ticket. There is a public bus (number 27) going to the top of the hill, but the initial stop in the city is hard to find. The view is very nice and it's good to see both: this one and that from the Royal Castle to have the comparison.
nice view. You get a nice view from Pest near the statue. You can sit there too. The walk up is not too long and the hill not too steep.

Walk in the tree tops. A great place to walk in Budapest (if you don't mind walking uphill!). The paths seem to wind on forever! It's peaceful to walk among the tree tops, listening to the birds.Our kids really enjoyed exploring the hill. On the south side there are some good playgrounds about half-way up. Bring water and a snack and enjoy the free views!

Amazing views. The walk up the hill wasn't as long or as tiring as I thought it would be.The path could do with a bit of redecorating but all in all it was fantastic, the views were breathtaking and you had a full 360degrees view of Budapest - would be an amazing place to propose at night time with all the lights and views.

What a view.. Stunning view, chill out park. If you not a walking freak, get tram nr. 6 to end station, cross main street and grab bus 27 to the top. Watch for sign on right Citudella, get off here. 200 mtr. walk to top.
Our Manhattan :). Do not miss this if you are coming to Budapest. Besides, there are so many sightseeings around... It's definitely worth it!

FANTASTIC VIEW OF BUDAPEST AND DUNABES RIVER. We went ur to the hill by our tourist -bus as we travelled with group. In my opinion the reason to go there is only the great view of Dunabes river in between Buda and Pesti. Really is wonderfull ,especially if the weather is good.At Gellert Hill you can also see the Walls, and the Statue of Liberty.Along the street they sell souverir and i saw only one cafe. There is also a park, if you like to walk and have a kind of relax.
great views of the city. Went for a run up here and the views over the city are amazing. Also there is quite an impressive statue at the top and the park and surrounds are very nice and peaceful.

A steep climb but lovely views. We crossed the bridge and walked up the long but steady path to the Gellart Hill and statue and then walked to the top. We walked along and down to the next bridge before crossing the bridge near the market.
Great city views. Take the #27 bus and get off before it starts downhill again. It's a short walk uphill the rest of the way to the Freedom Statue.

Best viewpoint of Budapest. Come at night or in the afternoon for best photo opt.
Best way to get there is by taxi.
Can be combined with a gourmet dinner at "búsuló juhász" restaurant downhill.

Do it for the solitude and the views. On a clear day, the view from the top of the hill is quite wonderful. In my personal opinion, it's much better than the view from Castle Hill. At the top, besides the views, there is the statue, a few little shops, a restaurant, and a parking lot for tourist buses. That being said, there are not as many tourists in this place as there are in other places of Budapest. In fact, as far as attractions go, it's the attraction with least amount of tourists that I have been to, and I have lived in Budapest for several months. I did not take a bus up there; rather, I walked it, and if you're in fairly good physical condition, I suggest you do this as well. There are other people on the trails up the hill, but by far, it's the emptiest "green space" I've ever seen in Budapest--I imagine because, well, it's quite a climb. Nevertheless, for me it was a welcome reprieve from the normal rushing crowds of the city. I wouldn't put it at the top of my list of things to see in Budapest, but if you're here for a while or hate crowds, it's worth a visit.

Worth the climb!. We climbed the hill from the steep side with lots and lots of steps but it was worth it for the view from the top. We called at the bar on the way down on the other side - beware - were asked if we would like to try Hungarian schnapps and were charged £12 for 2 very small glasses - after being given the impression they were just a sample.
Steep Hill. Provides a fabulous view of both sides of the river on a nice day - we were there on a cloudy day but the drive up to the top was worth even a hazy overcast view.

Gellert Hill. Loved the walk up the hill, plenty of places to pause, get your breath and admire the views.Watch out for the con tricksters, though. A man with three cups and coins pretends to lose to his "stooge"

Nice, but compared to other Budapest spots..... If you are in Budapest and you have the time - yes! But, if your choice is Opera, Parliament, Dohany Street Synagogue, Heroes Square, Covered Market, St. Stephen's or Buda Castle vs. Gellert Hill - choose one of the above.

Best place in Budapest. We had been there for a short evening walk, i must say the view is breathtaking. Budapest in the night with all the lights and buildings and the Danube with the night cruises is really impressive.

Some View. As just about every review on here is saying, this place is all about the view. Just about any time you see an overview of Budapest on photos or on the TV, then this is the place that they are taking them from. Simply stunning place to take photos, especially on a clear day. Another area you should visit when over at the Buda side of the river. As we were only on the Hop On/Hop Off bus tour, we didn't get or even make enough time to take in the Citadel whilst up there, which was a little disappointing. Something for us to do, the next time we are in Budapest.

Astonishing view. when you see panoramic postcard of Budapest, you often wonder where they have been taken from. Tha't the answer: Gellert Hill. you will keep the image in you heart forever, I took bus n 27 and it stopped just a few minutes from the top of the hill. it wasn't tiring at all and I had plenty of time to enjoy the panoramic wiew

Beautiful views. The whole Buda side of Budapest is impressive with plenty to see and do for some time. Views across the Danube are beautiful. We used the hop on/ hop off bus to give us an idea of where everything was then did our own thing.
Shame about the graffiti. A great statue and monument but the graffiti around it really ruined it and made it look as if no one cared.

Great way to spend a spring morning.. The climb was work, but relaxing in a way. The scenery was beautiful and didn't feel like I was in a city at all. The views are great from the top, just avoid all the people trying to sell you stuff. Make sure to take another route down to see more of the hill!
Panoramic beauty. the hop on hop off bus tour allows a 15 minute stop here for photo opportunities and this should be taken advantage of because the views of Budapest are stunning
impressive space. but not a lot going on. not sure if they used the space for anything? not sure what i was expecting, but no one was there and it was a beautiful sunny day.

A long climb. It is one hell of a walk up there and to be honest, when you get there it is a little disappointing as the best view of the statue is really from below. Also, there is a lot of graffiti which is rather sad. However, it is on the way to the Statue of Liberty at the Citadella so not really that much out of your way!
Fantastic views. Make sure to visit the fortifications - there's a war time German bunker which is well worth a visit

Worth the visit. This place should definitely be in your ToDo List .When we went, it was fully covered with snow and looked very beautiful as we were going up the hill. The view from top is breathtaking.You will find a lot of nice statues,the citadel,the Liberty Statue,the Cave Church,Gellert Bath etc etc on the hill..There will be so much to click from different places and different angles...
view!!!. The view from up here was just amazing, a must do on your trip to Budapest. the hop on hop off trip will take you right there.

a great experience in any weather. the challenge is great but the surprises on the way are really magnificent. by the time my family got to the top there was a lovely choir singing. And the view was inspiring
Worth of seeing. Once you are in the vicinity of this place, make sure you visit it. If not take the public transportation and surely go there.

worth the climb!. As you progress up the hill, the views get better and better. The paths are mostly easy on the feet, though one or two of the higher paths got a bit rough. The monument at the top was impressive and well kept.

Interesting monument. A really nice walk to start off the day in Budapest, and the monument is really interesting to stand next to. Lots of lovely views of the Danube, and you can carry on climbing if you so wish!

You could spend a whole day up here!. Cave Church, Libert Statue, Citadel, and the Gellert Statue are all situated along a great hike up the hill and down the other side. Wear good shoes and bring a bottle of water (and your camera!). Amazing views along the way.

Very nice Panorama of the City. It is a nice short, but intensive, walk to reach the top of the hill, but the view of the Budapest city from there is an excellent reward.
It is probably a must do trip when you come to Budapest. The park around he hill is also very nice.
stunning views. We went up here as part of the hop on-hop off (green) tour twice-1st time lovely and sunny, 2nd time raining but views were stunning both times.

Very nice park: great for an afternoon walk. This is one of my favorite places in Budapest. It's a park large enough to get lost in so that you feel like you have it to yourself. There's some great locations to take a picture of the beautiful Budapest. Definitely a great way to spend an afternoon.

Wonderful views of Budapest. We walked up here on the afternoon we arrived in Budapest. We had beautiful weather and it was quite a hike up to the top (I likened it to a couple of gym workouts!) but I'm not sure we went the easier way up! However, the view from the top was wonderful, a great first view of this beautiful city and the River Danube.It was very quiet in March and we walked back down a different route which didn't seem as arduous even though the paths weren't that well signed.
Climb up for a view. Nice walk up the hill. Great view of Budapest from the top so take your camera with you :).Prepare to meet other tourists as well since there are always tourists up here.
Nice for a walk. This area is worth a visit just for the views of the City alone. The Red Bus stops here and then walk down the hill.

See from below and from top. Start looking at it from street level. Afterwards, climb the stair (yes, there a few but take your time) and get a great view over the Elisabeth Bridge and Pest. Afterwards, continue on the paved paths to the very top of the Geller Hill (snacks and drinks for sale on top). There are plenty of benches along the way,so tak your time. The view is worth it!
Another good viewpoint. This hill is another good viewpoint of Budapest. Really crowded. Go there and take nice photos of Danube and Budapest.

Best view of city. Even better view than the famous Castle Hill...and less crowded too! The walk up is surprisngly quiet and peaceful. From the top you can see both sides of Budapest and it is absolutely breathtaking. Enjoy coffee or wine in the small souviner shops and stands...but beware the restaurant/cafe is a bit over priced.

Beautiful view of Budapest if the weather is good. The spectacular view of the city and surrounding area is worth 5 points provided the weather cooperates. We visited on a cloudy windy day and a brisk sunny morning and the difference was clear. We visited as part of a Hop-on Hop-off bus tour (there are many of these in Budapest) on our first day in Budapest which was cold, windy and cloudy. We could tell that the view was great and planned to come back on a nicer day. The next morning was beautiful and we hiked up the hill from our hotel in Pest. It was a nice vigorous hike (250 m of elevation gain) with good views on the way up and the exceptional one from the top. Could see the surrounding hills to the west and the plains to the east. It is true that there was quite a bit of graffiti on walls and rocks on the trails up and at the top. There was a bit of trash left by uncaring people as well. If one can look beyond that, I think that the view is definitely worth the trip provided you have adequate weather.The main statue is large and visible from far but not too visible from up close. However, we did have fun taking photos with other statues at the top.

Awesome view!. It offers an incredible view all over the city. We visited it on a winter evening (at about 19h). It was stunning! The night-time city is not only beautiful, but the place itself is so calm and deserted, it's mesmerising!
Interesting statue/View. Interesting statue and view of the city. Statue and surrounding area was tagged with graffiti though when we went through. Took away from the interesting location.

Spectacular...even in the rain!. This was a place that was interesting to see. ON the hill is the WW II Bunker, little kiosks to shop at, as well as restaurants. They even have a hotel in the citadel!
great views. From Gellert Hill you'll have plenty of amazing views of Budapest. In spite of this, it can be pretty tiresome if you're not well prepared for the walking all the way up to Citadella.

Give it a miss. This is not a place to visit on a cold winter's day. There a a few stalls selling the same gifts that you can get cheaper at the market. The view over the city is ok if it's a clear day otherwise forget it.The restaurant doesn't open until 2pm in winter and there is only one public toilet for the whole area which was broken and given the number of visitors is totally unacceptable.Have a look at it from a tour bus but don't get off here.

Snow capped hill. It snowed the day we walked up, stunning actually but very poor views, we'd stopped for coffee & cakes in the nice hotel at the foot then into the Cave church then up to the top, fortunately we'd had a brilliant sunny day before so not so upset. However we did visit the Panoramic Cafe..complete rip-off.
Great views. Great views of Pest from Gellert Hill on the Budapest side of the Danube.. Lots of steps down from the top of the hill and a great start to sightseeing in Budapest.

So pretty on a sunny day. We went on the tram - No 6 to Mexo and then got the No 27 bus up to the Cuitadella. A short walk from there to the top. We saw the bronze lady statue etc but didnt't go into the bunker. It was a beautiful morning so we stayed outside and enjoyed the views. There was a lovely souvenir shop with nice momentos. We walked down from there and across the White bridge back into central Budapest.

Nice climb and a great view!. We walked up this hill and it gives a great view of Budapest. Steep climb in places but manageable and there are plenty of places to stop. Great photo opportunities and plenty of interesting statues. Worth a visit!

Better from a distance. Unless you are climing the hill to get to Citadel i wouldn't bother. Covered with graffiti and not a lot to see other than the statue. Views are ok but far better from Citadel or the castle
Worth the effort. A good climb in the snow - really worth it, great views at the top of the city and the Danube. All the bridges look amazing

worth the effort. We walked up the hill, which maybe wouldn't suit everyone but worth it if you can as the view as you get higher is lovely, especially in the snow. The tourist bus also goes up there but the walk was probably the best part, although the statue is well worth seeing too

Alright but a bit grubby. Went passed it on the way up to the citadel. Was ok with great views but did come across as though it has been neglected a bit. Defintely worth doing as part of tour to the citadel.

nice and easy climb. I climbed the hill in winter and then go to the thermal baths, this are not as good as the szenchyi and this ones are a little mor expensive but they are very close to the city center and the market that is a good idea two complete a half day tour in Budapest.

Great place for photos!. It's not as long of a walk to the top as it may look. It's a great place for getting all your pictures of the city. There's a museum, wax musem and the baths on top but we just went up for the view.

Comfortable shoes required. This is a hike and when you look from the river view it doesn't seem like too much of a walk but when you are doing it you need your comfortable shoes. Excellent views from the top and well worth it

Brilliant views over the whole of Budapest.. We climbed the hill after a snowy night, and paths had been cleared by Council workers. There were 6 or 7 stalls open once we got to the top, selling typical tourist items. Disappointingly no toilet as the one pay toilet was out of action! Lovely parkland and some interesting statues. The hill has the most amazing views over the city.

A Real Treat at Sunset. A tough climb but many place to stop and relax and take in as you progress. On the way up we stopped at the St. Gellért Monument,Tabán Parish Church and Deer House as well as the Garden of Philosophy. A very neat sculpture composed of eight figures. The five central figures Abraham, Echnaton, Jesus, Buddha and Lao Tse encircled around a central pond with 3 outlying figures being Mahatma Gandhi, Daruma Taishi and Saint Francis all representing people from different times and cultures who influenced spiritual enlightenment. Definitely worth a look if you are up there. For those who read this with small children we also stumbled across a popular play area equipped with children's slides of different length and difficulty. It's not easily visible from the main path, we found it by the sound of laughter but I think it is marked by wooden signs pointing to the 'csuszdák'. (I hope I got that right if not please forgive)We finally reached the top and really enjoyed the views very picturesque but as we found the best was yet to come. We stayed as the sun began to set and I must say as twilight fell and city lights began to spring to life it provided a one of a kind view which in my opinion is one not to be missed especially if you get the chance to enjoy it with that special someone. Additionally it was not just a wonderful experience but I believe gives a first time visitor a great introduction and first impression of the city, it will also make future orientation much easier, because it's like laying out a map of Budapest in front of you. You can see the structure of the city and the difference between the hilly Buda side and the flat Pest side, with the picturesque Danube dividing the two.Add this to your must do list while in Budapest

Snow and more snow!. I went over winter and despite a bit of snow it was the most magical experience to view the city from the top of the hill. Recommend the red hop on hop off bus to get you there (especially if you're going during winter like I did).

A rewarding view for a good hike. We went up the south side of the hill starting at the Gellert Baths, and found it to be a good hike (lots of uphill in a short distance). We walked up to the Liberation statue and then took the stairs back down the East side to the Gellert Statue. It had snowed the day before we climbed up, so it was pretty slippery both up and down, but was worth the view. I would also caution that the walk up probably isn't well suited for people who don't move around well. You don't have to be in a top physical shape or anything, but it got us both huffing and puffing pretty well going up.
Gellert Hill. We visited the Great Market Hall and then walked over the bridge and up the hill. Wonderful views from the top. We went into The Citadel and The Bunker.

A place to make great photos :). If somebody visits Budapest, I would highly recommend this place for visit :) Basically, you can see almost the whole city from there, the scenery is really majestic both day and night. So feel free to check it out :)
Never walk alone !. Being Hungarian it is my favourite place to visit , but unfortunately the favourite place of muggers as well ! Be careful do not walk alone !

Could see the statue from my hotel room. On one trip there I was placed in a room right under the hill and the impressive statue towered over the place.Didnt get time to walk up the hill to it though which would have been nice but I was there on business.

The best place to make fotos of Budapest!!!. For me it's the most beautiful and captivating place in Budapest, even better than Fishermen's Bastion;)). I think it's so not only because of very slippery stairs climbing up during cold and frosty January evening, but because it's undoubtedly so. This is the place to be visited in Budapest to say that You ever been to Budapest!;))
An excellent view of the river. From Gellert Hill, you can see the Pest side above the river. The church spires and other beautiful buildings are spread out below you at this vantage point.

Photography Heaven. Fantastic place to get great shots of the city and to simply take in the cool winter air. This is easily accessible via many of the local tours and is a major stop on the hop on, hop off route. Come early to avoid the crowds. I can only imagine how busy this place would be in the summer months.

Absolutely Terrific. I went in January so it had snowed quite a lot and the snow had froze and ice was everywhere so it was tough getting up there as they are steep paths. It was a good laugh though as we were slipping everywhere trying to grab onto the railings. When we eventually got to the top it was worth the tiring walk up because the view was magnificent! They had a few stalls at the top where you can buy souvenirs and mulled wine and other food and drinks. After a few photos it was time for the way back down the slippery paths! Luckily we had brought with us some shoe grips that dig into the ice and snow so you don't slip and they worked a treat! It's a shame we didn't where them going up. Highly recommended! Remember a camera though!

Some of the best sites in Budapest.. My girlfriend, her mother and I went up to Gellert Hill to see the amazing views and was taken aback by what we saw. The walk up to the main attraction is a little too daunting for some, however if you can brave the steep hills it is definitely worth your while. There are shops and refreshments at the top (much needed) and some entertainment in the form of archery and some other historic sites. Definitely worth the trip! Loved every second of it!!

Worth of pain. You really have to be in good shape, specially if you are visiting this place when it is cold, snowing and icy. There are several paths that lead to Hill. You can go to Bridge of Liberty and follow the path besides cave church. Also, you can take a walk from the bridge besides the Danube, see many beautiful towers, reach the Elisabeth Bridge and go upstairs. Stairs lead to monument dedicated to GAllert, who was thrown from the hill in trunk. Follow than several paths and you will reach the top. Turn left and go to Liberty Monument. View is magnificant!

wonderful views here and a great atmosphere. This is well worth a visit. it is free. All the tour buses stop here. Views are amazing and the statues are also good. there are also a few market stalls here and many of the stall holders have made the goods themselves rather than imported the goods in. You can spend quite a while here. There is also a nice restaurant up here and it is not too expensive, the quality fo the food is good adn trhe service is very quick. We had a free goulash soup which we got with our tour bus ticket.

Best panorama in Budapest. An amazing panorama of the city and the Danube awaits you after a somewhat intense climbing session (or you can get a tourbus up). A definite must do for Budapest. Be prepared to work up a little sweat on the way up though!
Gellert Hill and the Liberty Statue. A night visit here is mandatory as the view is spectacular, Pest lights up like a fairyland and the Danube sparkles in the reflected glow
Lovely Walk. We took a lovely long walk from the castle district across the park to the statue and down to the baths, the statue is huge and well worth the walk up there.

Beautiful views overlooking Pest. We visited Gellert Hill with The Big Bus Company on a 48hr ticket. It's has incredible views over the Danube and Pest. The Liberty statue and the associated statues are impressive and give the hill a grand feel.

Stunning viewpoint. This hill is not hard to climb up at all. We accessed it from the end of The Chain Bridge. The path meanders along and there are plenty of places to stop and get your camera out on the way. At the top the statue is much bigger than we realised! We were also surprised to see lots of stalls selling souveniers and hundreds of people who had come up by bus from the other side. We much prefered the route we took up and down. We'd suggest this if you can hack the walking!
night trip. there are some little shops in the centre and the proveiw was amazing at night. If you have a little free time, just take a walk in this area:)

Great view, beware of scammers. We loved the view from the hill. You can appreciate the Buda and the Pest side from this hill. Besides this, there is nothing else to do here, there is a museum (we didn't go in) but apart from that small souvenir shops. BEWARE of a group of men that are total scammers! We witness them in action and it is sad that they would take advantage of tourist. They work in groups and this is how they do it. One man is the one doing the action- hiding one object and moving three boxes very quickly so you can guess where the item is hidden. As you are diligently observing his quick moves there are two or three men around pretending to be tourist and saying where they think the item is hidden. The men stand close to the onlooking tourist and that's when they pick pocket. There are also two men up the hill who serve as the "look-out" in case the police comes. We witness an Asian man asking the men if they took something from his wife. The scammers pretended they didn't know what he was talking about and they pointed at a different direction of where the "scammer" was, after the Asian man left distressed they all ran away. They came back about 7minutes later to do the scam all over again since a new crowd of tourists comes every 10 minutes or so. Keep your belongings always at your side and don't fall for these scammers. Just take your pictures and move on.
Good views. We started climbing up but it was getting dark so we only made it up a short distance, to the part with a smaller statue and collumns, however the view was still excellent at night.
Impressive.... Did it by walk after Rudas bath (just below of it)...nice experience with snow...the view was not pefect due to fog but for sure it is something to do in Buda
Imposing over the danube river. It's the hill of Buda, when you cross the Chain Bridge you can enjoy the view, the statue is very big and stands out, you can not miss it.

Disappointed. Would not go to gel art spa if we revisit Budapest. Staff obviously repressed and had a lot of attitude. Not at all welcoming to visitors. Bring your own towels as you are charged 600hf or £2 each. Was not very clean in places. It was good value if you had time to stay all day. Even if you o ly stay an hour you pay same price. Also bring swimming hat or you have to buy one
Very nice view. Worth the climb! Beautiful place overlooking the city. A must see in Budapest. Combine it with visiting the citadel.

A good Climb. We decided to climb up the hill to get a better view of the city. It was not easy in the cold, but definitely worth it when we got to the top. There are wonderful views and lots of places to sit. You get a clear view of the river and the city below.

It was ooookkay.... I might have been annoyed when we got there because we visited in winter and at night so took a taxi and he ripped us off charging 6000huf for what was a 5min drive.The statue at the top is quite cool and the views are nice but the view from the castle is far better to be honest.They don't prune the trees back so it is hard to get a shot without branches hooking in the way.The walk down (and presumably up if you don't use a ripoff taxi) is long and winding and especially in the winter very cold and slippery.Possibly during the day there are some stalls and things at the top but I really thought it was a bit of a waste of time (and money but that was my own fault!)
Nice view. Really nice view especially during night time. Climbing to uphill is heavy but it is worth of it. From here you can continue to old town and Buda castle.

Attractive statue and park area. Took a tour which took us up to Gellert Hill. We decided to walk the paths back down the hill to the bridge. It looked like a nice area to spend some time, unfortunately it was raining.
Great view of Budapest. Magnificent views and the statue aint bad. Good refreshments and a great market place for lots of quality souvenirs including lovely items of clothing.

Highly recommended for a night walk. Absolutely a must visit at night, due to perfect view on the city. Would suggest to walk from the side of Liberty bridge & Gellert Baths, visit the big statue at the very top, then move lower to st. geroge statue, and finish on the other end of the hill on Royal castle side (should not take more than 1hr of your time, if you are used to walking (the climb is steep) ;)). Given good weather, you will definately enjoy the view on the city, view on the Royal castle, the bridges, etc. Budapest is beautifully lit during the night, and this is probably one of the best places to enjoy it from.

Must see in Budapest. We went to the Gellert Hill on a hop on and hop of tour which can be highly recomended. The tickets for the tour last 48 hours and the audio information you get is very good and the voice in the audio set is very easy understandable with very clear pronaunciation. The information is also avaiable on - I think 15 other languagesThe view from gellert hill over the Pest side is fantastic
Best View is at Night!. Best view of the statue is at night from the river. If you climb up to the statue you can only see the back side as the statue faces the river and is on a steep hill.

Go at dusk. Got the tram over and after a bit of phaffing around we started climbing up the hill at around 3.30pm, although lots of different paths and steps so not easy to tell which is the most direct route. Got to the top just as sun was setting and got the most amazing views over the city with all the twinkling lights and was just priceless. Definitely the time of day to do it.
A good walk.. A really good walk with awe inspiring views of Budapest and the Danube, really enjoyed getting to the top.
Amazing Views. The best views of Pest from Gellert Hill so well worth a visit, lots of stalls to buy souveniers too.
Fantastic view. Great view to the city and to Danube and the bridges. Lots of historie. Go by tour bus or take a walk (hard walk) it's worth it

Amazing view. Well worth taking the time out to climb the steps up to the statue taking in the Citadella en route. Really nice view from top as can see the city from a different angle than the view from Palace side. Can see all of Pest plus full view of Palace.
Big. This is a clearly Soviet-style monument that you come across in many cities East of Berlin. A towering figure, meant to keep people more intimidated then awed.
Some of the best views!. The statue, the citadel, the palace across the valley, the city unfolding at your feet...the pulse of Budapest moves under the skin...

Worth a hike up the hill. Definately worth a hike up the hill. The views are amazing from the hill. The park is also beautiful so if the weather is nice, take your time to stroll through the park. There is also a cave (built into the rock) church as you go down the hill towards Gellert Hotel.
Nice hike, nice view. Take the steps, it will make you appreciate the view from the top a lot more. Not too tiring, even for kids, if you take your time.
long walk but worth it. great views of the city. The steps leading to the statue are many, but the walk is worth when you finally get to the top. the paths are clear and easy to navigate.

SunnyGlen. The historical information (in English) was extremely interesting and informative, as were the displays. It was a bit of a climb from our hotel (Gellert, at the base of the Citadel), but the views were magnificent.

Fantastic walk. Walked up to the top of the hill from the bridge over the river and even though the weather was damp to say the least, it was still breath-taking. It's quite a walk so only do it if you are reasonably fit but it is well worth it. The museum and the views at the top are splendid

Birds eye view. The complete Budapest unfolds like a map in front of your eyes as you realise why this is the place where the guard posts were sited. Breathtaking view of the city and souvenir shops that are cheaper than at other places are the reason to go

Good views, long walk. As we were staying at the Gellert Hotel, we decided to trek up the hill to see the statue and views. It took about half an hour, though the hotel suggested it would take only 20 minutes. I guess we must be out of shape.Fortunately, there are several places with benches to rest along the way up, though the views from those stops are partially obstructed by vegetation. The view from the top is great, though it was rather crowded when we were there. Still, there is a great feeling of accomplishment being right next to the statue high up on the hill that you can see from many vantage points throughout Buda and Pest.When we got to the top we found a stall selling cold water which we immediately partook of. Good thing we did, as it closed right afterwards (at mid-day) though all the other vendors around the Citadel were still open. We walked around and saw various statues and old cannons.If we had gone by bus (public or Hop On/Hop Off), I probably would have given this attraction a higher rating. But my rating reflects the value of the view relative to the value of hiking up and down hill.

Go there at night!. 25 years ago I used to go thre with a bottle of champaign and 2 glasses. Today I leave the champaign at home, but the place even got more beautiful as the city-lights are breathtaking. Don´t miss this place if you go to Budapest!

The greatest view. This place got to be the best view of Budapest at night. You could stay there for hours and hours and you won't get bored. I've spent many nights there with friends, just driking wine and watching the view, it's just priceless.

Good for earning your lunch. There are loads of routes up including by bus. We wanted to wander & found that near Elizabeth bridge there is a very manageable but fairly energetic walk up Gellert hill to the Citadella & statue via the monument & a very small waterfall. Going back down you can make your way to the cave church & Gellert hotel or head back towards castle hill. We chose the former but I'm sure either route would be good.You get some great views on the way up & from the top out over Pest and the park on the Gellert hotel side has some sculpture to take a look at as well as a couple of kids play areas.Once at the bottom on the Gellert side you are just opposite the baths & 2 minutes from the church (back up the hill) If the walk has made you hungry then wander over the bridge & grab some food from one of the upstairs stalls at the Market. After the hill we decided we had earned our pork knuckle & strudel!

Great view. It took some time to find out how to cycle there. We found out the best way was to follow the signs for the cars and cycle on the sidewalk at busy points. The view was a bit foggy. We have seen that fog for 4 days hanging over Budapest. Maybe it is smog...?!We also visited the Citadella for an even better view (1500 forints pp).
stroll. we walked up to the top, but well worth it looking at the view over pest seemed to go on forever lol. one of my favourite places in budapest
Wonderful Views. We enjoyed the walk up the hill and the wonderful views of the city. This is a must see and it is free! Loved it!

The views make the walk worthwhile.. We walked to the top of the hill after crossing the Liberty Bridge from Pest. The climb is not too difficult for anybody moderately fit, and there are plenty of benches to stop and rest on the way up. The panoramic views across Pest and the Danube are simply stunning.

Nice walk and exersice. Hill: You can have a nice walk and have exersice!! Is safe and clean and you can find benches in order to relax and take a breath from the climbing!!! Statue: Nice view from Gellert Statue and nothing else.
Over rated. Nothing much to see except the statue - although the story behind the statue was enthralling! It is a bit hard to get up there for independent travellers who are not on any tours

amazing walk up and well worth the end result. start by elizabeth bridge and slowly walk up the paths stopping to take in the views of budapest as you climb higher , simply wonderful and statue at top is amazing plus the views , there is cafe toilets and musuem up there also , plus bus links if you cant or dont want to walk

Beautiful. Interesting and beautiful, we travelled there by tram - worthwile journey - make sure you get the right tickets - we were pounced on by not one but four ticket inspectors (Not sure if they were genuine?) luckily we had the right tickets
didn't go in, but did go up gellert hill. the statue area you have to pay, however the view of the city before theis part is amazing, so theres really no need for it, you will get amazing photos

disappointed. It has slipped in quality and service. However the price has well increased. Had a major disagreement with parking attendant. One said we are allowed to park in public carparking spaces with a disability permit. The other one said no,it is not allowed. So we had to walk from the car half the hill down with a disabled person. What a hospitality for a few cents???

What a walk, but well worth it. We walked to the top of the hill, it is a very hard walk, but you can get the 27 bus which takes you near to the top. It is well worth the visit, the statue is very impressive and the views across the city is out of this world.

Best time at sunset. It's the best time to climb the Gellert Hill at sunset in fair weather. The view is glorious.It was a bit scary climbing it alone through the thick wood, so better do it in a reliable company. The picture of the city with igniting lights is marvellous. Consider your way back as in autumn months, when days are shorter there could be no buses running from there after sunset

Not a turn on for me.. But nevertheles I have given it a hogh mark because there is just about something for everyone's tastes. Magnificent views across Pest and the sweep of the river. The strident piller statue is remeniscent of communist sculpture, and there are guns from the last century on display, a museum to give you a picture of what it was like to live for decades under totalitarian regimes, restaurants, gift stalls and people from every nation you can think of virtually.The fun of getting there by local transport was quite exciting as it involved three buses (we got off at the wrong stop), and a tramcar.

wonderful view. This is one of the best city views in the world as one looks down and one can see the castle the chain bridge and the houses of parliament with the Danube snaking away to the north west past Margit Island.One can see the whole of the north bank of the Danube including the dome of saint Istvan's basilica.

The best view of Budapest. This is a must if you want to get the best view in the city. It is definitely a good hike, but I was very impressed by the fact that it has both stairs and inclined paths that take you to the top. So you are not always on the stairs!! But after the hike the amazing panorama view of the city, river and the bridges are breath taking. I would highly recommend going all the way to the top just for the view.

Very nice, even on a drizzly day. We hit Gellert during one of two misty / rainy days on our two-week trip. It was quite the hike up the hill (might recommend a bus unless you're a stubborn walker like we are). The Panorama restaurant was closed so we attempted to eat at the Castilla. Waited 15 minutes without even receiving water or a menu. Our only bad service in Budapest. Then we abandoned that failed attempt and went to a nice place on the walk back down the hill. The views from the top of the hill, even on a rainy day, are incredible. If we had made the time, we would have enjoyed viewing the city on a clear night from this vantage point.

must visit. this is a place you need to go if you visit Budapest.It the best spot to see the whole city and the bridges!I would not go with the bus, I would just go to have a nice walk in the forest there and to admire the city, its very romantic, if u go couples get a nice take away from the hotel and eat it there looking at the river and the city.

Take you time and walk up. Go via the gellert side and take your time to walk up. The views are breathtaking and worth it. It can get quite packed with the tour buses but I would recommend you go up by your own steam.
GREAT VIEW!. Nice view down into Pest! A bit hazy on the day we went up via the Big Bus Company but well worth the visit!

View can not be topped. Although there are many places in Budapest to get a great view of the city below, this one surpasses the rest. While the climb may deter many travelers, brave the Gellert Hill to get to the Citadel on top and you will be confronted with three amazing statues and contrasting feelings of oppression (the Citadel) and liberation (the open space and statue of the woman and the feather).
The story is interesting. The myth about th hill is very interesting and it could be right. Excellent view to the pest side of th city from here. For those hi lik walking you can do the hill

Very Nice View. This place was very close to our Hotel. We went 3 times to this place. Few benches are facing city, infront of Citadella Restaurant. We loved watching the city from this place. Filled with tourists.
Necessarily climbed on foot. Necessarily climbed on foot (it is difficult). But it will be worth the climb due panoramic view of Budapest. Do not forget to take pictures or shoot panoramic.
Another view. If you go there... You will be able. To look at pest side and nice mountain and statute over there....You can also view the pest side and visit some historical buildings....

Wonderful views. We used the hop-on hop-off bus to reach this location as it is a very steep climb and quite a way from the centre. The views from the top are wonderful and there is a bunker, cafe etc at the location. The statue itself is very impressive.

Spectacular views. Quite a climb but spectacular views of the city from the top.You can see the Liberation Monument up close - she who was erected after the fall of the Nazi's...only for Hungary to begin a new but continually dark era under the Communist regime.

Excellent view. If you don't want to walk uphill, you can take one of the city buses that will take you up there, then go down by foot ( down hill is always much easier) through the park where there are sits and a lovely path through trees.

Walk the Erzebet Kid(Elisabeth bridge)get to Gillert Hill. If you are willing to take a quiet foot trip, walk the end of Eizabeth Bridge(left side) towards the hill, and then just past the statue and a small water fall beneath the hill, you will find stairs and slopes going up.Ascend from the left side.You do'nt have to go all the way up.At one point you will find a bench and view point.You will have breathtaking view from here.Good way to loose some calories.The trip was completely safe.Still OK to tag along with someone either going up or down.Have a great climb.JoharNorway
Good. Nice structure, nice view from the hill, freedom stAtue was bit abstract but nice gesture, will recommend, must see

Gllert hill is not near oktogon!. Ur map is drunk! Gellert hill is no where near oktogon! After following trip adviser map we traveled across the whole city just to find we were completely in the wrong place.

Must see in Day and Night. At the top of the mountain is a citadel and from up here you get a wonderful view of the entire city along the Danube. You'll want to visit the citadel in the day and at night to enjoy the lights of Budapest.

Think of all the calories you'll burn ..... Whichever way you attack it, it's a bit of a hike. Having gone up one side and down the other, I am convinced that we did the right think by going up the Gellert Hotel side. Even that will make your calves ache and the sweat poor, but the views from the top are magnificent and not to be missed. Amazing!

What can I say it’s a statue very photogenic. Use the hop on and hop off buses to get the stories of all these places as they have headsets in many languages. We found the green buses better then the red ones.you can see it from the river of bank

Quite a walk up the hill to the statue but worth it. We walked up from the Gellert Bath side, stopped in at the Church in the Rocks which was fabulous. Along our walk up to the Liberty statue, which is quite steep by the way, we encountered a friendly corn on the cob salesman which was a welcome refreshing treat. The view once you get to the top is great - try to get their at dusk - great photo opportunities!
great views. take bus 27 to go up the hill, saves you walking. is bus from gellertbaths. excellent views of the city.

Amazing views. Probably the most amazing views of the city even from the lowest view points. We really enjoyed walking around the hill, even though we only saw a fraction of it. The top of the hill has small shops and a museum surrounding the Gellert Statue. Beautiful waterfall at the front and the most breathtaking views across Pest.

Hilltop views. Fantastic views.where to drive and park was an interesting experience. A couple of vendors available with refreshments which was most welcome as it was a very warm day. Take your purse for souvenirs
Gellert Hil - WOW. Loved this place worth the trip. The most amazing views across the city. Go into the bunker museum but be prepared to be shocked as it descirbes life in Budapest during WW11
Walk uphill to Citadella. It is worth walking uphill... until one gets to Citadella!! The view is outstanding!!The statue of Gellert is not something particularly nice but one must climb up!!
Go early in summer. Gets very busy so go ealry in summer. Hop on hop off bus goes there. Great outdoor restaurant behind the citadel. A little picey but great.

Beautiful. There is beautiful view from the Gellert hill. I can recommend walk on the hill ;)
(there is no more to say but my review was too short)

Great view of Pest!. there is plenty to see up on the hill, and it gives you a great view of the Pest side of the city. There are some restaurants up on the hill and if you take the Hop on Hop off tour you recieve a coupon for a free bowl of goulash up there.
Best view in Budapest. This is the best spot to take pictures over the city. You can see all Budapest from there and all main buildings. It's gorgeous and pictures look amazing.
Take the bus. Went as part if the bus ride. A must because it's a good climb to the top. Fantastic views from the top.

Best Views. If you want the best view of Budapest and the Danube, this is where you should go! It's quite a climb though so be prepared for it. And the citadel up there, an absolute favorite of mine. You'll definitely enjoy the walk down from there.

Best views. The top of the hill provides the best views of Budapest. The terraced restaurant, whilst pricey by Budapest standards, was worth the expense for sitting enjoying the view down the Danube. Nice walk down the winding paths to the river.

Quite a climb, but the view is worth it.. Our family of four climbed this hill in the heat. Thank goodness there were refreshments available at the top, as we ran out of water on the way up. It's quite a climb, but we did enjoy the views of the castle and the Danube.

Great Views. I took a walk from St Gellert's spa half way up the mountain to the cross. There is a cave church which is worth the stop - just because 1. its beautiful and 2. how unusual. The walk up the mountain wasn't as steep as it could seem; through the paths and trees are amazing views of the Danube. The following day we took a bus up the other side to the Citadella. Which was lovely but not as nice to drive up as it was to walk up
Gellert Hill. The best way to experience Gellert Hill is to walk up from the street level to see everything on the way. Taking the tour bus or car up takes away from everything.
Disaappointed. Needs a lot of repair work and could be dangerous. Steps disintegrating and railings not always safe.

Best view of Budapest. You can see both Buda and Pest from this hill. It is gorgeous. It is a bit of a climb, but you can drive up there somehow if you aren't prepared for the hike. I would say about 20-30 minutes. There is a cave church on the side that is worth a visit if you have time. Try to go early...it is a miserable hike if it is hot out!

Fantastic views of the city. We visited this area using the hop on-off buses which was good as it was quite a way from where we stayed on Pest side of the city. The views over the Danube and city were brilliant. We also had a free lunch here (Goulash soup) using the vouchers from the bus - it was delicious!
Beautiful view. Most beautiful view of the city is for sure from the restaurant at the top of Gellert Hill. It is worth the trip up there garantied.
Nice View. Walked up to the Citadel from the Danube and it was quite a walk. At the top is the monument and citadel and great views over the city.

A Must See because of View. My wife and I walked up to the statue. The walk to a little while but it was well worth the walk. It took us at least an hour to get to the statue walking but the walk itself was fun. We spent at least another two hours once we were there.
One of the most beautiful view from Gellert Hill. Gellert Hill is on the Buda side. You will be able to see one of the most beautiful view of the city of Budapest from it.
Nice View of Budapest. A nice spot to view the City and you can also take in the Gellert Hotel.

Best View of Budapest. You can get the best view of Budapest from the Gellert Hill. The Parliament, the Chain Bridge, Castle, and good view of Pest - so this place has to be there in the list of people visiting Budapest.

What a view. We walked to the top of the hill and to the statue.Not easy but the view and the fact that you walk between green trees and there are benches on the way made it possible.We were realy proud when we got to the top.

Worth climbing. We were on the way to the Gellert hotel when we came across this Statue, you can climb to the top of the hill and it is a lovely view from the top of the Danube and the city, nice pictures!

Great hike. Start at the base near the waterfalls and then just hike upwards. As long as you are going up you won't get lost. All paths lead to the Citadella. It took about 30min and I needed to rest as it was 100 degrees F when I was there. I was soaked through. You have to pay to enter the Citadella, so I just walked around and admired the statures. They were really well done. I hiked down the south side of the hill towards the Gillert baths and had no problems. Just continue taking paths that lead downwards. A great way to work off all that gullash you have been eating.

Great views- worth the hike!. The waterfall at the base of the hill is beautiful and the splash from it was refreshing on the hot day when we visited. There are stairs to safely hike up to see the statue and a great view of the river and the city.

A bit touristy but worth the visit. The Gellert baths is a beautiful architectural building, it is well kept with separate areas for men and women for the thermal baths. It is pricey, very touristy and the standard lockers/showers are not as clean as it could be. Nevertheless, it is worth a visit.
Nice. One should not expect much from this site. If so, one can enjoy a relaxing nice place
Wonderful view of the city!. Get ready to walk/hike or you can ride thevtour bus. It was worth it! Great view
long walk. it is very long way up, especially if you have already walked to get to the bottom. It is hard to find access points. If you want to go consider this.

The Hungarian Statue of Liberty. The walk up to the statue was a bit steep, but paved and there were vendors along the way, so we could walk and shop on the way up and down. The statues were interesting, and the "Statue of Liberty" was beautifully lit at night. We could always get our bearings in the city if we could see it. We went as part of a city tour, so only had to climb the last little bit on foot.
Beautiful view over the City and Danube.. We went there around 23 pm and really enjoyed the views from up there on the city. Marvelous pictures can be taken of the river and famous buildings.
Take the bus tour. Very very steep hill best to save your knees and take the tour after all its for two days great views and a very very steep hill to come down even on the bus phew??

The Best Place to See the Twin Cities From. The trip it to the old Citadel was charming and the views from the top, spectacular. On a clear day, as it was when we visited, the whole vista of Budha and Pest can be seen from the ramparts. Or if you don't want to pay the HUF 1200 entry to the Citadel, equally well from the pathway arround to foot of the walls and from the base of the Liderty Statue. One of very few Comunist era statures remaining in its original location, and rightly so in this case as it adds to the location and forms a prominent landmark.

Definitely the best view of Budapest. I went here riding a bike, which was pretty difficult since it's a steep hill. But you can get there on pblic transport (a bus will leave you two blocks away) and the view is definitely worth the trip. They have a pintoresque antiquity store with some Russian hats etc which is not too expensive. There is also a restaurant there (the only place to go and have a beer, actually) but the staff are terribly bad (they were actually making fun of a customer next to me!). But yes, definitely a great place to go, definitely a beautiful view and I would actually go there first to see the city and take a map to understand where main things are, and then go on the rest of my tour. This time I didn't at the end, which was also nice since I reviewed the other places I had been to.
okay. If you drive up, pay for parking, there is a guy that watches when you leave the car without paying and will write you a ticket, great spot to take nice pictures from Budapest
At the top of the city. Views probably the best in the city. Quite stroll around the hill. Bunker museum not to be missed. Nice stroll back down other side to the Gellert Hotel.

Beautiful views - especially at sunset. This is a beautiful park to visit in the late afternoon or early evening when the sun is setting. The views of the surrounding city is just lovely and there are several look outs to view from.We walked down the hill - there are trails and paved pathways down. The Gellert Hotel is at the bottom of the paths - and it's worth it to stop by, have a cool drink or a bite to eat at one of their terrace cafes. From there, walk across Szabadsag Bridge to the Central Market or to Kalvin Ter - nearby is Raday Utca which is a nice pedestrian street with loads of restaurants and bars.
Excellent way to see the city. Likes:- View- Statue of Saint Gelert- Statue of independenceDislike:- Cost of souvenirs and water at the top!

Best views. Another must-see. A great photo opportunity of a beautiful city. The HOHO bus is a real treat at some 14 euro over 2 days - a red route and a yellow route and a boat trip on the Danube. Some great ice cream and views to be had up here.
What a workout. It was a long way up but the view was breathtaking.

Wonderful view of Parlament, Danube River and Buda Castle District. My family of four went on an afternoon (4 hours) private tour. The guide brought us to Gellert Hill. We enjoyed the wonderful view of Buda Castle district, Danube River and Parlament. On the way to the top of Gellert hill, we saw beautiful villas. There were some souvenir shops on Gellert Hill selling secret boxes, hand puppets. There were also some activities that can be purchased for a fee like riding a small tank, holding artillery, using archery.We also went here for our night tour. It was a beautiful sight at night!
Not to be missed. We walked around the hill (as outlined in the Budapest guide) not for the non walker. Great views across the city.

Amazing view!. Amazing view on the top! You can admire all budapest! Climbing was bit exhausted because its a long way up hit getting down was easier. You can take tourbusses for elderly people who cannot walk so much

Worth the experience but.... Beautful historic thermal baths. Three of us wanted a spa pedicure (60 min), but on a Monday morning they only had 1 technician on duty. We didn't have that much time. For such a large and popular bath, was very surprised at the number of technicians available. So we soaked in the hot baths. The steam room was so hot I couldn't breathe. My companions lasted a few minutes. Not as nice a bath as the one on Marguerite Island in the Danube.
amazing...... Access via the hop on hop off bus and spend some quality time there with spectaular danube/city views!

We totally did this. We walked up Gellert Hill on the way to the massive statue of the lady of peace. We did this after a day of shere bliss in Gellert spa. Fully relaxed and clean as a whistle we climbed up th long winding pathways and steps. This is challenging even for the fittest of souls. Do take the hop on hop off tour if your not up for the thirty min climb. when your up there and your not carted off to the nearest oxygen tank supply area !!!! you ll marvel at the beautiful paneramis views of the whole of Budapest. Wait till sunset for the best snaps of Budapest with all its lights on. Hve a meal at the castle resturant its fab and the oven baked pizza was only 7.50 for a huge homemade 12". Please allow yourself a good few hours up here its so beautiful. Be careful on your way down at night time as if you ve waited for sunset snaps it will dark quickly on your decent. Enjoy

Just the view. The main reason to go to Gellert Hill is the magnificent view, which you can also get in the Castle Hill. The Liberation Statue has a very hieratic flavor, from communist times. The Citadel has a small, old 2 stars hotel, but also a very good Panorama Restaurant, a night club and a beautiful terrace.

The best view of Budapest. The climbing to the Freedom Statue is very tiring, but the panorama you can get from the top of the hill, worth every calory you burn. From there you can see Buda Castle, Matthias Church, Szent Isztvan Church, The Parliament and the Danube Bridges. If you can't climb the hill by foot, there are many hop-on hop-off buses that goes there.
Best View of the City. Long haul to get there but the view was worthwhile. Best option is to get a hop-on hop-off bus as they tour here.

What a view. Some parts of Budapest are visited by some tourists. Everyone goes to the top of Gellert Hill (Citadella) - mostly they seem to be on tour coaches on Hop-on Hop Off tours.The views over the whole city are fabulous, the Freedom Monument is impressive - the cafes very overpriced!But just go a few yards around the corner, or down the green slopes and you can have the place almost to yourself. My suggestion: Catch a 27 bus to the top and walk down slowly, past the St Gelert Memorial.

Our stay in Budapest. The statue was very inspiring it was part of the view from our hotel the Intercontinental, a lovely hotel with extremely helpful staff we enjoyed our stay in Budapest very much indeed
great climb. You will be rewarded with a breathtaking view on a clear day.

the hills have eyes. Cross Liberty Bridge to the Gellert Hotel and spa complex and make the stirring physical ascent of Gellert Hill for commanding views of the Danube and its World Heritage skyline. The Citadella is dominated by a former Soviet monument known as Liberty Monument but its possible from here to retain the high ground for most of the journey north to the Castle District. On a clear day, the views are truly inspirational.
Best views in Budapest. Its a lil hike up, but once you get there you will accept that it was well worth it! Beautiful statues, actviities (do try the archery!!) and a panoramic view of Budapest!

Birds Eye View. The pinnacle is a delightful view of Budapest and the statutes invite you to climb them as a reward for reaching there. The journey up though is a maze of different way to get there with wonderful vistas at different places. Getting to the top is really half the fun. Once you're there though there is a bit to keep you entertained. Archery practice, views and restaurants. It will seem like a long way up but it's worth every step.

Best view of the city - check out the museum inside too. Well worth the hike up the hill (especially if you bring a picnic and a bottle of wine bought from the Great Market Hall across the river). On a clear day the view of Pest is incredible. There are open spaces on the back of the hill that are great to relax in the sun on as well.It's worth taking a look at the exhibition inside the Citadell too - really great photos of Budapest from up to 100 years ago.
A bit of a hike up the hill, but fun. It was quite a hike up, but we enjoyed the view from the top.
Good vantage Point. good views, did not spend a great amount of time here - as once finished walk (approx 15mins) not much else to see.
An amazing site over Budapest. We travelled past this several times on the bus and it was so inspiring standing up on the hill overlooking Budapest.
Go in the early evening to see the lights of the city. Great place to see the lights of the city and to take panoramic photographs. Beware -- there will be a lot of tour-buses there too.
I liked it. Gellert Hill has huge statues with a story related with it and also from here you can have a nice view of Danube.

Steep climb. I followed trails up through a park at the top of the hill to the base of the statue, and relatively limited viewing area. The area undre the status is overgrown, so you have to walk down to where the buses and kiosks are to get a great view over Budapest.
Great views. Not that easy to reach but once you arrive there are great views down on Budapest and the Danube.

Gellert Hill. The Gellert Statue on Gellert Hill is not so much a destination in and of itself as it is a pleasant journey. The statue itself is unremarkable, but the woods surrounding it cover beautiful hills filled with horse chestnut trees which are a lovely yellow in the fall. Paths meander on up past the statue and up toward the Citadella and the Hungarian Statue of Liberty. These are not outstanding monuments either, but the view from the top of the hill is truly fabulous. You can see almost every famous rooftop and monument in Pest. It's a pleasant excursions out of the busy streets of the lower city and the view makes the climb more than worth it. It's also a great place for dog-walking.
Great views over Buda and Pest. Great to go to on a clear day. Hop on bus stops here for 20 mins which is just enough time to buy a drink and get some photos.

Best view of Buda and Pest. On a fine day there are great views of both sides of Danube. Views from different locations. Several ways and tracks to go up. Best not to have a rigid idea of which track to take but to go with the flow -- you will get up there! I had nice stroll from Central Market, Szabadsac Bridge, the hill, then back down via Elizabeth bridge. Met an Italian manager of hotel in London, chatted with him on the way and shared travel tips, still manged t reach the top. Best viewed late afternoon to get western sun.

nice views but bastion is better. long climb up, but discovered on arrival that there is a road up! nice views, but fishermans bastion has better ones. museum at top would be interesting if you were interested in war history

Nice place to go. Well, this was actually pretty nice place to go. Some tips:- Climb there, don't use tourist busses.- Go to the bunker museum.- Take the camera with you and take pictures from whole city.
View. Take a public tram up from just around the corner from the Gellert Hotel and it's no sweat. Walking down was lovely through the greenery
Take a public bus up the hill as far as it will go. Still worth it to climb to the structure for photos.
Pain. Painfull walk from the bottom but up it was quite boring nice views etc. Take the bus down moore fun and I ended up eating some nice indianfood for less than 10E for 2 ppl.
Beautiful views!. Best panoramic views of Budapest! Definitely worth the hike!
No fenicular to travel up on, climbing for the fit!. Great view from the top, nice restaurant in the mountain, lots of stalls selling at tourist prices........

Gorgeous views. This is not for the faint of heart, it's steep. It takes a while to climb especially in hot weather. I think it's worth it, the views are great. I wouldn't recommend climbing up at night by yourself, I did have some creepy men kind of just...hanging out and staring at me and other women which skeeved me out a little bit. But with friends it was a great walk up. Good workout, scenic, lovely photo opportunities. I'd definitely do it again.

Spectacular view at night!. Our first evening in town and after a great meal, we wandered across to Buda and did the climb. I was out of shape and couldn't keep up with my friends' pace but finally made it to the top to enjoy the lights of both sides of the Danube. A must for anyone visiting this beautiful city.
Beautiful. We toured this site at night and the view of the city is awesome and should not be missed on a trip to Budapest.

Well worth the climb. A steep climb to the top but can be accessed by 'hop on hop off' buses. Lots of litter and bins full of rubbish around. Spoils the effect. The local council needs to keep this major tourist attraction clean and attractive. Nice restaurant at top - fresh pizzas etc. Reasonably priced
Perfect. Absolutely imazing view to the city (to the Buda and to the Pest side), very quiet and good park downstairs.
Excellent views. We arrived here by way of the hop off hop on your. We only stopped for photos which was well worth the stop. Beautiful views of all of Budapest.
Nice workout - Great view. It is a steep climbMany steps :-(Fantastic view :-)The unbeatable victorious workout feeling :-))
Fantastic Views. We walked up to Gellert Hill on a very hot day but were rewarded with amazing views of the city. Well worth the hike!

Fabulous views as night was falling. We visited the Hill and Statue at sunset and watched as gradually darkness fell over Budapest and the street lights, then the lights over the Castle and Parliament buildings, turned Budapest into a fairyland of lights
A must see. If you go to buderpest you must go up to the top of Gellert Hill the views over the city are wonderfull
Lilac in blossom. Very pleasant sight on the Erzebeth bridge and Pest. We were lucky enough to walk down from the Citadella through a "forest" of lilac trees in blossom.

Bishop Gellert on the hill.. Good old Bishop Gellert, an Italian who went to Budapest around 1000 AD to convert the Hungarians to Christianity. He is the bloke on the hill holding forth a cross, he came to a sticky end being rolled down the hill in a barrel into the Danube!

nice trip. If you're up for some walking gellert hill is a nice and reachable place for you! Takes about 30 minutes to walk up, various trams stop at the base of it, and you can see most of the city from the top! beautiful!

What a climb. Because of chaotic bus network, we climbed the hill. Huh, Im not so young and fit anymore... but it can be climbed :) It offers best view on Budapest from whole city. Pity, that citadel is now only bunch of overpriced restaurants and some average museum of german post from WWII.

ahhhh and a massage. Beautiful and the waters are wonderful both in the pool and in the mineral pools. Would have been nice if they'd told you prior to going that be sure not only to bring a bathin suit (optional in the women's area), flip flops, a bathing cap and a towel. But, please know that as soon as you get there they have all those available to buy which they are very quick to tell you. Would go back, but, prepared w/ all--take a towel from the hotel, etc.
Superb. Long walk - well worth it though. Absolutely gorgeous, especially at night
If Your Time is Limited...... .... don't bother, as there is so much more to see in Budapest.
spectacular views. We took the bus most of the way up and walked the rest then walked down. Really impressive views. Had lovely coffee and pastries from a stall at the top.
Good viewing platform. Great views but the Statue area needs some TLC, it's a bit tatty with Grafitti on the stonework and some unsavoury locals but safe.
Best view in town!. This is an absolute "must stop" if the weather is cooperative. Their is a commanding view of both Buda & Pest, and of course the Danube.
