Hike it up!. I decided to hike up Gellert Hill instead of paying a few bucks to go up by bus. And it was worth it. Good exercise, clean air, amazing view. Once I got up to the top, the Citadel, I couldn't help but to fall in love with Budapest even more.

Good for a walk.. Nice walk through the park. Next to the Gellert Hotel and Gellert spa and by the Church in the rock. Good views of the Danube.
Liberty statue at the top was interesting to see lit up at night.

excelent view over the city and the Danube. If you visit Budapest you can not miss the gellert Hill. It has an excelent view over the city and the Danube and you can take nice pictures from there capturing everything. In my opinion is one of the most landscape of budapest. If you go in the morning is easier to find a parking place (with fee), but if you are just a tourist without car I recommend to take a map from the Tourism information center because it is very well made and you can find all the attractin on it and also the public transport network.Enjoy !

St. Gellert. Was an Italian bishop from Venice sent to Hungary at the request of St. Istvan to help Christianize the country. He was martyred by being put in a two-wheeled cart and rolled down the hill. Not dead, he was beaten to death. He is one of the patron Saints of Hungary.
A beautiful visit. Well worth the tram ride. The building is a wonderful example of Art Noveau and just lovely to look at. The baths were nice but we did not visit. The hotel is spectacular!
The panorama. Good place for taking photos. I think I am lucky that my visit was in april, not in august?

Must see. Wow, this view of Pest is not to be missed. You can sit there for hours and see the Danube and ALL of Pest and the Parliament, and go to the other side and see parts of Buda which you don't see anywhere else (also old commy type concrete live-in factories".
wonderful view of the city. a visit to the top of the hill is well worth it to see the statue that signifies budpaest's release from the soviets and offers a wonderful bird's eye view of the city
Photo spot.... A lot of the photos you see of Budapest as a city are taken form this hill. It's worth the climb to the top.
Worth going to see Budapest from atop. A good place to see Budapest from a height, a number of photographs are taken from this hill.

How fit are you?. This is a fair old climb from the Gellért Hotel, but the views make it all worthwhile! On the way up notice the chapel carved out of the rock next to the statue of St István (near the bottom').

Hike up Gellert Hill!. The north side of Gellert HIll provides a perfect (if somewhat steep) 20-30 minute hike via a wooded trail. The steps and slopes are well maintained. Walk up to the Citadel and enjoy the most beautiful views of Buda and Pest. The south side of Gellert Hill leads you to world famous Gellert Baths and you can visit the Cave church on your way down. Perfect way to spend the afternoon or evening (for stunning night shots of Budapest).
Climb it on foot. And enjoy the fantastic view that slowly appears while going up

One of the best viewpoint in Europe. One of the best viewpoint in Europe. The altitude of the viewpoint is 235 meter, it is a part of the World Heritage from 1987. Here is no entry fee, you can come here (if you are in good condition) on foot (level of the Danube is 139m height) or some sightseeing bus or just take the bus No.27 on the Móricz Zsigmond Körtér.

Best views of the city. If you decide to walk up the steps then be prepared for sweat and red faces. That said there are plenty of stop off points on the way up to refresh and cool down and you are rewarded with the best views of the city.

Use the North side!. If you choose to climb to the Statues at the top - the view is well worth it - use the North side approach, instead of the starting point just to the side of the Gellert Hotel. The route on the North side is less steep and provides a better walking experience. BTW - there are local buses that get you well up the hill, and are worth researching if you want to save your body a bit!

Spring Flowers at Gellert Hill. Gellert Hill really offers the best view of Budapest. It is worth to visit it during the summer or at springtime when everything is full with flowers. The chapel in the rock is a unique place to see.Try to avoid the restaurants at the Citadella at the top. They just try to sell some average food at high prices. If it is an option for you then pack some sandwiches, drinks and grab a plaid or blanket and make a picnic at Gellert Hill or at Margaret Island.

Worth for the view. We also walked up to the top and it is worth it for the views. They are amazing. The path is not indicated and there is a lack of information overall. Beware for the fake players that try to trick you, on the way up, watch your wallets and try to walk in group. More cleanning and preserving of the paths and monuments is urgent, since if it not done now, there wont be much time until that place becomes a degradation zone.
Big hike. We walked up to the top, a right treck but worth it for the views. the german bunker is worth going into if you like history.
there much more nicer places. there much more nicer places, its worth to visit it if you have enough time but I would suggest to visit first the other plenty beautifull things in Budapest

Great views of the city. Large wooded hillside criss crossed with numerous paths and lookouts with spectacular views of the city. One of the paths skirts around the hillside on the Danube side with great views up and down the river. Walk down the southern end to get to the Gellert Baths.
Climb to the top. Take the tram and no 27 bus to the top of the hill and see all of Budapest spread before you

Not that quite impressive. You can get on top only with that hop on/off bus, otherwise you will have to walk on foot quite a bit, but it's a nice walk...When we got to the top, we took a few pictures, admired the city and that was pretty much it, we got off the hill on the other side, next to the white bridge.When going from the Gellert side, there's also a church carved in stone at the bottom of the hill that you can visit for free.The sight is not that impressive, since you can see much closer the city from the Fisherman's Bastion, which is more in the city, the Gellert hill is in a way at the outside of the *touristic* side of town, so you won't have what to see... :)But again, it might worth the visit as a nice walk.

Gellert Hill and Statue. It is well worth the walk up the hill to get to the Citidal and Statue just to brag that you've done that climb,(or you can take a taxi to the top) . When at the top, go into the Citidel interior. Cost was 1200 forints in February, which is about $10 US. You'll see a bunker occupied by the Germans during the early wars, and get to climb into it. There are at least eight rooms, set up with an example of how those rooms were used and some with pictures and more history on Budapest. And within this interior, you'll be at a higher altitude and get even better pictures of the scenary including Danube River
Best view of the city. I took the bus up the hill just before dusk. Perfect timing. I was able to take pictures of the city both in daylight and as night was falling and the lights were coming on.
Another must see.. Budapestmis an amazing place full of so many things to see and this is another to add to the must see list.

Veryunusual. Surroundings are outstanding Suggest that you bring a towel from the hotel(hotel will tell you they provide towelsbut baths just provide a cotton sheet). No problem bringing some food. Definitely Yale the massage but make a reservation before Unusual experience and worth it

View of Budapest is stunning. The hop on/off bus stops up here for 10-15 minutes for the drivers smoke stop and you should use this time to capture the wonderful 360degree view of the city... take the 16:30 bus ( last tour) up and you will get the sunset as well... ( march)
Great view. Great view of the city, the only downside is that we had to walk a lot.

The Top of Budapest. If you want to have a great view of Budapest town, then go on the top of this hill. The sightseeing bus also stops there. You have a 360° panorama of Budapest and you can then realize how big the town is. There is a good panoramic restaurant called Citadella where you can taste a good Gulash soup. The statue on the top carrying a palm leaf is the symbol of the release of Budapest in 1945 by the Communist Red Army.
Have a walk. The walk is very nice and the statues are magnificent. One of the points to ascend is just opposite the entrance to the Gellert Baths.

Great view. The monument at the top is nice, but it's the view that is the reason to come to this spot. Another panoramic view of Budapest with all the major sites laying at your feet. If you would like to do something a bit different, a hike to the top (or down) would be nice, maybe enjoying the spa at the bottom. All the tours stop here and the path from parking to the monument is full of tourist huts. If you don't take a tour, it costs about 1000 HUF for a taxi one way. While it's one of the typical sites, it's not a must see.

Incredible Night Views. We were on our way to Cittadella for dinner and we captivated by the night view of Budapest from this hill just outside the restaurant. Though it was very cold up on the hill during evening, it is worth to spend some time to take in the night scenery. We got some nice pictures as well.
View and exercise. Make an excursion in the middle of the city! You will see an amazing panorama, and you will greet old preacher Gellért as a close friend when you see his statue from the Pest side.
looks amazing. statues are really striking but if you have mobility problems you can get good pictures from the chain bridge if you have a good zoom camera.
The most amazing view....... ...... only spoilt by the souvenir shops, too many all selling the same things.
Great sculpture. Visible from the Pest side of the Danube, saw it from the Hop on Hop off bus. and from the Palace area.
Must see. The view from the hill is breath-taking, espescially in the evening. The story behind the name of the hill is very interesting.

Nice walk. It's really worth to visit during your stay! You can reach the statue by bus, but the best way to do is to walk. When you are down to the hill, it looked too high to walk, but it's okey. The stairs are not too high, but sometimes very slippery. When you are on the hill, the views are amazing! There are a lot of places to sit during your walk and eat something.

terrific views of the danube. it was minus 8 degrees with heavy snowfalls the day we went to gellert hill so climbing the steps to the top was a bit of a challenge but totally worth it.crossing elizabeth bridge we watched the enormous ice flows head south on the danube.from the summit of the hill hundreds of children and adults were sledging on the slopes of the park on the other side. what a site. fabulous views both directions from the top.can only imagine what it must look like in spring or summer. pure magic and you can stop off at the rudas or gellert baths for a reviving dip when you come down the hill.

You can't miss this view. If you want to see the whole Budapest, if you love spectacular views, this is the place you must visit. We get there by bus, during the city tour. We had time to walk around the Statue, make some pictures, eat in the restaurant and just enjoy the view. Weather was great so we were able to see the Castle, Parliament and many other places. Just put this place on your “must visit” list.
What a view!. We walked up to the top! - you can drive or get a bus. It's a long, steep climb but we took it slowly and were rewarded with a magnificent view over the whole city.

Gorgeous view of the city--better than Castle Hill!. This was our first foray into Budapest--we were not sure what we wanted to do that day, so we wandered over to the Great Market Hall then crossed the bridge to the foot of Gellert Hill. Having no pressing items on our schedule, we proceeded to hike up it, stopping at the Cave Church on our way.It was well worth it! High above the popular Castle Hill, the views from the top of this area were unparalleled. We took so many photographs of the beautiful bridges, the nicely-lit Castle Hill and the delineation of Buda and Pest and the River Danube.I also enjoyed some of the informative displays set into outdoor niches inside the fortress. Written in both Hungarian and English, it talked about Saint Stephen and Gellert himself, their lives and what makes them so important to Hungarians. It made the visit extra-special.We then ambled down via the path next to the St. Stephen statue before wandering back to our accommodations in Pest. A perfect first day.
Great views. Don't expect to much it's a hill with a statue at the top but it gives fantastic views all over Budapest. visit in the evening to see all the bridges lit up
Great view.. I walk the whole way to the top from Erzebet bridge. It's fun both summer and winter. worth going. The best view in Budapest.

the history and the wind. Probably St. Gellert really deserved the best point in a city. And it's great, the view from the top is stunning. We've being there on January 18th 2012 and it was so windy... But even the elements couldn't destroy our mood and a chance to take exellent photos.May be we were blessed by... St. Gellert. Thank you , The Saint!!!

My most favourity view in Budapest. I always take my most beautiful shots of the city here. Not right on the top but 3/4way up walking from the bottom of the hill. If you enjoy taking photos you must make this walk.Stayed at the Gellert hotel at the bottom of the hill couple of times. Lovely stay and the outside pools look right at the hill.
What a view!. Don't go to the hill with a bus!!! Walk because even the small sidewalk on the side of the hill is very pretty.
Climb your way up.. What a rewarding climb!The view from the hill is amazing and the 3 monuments on the Citadella are awesome.
Walk to the hill. Good place to get panorama photos of Pest side and bridges
The sights a re great as are the vistas.. Buda is the "Green" side of the city, and this is one of the nicest spots for walking and feeling the grandeur of the historic structures.

Hike to the top for a great view. Start your walk across the river from the Central Market for views of Cave Church (also called Church in the Rock) and Gellert Hotel. Walk through the lovely park, get some exercise, and finish with a great view of Pest from above. Restrooms, food, souveneir stands, and lots of tourists at the top, but the hike to the top is great for some quiet time on a nice day.
One of the Budapest hills. ..with a beautifull view on the city. We took a hop on - hop off tour around the city (I recommend) and this was one stop.

Incredible structure with terrific views. Getting to the top of Gellert Hill to see the citadel and the Liberation Monument is well worth the effort. Rather than take an organised tour we used our 3 day pass to take a tram to the Gellert Hotel and baths (another tourist attraction) and then a local bus to the top of the hill. The trip was an experience in itself.
Fantastic view. If you want to a panoramic view of Budapest this is it! Fantastic. Go up by bus though as the walk may be difficult.
Nicest in autumn. When leaves start to get red/yellow, this is the most beautiful spot in Budapest! Great excursion to go up the hill.
Interesting history. Great views, especially at night. The freedom statue gives off an aura of times gone by and present and future hope.

Nice view from the top, not sure about the walk.... We walked from the Elizabeth Bridge and follows the steps to the monument - Bishop holding the cross, then con’t to the Statue of Liberty on top of Gellert Hill. Nice view if it's a clear morning (ours was a cloudy day). A lot of walking/ steps though. From the Statue of Liberty, we decent down towards the Cave Church and it’s another nice visit before we walk back to the Central Market via the Liberty Bridge. Do the walking if you got the morning to spend before eating some good cheap food in the market for lunch! Otherwise, get the view from the Castle...
Nice and quiet. I just love everything in Hungary! so clean and nice every where even in the park area.

A great walk. We went from the Great Market Hall, enroute to the Cave Church on Gellert Hill. It is a working church and as such you should respect it and it's worshipers. You will not see anything like it. Walking through the woods to the to the Freedom Memorial you forget you are in a city very tranquil.

Stairmaster with a view (FREE). this was the first thing we did. Expect a lot of steps. Pretty view but over the part of town that doesn't have much to look at monument wise. If you have an hour to spare it is worth checking out. Directly in front of the bridge parallel to the chain bridge.
Fantastic panorama. Do this in te afternoon because than you have the sun in your back for fantastic panorama over the Danube, the bridges and the city.
good viewpoint. full of tacky stalls selling touristy stuff at rip off prices ,watch out for beggars!
beautiful views of the Danube and city. we visited as part of the hop-on hop-off tour. The views are beautiful and well worth the trip.

Great. Bit of a hike up to the top but the views are worth it. There are childrens play areas - safe and clean - on the way up. Remarkable, massive, clean monument at the top and amazing views. Some reasonably priced tourist stalls too.

One of my favorite places. One of my favorite places to walk to. Great views of the city during morning, afternoon and night. Long walk up the hill but very rewarding once you see the views. Read up on the history of the location before you go, makes the trip more meaningful!
unforgetable. i like everything.it is easy to reach there,very close to the city

Don't cheat. Make the climb!. Part of the appeal is climbing all the way to the top of the hill and occasionally reflecting on the fact that Gellert was tossed down it in a spiked barrel (Ahh!). There are so many excellent vistas for photos or just sitting and taking in the city below.
Great Views. Lovely walk through the woods in their full autumn colours. Great views despite being misty and dull weather. Will have to come again in summer !
Vantange point. Another great place to take panoramic pictures of Pest. Site has a very good restaurant (tasty goulash soup) with a lots of character
great view of budapest. relaxing stroll in the woods if you can go all the way up the hill!
A good walk. Good views and the statue is impressive, though the graffiti around are not. The paths in autumn are covered in leaves and steep, so make sure you have good footwear.
GREAT views!!. The views of Budapest (the Danube, Parliament, St Stephen's) from Gellert HIll are the best!!

Quite a View!. When I asked the concierge at our hotel the best way to get to the top of Gelliert Hill, he said that you can just walk up there. As he said, "It is many steps, but it is a nice walk." It was an understatement on both counts. It was worth it when we got to the top, though. The view really is lovely.

Nice view from here. The citadella and the liberty statue are all nice and it worth the time to walk up and check them. The view is wonderful from here, you can see nearly all Budapest from north to south.
excellent views. great spot with excellent views across the city, well worth the climb!
Nice view of the city. Great way to see the city, unfortunately it was quite smoggy the day we were their. The statue is impressive.

Nice walk up and a better walk down. We walked up the hill with beautiful autumn colours surrounding us. Clicked great pictures. When we reached the statue, we happened to be the only ones there. So we got to take it all in, in peace. You can actually feel the calmness of the place. Also got really clean pictures. And as soon as we were done clicking 2 huge tourist groups came in. How lucky were we! Walked down another path that was even more picturesque. On the way down, saw the St Gellert statue as well.

It is worth the hike. You can take bus 86 from castle district (by Chain Bridge) to the bottom of the hill. It is quite a hike, but take your time while you stroll through the park. It took us about 20 mins to hike up, but once you are up there, the view is worth it (you get to see both Buda and Pest)! It is also a good place to have picnic.

Great view of this beautiful city from up here. Great view of this beautiful city from up here. Though the hill is named for St. Gellert (interesting story - look it up) the major statue at the top is a "lady liberty" commemorating the liberation of Budapest from the Nazis... by the Soviets. Tyranny from the right, tyranny from the left. After the collapse of Communism, all the Soviet era statues were moved out of the city and this one was rededicated "To the memory of all of those who sacrificed their lives for the independence, freedom, and success of Hungary." My OneLifetours.ca group had a great snowball fight up here.
One of the sights from below.. All of the sights looking up from the river are impressive and the Buda side of the river has more than its share with that statue towering above the hill.

Quite a hike. But worth it for the view. The soviet built "Statue of Liberty" to commemorate their "freeing" of Hungary from the Nazis is more tasteful than I had expeccted. The Citadel was interesting.Watch out for the vendors. Most seemed to have overpriced (compared with other areas) chinese crap.
Fantastic Panaromic Views. The view from the hill over Budapest was amazing particularly the sunset. The walk around the hill was so pleasant and highly recommended.
Neat. Normal attraction. Nothing special, but an interesting history behind. Beautful view over Budapest from the hill!
Beautiful in the fall. The autumn leaves along the hill make this a very picturesque photo op.

take a walk or take the bus. hiked up from the river side and was a little surprised(disappointed) to see the crowds at the top who had taken the sightseeing buses to the top. area seems a little run down.numerous craft stalls align the top

Marvelous view over Buda and Pest, as well as the Danube. Gellert Hill was our first destination during the trip to Budapest in October 2011. When we arrived, it's almost dusk, and we saw how the color of the city changed gradually. The sunset glow was so beautiful that we became speechless. That day, someone were also taking their wedding photos there.
So brilliant!. BEAUTIFUL! Definately worth a visit! A lot of tourists but not as much as you could expect, if possible don't visit on the weekends.

Stunning, Stunning, Stunning VIEWS!!. My husband and I spent our last evening in Budapest walking up Gellert Hill. We watched the sun set and took pictures looking out over the entire city. It was absolutely breathtaking watching the lights come on over all the bridges and the lights come up in the city. If you're visiting Budapest, you MUST take the walk up the hill. It is a WALK and it IS tiring, but SO WORTH the view especially in the evening. We were there until well after dark and felt very safe. Additionally, walk over to the CAVE CHURCH and visit the Cave Church Cats-they are a colony of feral cats being fed by a group of animal lovers! They can always use some additional food if you're so inclined.
stunning. Fantastic views. Worth the joiurney up the hill...
Worth the hike up the hill. We hiked up Gallert hill on a sunny autumn morning and the views were not dissapointing. Worth the trek and burning all those calories for.

nice view. The top of the Gellert Hill with the liberty statue were only 10 minutes walk from my hotel, Gold Hotel Buda, so I decided to walk up and check it. There is also a Citadel and a wonderful view to the Danube and Pest side. I recommend to visit it after dark to see the wonderful lights of the city.
Gellert Hill. Well worth the quite steep climb. Liberty monument and citadel a bit depressing, but descend via St Gellert monument down to Elizabeth Bridge. Marvellous views.

Fantastic View!. You get a fantastic view from this extremely high elevation in Buda. Well worth the trip.
Criticism: It is highly comercialized with plenty of vendors in the nearby parking area and many many busses too.

Superb View. We chose to climb up the steps at the foot of the waterfall, a bit of a work out but the views on the way up and from the top are well worth it. Looking back across the city you can see how everything is laid out, it's a great spot to take photo's of the city.
Amazing views. Don't forget your camera as this is a wonderful place for photos.
nice views. The view was very nice but on sunny Sundays it seems to bee just too crowded!

Excellent Views of Budapest. From this vantage point you have excellent views of Budapest. Only negative are the crowds, we were there in the morning and it was packed. This was a stop on the City Tour, it is very high up and despite my wife and I being in good shape and walking up and down many attractions throughout Europe, this walk would have been tough and I am glad we took the tour bus up.

Easy to get to by bus (save your legs for another day!). We did a bit of research first about getting to Gellért Hill by Bus as we didn't fancy the hike up on foot. Here is how we did that journey:-We took the No 6 tram to the terminus Móricz Zsigmond körtér and then took the No 27 Bus up to Gellért - well not quite to the top but it's only 5 mins stroll from there.To find the Bus Stop at the terminus just walk on in the direction of the way the tram was going (as its not all that obvious). We got off the No 27 at Búsuló Juhász (Citadella) which I think is 7 stops from when you get on (the bus stop at the terminus gives English instructions) and then follow up the hill. I found this website after we came back to the UK (sadly!) http://www.bkv.hu/en/day_services_map/day_services_mapThe views are spectacular and there is no charge to see them either! We particularly wanted to see Liberty and have popped some photos of what we saw the views were Amazing.We chose to walk down back to the city which took us 25 mins stroll and brings you to the back of the Gellért Hotel.There are toilets there too either as one of the automated 'pods' or inside the entrance to the Citadella both charge 100 HUF (about 30p).You have run the gauntlet of stalls on the way up but that is the only con I can think of.
Fantastic. Wonderful experience .Just go there relax and enjoy.

Worth it for the amazing views. The expansive views are worth the trip, especially around sunset. We didn't find the fortress especially interesting, and there is little else to do on the hill, but we would still recommend it for the views/photo ops.
Also, the extra walk to the absolute top isn't necessary. You'll see everything from the first viewpoint.

The views. Every city I go to, I like to see the city from the highest point, or best vantage point. The views from the top are wonderful.. you get a lovely view of the bridges over the danube, as the danube goes away in to the distance in both directions. You can see the Houses of parliament across the water, with water craft going up and down the river. You can also see all the main areas on the Pest side...Who really cares if its a tourist trap or takes an age to walk up to the vantage point..catch the hop on, hop off bus tour there...and just spend a little time admiring the view.

A bit of a tourist trap. Great views over he Danube and all main buildings and bridges. The tour buses all stop here so there are plenty of tourists - like us!! - to avoid. We walked up from the Gellert baths next to Independence Bridge (Szabadsag). A bit of a pull and not for those with bad knees, heart problems. We are fairly fit 63 yr olds and it was manageable. Good large photos of Budapest through the ages are next to where the buses park.We walked down to Elisabeth bridge - an easier walk as the path follows hairpin route
Great views. Great views up there. The kids had fun on the long slides on the north side of the Hill. The only unfortunate thing, is that a lot of the park is run down and in need of maintenance.

FREEDOM-GELLERT HILL. If you can take the walk up to Gellert Hill - it is not so difficult - it looks steep but it is OK when you get going - I am 49 my daughter 19 - but beauttful views along the way - waterfall- we kept looking at them and ....we were there....the great monument of liberation..freedon..what it must have meant to Budapest!!I I did the walk in 2007 - think it took too long- you need to start at Elizabeth Bridge (Ersebet Szabad) ...we got up early and the view were magnificent..you can see this lady from most places in Budapest - but it was nice to stand and have a photo of liberation with her
Worth the walk!. Best views of Budapest. Go in late afternoon when it's cooler. It's a bit of a climb but the statues and views make it vvvv worthwhile !

Great walk, even when the weather's desert hot. The hill is located just over Danube from the downtown and features breathtaking views of the entire city and its surroundings. There is a nice walk up there through woods that also features some nice views. The summit is full of tourists and gift shops. You can get there by a sightseeing bus, but I recommend taking a short hike from the downtown. Don't forget your camera, some money and when sunny also sunglasses and a hat.

A hard slog but very Impressive. We took a cab halfway up the hill and walked the rest of the way, bad move it's quite steep! For those individuals who walked all the way up I salute you. Once you arrive at the Citidel the views are the best in Budapest. The inside of the citidel was drab and not much to see. Than by accident as it is not well sign posted I came across a massive WWII underground bunker set on 3 floors. It was built by the Germans and was part of there central command structure and is very impressive with narrative in English on the walls.When we finished we decided to take the steps down the hill and visit the Gellert baths to soothe our tired feet.

Hiked up Gellert Hill on Easter Sunday. My wife decided this Easter Sunday we would hike up Gellert Hill by crossing the Erzebet Bridge from the Pest side and explore the Citidella. My idea of a good time is not hiking up a steep trail to get to the top of anything! But my wife was right as always and this was a good hike! Yes, I was huffing & puffing but once here you'll be proud you did it! One disadvantage to having a younger, healthy, slim, wife is she'll force you to go on good hikes and do things you would never do!

Relaxing walk. As university students, it was one of regular pastimes to walk over Szabadsag Bridge to Buda and climb up Gellert Hill. It is a bit steep, but the view is well worth it.At the bottom of the hill there is the "Rock Chapel" (Sziklakapolna), which is one of the most popular wedding sites in Budapest. It is carved inside the hill.It is worth stoppping to catch your breath as you climb up, as scenery of the Pest side is very beautiful. (I might be a bit biassed here.) You can see the Parliament and all the hotels by the Danube, and of course all the pleasure boats, cruises on the river.As far as the statue is concerned, it is ok. But I prefer the view and sitting about with a nice book on a bench.

Quite a climb, but amazing views!. My friend and I climb from the cave church, so near the white bridge. It was quite an uphill climb! Bring some water and make some stops (there are viewpoint stops along the way.) When you arrive up, there is the massive Liberty Statue, the Citadella and a lot of cheap souvernir carts. The souvenir store up here was the cheapest we found on our travels... Most importantly the view from the top is amazing, best of the city.

Minket climbed but was a bit disappointed. OK - it's a hill and you get a good view of Budapest from it. But it is quite a steep climb to get up and the knick knackery at the top is the same knick knackery as you get everywhere else. The Citadella is ugly and it rained (so maybe that's why we found it disappointing) so it was muddy and slippery on the way down. As a hill, it's a good 'un. As a tourist attraction, it is so-so.

Amaizing view - especially at night. You can climb up to the hill from the Elizabeth Bridge or from the Liberty Bridge (behind Hotel Gellert) but also travel by bus from Moricz Zsigmond Körtér almost to the top. I like the view from the hill to the city especially by night - I live in this city and I was 17 years old when I first climb up at night. Since then I like to go when it's dark. The city is more beautiful that time :)
Only 10 minute uphill walk. The best view spot of the inner city. 10 minute uphill walk but the view was really amazing. Try to catch the sunset. It was really romantic.

Enjoyable walk & WOW what a view!. Fun walk up to the top. The views are amazing and a great reward for the hike up. There are beverage/snack carts at the top. You will discover look-out stops along the way up and down.

The best view. This was the best view we had on our entire 3 country trip. The evening views were spectacular (I wish my camera took better night shots). The statues at the top were interesting to check out. There are several stands to buy souvenirs like jewelry, paintings, etc. It is definitely worth the walk up.

Fantastic views!. We didn't set out to climb the hill, but just wandered to the top (well more of a climb!!) but worth it as the view is spectacular! Nice to relax at the top and rest and even read for a wee while. Worth the climb and I felt justified having my dinner that evening!

Worth the walk for the view. Good trip to take. The paths are well paved and clearly marked, but can get steep in parts. You are climbing a couple hundred meters plus, so it's a brisk walk but completely doable; how easy you find the walk, and how tired you feel at the end will likley depend completely on your level of fitness. Once at the top, you can wander the Citadel for a bit, grab a drink from one of the vendors at the top, and pat yourself on the back for a job well done.
Excellent view, worth the walk. You can see the Statue at all major points in Budapest, and it's worth the climb up to get a closer look.

Great walk up - and cheap souvenirs. We walked up from the Elizabeth Bridge and found it fairly easy to follow the path all the way up to the top of Gellert Hill and the citadel. Plenty of good views from the top, and surprisingly, given the location and the numbers of tourists, the prices offered by the path-side souvenir sellers by the citadel were the cheapest we found in Budapest.

Careful ladies!. The views are lovely, but the walk to the top is fairly steep. There are some good view point stop off's along the way.I visited Gellert Hill with my female friend (we're both mid twenties) around lunch time on a saturday. We felt perfectly safe as other people were wandering up the hill also and we were in broad daylight, however we were flashed at by 2 men on 2 seperate occasions! Bad luck! That did leave us feeling vulnerable as we didn't know the area well enough to get out of there. It was definitely planned as one of the men spoke to us in Hungarian minutes before, and had obviously watched to see where we were going.This is most probably an isolated event, and im certain it wouldn't happen if you are travelling with a male! But its just a warning to females travelling alone or in small groups!
Best view in town. Don't miss this!Make sure you're there just before the sun goes down, so you can watch the lighting of the chain bridge.

One of a kind view near the Citadell. No need to pay to get into Citadella in order to enjoy these views. The view from Gellert Hill is the best in Budapest. It's a great way to see the city. Take one of the public transport buses up closer to the top so you don't have to climb up the whole thing (#27 I believe). The monument and hill were named after Bishop Gellert who was apparently rolled down the hill in a barrel nailed with spikes on the inside. There is a restaurant at the top near the Citadell and also little booths for buying trinkets or drinks and ice cream bars. You must try a Magnum bar if you are from the US. At the top you'll enjoy the lovely views and get an overview of the city. Then when you are done you can walk down the backside and end up near the Gellart Hotel. If you have kids traveling with you, note there is a big park area with lots of fun slides along this decent, but going up the hill with kids would be a huge feat. We passed one guy pushing a stroller up the hill and he was just about to give up. When you get to the bottom, in front of the Gellert hotel there is a neat spring fed fountain where you can fill your water bottle or just stop for a quick drink(see picture). Enjoy!
